description:
If you are a hip hop/RnB/old school lover this is the place to be.
I really enjoyed the time we spent there with some friends. No specific negative feedback: security check, bar, services songs all were good!
I recommande the place.
author: Malik T.

description:
I went here on a Saturday recently.  True to what some others have said, there are a lot of ratchet people here.  I was looking for more of a place where everyone just wants to dance and have a good time, but there were so many catty girls (and some guys) in here who were just being rude, making fun of people.  

I liked the decoration, but next time I will go somewhere with better vibes.
author: Alex d.

description:
Bottom Line: RUDE! Five dollar cover. 

Line: Came here on a Friday night... they go back and forth between having a line and not.

Cover: $5.

Cons: The bouncer was actually okay, but the guy taking the $ was RUDE as HECK! Not knowing there was a cover, I tried to go in and he stopped me and said "$5"- cool. I asked if I could take a glance at the place first as I'd never been there- he said no... which I was OK with, it was just HOW he said it. He adamantly said "NO SORRY FIVE DOLLARS" with an attitude and straight face! I had a crew hoping to get in as well, so it sucked that the establishment ended up turning away profit because while my friends were willing to pay the five, they weren't willing to support a place that treated me with such rude intent. Once I told them they were like "forget it!"

Too many other places with good hospitality to settle!
author: Tristina B.

description: There was a line and there really shouldn't have been! But that's the usual for clubs/bars right? The inside of the establishment is dope. Music is decent. Drinks were strong for price. Vibes were good, people were friendly. The dance floor is small but definitely used for dancing and not just standing around and looking.  The bouncers weren't rude to us. Over all good night.
author: Hope W.

description: The bouncers here are fucking dicks for no good reason. If you manage this bar you should get your bouncers together and talk about how rude they are to their own patrons. It's bad business practice. You're better off going somewhere else where bouncers aren't assholes to everyone who walks into the door. I get that being a bouncer is a hard job, but when your patrons are nothing but nice, the attitude is uncalled for (attitude from both the guy checking ID and taking money. Seems to be a problem many people have but management doesn't give a shit about.) Will not go here again and highly recommend others to go elsewhere
author: Amber M.

description: I had to write a review solely because of the rudest MF taking money to get in at Double Dutch. Either he had the worst day of his life and he was takin it out on every customer comin in or he is just a prick. To the owner, dont have this dude work the front because on this night alone you seriously lost hella customers. He was talkin sh*t to and about everyone, cmon now!  Give this guy some cannabis to calm his a$$ down.  I dont think we will come back here, so sad.  1 star for the cool bouncer and nice female bartender.
author: Joy R.

description:
Dive bar with a makeshift dance floor.

Random guy started grabbing on me and telling me to get up from my seat. I declined politely, trying not to escalate the situation. He literally starts YANKING me off of my stool and says I said it's that time of night. I then realize this guy is a "bouncer", please keep in mind.... The lights are still off, everyone is dancing in front of me and this guy still didn't identify himself. My friend and I are not a rowdy brunch. We are usually the women seated, swaying to the music. 


 I have a bruise on my arm because of how hard he yanked me off of my seat. He was alarmingly AGGRESSIVE. This is the continued story of some men in our society feeling like they can touch and acoust women without provocation. Men who assert their dominance over women through physical strength. I will NEVER visit this establishment again. I still have no idea why this happened given the sheer lack of communication.
author: Sheralyn F.

description:
Come on folks, it's a bar/club.  The staff was fine, no extra rude person, no one was extremely friendly, but the staff was good.  The drinks were just that, they were drinks.  The beer was cold and the Henny shots were filled to the top.  No complaints here on that.  We got there on a Sat night before they start charging a cover so don't know what that's like.  

I love the décor of the place, makes me feel like I am living my childhood again.  

They do have a weird rule about hats though.  Door guy told a friend of mine that after 9 he had to take his hat off and it's officially a club at the point?????? Ok, house rules I guess, just found it a little weird.  They were also only half-assly  enforcing that rule depending on who's wearing the hat.  So, hats off to Double Dutch I guess.  

As in any bar/club/public place, the restrooms were disgusting.
author: Bobby W.

description:
Come in for a drink and to stare at the walls.
Tiny bathrooms. Minus one star for that. But they are neat :)
Great environment for a drink with a couple friends or to pop in solo. 
The way the place is set up is a little annoying. There is a bar and a few high tables, but I would love more seating. It isn't set up for people to come and stay for long. I come in, have a drink, but then usually hop to another place so we can sit and really relax. If there were comfier seating, I would definitely stay longer and drink more.
Bartenders are nice and make good drinks. 
Street parking.
Will be back to meet up with friends.
author: Kat R.

description: $5 cover. No hats allowed. Good luck trying to get a drink. Literally watched the short haired mean bartender skip us about 6 times when she clearly saw us standing there. So at that time we decided to leave. Couldn't even get a drink, couldn't even move. Staff was extremely rude.
author: Alisa R.

description:
Are you joking?
Sat night 4/21/18

Bouncer: ID.
Me: Ok.
Bouncer: Five bucks.
Me: My friend is bartending, I live overseas, she just asked us to come by and say hello, we're on our way somewhere else. She said to ask for Niko.
Bouncer (angry): Five bucks.
Me: I'm telling you we're just here to say hi. Are you Niko? Look she's right there at the bar, just ask her.
Bouncer (screaming): I don't give a f***? Want to die?
Me (calm): Look let me just walk in and get her. She's right there 10 feet away. The rest of the group can wait here. Ok?
Bouncer (screaming): I'm a former Marine. I will kill you believe me. I will kill you!
Me: ......
Bouncer (screaming): I will kill you. 

Do no support this dump. Terrible, aggressive vibe from beginning to end. We had half a drink, went home. Evening ruined.
author: Eric B.

description:
Poppin music and decently priced drinks is always a good time.

I was here for the first time last week and it was pretty fun! The music is just my stuff, a little old school hip hop rnb mixed in with the modern. The dance floor is pretty cool, it's right in front of the DJ and surrounded by pretty cool artsy walls.

The drinks were alright, not super strong, but not weak either, and they take cards (THANK U DUB DUTCH). It was about $7/8 a drink, which is pretty darn cheap compared to most places in the city! But I guess, compared to other places in the Mission it's about right.

Would definitely come back.
author: Eva C.

description:
Must experience if you're a 90's / golden age hip hop / rap fan. 

Big, crowded party atmosphere. Come for the music. Stay because you're hyped.
author: Tex M.

description: This bar was great on the weekends. Fun dance floor, great vibe. Drinks were strong! Went on a weekday and it was a little weird, but still have a dj and good music.
author: Meg D.

description: Love the music, atmosphere is great, bartenders also good; however the bouncer/security named Phil was overly aggressive with everyone. He screamed in my face at last call then threatened me because/if I had a problem with him. The bartenders were nice and trying to calm the situation but Phil was angry at the world and tried to fight a few of the men leaving the bar.
author: Cindy G.

description:
I used to go here back in my college days. Loved this place and loved the crowd before. When my friends have decided that we were going to Double Dutch, I definitely got excited. I mean, I loved this place. 

There was a long line. And as always, this place can get really crowded. It was packed. We were like sardines. It was pretty damn disgusting. 

The crowd was pretty ghetto and there were plenty of ratchet people. The bathroom was so gross! I wanted to vomit and no, I was not drunk, it was cause of how gross the bathroom was. I had no choice but to use it cause I needed to pee! 

I don't know what happened to Double Dutch. It used to be such a cool place with decent people and last night it has turned into something really ratchet. I mean not all were ratchet but let's just say the majority were ratchet. 

Also, the whole entire time, I kept checking my phone cause they said people steal phones here! 

Anyways, yesterday was just a let down. Again, I loved this place before. Music was better before, bathroom was way cleaner before, and the crowd was way better before. 

I'll probably check this place out again but maybe during the weekdays like Monday lol
author: Jennifer B.

description: Overall lit energy. I wish the bartender who always wears a beanie and a hoodie would make out with me. Live laugh love.
author: KT D.

description: Double Dutch is a bar with a dope vibe. They've got a bunch of old boomboxes on the walls, light up shoes hanging from the ceiling and the dance floor has a bunch of character. It's divey, good drink prices and has  good staff. I was in SF for the weekend on the look out for anywhere with good music and a decent crowd, unfortunately in was a Sunday night. Walking down 16th street, Double Dutch was  the one place with good music bumpin. To be honest the bar was empty when I walked in with only a few people inside but as the night transitioned a few more people showed up and that's when the energy changed. It wasn't packed by any means but a couple guinea pigs were the first on the dance floor and before you know it there most of the people ended up on the floor. The DJ seemed to be practicing for most of the night but once people got on the dance floor, he picked up on the energy and matched the music with the dancers. This Sunday night DJ played roughly 1 minute or so from each track so on occasion early in the night there would be a transition from fast to slow that really interrupted the vibe. But...with the crowd on the floor he did a nice good of keeping the energy up. My Sunday night was shaping up to be pretty dull but Double Dutch was able to keep my Sunday night respectable among the many sleepy Sunday night bars I walked by on 16th.
author: Sean F.

description:
All I can say is, come here if you are ready to let your hair down and have some fun - in a crowded and small venue. Very small dance floor in the back and packed bar scene on a Saturday night. You gotta be prepared and know what you are walking into. 

Younger crowd for sure. 20s - yes. 30s - iffy. 40s - no.

I absolutely love the wall of boomboxes and could not stop staring. Seriously! You just don't see that anymore. 

Cheap drinks and awesome music. Great place to bar hop, people watch, and grab a quick drink before making your way around the Mission.

Ladies, use the bathroom at our own risk.
author: Song C.

description:
Get your dumb sandwich board off the sidewalk, you tacky idiots. And tell your rude bouncer that although I may be an "ass monkey" at least I'm not a small man with a tiny wiener.

Seriously. You're wrong. I'm right. Put your ego aside and get over yourselves. Make some room for the passersby. You don't own the sidewalk.
author: Tom S.

description:
It looks like I'm the latest victim of pickpocketing at Double Dutch in San Francisco. If I could give this place 0 stars, I would.

I was out this past Saturday night with a group of friends and on a whim we decided to check out Double Dutch, HUGE regret. When we got there it was quiet, but within an hour the place was so packed that people were basically on top of each other/running into each other left and right. Let me start by saying-I am OVERLY careful with my belongings when I am out in public, so I am the LAST person this should have happened to. So credit to the real pros at double dutch stealing phones (which like many have said before, I wouldn't be surprised if it were the employees working there based on their lack of remorse and unwillingness to help). My phone was stolen WHILE in my possession, meaning there was not a single moment I set my belongings down.

When I realized my phone had been stolen, I searched the place high and low to no avail. The DJ couldn't stop his set for 10 seconds to make an announcement because his boss would "kill him". The bartender responded with complete disinterest and said "you can leave your number if you want but it's probably pointless" and "there's literally nothing I can do for you". And the bouncer said it happens ALL the time and blamed me for not reading the tiny sign in the front window that says "beware of pickpocketers".

DISGUSTING customer service, EVEN WORSE experience. I will NEVER be back, and I will warn everyone I know not to waste their time at Double Dutch. I hope this place gets shut down for unethical practice, pickpocketing happens all too frequently at this place and they have done nothing to prevent it from continuing.
author: Jenny E.

description: I met my fiancé here - I've had some great times at this place. It was great while I was young. But I recently realized how dumb and careless the staff is. The bouncers - classic SF disrespectful. Probably have 0 education and need therapy. I left him a $20 dollar tip and he told me he didn't like me. Go back to high school, bud. The bartenders are trash. You could go anywhere else and get better drinks or service. Not to mention they're extremely unattractive. Try harder people. I'm surprised this place is still open. SF - raise your rent and kick these people out of the city?
author: Taylor C.

description:
Go to Blondie's instead. 

That feeling when you look down at your purse and see that it's been opened and your phone is gone is something no one should EVER have to experience, especially when you're out celebrating your friend's birthday. It's an instant buzzkill and life traumatizing (no joke). I regret not having a fake toy phone to troll the thieves with. 

It looks like this theft issue has been happening for years too.....and I know the bar won't do anything about it besides put up warning signs so all I can do is stop coming here. 

I'm reviewing this place even though several others have mentioned the thefts because I want it to drop down to as little stars as possible to warn people NOT TO COME. The amount of paranoia you face coming here isn't worth it. Whether you have a clutch, wristlet, wallet, whatever, you just never know because these thieves have racked up a lot of experience and learned from unique situations and have established this place as an easy target. 

For those who still decide to come here, be aware of your surroundings, watch out for your friends too, and report anything suspicious. Let's all help each other out.
author: Monica C.

description: This is a great bar for dancing! We ended up here at the end of the night although I wish we ended up here earlier. We tried to go to Beaux, but the line was too long so we ended up at Lookout. We discovered Double Dutch at the last minute, but we had so much fun!
author: Erica H.

description: Always a blast hanging out at double dutch. Drink is reasonably priced, music is a hoot, crowds are perfect.
author: Kallista P.

description:
Do not visit here, unless you want the following:

1) Expensive drinks
2) Rude staff
3) Horrible music and experience
4) Nasty environment

I recommend Bruno's instead.
author: Anisha C.

description: Horrible experience! Do not go here unless you like being threatened then followed up the street by an obnoxious and unprofessional so called bouncer. There was no reason for this bouncer to aggressively approach one of the guys in my group and demand that they take their hat off. What does one expect when you approach someone that does not know you and insist on getting in their face, clenching your fists, and posturing while demanding that they take their hat off. The guy in my group did not instantly respond as he was taken aback and immediately felt threaten. Then when the hat was off, the bouncer continued to posture in the guys face and also attempted to threaten one of the women in our group. Only cowards do that! Sadly, other bouncers had to intervene and ended up sending this fool home for the night. And while one would think that the bad experience was over- when we decided to leave, the idiot followed our group up the street and continued threatening and yelling obscenities at us. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy and wish that I could give 0 stars. No one deserves to be treated this way and it's sad that a bouncer would have the audacity to follow a group up the street threatening them. This guy should not have a job as a bouncer as it hurts the business.
author: B W.

description:
Come here at your own risk!!!

Everyone deserves to know if they're in danger before they give a place their business.

Not even 20 minutes after entering the bar, I realize that my phone, ID, and credit card are gone, 2 days before I needed to fly out for work.

Tried to ask a bartender if any phones have been turned in only to have him yell at me that he was busy. I ask a bouncer and he tells me that at least 80 phones "go missing" every year with only about 3-4 ever being found.

During this time I notice at least 3 other girls weaving in and out of the crowd with their heads down trying to find their phones.

My friends and I leave for a taco place to salvage the night. We come back to Double Dutch afterward to see if they've found my phone. When we knock, someone from inside yells at us to get lost. Only after I pound on the door yelling that I had my phone stolen does someone come out and take down my info - a very sweet young woman with whom I had my only positive interaction there.

Not that that would make a difference, since the bar's security is obviously aware of their pickpocketing issue and chooses to not do anything about it (see: reviews about phones getting stolen circa 2015), which makes me think the bar is associated with the crimes.

A ton of other reviews on here confirm my suspicions. It appears to be a gendered issue too so girls especially be aware if you choose to come here. I personally didn't find this place to have any redeeming qualities (hot and cramped, mediocre music, tiny dance section), so why risk losing all of your valuables (not to mention getting yelled at by rude workers) when there are so many other bars to go to in SF?

Stay safe, friends.
author: Kelly Z.

description:
This was a fun find -- we had originaly planned on going to another bar around the corner, but the line was long and it was starting to rain. When we got to Double Dutch, it was early enough that there was no cover, and we got a hand stamp. The place was pretty empty at the time, although the line for the restroom was long. There are just two non-gendered bathrooms at the back -- one decently large and one the size of a very small broom closet. 

Drinks were cheaper than I've come to expect in SF: we got five mixed drinks for about $35. The decor is cool, with a wall of boomboxes, but it's so dark inside that you don't notice it much. 

We left to go to another event, but once we were done with that, we decided to come back for some more drinks. They were charging a cover at that time, but since we already had our hands stamped, we got back in for free. The place was CROWDED, and the DJ was spinning, so it was more club-like than expected. It wasn't really what we were looking for at that time of night, but it was still a good time.
author: Olivia H.

description:
Came here with my BF for his friends birthday. I was super disappointed. The place was run down, the crowd wasn't quite my scene. I'm not much of a bar hopper but I can tell you, there are plenty of better options. Personally my preferences are - ghetto music, nice but cheap drinks, and crazy dancing. This place sometimes have a cover fee and sometimes not. When we arrived my bfs friend told him there was a 5 dollar cover, but when we were at the door, we didn't have to pay so that was awesome! I think because we came around 1:20 am or so and they close at 2 am we were exempted. The margarita is HORRIBLE here. It tasted like water with salt. They didn't have mojitos... One beer and one margarita came out to be $19! 

There are plenty of drunk men here breaking beer bottles. I saw one for myself being taken out by the security guard. The place say they open until 2 am, but the lights came on and music stopped at 1:41 am. It's a squish scene in door. The only kuddos I give would be he wall of stereos for decoration. If you are looking for better and nicer bars, I saw try Polk street or Castro!

Parking here is also HORRIBLE!! You have to find street parking!
author: Amy Y.

description: This place was OK it was kinda dead when we went and I hear that there's pickpocketing so I'm not sure about this review
author: David C.

description: The bartender doesn't know many drinks it's very small but the bouncer is s great guy and nice place cool wall designs a little too small you will spill your drink kinda place
author: Marilyn Manson I.

description: I will NEVER come back. If you want to be treated like dirt by the guy who collects the cover fee then come here.  I have NEVER felt so disrespected by an employee at a bar before. This guy, we were told his name his Philip, was really disrespectful to me and my group of friends, his coworkers even felt embarrassed by his behavior and were holding him back while he was yelling profanity at us. I DO NOT understand how an establishment can hire and continue to keep someone as classless as him. It is unacceptable. A decent person WITH CLASS should know the importance of customer service for a business. Especially if we were cooperative with him. Double Dutch, your customers should not feel unsafe by your employees, I see that this isn't the first time someone complains about him. After my experience last night, I think he's capable of doing something that will negatively affect your business permanently. Is it worth keeping him?
author: Monica A.

description:
When I was 21, I loved this place. Now that I'm older? Yeah...not so much. 

I'll admit the music here is probably one of the better picks in the area. Any place that plays hip hop / r&b on the reg beats any of that EDM nonsense by a long shot. The aesthetic of the place is pretty neat too. Old boomboxes line one wall, old cassette tapes line another, and an assortment of other throwback memorabilia are either hanging from the ceiling or are artfully displayed on the shelves above the bar. Drinks were..decent? I don't know the pricing but they tasted how they were supposed to, so I guess that's a good thing.

That's probably all that I like about this place. Like most places in the Mission, there's a cover after a certain time. The restrooms are filthy. I don't know how it's possible there are only like, 2 stalls when this place is consistently packed but if you can imagine how many people are going in/out there in one night I'm sure you can see why it gets so gross. There is a dance floor but it's packed to capacity most all the times I'm there and despite there being a couple fans around the room, the ventilation is almost non-existent. Often times I feel like I stepped out of a steam room after leaving this place. Also worth mentioning that I've been here one time when a dude was literally peeing...on the bar. Disgusting. 

IDK. I used to find this place pretty fun back in the day but I don't know if it's because I didn't know any better or maybe 21 year old me just had poor judgement. I will say that it's worth going to early on in the night (& before cover) if you're hopping around Mission but not somewhere that I would recommend staying for all night or even once it starts getting crowded.
author: Gabrielle S.

description:
I didn't enjoy my experience here because of the DJ. My group of friends kept requesting that he play a Mac Dre song because it was my friend's birthday, and we are from the Bay Area we really like to hear that on a Friday night. So the first two times we asked, he said, "Okay, I'll do it next song!" And never played it, so the third time I told him we were getting ready to leave can he please play Mac Dre? He responds with this:

"LOOK, ITS EVERYONES F*CKING BIRTHDAY B*TCH. I'M NOT PLAYING MAC DRE. SO GO AHEAD AND GET THE F*CK OUT!"

Why did he have to be that way? Why didn't he say that the first two times we requested it if that's how he felt? Why did he have to call me names? 

Usually, I don't request music. Because most DJs know what they are doing and play music that doesn't make me wish I could please just hear a different song. But he was doing that thing they do in the Mission where they want to get the people of color out of the bar by playing music without rhythm (like T Swift). Why is the DJ stand open to the dance floor if they don't like requests ??? Build a DJ booth. Or, fire the DJ and build a Spotify playlist - no difference.
author: Aarie C.

description: Fun night on a Saturday. Hot as hell! People are down to dance, cover was only $5, and drinks range about $9. So overall. Litty!
author: Chia S.

description: Poor service. Very rude security guards. Fortunately there are other great bars in the area. Don't waste your time here.
author: Carolina M.

description:
Double Dutch is my favorite spot in SF! Sure, the crowd is sometimes a little young (especially for this late-20s grandma) and the tiny dance floor gets PACKED, but the music is always on point. I love the old school and top 40s mix, and I always have an awesome time here! I've also never had any issues with watered down drinks.

Parking is a royal pain here (like every part of the Mission), so I highly recommend leaving your car at home. Also, be prepared to wait in a little line if you plan to come around 11-12.

See you on the dance floor!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Has a very good night life scene for 30 and below. The couple times I have gone, it's been packed. Dj played current club music! You are able to use your credit card at the bar which is helpful (there is not an ATM inside)
It's a small venue so be prepared to be close to people. If you do not do well in close areas this is not the spot for you! 
Over all, I have had good times at the place!
author: Christina C.

description: straight trash bartender didn't know what he was doing and the bouncer didn't have a clue what he was doing granddma wasn't allowed in because she didn't have a ID my ID was invalid expired id but I was let in when they realized we were together the they kicked us out super unprofessional and lame this bar used to be lit now it's straight trash the bouncers and bartenders are so unprofessional and  uneducated
author: Victor C.

description: I ordered a Makers Mark Manhattan and watched the bartender pour Makers Mark over the rocks in a high ball glass then shoot water from the gun in it and throw in a orange skin. I said is that a Manhattan and he said yes. I said I wanted it up and he took a strainer and poured the watered down Makers a mark in a new high ball glass and dumped in the same orange skin. Enough said.
author: Steven B.

description: Fun place to drink , DJ plays the best jams to drop it low! Easy to find parking too!
author: Giovanie R.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with a group of about 10 people. We each paid a $5 cover and were extremely disappointed to discover how crowded the venue was! Literally no space to move at all! After wiggling in and out of the bar, we inquired about getting our money back seeing as we were only there for 10 minutes (it took 5 minutes to squeeze through the small bar each way). The collector said no can do but said we could talk to the manager (some vague guy somewhere in the building - thanks, like I'm going to spoil the rest of my evening trying to chase down someone that doesn't exist). Nope, instead I write Yelp reviews. 

They easily surpassed their maximum occupancy seeing as everyone was standing shoulder to shoulder. 

Do not recommend. Will not come again.
author: Lexy C.

description:
Unless you want your belongings stolen I recommend not going here! If you see other reviews it has happened before the same way they went into my purse and stole my iPhone! Whoever it is I'm sure is associated with the bar, it goes on way to frequently. They knew exactly why what to do! They put my phone on airplane mode I cannot search it! It's insane they obviously knew how the bar worked as well. Just so disappointing I lost so much from these selfish people taking my phone! Obviously they are not investigating these crook he's if it keeps reoccurring! I'm just convinced that whoever it is is associated with the bar I'm sure they are working together. It happens too often an and it's smooth.

They music was great! We had a great time it was a bit crowded but fun. Just not worth so
author: Veronica M.

description:
Do not go here. I was there for less than an hour and 4 random girls had their phones, IDs, and credit cards stolen. Did anyone that worked there care? NOPE. If anything the bouncer yelled at me because he can't deal with "drunk girls" when I'm sorry but having your purse unzipped, and someone stealing all of your belongs even tampons is a "drunk girl" well idk I'd like to re-learn the definition of "drunk girl" because girls/ladies/women/bitches don't lose their entire purse. 

Not only was this a one time scenario but I was told that this happens on the regular. Just not acceptable. Thanks :)
author: Katrina C.

description: Twas a nice time, drinks made well. Service was quick and precise. Only negative was the bathroom, there were no toilet seat covers. The cleanliness of the only restroom in the joint was sub par. I've smelled mutant ass cheeks that has had a better aroma than this bathroom. 3/5 would come again on an empty bladder.
author: MultiCylinder M.

description: If you want to get down and funky without trekking to deep SoMa and waiting in one of the club lines, Double Dutch may be your best bet. With pretty standard Mission drink prices ($5 local beers, $7 mid-shelf shots) and an entertaining if sporadic DJ spinning tunes out on the dance floor in the back, it's hard to go wrong here if you're with a fun group. Admire the music-themed decor on the walls everywhere and try to stay out of the black lights as much as possible, especially after a full day of SantaCon debauchery. Fun place! Just watch out for iPhone thieves and pickpockets...
author: Andy L.

description: Music is nice, the place is too crowded for my taste. At least the beer is cold. Doorman warns you ahead of time about pick pocketing, which is a turn off but a lot of places is SF are like that now. If you're trying to get smashed and dance it's alright, if you want to have any sort of personal space, forget it.
author: Lane S.

description:
BE CAREFUL SOMEONE IS PICKPOCKETING FROM PURSES WHILE PEOPLE ARE WEARING THEM!!!!!! LEARN FROM MY UNFORTUNATE EXPERIENCE!!!!!! DON'T BRING ANYTHING VALUABLE AT ALL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! OR DUCT TAPE IT TO YOUR BODY!!!! lol

I went here on Friday 5/6/2016 and my $200 wallet and iPhone 6 were stolen out of my bag WHILE I was wearing it. The bag was a small clutch that folded over and closed with a magnet, so not the most fool-proof purse but not complete open. SIM card was removed and I couldn't use Find My iPhone within 20 min of it being stolen. Clearly the person doing this knows what they're doing. Double Dutch said they thought they might have a suspect as this has been occurring for a while now and they've been investigating. Wish they would have told me that earlier, I would have hidden everything away in my shirt lol.I've never had anything stolen from me like this, I'm not a completely careless person and I've lived in San Francisco most of my life (have exposure with being street smart) so the thief is clearly experienced and has this down to a science. 

This bar is DOPE, plays great music and the crowd is awesome. I had a great night except for that. If you go JUST MAKE SURE YOU KEEP ALL VALUABLES ON YOUR LITERAL BODY OR IN YOUR HANDS ALL NIGHT LONG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! DONT BRING A PURSE!!!!!!! BE REALLY REALLY REALLY VIGILANT!!!!!!!!
author: Dzanela M.

description: probably the trashiest place i've ever been to. if the first thing the bouncer telling you is "hold on to your belongings, a lot of robberies happen here" isn't a clear enough sign to turn around and go somewhere else, be cautious of the low class girls who come to this place. i understand it's a crowded place, but there's no reason for unnecessary aggressive pushing and pulling of hair because you want more room on the dance floor. i will never come here again. save yourself the $5 cover and go literally anywhere else. i truly don't understand how this place is still in business
author: Gaby L.

description: The bar is cool and everything but someone's pick pocketing everyone and stealing phones. FUCK YOU PICK POCKETERS!!!! If you wanna  TU then yes this is the place but hold all your shit and keep it on sight.
author: Yenni H.

description: Depends what you are down for. DD on the weekend nights is a sweat box, with 90's hip-hop and R&B blaring. It is not a classy scene, but can be the best place to black out or get nasty haha. Double Dutch is definitely one for the books
author: Ross S.

description:
Two friends and I came here last night, both of them had their phones stolen within an hour. Two iPhone 6's stolen out of their purse on the dance floor almost immediately after walking in. One of them had a zippered purse, the other's had a clasp. These aren't careless people, none of us have ever had our phones stolen before and we've lived all over the world, in Europe, in many places with pick pocketers, etc. Double Dutch is something else though. 

We told the bouncer right away, and he seemed completely apathetic, said it happens all the time... Like what the fuck is your job then, you shady ass hole. Seems like this happens all the time, I honestly wouldn't be surprised if it's an inside thing with the staff. 

Too bad because the music and drinks were good, but not worth the $500+ you dish out for a new iPhone after yours gets stolen upon entry.
author: Michael B.

description: Music is pretty lame, along with the poor beer selection. The decor is pretty cool! The staff seemed pretty good overall. Service was prompt.
author: Jonah K.

description: I would give them no stars if that was possible. Terrible experience. Very rude staff. Lots of pick pockets here and the security turns a blind eye. Don't risk it. Go somewhere else.
author: Brodie S.

description: Bar staff lost my friend's card and gave it to someone else. They did not offer any apology and were terrible in the way they dealt with the situation. Pick pockets are not the problem. Amanda is.
author: Taichi H.

description:
Dope place! Good music for hip hop lover. 
The entrance is 5$ pretty good! 
It was pretty hot inside.
author: Naj A.

description: I had some extra time to kill while in San Francisco & ended up at Double Dutch on a whim. I must say, I didn't encounter any of the negative experiences that others before me had. The lady tending the bar was very friendly & the drinks were generously poured. I found it to be a super comfortable/chill spot. Good energy & vibes, not to mention great music. If you're tired of the typical techno dance music played at many bars & enjoy old school & current Hip Hop, this is the spot. The boombox wall was very unique & made for a cool background for photos. The bathroom is oddly placed tucked away in a back corner on the small dance floor & can be a bit of a challenge getting to once the crowd picks up. All in all, I had a good time during my short stop there & I can see myself returning the next time I find myself in the neighborhood.
author: M P.

description:
Good music and friendly bartenders are the main pros to this place. Also, reasonably priced beer (can't speak for cocktails, didn't get any). 

Cons: $5 cover for seemingly no reason given that the dance floor is tiny and the place gets so crowded that I literally had trouble breathing. Also, crowd can be a little dicey. Expect to be grabbed by more than once person while attempting to walk from the dance floor back to the entrance. Make this place bigger!!!
author: Mallory W.

description: Good music. Way too small inside and the bathrooms were horrible. Too hot and long lines just to use it.
author: David L.

description: A group of my female friends and I went to the Double Dutch this past weekend. I am a female and had previously been wearing a hat, but was told by the doorman that security "may" ask me to take it off inside. I took it off and eventually put it on back inside when I saw 5 or 6 other people wearing hats that security was not asking to remove. Some time goes by and someone starts flashing a bright light in my face, considering I was being blinded, I assumed someone was taking a video. My friend puts her arm out to block the light and the security guard proceeds to throw his arms up and sends my drink flying up in the air, causing it to dump all over me. He grabs my female friend by the right arm and starts aggressively shaking her. I yell at him to let her go and he turns to me and finally says "No wearing hats in here".  I tell him "Okay that is fine" and proceed to take off my hat. My friends and I immediately left the club, considering one of us was just physically assaulted by a security guard. My friend who was assaulted by the guard now has a giant bruise on her arm from where he grabbed her & I was covered in my drink after he caused it to pour all over me. This was my first time at this club, and certainly the last time. Double Dutch should hire guards who can handle their emotions calmly, rather than guards who are so power hungry that they would lay hands on a woman before even telling them what they are doing wrong. The owner of this club should be ashamed they even hire people like this.
author: Jessica M.

description: The bartenders and bouncers were pretty cool and they treat you like regulars (shoutout to Darcy!)  Their tequila sunrise isn't as tasty as when other bars make it but I don't know why that is.  It was awesome of the bartender to accommodate and add more grenadine, though.  He was so cool about it.  The venue is pretty small but the scene is lit.  I love the design of the place.  Like the other reviewers said, do anything you can to prevent pickpocketing.  And there's a shelf where most people set their drinks down but I wouldn't if I were you.  In no way it's the bar's responsibility, but one guy attempted to drug me so there's that.  Had a great time, though, due to company, and this place won't break your bank.
author: Quyne V.

description:
If I could give this place ZERO stars I would! Not too long ago I forgot my messenger bag ,after last call, with a blue button up, and a vest with several patches and pins on it under the bar. When a friend of mine did me the enormous favor of picking it up for me and shipping it to San Diego I discovered the button up  and vest were missing and replaced with random scarves. 

So to the owners, know that your staff is not trustworthy and should be kept an eye on.

And to any potential customers don't go!! Nothing's worst than having to worry about untrustworthy staff!! 

Picture of the vest in my profile picture. Not shown in picture several patches from Moped companies, misfits patch, black and white flag patches and several pins.
author: Daniel B.

description:
Great Hip Hop on a Thursday night. Drinks were adequately priced and the atmosphere was very chill, with the ability to dance your butt off. I loved the boombox-filled wall art - what an ode to my childhood!

That bathroom, though? That bathroom was horrendous! Absolutely terrifying.

My group and I had a nice time, though.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Came to Double Dutch on a Saturday night after going to other bars in the area. Even at 12:30am they had a $5 cover charge. The security was very biased. Letting in friends without checking IDs, waiving cover charges in front of people waiting in line to pay. Holding up the line to say what's up to passerbys. It was a little disrespectful and made me want to take my business elsewhere. I know this kind of stuff happens everywhere, but you don't have to blatantly shove it in others faces that you're getting the hook up or preventing business from entering. 

The place was packed so the dancing was very smushed. Some people like that, I don't. Drinks were averagely priced and pretty strong which is a good sign of a strong hand. Atmosphere is casual with the population about mid to late twenties. Decor is 80s Bboy, boomboxes, kangol hats and cardboard. It was well done to bring you back to a simpler time when disagreements were handled by dance battles instead of world star hip hop videos.

The music started okay. By okay I mean they had the good throwback jams that bring you back to a time before clubs were all EDM. It made you feel good and you just couldn't help your body from moving to the beat. Then the DJ starting doing shout outs and playing random songs nobody was feeling. Maybe he was trying to help his homie out by playing his new track, or he was trying to go underground. Regardless, it was apparent the DJ was not feeling the room and was just spinning for himself and a few friends. Eventually it was too much and we ended up calling it an earlier night. Not my first choice of places to visit in the area. A two star rating that means "meh I've experienced better" is a fair rating.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
I felt like I was reliving my undergraduate days, which isn't a bad thing! 

This bar has a cool set up, with old vintage boom boxes plastered into the walls. The music was great as the DJ spun old and new hip-hop tunes. There could be some more room on the dance floor though! All in all, everyone is pretty friendly, just looking for a good time. 

Make sure to get here at a reasonable time because it does get jam packed in here!
author: Sarin P.

description: Idk who the bar tender was tonight but he made us feel unwelcome we spent our hard earned money for someone to give us attitude?! I don't think so get your priorities straight! Customers are always right
author: Alexis A.

description: Didn't quite enjoy the music. Went in on a Thursday night and the crowd was kinda poor. Maybe they're better on weekends.
author: Pallav T.

description: Like everyone else who has written a review, I too have had my phone stolen from my purse...so a quality place..in which the bouncers did not care whatsoever about the well-being of their customers. Also, my friend says he is pretty sure they have small pen15s. Definitely recommend this place if that's what you are looking for.
author: Jamie M.

description:
I want to give it five stars for the old school hip hop and cheap drinks, but I can't considering the place is jam packed, sweat everywhere, so small, with a shitty bathroom. What do you expect though - it's a dive bar.

I emphasize again, the music is SO good if you're looking for a hip hop bar. There's a live DJ near the small, crowded dance floor that gets pretty ratchet lol. They have this cool wall of boom boxes. After a certain time they have cover ($5).
author: Marivic D.

description: Came to this bar Lounge for a friends bday and the place was packked to the fullest. It was getting hot in their. Pretty much shoulder to shoulder with everyone and it was hot. I don't blame the bar because well their trying to get as much people as they can to go to their club. Music is pretty good with hip hip and RNB hits.
author: James L.

description:
Uggghhhhhhh I got my phone stolen here last night.

I just read a bunch of other reviews saying the same thing. What a shame.

I'm really bummed, I just wanted to dance and have a good time. I'm pretty sure it was swiped from my pocket while on the dance floor.

Stay away if you wanna keep your stuff!
author: Sandra N.

description:
You know those apartments in SF that go for like $2800/mo and you get a 250 sq ft shoebox? And you invite 45 people over for a pregame and it feels like Bart at 5pm? That image/feeling is exactly what this bar is... If not worse. 

Chris Brown's song "Wall-to-Wall" is the theme song for this bar (if you even want to call it that). 

If you love not being able to breathe and examining a drunk stranger's facial hair, this place is for you. 

Don't even bother trying to get a drink here, you can't tell which part of this place is the bar/dance floor/bathroom because it's so packed.
author: Bradley C.

description: Another stolen phone review: my friend had an iPhone 6S taken from her closed, clasped purse last night. The staff members we talked to were unhelpful...we're not surprised now that we've seen how common phone theft is at Double Dutch. Too bad, because it's a fun bar otherwise. Super shady...
author: Malini N.

description:
I'm not into Hip Hop but I do find myself at the DD quite frequently before the music starts.  Nice bar, cool stuff on the walls, good bartenders, and a nice selection of drinks make this a place worth visiting.
It always seems pretty clean, but I'm there around opening time.  Drink prices are good for the 'happy hour' right when they open!  They don't have food or snacks, but there are places all around it.
I'll be back!
author: Jim P.

description:
Double Dutch is where you go when one of your friends says "I wish there was somewhere we could go to just dance our hearts out...it doesn't even have to be that fancy." That spot it Double Dutch. Amazing hip hop music and tons of people who's number one goal is to dance their a$$ off. I am proper on the outside and ghetto fab on the inside so this is a spot where I can truly be myself. Sometimes a girl just needs to drop it low. My boyfriend and I are both pretty nerdy bad dancers but after one tequila shot we magically turn into the best dancers in the world. Or we at least think we are. Every girl needs a guy she can dance her heart out with. Even if you look completely ridiculous doing the sprinkler together but you'll be laughing so hard that people will be jealous of your sprinkler.

In summary, bring your date or your friends here because they will have a blast listening to old school hip hop and dancing all night.
author: Juliet S.

description:
I can't agree more with the reviews written below about getting your belongings stolen here!! It just happened to me last night! Even though they have two guys at the door, they still let in people that are severely underdressed, with sketchy huge backpacks and don't manage capacity to make sure everyone inside trying to have a good time is safe. If you go here, duck tape your shit to your body.... or just don't go here. 

Ps: F*** this place.
author: Rory F.

description: I will definitely come back! The music and atmosphere was fun and great for dancing with my best friend :) Super strong drinks but not the friendliest bar tender..
author: Maurisa D.

description:
I have seen double Dutch deteriorate year after year. Tonight it reached new lows. First, the fat, bald bouncer let a totally inebriated young female back into the club, even though anyone could see she was in no condition to be back in the bar. He then gave our party of 10 grief because he decided some of us "cut the line" even thought we were waiting together. (In 8 yrs of partying at DD I have never seen this fool...what an ass)
Then there was the amount and the quality  of people inside the establishment. Overcrowded (yes, even for fucking double Dutch, I know) rude, and plain dumb.

Oh honey, you are not the same person I once fell in love with.

The restrooms are outright disgusting and a cesspool for infections. But on DD defense they have always looked that way, so obviously, the owners just don't give a flying fcuk.
author: Pony R.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO HAVE YOUR THINGS STOLEN!!!!!
I was at the venue for less than half an hour and my ID and credit card were stolen from my purse. The place is crowded way past capacity which makes it impossible to detect someone stealing your belongings. Luckily I had phone in my hand or it would have been taken too. When I approached the security he acted completely uninterested and apathetic which makes it seem like they are in on it. Trashy place with even trashier staff and crowd
author: Jazmin V.

description:
This place deserves a 5 for the music but a 4 for the location and crowd. I have been dying to come here after my friend said she went inside, danced to the best ratchet music ever, and ripped her damn pants in the making. I was like...GIMMEEEEE. I finally got the chance to go to this small ass bar and small ass dance floor since we had dinner at Picaro a block away.

Parking
This is located in the Mission and parking is friggin impossible. You literally have to circle for dayzzz but luckily me and two other cars were able to find parking. Trust but make sure you pick a restaurant and post activities in the same area because you do no want to repark. This place is also very sketch and I feared my car would get attacked so I went back before DD to check it out. I would want to lyft to this area if I lived in SF.

Cover
I got there at 10:30 and no cover. I asked the bouncer for information just so I could write it in here. He said cover is $5 and its after 11pm. When he said the time, it seemed iffy like if you made it a little after then it is ok or if the line is super long then maybe you have to pay? It seems all dependent on how happy he is that day haha. There is no coat check.

Attire
SF is chilly but I guess this was a "warmer" SF spring night but I was wear a shirt, skirt and a workout jacket haha. There is no coat check so you have to hold onto your shit. I noticed a lot of people wear jeans shirts and jacket so it is a super chill setting where you dont dress up. I sorta felt weird wearing a skirt but thank you baby jesus I did. It is friggin hot on the dance floor. Sweaty sauna status where I had to go home and shower and shiz. It may be cold at night but you will thank me if you have a shirt and shorts or something. Even dudes can wear casual shorts.

Place/Crowd
This place reminded me of Raven..but a smaller version. You literally walk in and you can see the end of the place. There is a small bar area and you walk to the back to the small dance floor which is comparable to the Raven dance floor size. I guess I expected more of a dance club than a bar but obvs its a bar. There are stools at the bar and a few tables along the edges so that is nice. You can get some of that AC at the bar and some water from the bartender. The crowd is also mixed. I guess it is what you expect since it is located in the Mission. Since we got there sorta early, we were pretty much the only asians there but then filipinos and what not came in when we left. We sure do love our hip hop music. Which brings me to....

MUSIC!
UMPH. I love me some hip hop and r&b. Like I said, it plays similar music to Raven but it is more of the ghetto ratchet side with lil jon e40 tyga and stuff. The DJ...who will now be my best friend. I wanted to see if I could build a similar relationship to my Raven DJ who lets me request my usual songs but plays them a bit later. So I asked this guy if I could hear Too Close, Return of the Mack (and then he thought I was done but I thought lemme test this playa), Dont Tell Em, and Ayo. I was like yeahhhh thats a good set list. He said yeah I already play these songs and my eyes widened with excitement that we would be best friends. Just one song later, I hear Too Close and I obvs get super excited. I was like hayyyyyyyyy. Then right after was Return of the Mack and I thought, OH NO HE DIDNTTT. I expected him to mix it up and lo and behold Dont Tell Em comes on and at this point my heart is exploding. My friends and I are like there is no way he will do all four of my songs back to back....and we just waited to the end of Jeremih.......and BAM. Ayo comes one and I explode once again. I point my finger at the DJ and say thank you DJ!! Obvs he didnt hear me but I am sure he felt my happy good vibes. Umph. This DJ has a good memory or he sure likes to make his people happy. Yay my music! I am sure everyone else enjoyed my little short set as well hehe cuz people on the floor were getting a bit too low if ya know what I mean.
author: Amy H.

description: The music is good and everything. Gets super crowded, shoulder to shoulder like sardines. If you want your shit stolen, don't come here, hence two people had there phones stolen when we were there for only 5 minutes. My friend had her phone stolen out of her purse when it was locked. Theres even signs in the bar that says beware of pick pocketers. If you do swing by hang on to your stuff tightly.
author: P. A.

description:
It's a sweaty, chaotic mess... And I mean that in the most complimentary way possible. You shouldn't go here if you're prone to claustrophobia. You go here when you want to dance to quality, recognizable hip hop and mix energies with a wide variety of people. You are guaranteed to sweat, smile, and sing along to your favorite jams, but ladies, leave your purse at home... Trust me, you'll want all the room you can get once you're on the packed dance floor.

I gave it a 4th star simply because the decor adds to the funky fresh vibe and will make you reminisce about the days when music was tangible!
author: Michelle M.

description: Fun venue, that was until my phone was taken out of my bag -while around my body too! Serious pro's running around there as I just noticed all of the other reviews that say the same thing.  Urgh, if you decide to go here, watch your bag!
author: Kylie R.

description: Back when Mark Walburg was Marky mark, this is how we use to make the party start, go into a room unless its totally dark, and look for a cute girlie so you can try to talk! If your itching for a low key club with tribute to early 80s Hip-hop, this must be it! Everything from the Photographs placed on the wall, to the decor of used boom boxes which have seen their lives come to an end, from a block party or Breakdance battle. The place is decent sized, drinks are modest at best. You are coming here mostly to dance with your friends, and listen to cool vibes and have someone spill a drink on your new shoes and it be partly crowded. This place is like the hidden gem, or little sister to the Milk Bar in haight street. Milk bar use to give off this incredible vibe that supported hip-hop without being too commercial or overcrowded. Ladies and Gentleman I give you double dutch. A place crowded enough on a weekend night, but still cool and laid back enough not to have any riff raff, or no nonsense.
author: Michael R.

description: Went to this bar on a Friday night was hella crowed for one. The people seem racist. I was looked at up and down like if they stereotyped me. I got asked what was I selling. Shoes got dirty cause rude people would just get by with pushing you out the way. Even the guy at the front door said my name really funny and greeted my friend but not me. I didn't like the atmosphere at this place. Have you ever felt not welcomed?
author: Michelle Z.

description: Decent bar in the Mission. There's a small dance floor towards the back... The place itself is pretty small. Seemed happening when we cruised by to check it out on a recent Saturday night. I dig some of the pictures and decor up on the wall cause it salutes hip hop culture as far as b-boy framed photos & posters as well as boomboxes scattered about. The bartenders were cool. People at the door seemed cool... But the music wasn't. At least to me it didn't match the vibe of the place. I expected classic or golden era hip hop but instead it was all radio play & other Vegas club type music. So I was a bit confused on that... Maybe I came there on the wrong night. Maybe that's how it is most nights... Didn't stick around too long to see if the music would change. As we all know, it's all about the music.
author: Chuck D.

description:
Seriously, be careful with your valuables in this place. My phone was stolen out of my purse while I was wearing it after being here for less than an hour. On Saturday nights, it is wall-to-wall people, and you can get ripped off really easily.

Drinks ok, music ok, but understandably I will not be coming back here.
author: Nora K.

description:
Collin is the bartender! Ask for a BANG BANG! He's the only bartender who knows how to make it.. It's a customized Zombie. Great drink of you want to get onnnn and not taste the alcohol. I love double Dutch. 

Make sure you visit this place if you're in SF.
author: Ruth B.

description: I wish I could write a 0 star but there isn't one.  I went here last night with a large group of friends to go dancing and at least 7-8 people all had their phones stolen.  It is such a shady club and way too crowded!  Now, it is not the club's fault what kind of people come into their establishment, but it is their responsibility to keep everyone safe inside.  When they found out last night that someone was stealing cell phones they really didn't seem to care.  They just said "well you can look around for your phone, or call in tomorrow and see if anyone has found one."  Made us feel very protected by their "security" staff!!
author: Amanda L.

description: Awesome club unfortunately there are peeps tryin to steal phones and wallets. Been going for years this is the first. Usually this happens in the  Castro. Tough times.... so keep your phone I. Purse or front pocket.
author: Naka G.

description:
After a trip to Good Vibrations, my friends and I came to Double Dutch to continue our bachelorette celebrations.  The doorman's obligatory search of our bags was one of my favorite moments of the night.

The bar was small and a little dingy, but I liked the eclectic decor.  It featured walls covered in stereo facades, and plenty of neon and sneakers completed the consciously '90s vibe.  The music was sort of in tune with that aesthetic, and we left after a drink because the bachelorettes wanted more danceable music.  Fair enough. The dance floor was tiny and more or less empty.

We stayed long enough for me to buy a shot for one of our bachelorettes.  Two shots of well vodka cost $14, and they were served cold and smooth.  Not bad.  The bar also looked pretty well stocked, with a decent selection of most liquors.  Service was friendly and fast.

I did not enjoy the cramped bathroom.  I am not super particular about cleanliness, but the floor was wet, and that is always disgusting when you're in a sliver of a room where all people do is release fluid and solid waste into the world.

We left pretty fast, but there was no cover and the bar was serviceable enough.  I wouldn't make a point of coming back, but I liked Double Dutch fine.
author: Steph C.

description: Similar to reviews below, both my friend and I got our iPhones stolen out of our purses within 30 minutes of being in this bar. When I let the bouncer know, he said "it happens all the time". I would be willing to bet the bouncers are in on this since it seems to be the same story every time. If you want to have an $800 night, go to this bar.
author: Kara B.

description:
Is it just me, or are the glory days over?

The only thing left for me in this dive is that unbeatable wall of boombox heaven.

Other than that, it is RIDICULOUSLY crowded on any night you'd want to be out on a Mission bender, even if you wanted to dance on the tiny dance floor, good luck shoving your way through the crowd to get there first. And if you're trying to make it through with a drink in your hand, well you might as well just forget about it. They pack this place now like a can of sardines. It's hard to get a drink at all, it's hard to hear anything except the music which is WAY too loud, and the kind of clientele Double Dutch attracts these days is, to put it nicely, undesirable. A couple of instances of hearing about violent occurrences around the outside of that place late at night and I thought that pretty much spoke for itself.

Won't be coming back for a while, just can't hang with it. Good for 21-22 year olds maybe, but I'm just too old for all that now.
author: Theresa C.

description:
This place is small and a bit grimy, and since I'm a hot mess when the sun goes down and the liquor touches the lips I had an amazing time here celebrating my BFF's 30th birthday.

We came here on a Saturday night and they were spinning old school hip hop and R&B.  I love my electro music, but I have to say it was really quite refreshing from the unce unce unce found at every other bar/club these days.

There was a short line out the door but nothing that wasn't bearable.  Ladies were free, men paid $5.

Drinks were decent but can't give any input on the price since these were graciously bought for by my generous manfriend.

There's a small dancefloor which is packed where the DJ is.  The only downside of this place is that the bathroom is where the dance floor is and there's only two single stalls (no distinction b/w men and women).  So you have to wiggle your way through sweating dancing drunk bodies to take a leak.

This place is for the unpretentious and for those who just want to have a good time with their friends.  Double Dutch won't be for those who come for the ambiance, it's for those who bring their own.
author: Jennie K.

description:
Imagine a Sunday night that is pouring rain. You and three girlfriends go to the Double Dutch for a drink. As you cross the threshold into the bar, a large, unfriendly bouncer pulls you back and makes you stand outside even though you already had your ID out. As your friends arrive, the same bouncer yells at them, "Get into the light." He is demanding all four of you stand under a single bulb outside the front door in the cold, rainy night. He then yells at your petite friend for not having a large enough hand for his stamp.

It was one of the most intense, bizarre experiences. In the nine years since I have turned 21, I have never been so insulted and physically threatened, especially for a raining Sunday night.
author: Bridget K.

description:
Since when can you not wear baseball hats at a dive bar. Beanies...fine. Safari hats (saw two)...fine. But wear a baseball cap and you get a big old bouncer on a power trip shining a flashlight right in your eyes. When my cap found its way back to my head b/c I was sick of holding it... he threatened to kick me out. Not a problem...decided to leave on my own. 

My two cents... if a local boy can't represent the Giants at bar that plays hip hop, where wearing sneakers, hoodies and even sandals is allowed....then its probably not that tight of a scene....Which it never really is at Double Dutch. 

I'll throw in a second star though because the music is always good and if you show up with your own crew, its always a good time dancing the night away. 

Seriously though let me wear my hat.
author: Matt M.

description:
Came here last week and the place was poppin'! They played all the classic hip-hop from all those middle school dances, but coming here is without the awkwardness. The place is pretty small, so it was really packed--which means your bubble will get real small. Not recommended if you don't like tight, small spaces. It got real sweaty and hot (like a sauna, seriously), but it was worth it for all the singing and dancing. 

Drinks were at a decent price, same as most bars.

Bathrooms (only two unisex bathrooms) were not that great, but what do you expect from a bar? The line to the bathroom got a little weird because people were dancing right in front of them too. It got a little awkward.

Got there around 10:30 and there was no cover. Bouncer was pretty friendly.

Overall, four stars for the music and chill vibe here.
author: Kristine N.

description:
It's about the same size as Skylark where we were at prior.  Small and narrow, but I did enjoy the decor which had boombozes along the wall.  Like Skylark, it was a $5 to get in but unfortunately we did not get a $5 chip to go towards drinks.  The music was just as good, but it felt more crowded at Double Dutch.

It was just ok, not too much room to dance.  Many people pushing and shoving their way through the place.  Looking back it's basically the same as Skylark, except I like Skylark better.
author: Geoffrey C.

description:
This place is AWESOME! I came here last Saturday night with my folks and we had a blast, I just turned 21 so the bartender hooked me up with birthday shots and had my ass feeling nice alllllll night long. The music was perfect exactly what I was looking for because I'm not a big fan of EDM/House music, lots of throw backs mixed in with current hip hop/r&b jams, I danced all night long. 
This place is casual I ended up changing shoes because I had heels on and you won't need those because you'll be dancing all night long. The crowd was a good mixture of all types of ethnicities and it was a fun vibe. It's a small place and it was pretty full by 11 pm but it wasn't shoulder to shoulder I had room to dance around  , we showed up a 9:30 and got in no cover charge and watched the place fill up and get jumping.
I would've given this place 5 stars but the bathroom was REPULSIVE, ive never seen a bathroom so disgusting in my entire life I was horrified when I opened the door. Only downside about this bar but I will definitely be back for good music and good drinks !
author: Chantelle T.

description:
I personally love this place because the music is all old school hip hop. The decor is 80s with the posters and radios on the wall. 

No cover and no dress code. Place is tiny and gets overpacked. You gotta push your way through the crowd. This is why it gets 4 stars. The dance floor is a super tiny. This place is always smackin' though.
author: Jenna T.

description:
Good drinks. Decent music. Small dance floor. What more could you want? I guess the bathrooms are a little small and dirty but you get what you pay for! I had no cover charge on a Thursday night and it was pretty hopping. 

My first drink of the night was a dark and stormy and the bartender literally poured like 4/5 of the glass rum and the rest ginger beer. Sweet gig.
author: Patrick T.

description:
So you've been bar hopping around the mission, a little faded now, but you want to dance and possible meet some people that are looking to have fun.  Stumble over to double dutch.  The dance floor is a bit small, but the crowd is young and fun, and the music will keep you going.  

The decor place is pretty cool.  If you aren't too faded, you'll appreciate the boombox wall and the giant boombox mural on the dance floor.  They also pay tribute to sneaker heads with classic shoes hanging from the ceiling and a mural of Jordans on one wall.  No place gets you into that hip hop mind set quite like double dutch!

Boo on the $5 cover tho.
author: Veasna H.

description:
I'm not a fan when condescending people say "I'm too old for this shit!", but seriously, I was saying that about this place when I came here for the first time when I was like 22. Some odd number of years later (more than 5, less than 10...), I return, and I feel exactly the same. EXACTLY. I'm too old to be cramped into a small, wet sweatbox with crazy dancing people who don't respect my personal space! Where there's a $20 minimum for drinks at the bar and just two co-ed bathroom stalls meaning a line spills out onto the dance floor. A dance floor where I'm TRYING to dance, because the music here is actually pretty sick and my friends and I stupidly went all the way to the back thinking there'd be more room there, but nope, it was just a 120-degree sauna, people up in my personal bubble, and folks waiting in line for the bathroom. If this place were bigger, I probably wouldn't complain so much. I love the hip hop music which spans several decades, as well as the clever interior decorating. But like the creaky old party pooper said... maybe I really am just too old for this. 

That being said, if your group is insisting on dancing, I think this is still the best option around the 16th and Valencia corner on a weekend. Skylark seems a lot more shady. $5 cover on a Saturday night.
author: Kate V.

description: My friends and I came out to SF for a girls night and were so happy to hear hip hop and some old school beats at this club! It's incredibly packed, and the line for the restroom is inconveniently placed and semi-weaved onto the dance floor, but the vibe is what got me.
author: Meighan N.

description:
I don't care if the bathrooms are gross or even if the dance floor is ridiculously small. All I know is Double D is my fave spot in the Mish, the music is always popping, and its guaranteed to be packed. The crowd is diverse and represents SF well -- basically, don't expect to find just one "type" of group here. The old school hip hop theme I definitely dig. And lets not forget the awesomeness of the bouncer on Fridays, the little man who cleans up everyone's mess, and the dude that always gets kicked out for smoking pot in the middle of the dance floor!

If nothing else in my review has convinced you to check Double D out, come at least to marvel at the awesome sneakers that dangle from the ceiling, the beautifully graffiti-ed walls, and the boomboxes that line the right hand side.
author: I. L.

description:
OK, so maybe 5 stars is a bit zealous but, I loved the music and ambiance.  They have a dj who plays old school hip-hop, from the good ole days when hip-hop songs contained more than 10 words that get repeated over andover for 3 minutes.

The drinks are very good, the staff is friendly and know how to make a drink and it is a whole lot of fun.  What more could you want from a little, old bar?

I had so much fun I did not want to leave and, for me, that rarely happens.  So I have to give them 5 stars.
author: Brady S.

description:
Place is bumping' that's for sure. Crowded, guaranteed to brush against somebody and spill you drink. Protect ya neck, kid. 90's rap/R&B mixed in with what I like to call 'ratchet rap' i.e. the the current radio rap selection.

Small venue, cool for a spontaneous night of dancing. Did I mention it's a small venue? Minimal air circulation, so don't wear gray if a little booty shaken' gets you sweaty easily.
author: Emmeline A.

description:
It'll remind you of the bar you went to during the glorious undergrad years. The 3 stars was for the awkwardness of people waiting in line to go pee (or poo, what have you) standing right next to people who are grindin' and getting down n dirty. 

Yes, the line for the bathroom literally bisects the dance floor. This is real life.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Ah Double Dutch. How is it that I always end up here at the end of the night, dancing to the great music on the tiny, crowded dance floor?

I found it hilarious that the hottie of a bouncer literally shuffled my tiny friend back out the front door because the rest of my group was loudly debating whether or not to go in, and I told him so : )

When we did end up finally getting in, it was packed to the gills and the energy was good. The space is just big enough to fit a large crowd, but not too space to make it feel claustrophobic.

We had just enough time and opportunity to grab one drink, which was similar to salmon fighting to swim upstream (how did those bartenders make it to us!). My friends soon after ran off toward the dance floor to boogie with their men.

Before we knew it, the night was over, and the bouncer was hollering at us to get out.

Bouncer, yelling: "Go home people! You've got lives. Go live them somewhere else!"

Me, leaning forward and shrugging: "Actually, this is my life. I've got nothing else."

Bouncer, cocking his head to one side and giving me a sly little smile. Cute.

He let me alone to finish my beer. Guess he liked my answer : )

Now I remember what draws me back. I think that The Mission is starting to grow on me, in a good way.
author: Diana V.

description:
I just moved to this city and I have found my new favorite place to be on a Saturday night. The music they play is great. The staff is awesome. The bartender Noah is so nice and I go out of my way to wait on him to serve me. also, mark and Robert at the door are hella nice. I always have so much fun when I go. The DJs are great and mix the old school hip hop with the new. 
The only thing is that if is so freaking hot in there. Please get some more air circulation in there. When I leave my head is soaked but I will keep going back because it is so much fun
author: Brandi R.

description: The atmosphere was busy, drinks were on the cheaper end, and the dance floor was packed. We came hoping for 80s music but there wasn't any! The DJ stuck mostly to current rap music which was a little disappointing. Will probably choose another option next time.
author: Sara K.

description:
After listening to rock all over the Mission District, my friends and I were on the hunt for some good hip hop music.  Enter Double Dutch.

Today's hip hop/rap lured us in and the old school hip hop tunes trapped us. The dance floor is smaller, but I didn't mind at all. It was just a really fun space to dance around in. I will say that the bathroom is a little inconveniently located, but it was a small price to pay. I had so much fun, I'll definitely be back!
author: Jane K.

description:
Double Dutch is a go-to for me whenever I'm bar-hopping in the Mission. It's on the same block as a lot of different bars so there's a lot to choose from.

It's actually not that big, but there's a small dance area in the back that usually gets really crowded/full on weekend nights. I would say to come to Double Dutch toward the end of the night, and if you're trying to dance. Definitely not a good place for a conversation with friends, unless you come very early.

The decor is cool and the music selection is pretty good whenever I've went. It's usually a fun night at Double Dutch (although probably not the classiest...)!
author: Greg J.

description: Great music is the only positive thing I have to say about this place. The bouncer is an angry frumpy dude who rummaged through my purse then slammed a stamp on my wrist. Dude has no business interacting with human beings. Ever.
author: Paige B.

description: It's a pretty small bar. Music was good. There is only one bathroom, therefore the line was long and it was also quite dirty.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
Eh. Double Dutch reminds me of a college party. It's a bit strange that so many of the other reviewers feel the same way, but I guess that means the feeling is mutual. The music was mostly Top 40 R&B/Rap, the drinks were decent. The crowd seemed to be mostly still in college and people who wished they were still in college. To be fair, I wish I was still in college. 

The locations of the bathrooms is pretty strange. If you have more than one or two people in line, you are basically hanging out in front of the DJ. Even by dive bar standards the bathrooms were particularly dirty. 

I had an OK time here with friends, but there are plenty of fun bars in the Mission. I'm giving this place three stars because I probably wouldn't take anyone here
author: Jake B.

description: I came here with few of my friends on a saturday night. They played great hip hop songs - songs where the whole crowd could sing along to. The thing the bothered me the most was the space. The place was a lot smaller than I thought. It's still got a bar but in my opinion with the given space it felt like it was a bar and they just added a DJ for people to dance (with very little room). It was super crowded on saturday night and I was always squished. What was worse is that a lot of people were holding drinks in their hands and I actually got drinks spilled on my shirt that night.
author: Andy A.

description: Double Dutch was cool. My 3 roommates and I went yesterday for Halloween and it was packed. No cover charge, walk in and it feels like hell (SUPER HOT). Dance floor was tiny but the music definitely made up for it. The DJ mixed a few old songs and new songs, a little Hip Hop and some House here and there. Prepare to sweat (If you actually dance). Very diverse crowd and we met a bunch of friendly people. We would definitely go back!
author: Monique L.

description:
Boomboxes and cassettes.  Who the fuck doesn't like the 80's memorabilia??!   They have a dance floor, and one TV.  

Drinks are dirt cheap here... $3 for a cranberry vodka (cheap vodka) and $5 for my kamikaze shot (Ketel One).  

There's plenty of dance floor.  However, since it's March Madness and only 1 TV, this place was pretty dead.  And it was WONDERFUL!
author: Fannie S.

description:
The Mission is always a great place for a night out with friends, especially if you don't feel like dressing up. Double Dutch is definitely a great place to make as one of your stops if you decide to go bar-hopping here in the Mission. 

Came here on a Saturday. Got to the place around 11:00pm. There was a short line, but we were able to get in after waiting for no longer than 5/10 minutes. Both guys and girls had to pay a cover of $5. In my opinion, the best part of Double Dutch is the music. I love me some 90s/00s hip hop and r&b. Every time I've come to Double Dutch, the music has always been on point! It's one of those places where you feel like every song they play is your jam! 

Other than having to pay a cover, the only other con of this place is how freaking packed it gets. When we first got there we ordered some drinks and tried to make our way to the dance floor. Trying to maneuver our way through the crowd was a mistake especially with our drinks still filled to the brim (splashing drinks everywhere). There was honestly no room to actually dance, so we went back the way we came from and luckily was able to swoop on one of the three/four tables on the side. But once we had the table, we were able to just dance where we were and that was just what we needed.
author: Kevin Joseph A.

description: This place definitely needs to be double the size.  It's great until it becomes so packed you can't move.  The music is what sold me, so many bars/clubs only play EDM (which is fine), i like a little variety in my playlist.
author: K S.

description:
Went there this past weekend. 
The moment I walk into the door, I see that there is this black guy who has his fist in someones face telling them how bad they are going to F**# the person up. 
Within 1/2 hour I see this guy, go up to people and do the same thing. 
It clearly being a problem, I go to the front door to let the staff know that there is someone in the club who is trying to hurt people.
