I point the guy out (as he is chasing someone out of the club cursing them out), and the staff say "Oh, thats our bouncer" and proceeded to do nothing about it as they clearly see him in the process. 
Don't go to this club people. You're going to have a bad interaction if this guy is working. If you read the reviews by other people below, this guy has been at it for awhile.
author: Jay N.

description: OK, so early 90s hip hop is definitely within my top 3 genres and this place just gets it. I am definitely past the sticky-floor-dance-bar time in my life, but the beats are so good here that it just doesn't matter. Quite the jewel.
author: Mel G.

description: Very small bar but very cool vibe with radios all over the wall. Dance floor in the very back. The nights they play hip hop are fun!
author: Annie R.

description:
Best night out I've had in a long time thanks to Double Dutch. No cover and the drinks are decent. The dance floor is really tiny and there are only two bathrooms, but everyone makes it work. No one is pretentious or lecherous - quite the opposite really. I went hoarse from shouting "I LOVE THIS SONG, THIS IS MY JAM, I LOVE THIS DJ" for every other song because damn, I really loved the songs, they really were my jams from the 90s, and I did love whatever dj was spinning last night. Old school Mariah and Jagged Edge? Done deal.

PS: Not to be a total kid, but you should wear white when you go to dance under the glow-in-the-dark lights.
author: Cat N.

description:
I was recently at this bar and was assaulted and yanked out by a bartender. People were going out the back door and I opened it to let cold air in for 2 seconds then turned around to continue dancing with my friends. Next thing I knew I was being aggressively yanked and thrown around outside in the back by a bartender. I was not drunk, I was completely complying with him and he kept yelling and pushing me around. I currently have 3 large bruises on my arm from this man (he was maybe 5'9 and has a red beard). I am not a small man (6ft 200 lbs) but he was extremely abusive when I was not even fighting him back or anything. He continued to yell and push/shove me down the alley way until I was on the street. When I asked him why I was getting thrown out all he said was "because you opened the f****** door". If I would have known that it wasn't allowed obviously I wouldn't have done it. He could have pulled me out and said, hey don't open this door, and boom, guess what? I wouldn't have done it again. The staff needs to learn to not just assault people for doing such minuscule things.

I understand that I am no saint in this situation, but for getting yanked/shoved/yelled at for opening a door that people were opening throughout the night was a bit ridiculous. The staff here needs to be taught that you can't just try to manhandle people for doing things that everyone was doing during the night. For anyone that goes to this bar, please be careful about the staff. They will take abuse you and no even second guess it at all.

Another side note: The bathrooms. I've been to many bars throughout Europe and America, this place is in a league of their own when it comes to a dirty bathroom. Easily the most disgusting bathroom I have ever been in. The floor was literally one giant puddle and I felt like I was going to get a disease just walking in there. Also, beware of pick pocketers. The place is soooo packed you can barely move.
author: Steven H.

description: This place is awesome for old school and new school hip hop. Most of the time crowded. But what can you do its popular. At least check it out.
author: Jay S.

description:
Gotta love the mission and while it may not be my favorite area it is fun none the less. I am on a neverending search in San Francisco for the best hip hop club or bar and I had been suggested this place a few times. 

I have to admit the music was pretty great and I did appreciate the consistency of the dj we had on a Friday night. The music ranged from old school hip hop from the 90's to some of the current hits of today without the constant EDM interruption that I am used to in SF clubs. 

A 5 dollar cover will get you in which is cheap as a guy in this city. There weren't a ton of people there when I went but I could see this place getting crowded and sweaty quickly. It was really cool to see people genuinely having fun in a place. Most clubs and bars people seem like they hate being out and are usually staring agrily at people while they drink. 

Here people got on the dance floor and jumped around which was great to see. 
The biggest issue though is that dance floor. That is just too small for any functional dancing. They do embrace it there but its just too tight a space to really enjoy it for me. Some people like being that close to others and constantly banging into each other but I passed on that. 

Eventually we left around 11:30 to check out other bars in the mission as this place didn't hold our attention for too long. 

If you are into the dive bar feel and want to dance i recommend it. No club vibes here and no long lines and ridiculous cover charges and girls might actually not get hit on every two minutes here. Just not my favorite.
author: Nick R.

description:
Was in San Francisco for a birthday outing and was dining in the area. We were all looking for a bar to hangout at and passed by double Dutch. The music caught my attention as I passed by because they were playing 90's hip hop and Rnb. 

In we went and it had very cool decor that brought back my childhood memories. The boom boxes on the wall, the cassette tapes, and vinyl made it such a fun place.

I'm not in the city too often, but if I want a place to hangout; this is the place
author: Huong N.

description:
Meh, the music was weird this night. The DJ stopped in the middle of bohemian rhapsody right when it hit 150am or so. literally. right in the middle of the song right before the huge singing part. and we all thought it was a joke, that he'd at least finish it, but naaaaa. They just wanted to kick everyone out.

Nice people tho, cool place, awesome wall deco.
author: Kaitlyn E.

description:
Den of thieves. Great music, cool spot, but don't go there unless you want to get robbed.

This past weekend, FOR THE SECOND TIME, I had my cell phone stolen out of my purse while on the dance floor at Double Dutch. The first time was around 4 years ago and I deliberately wore something much more secure this time - a zippered bag, right on my hip - but in the crush of the dance floor I still didn't notice someone unzipping my bag and removing my phone.

Lest you think I'm careless with my phones: in the 15 years I have been using cell phones, in which I have carried them all over the world traveling, the ONLY times I have had any phone stolen was these two times at Double Dutch! And after telling my friends about this I discovered that many of them have been robbed or nearly robbed at DD, as well. The management, when I went to ask about my phone, admitted that it happens a lot there.

And of course I realize that the management isn't to blame for this. But they don't have a coat check so they're not doing anything to make the theft that goes on there harder to pull off.

Such a shame because Double Dutch is one of the most fun places to go dancing in the Mission. The DJs are always solid, the drinks are reasonably priced and the bartenders are really nice. But I'll never be going there again.
author: Allison B.

description:
Get ready to sweat out all the alcohol you're drinking. It was a random Tuesday and bff Rona R. and I decided to drive up to SF from LA. After dinner at Cha Cha Cha we weren't ready to hit the sack yet so Yelp led us to this spot, which wasn't all too bad. The dj was playing 90's hip hop and the dance floor was PACKED. 

I think they need to work on the ventilation up in there because I was sweating like a beast, and boy can I sweat when I dance. Hmmmm, I guess if you see me on the dance floor it'd be a good idea to stay at least 3 feet away from my sweaty self. Once we left the place and stepped outside it felt like one of those York Peppermint patty commercials when they bit into the patty and all a sudden there's a nice chill in the air, ahhhh.....
author: Liz M.

description: I love this place it really means a lot to be somewhere where there is real music I am over and sick of the edm it really causes massive headaches.  I feel bad for the people that got their things stolen, buta rule of thumb always have your shit on you and make sure to turn your purse the opposite way in a crowded place.  My only complaint I wish the venue was bigger
author: Ja l.

description:
My friends and I are from LA. We stopped in here on Christmas eve night. Darcy was a great bartender we had a lot of fun.

Beware of the restroom. It blends into wall.
author: Tan W.

description:
Met a couple of friends here for a drink. I absolutely fell in love with the decor. There's only 2 bathrooms in the back, but it works. I came when it wasn't too crowded yet so it was perfect for all of us to just relax and chill.

Afterwards, we all left to check out some of the other bars, but we all came back here because it was the one we all liked the most. Good job double dutch!
author: Erish M.

description:
Not my scene at all.  Music was Top 40 from what I can remember.  

Drinks were cheap, but not cheap enough for me to want to come back.  

When we walked in, the bouncers were warning the girls about watching their purses because they'd been having problems about people reaching into purses.  I'm always pretty careful about holding onto my shit, but it was just a little humorous that they had to warn everyone.

The group of people here were definitely kind of strange... not quite a dive bar, a lot of younger people, but a lot of older people as well.  I thought it was kind of dirty, so I didn't want to venture too far into the back.  Ended up hanging out near the entrance for the 45 minutes I was there because I felt a bit uncomfortable.

The best part about the place was the bartender.  She was a sweetheart and incredibly attentive.

Let's be honest... I'm never coming back though.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Crossed arms...legs spread wide...dark shades...B-Boy stance....Yes!!! This spot is bumpin!! The DJ on Saturday night was tight and he had the nerve to play my JAM Can't stop the rain Jay, Rakim and Biggie....nearly lost my eva loving mind.

This is a young spot I am too old BUT no one stared at me or even cared (all the old hip-hop heads like myself get an outfit from forever 21 and wear loads of eyeliner...worked for me : 0 ) If you want a small cozy spot with good good good music/DJ hit them up on Saturday night, drink heavily and tip the bartenders they will pour you some good ones all night long.
author: Joi M.

description:
The phrase "Double Dutch" reminds me of when life was much simpler, when my decisions could be solved with ennie mennie minnie moe and when the only thing I had to worry about was who I was going to exchange my snack with during recess time. Those days are long gone, but a trip to Double Dutch definitely took me on a trip down memory lane.   

Double Dutch normally isn't my scene as I prefer to go to more upscale lounges and places less crowded, however, it was the most FUN I've had in a LONG, LONG, LONG time.

On Friday, 6.3.11, my friends and I arrived a little after 11 PM. Parking in the area is HORRIBLE, so definitely carpool or take a cab. Double Dutch was packed and there was a line to get in. 

Walking into Double Dutch was totally nostalgic, from the graffiti painted walls, the wall stacked with of old boom boxes, B-boy pics and retro kicks on display to the Double Dutch Lite-Brite sign.  It brought back some embarrassing yet fond memories like being caught by my mom while lip-syncing Madonna's "Like a Virgin" with my crop top, neon colored leggings and my teased bangs cemented with bottles of Aquaspray. Ahhh, those were the days. 

Although Double Dutch is small, narrow, and divey with just one bar, 3 booths and small dance floor it surely doesn't lack personality. The friendly bartenders made drinks that packed a big punch. It normally takes me about 6 shots to get a good buzz, but 3 Goose Tonics ($7 each) had me BUZZIN'!

The crowd was diverse, fun, and lively. It was like a melting pot of SF; you have your Marina Elites, SoMa Hipsters, Thugs and Asian Bookworms/Wanna-Be Gangstas/Fobs which was a welcome change from the typical Asian scene I'm use to where people huddle around in their cliques, camera whoring it with their double peace signs. 

The thing that I absolutely LOVE about Double Dutch is the CRACKIN' MUSIC!!! The DJ was spinning Hip Hop and Throwbacks with some Top 40s thrown in the mix. My feet were killing me (as usual) but the music was so good it got me on the dance floor; well, actually my friends may have had something to do with it.    

Lately, I've been bored at clubs/lounges and end up wanting to leave even before last call. However, when the lights turned on at 1:45 AM, I was actually bummed it was almost time to go. 

OTHER THINGS TO NOTE:
*No Cover
*No Dress code
*$20 Min for CC
*One dingy bathroom each for ladies and men
*LADIES: Beware of Creepers: Some guy massaged my head as I was trying to walk through the dance floor. Dude, we're not at a rave!
*The bouncer is a power-tripping douche. Mr. X, Double Dutch is a bar not XS.
*If you go out for fresh air or for a smoke, you will have to wait in line again.

Cheap, Strong Drinks, Great Music and Fun Crowd...what else more can a girl ask for? Ok, maybe to resign from adulthood and a chance to turn back time...
author: Cherylynn N.

description: The reason why I am writing this review has nothing to do with the atmosphere or the bar itself, but with the bartender. In fact, when I arrived at the bar I thought it was really cool and authentic. He was Caucasian, bald with tattoos, fit, and around his mid-thirties. This man had a vendetta against me from the moment I walked into the bar. It was Wednesday, May 31st, 2017, and I was in San Francisco. He was rude to me from the beginning when I simply asked what beers were on tap because there was no draft list and I was having trouble seeing the handles! After receiving my drink from the mean bartender, I asked to close out my tab. He informed me that there was a $14 minimum when two minutes beforehand he had told my friend who was with me that there was a $12 minimum. I would like to add that I was 100 percent sober when arriving at the bar and throughout the evening because he was purposefully not serving me. His attitude towards me was that terrible that even my friends around me were astounded as to why he was acting that way with me and not them. After closing out my tab and walking away from the bar, he flicked me off with both fingers. I decided that I was going to leave after I finished my red stripe beer because he was making me feel so uncomfortable. After some time, I decided to go outside for a smoke with a friend of mine. When I started to proceed towards the door where I was going to put my FULL red stripe that I had just purchased on the ledge by the door, he grabbed me from behind with both hands, gripped onto my arms aggressively, took the beer out of my hands, and poured it all out into the trashcan. I was extremely frightened and startled, asked him, "Excuse me, OUCH! Is there some sort of problem here?" He told me to "get the fuck out of my bar and to not come back." Even minutes after leaving the bar and standing outside, I could still feel his intense grip on my arms stinging and started to cry in front of my friends who knew how he had been treating me the entire time. I should have gone straight to the manager after this incident, but I was way too frightened to go back inside; afraid that he would put his hands on me again and that this time it would be worse. If anything, I should be refunded for the drink that he fully poured out for no reason and the manager of this bar should fully explain to me why a man so rude and violent is working at this establishment. Not only was I not causing any disruption, but I was nothing but kind to the people of the establishment. It is extremely unsettling that a bartender who is in the service industry dealing with customers day and night is treating an innocent, harmless, and sober guest this way.
author: Kelly K.

description:
So I've been going to DD for years,  and although I love the music here , it is not a safe space.  I was drugged here in March of 2012 by a stranger, and was sexually assaulted by the person who drugged me a few blocks away. After that terrible experience I stopped coming , unless I was with my partner or with close friends. I was here last night and what I saw on the dance floor was almost a repeat of what happened to me,  only this time it was another girl.  With her eyes barely opened , she was sandwiched by two males, as they literally had her way with her. Everyone, even the bus boy witnessed it and looked the other way.  I alerted the guy who takes the cover at the door and left.  

Today I check my bank account and despite making a single transaction with my card, for 24$, and keeping my tab closed,  DD decided to put a $224 charge on my card. When you call , they don't take phone calls nor will they return your call if you leave a vm.  

stay away!
author: Mel P.

description: This bar was recommended to me by a friend so I was excited to check it out. However, the second I got there the bouncer was extremely rude... he turned to his colleague (who I don't think was even an employee of the bar) and made an extremely disrespectful comment about my friend and I, right in front of our faces! Needless to say, I was turned off right away. Once we got inside the place was uncomfortably packed. Our bartender was friendly but my friend ordered a beer and we quickly realized that her cup was leaking! Had to grab a water cup to pour it into. I do not recommend going here, ever. There are so many better bars on 16th street... don't waste your time and money here!
author: Lauren T.

description:
Super strong drinks = the last thing I remember of my NYE night was walking out of Double Dutch and forcing the bouncer to give me a stamp and saying I'll be back (I never made it back...)

My group walked in around 10 and no cover, woohoo! The dance floor is tiny, but it didn't really matter because the hip hop music was fun and kept everyone moving. 

If you are bar hopping in the mission area, Double Dutch makes a great spot to grab a drink and get down on the (tiny) dance floor.
author: Kristie F.

description:
"That was a great night".... is something you will never hear me say after a night out at Double Dutch.

To be fair, I've heard Double Dutch can be fun during the week, when they don't charge cover and it isn't as crowded, but I've only been on the weekends, and it doesn't bode well.

The problem with Double Dutch is that is seems to have suffered some hipster identify crisis. Though it has many of the characteristics of a good dive bar (and I do love a good dive), it has somehow shied away from the dive bar aesthetic and become trapped in the hipster purgatory between dive bar and club. Instead of embracing its somewhat small, dingy space and providing good, cheap drinks, and good music, they've tried to class up the decor with hipstery 80's memorabilia, and a packed dance floor with mediocre music.

Don't be fooled by the cover charge for guys and the occasional attractive lady standing outside; this place is still a sausage-fest (again, the cover charge puts this place out of dive bar territory, and makes it feel pretentious, but it obviously hasn't improved the bar's aesthetic or turned it into a fun club- its just somewhere in the middle). Double Dutch is packed to the brim on weekends (again, mostly with bros), to the point where there's very little standing room, let alone space to let loose and dance. Getting to the bar is difficult at best, and the staff obviously work hard to deal with the crowd, but the wait for a drink is inevitably long.

I suppose Double Dutch isn't terrible, but its just not that great either. Personally, I think its neither a comfortable place to spend time, nor a fun place to have a raging night out, which means its just not worth the cover charge, or my time.
author: Zameer A.

description: The bouncer at this place is kinda on a power trip.  This is the second time I've been here and he's the kinda person who wants people to bow down to his every request.  We didn't go in tonight because he was asserting his authority too much to the point where my guests didn't want to continue to comply and degrade themselves.  Sooo... I can say it's fun inside if you have the patience to tolerate the bs outside.... but the old guy with the grey hair outside is kinda iffy... The kinda person you have to walk on egg shells around.
author: Shari b.

description:
My kind of spot, not pretentious and just chill!! 

Come wearing your favorite dope sneakers and be ready for some hip hop beats.  The kind you don't hear on the radio and you can just nod your head to.

I used to could....double dutch that is!! We would double dutch in the school yard and on our block.  Singing all the songs and tag team in.  I wonder if I still got it?
author: Earlene C.

description:
I went here for the first time about a month ago. And I have some good things to list about this place and some maybe kinda cons.

Pros:
-FUN FUN FUN music (think old school hip hop/R&B jams/90's/and just plain dancy music)
-Dancefloor is pretty great, just try to stay away from the tumblers (those people that stagger as they dance cause they clearly haven't learned how to drink socially....still....)
-Good for big groups
-Younger crowd 
-DANCING ALL NIGHT
-Reasonably priced drinks

Cons:
-Maybe I came on the wrong night but the guys were not that cute (some were kinda ghetto fab ish if you are into that) but if you are going with your ladies to have a fun ladies night this will not matter.
-Persistent men, I mean seriously DO YOU NOT GET A HINT?!?
-That tumbler again who may or may not have spilled his drink on the floor and now it's all wet and slippery
-Can get crowded on a Friday or Saturday night

Other than that I had a pretty good time I would say.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
A friend and I were out bar hopping and she wanted to find a bar she could dance in so we stopped here.

I've been to Double Dutch once before for the same friend's birthday outing. That night, it was extremely packed to the point where we couldn't move. Opposite problem this time. Not enough people were around to make it really comfortable to dance around. Way too much open space.

We danced anyway. Music was okay. They had a DJ that played a lot of old school songs. I think that's the gimmick of the place. Old school hip hop scene. But some of those songs weren't really good for dancing. More for nostalgic purposes.

Cool place but probably won't go back on a Thursday night ever again. Weekends seem better.
author: Sofia R.

description: Best place in the Mission for fun hip hop spins. Along with today's hip hop/r&b, they include 80s but mostly 90s hip hop joints. It's a small place similar to Beauty Bar in the Mission. $5 cover charge. Drinks are fairly priced nothing special.
author: Oscar A.

description: Inside was really cool but the front door guy with the glasses was an asshole. We didn't get stamped was what the door man had said so he wouldn't let us back inside even though he had just talked to us when we were inside an hour later.  He claimed we had snuck inside and we didn't. We had payed way more in drinks than his shitty $5 charge he wanted and it was also my gf birthday on Halloween!!! We got our stamp to prove we had been  inside. By this time the doorman then questioned our age and asked for our IDs. He kicked us out for "arguing back." We are planning to speak with management about this heavy set doorman with glasses.
author: James V.

description:
This was a cool spot to grab a couple drinks at. Finding parking around this area on a Friday night was def. not cracking. We got 3 AMFS and 1 moscule mule for $44. That is pretty decent I guess? I came with the mentality of dropping $200 on drinks but $44 is fine. lol. They played a hip hop and that consists of Get Low by Lil Jon. They need to upgrade their music. Minus one star for the bathroom. That ish is gross.... But Its a bar, you can't expect much with all these drunk people running in and out. 

After you get wasted, go outside and there is a hot dog lady who cooks some bomb a$$ hot dogs with onions and bell peppers for $5. Great way to end your night at the Double Dutch.
author: Mila L.

description: I emailed the manager Noah a few days in advance to see if we could reserve a table for a friend's birthday. He was responsive and super helpful and reserved a spot for us no problem. We had such a blast!! We wanted to go somewhere chill, with great music where we could just drink and dance the night away and that's exactly what we did. The best part about Double Dutch is that it's nothing fancy... just a dance floor with great music and drinks. It's not pretentious or intimidating. My only suggestion for Yelpers is to get there early to claim a spot on the dance floor or bar. Like most SF bars, it's not a big space and can get understandably crowded. Thanks for a great time DD! Can't wait to go back!
author: Mel C.

description:
Great music and awesome decor! The bartender also made me a really great cocktail when a friend asked for a cocktail recommendation. It got pretty busy around 8ish on a Friday. I would most likely come back if I was in the area. 

Not that I expect much, but the bathroom was eek! Totally smelled like piss and we popped in way before it got busy. That says something.
author: Kayla S.

description: This place was off the hook!!! First time here tonight, and brought my comp from Kansas City here and he loved it as well....prices were right and atmosphere was awesome!!
author: Raul D.

description: Awesome place with great mix of throw WAY back and throw little back music. The mix good cocktails for cheap too. You don't find spots like this in the city.
author: Khalid N.

description:
RUDE, overpriced, crowded, and all around scummy. 

While the music was great (90s hip hop), the dance floor was overly crowded with an absurd dude:girl ratio -extreme sausage fest.  The bathrooms were repulsive, tiny, and soaked in urine.  To make matters worse, the drinks were overpriced and watered down.  Luckily, I was drunk enough that this was mildly bearable.  

The customer service.. now THAT was unbearable. After watching the hormonal bartender argue with several random customers, I was 'greeted' by the angriest bouncer-woman I had ever encountered.  She was rude, tired, pissed off, and ready too snap.  Before I could get more than 3 words out, she began screaming about how tired she was of people and sloppily stomped off into the bar full of piss and vinegar.  Each employee I encountered that night clearly hated their job, people, and all around life. Hard to have a good time when surrounded by a bunch worn out snobs. 

Definitely would NEVER go back.
author: Sydney M.

description:
This is a dirty pisshole of a bar filled with piece of shit hipster bar tenders that suck ass at their job. The bar is a mess and covered in sticky liquid, and if you ask them to wipe their bar up, they get all pissed off about it. 

Approach the front door. "5 dollar cover." "What's the event?" "No event, five bucks to get in. Ok, fine, here's five bucks. Walk in, the place smells like piss, the bathroom are filthy, the music is terrible, and the staff have their heads jammed up their tight assholes. 

Don't go to this place, ever.
author: erich s.

description:
Dear Based Trap God: Thank you. 

Oh, Double Dutch. The history we have can only be remembered by the bartenders, bathroom stalls and the big speaker in the back corner. Granted this is not my favorite place to be (ever) I only come here for the music on Sunday's. Any other day it's dead or overly crowded with poorly dressed men and women who can't dance and spill their adios' on you. 

Come in on a Sunday night - Walk in and turn up. Sometimes it's not that easy!! I've had several types of black-outs here:

1. TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot) - leave.

2. Fight a meth head, TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot) - leave.

3. Pretend to be a lesbian, TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot)TRAP(shot) - leave.

4. And hands down, my grandest black-out to date occurred here after The Do-Over this summer. HOLY FUCK!!!!!!!!!! LMAO. It went like this: Blunt(shot)TRAP(shot)Molly and repeat -_- Point is I fell asleep in the bathroom and lost my cellphone, wallet and keys. The bartender was so sweet and patient. I was a raging bitch, I don't know how I got home but I woke up in my bed fully dressed and accessorized, laying on a pile of  Dorito chip crumbs. 

A couple days later (after regrouping from embarrassment) I showed up at DD right when they opened and the bartender was happy to see me lol. After all the drama, he was glad I was alive and had all my belongings ^_^
He told me how it went down and we had a good laugh about it. So, I highly recommend this place. 

Do as I say, not as I do, kids. 


xo,

Trap or Die.
author: Lydia L.

description: Really diggin the 80's hip hop euphoric decor. Crowd was pretty scarce for a Thursday though.
author: David C.

description:
I would say about a 3.5

Went here for my friend's bday, had a great time. Drinks were cheap, music was good, place was packed! Loved the boombox wall decor. This place definitely has the old school hip hop vibe with a little bit of the modern mainstream thrown in. Loved the chill atmosphere, my friends and I def had a great time.
author: Elaine N.

description:
I wanted to rewrite my review, as i wrote it in a veey upset state. 

The decor and set up is pretty cool, pretty good music, very over crowded (not sure if it is that was regularly, or if it was because it was halloween). Overall great place, nice people, but the bouncer was a true jerk. I have never been treated so rudely in my life.

 It was halloween, my birthday, and i had waited in line with some friends. The bouncer was hitting on my friend as we come through. After being there for over an hour my boyfriend and I step out for air. Upon attempting to reenter, the bouncer asks for our stamps (after having seen us come out earlier). We never got stamps for whatever reason. I ask the people in line if I came from inside, they agree. He says I snuck in, (which, first of all, means he isn't paying attention as bouncer). He asks the stamp person if he recognizes us;  the stamp person agrees we waited and paid, so he stamps us. When we attempt to come in, he stops us and forces us to show him our ids. As we hand them to him, I let him know that it is my birthday and I've been in there over an hour. He says I have an attitude and may not enter ON MY BIRTHDAY After being in there for over an hour maybe 2. He tries to kick us out, I let him know my I cannot leave without my card, which annoys him more. 

The security pulls me aside and checks on me. He even apologizes, gets my card for me, and apologizes again as I'm leaving. 

As far as I'm concerned, a bouncer should be able to easily located your id, not stare at it trying to figure it out. If you are so concerned about your ego, maybe get better at your job. If I snuck in with a group of people in a place with only one door, that means you suck at your job. Kicking someone out. Who never did anything wrong and followed all the rules, on their birthday and making them cry Is disrespectful. Even the rest of the staff felt bad. He's on a power trip and needs to be checked.
author: Victoria D.

description:
I loved the old school boom box, 
The crowd was lively,
The dance floor tiny,
With a bathroom full of lyrics on the wall.

Pro: 
*Diverse crowd.
*Cool beats.
*Boom box decorative.

Cons:
*Pricey drinks.
*Small dance floor.
*One stall.

Came here on a Sunday night, You're welcome.
author: Juana S.

description: My iPhone 6s was stolen off me within 5 mins of walking in. I had it in my hand, put it my purse and then it was gone. Management wasn't helpful at all. Based on other reviews this is pretty common. Go at your own risk.
author: Priya R.

description: Place was live! Good music good drinks but it gets packed, real packed. The decorations were cool. Old school cassettes as wall paper. The vide was good no dress code so a great place to kick back at.
author: William M.

description:
Visiting from LA. 

Pros: 
1) We got a great area by the bar -- made meeting people and getting drinks easy. 
2) Good mixed drinks, decent beer on tap. 
3) Nice eclectic music mix of 80s, 90s, and today's stuff. Great energy on the dance floor. 

Cons: 
1) Sooo many dudes - even with a stupid $5 cover.
2) Too crowded to really dance, it was more like rubbing up against sweaty bodies all night (there is usually more bad than good than this judging by con #1). 
3) Long bathroom lines. 


Overall the place seemed a bit overrated and I was disappointed in a $5 cover for the place the size of my room.
author: Ryan V.

description:
This was my joint back when the fellas from Mag-7 would run their monthly partys there. 5 stars for repping hip hop without the BS.

For a review about what NOT to do with a hip hop concept, see my review on F6ix: http://www.yelp.com/biz/f6ix-san-diego#hrid:CW_GJhH8sco_M6WFok0--w
author: Charles B.

description: great place, nice small venue, amazing drinks, and wonderful music. Mixed crowd and friendly people. Its in the mission and if you don't like this venue you can walk down the street to other bars.
author: Kia S.

description:
I've given this place a couple of tries, but I don't think I'll come back here. It's usually too packed to dance, the bathrooms are dirty, the drinks are pricey, there's a cover charge to get in.

The one good thing about the place is the music, but the good music does not trump all the other cons listed above. Sorry Double Dutch.
author: Ren N.

description:
I had been here 2 years ago to finish off my birthday evening and we had a blast. On Friday, August 10th 2012 -- not so much. First off, $5 cover for the guys in our group of friends -- odd, but we'll let it slide. We get in, get some drinks, start dancing. It was probably less than 10 minutes when a fight broke out right in front of us in the middle of the dance floor. The music slowly faded but the fight continued -- where the hell was security? It took forever and by the time they arrived, it was 1 giant black dude and 1 midget Mexican bar-back/busser. The ruckus continued as security could not keep things under control and were having a hard time escorting the guys out -- not to mention, another fight seemed to be breaking out, or the previous fight was expanding to a larger group.

Somewhere in the mix, my friend shouted that her wallet had just been stolen -- I asked her if she was sure and she explained she felt someone reach into her purse and quickly snatch it. She said he was heading out the door so I chased after him. Wouldn't you know it, security stopped me halfway telling me to back up -- I believe they thought I was trying to fight with the men being kicked out from the brawl. I explained succinctly that my friend's wallet had just been stolen and the thief was heading out the front door at that very moment -- his response? "IT HAPPENS." I demanded he move out of my way, screaming at him to, "KICK ME OUT, I WANT TO LEAVE, THROW ME OUT" -- finally he obliged but by the time I got out there, my friend said she could no longer see the man who stole her wallet. 

The security guard/bouncer and I got into it after that. I blamed him for lack of proper security -- I mean for hell's sake, I told him a crime was taking place inside the club he's supposed to help keep safe and instead of chasing after the thief or AT LEAST letting me thru to deal with it myself, he threw his arms up in the air and basically said, TOUGH SHIT. All he could keep doing is pointing to the sign posted outside of the club that said something along the lines of, "PICK-POCKETTING HAPPENS HERE FREQUENTLY" -- basically, you're at your own risk here. I didn't see the sign going in but if you don't see it, hopefully you see this review. Stay away. I believe 2 more fights spilled into the sidewalk/streets right after this -- one involving a girl getting hit in the head with a bottle and police showing up. Deuces, Double Dutch.
author: Jonny A.

description:
Dance Dance baby! One of my favorite hip hop clubs in the mission. I love coming out to the mission when I  don't want to go through the fuss of getting all dolled up for the clubs. You can roll in wearing a pair of flats, and some jeans without feeling terribly under dressed.

The basics:
Door: no cover - door guy is really chill, show your ID and you're in and I've never seen too long of a line unless the line is caused by my group of friends.
Bar: relatively easy to get a drink even when it's crowded. The drinks are more pricey than Skylark down the street $8-10, but fine. 
Sitting: good luck - tables are always packed
Dance floor: Small and crowded, but still have your chance to boogy - just beware of elbows and hair whipping back and forth
Bathroom - hidden in the back of the dance floor - if you can find the bouncer in the back - you have found the hidden bathroom. 
Crowd: Creeper alert high - best club moment ever: two asian guys come up to my group of girlfriends and go "any of you ladies single? come on you! you gotta be single let's dance" - we all look down and continue to dance and they still are single and ready to mingle. * face palm*
author: Christine B.

description: The bouncer was an asshole. The place was basically empty. Not worth it. All of us got in except one girl who had a copy of her passport and he didn't let her in. Understood but regardless we watched him let in a bunch of his "friends" without Id. Regardless we went in, Had a look and decided our money was better spent elsewhere.
author: Alina H.

description: The DJ is ONNNNNNN - but it's too crowded to get low, so for me it's a no go. The dancefloor is jam packed and you feel everyone's sweaty body parts. Super disappointed.
author: Regina D.

description:
I don't go out often, but on the rare occasion that I do, I end up here. I love the 80's themed decor, casual ambiance, & sweaty dance floor.

Go get down with your bad self.
author: Briana F.

description:
It looks like all the other Mission bars: long, narrow, and dark (no innuendo suggested). There's a lot of old school 90's hip hop throwback like the wall made of stereos, graffiti'd bathroom walls, and the pictures of people double dutching. (Think Fresh Prince of Bel-Air). They play pretty good hip hop music. It's mostly the stuff on the radio mixed in with some older tunes. 

The plus: No cover + in/out privledges. The drinks are ok priced. Good music if you like hip hop.

The downside is that it gets really crowded. I came here on a Friday night and by midnight or so, it was so jam packed that you could barely move on the dance floor.
author: Caroline C.

description:
I've came here twice, and this place is one of those places you want to go to on their off nights. When it's crowded, it's packed - like fire hazard packed. The music is old and funky, and my childhood was relived many times. Fun decor. Cover was $5 (on a Saturday).

When it's not packed, it's a great place to dance. When it is, it's a nice place to get shoved around.
author: Jason S.

description:
I use to LOVE going to this place. I still go once in a while, but more reluctant. 

First off, they started charging cover on weekends, at least the times I recently went. Seriously?! Don't sell out!!!! Even on nights when it's not THAT packed, they still will charge you. 

The thing I love about this place is the inside decor. The wall is lined with old school radios, pretty cool. The music is awesome too! They play more old school hip-hop with a mix of current hip-hop. Love the mix! I think because of this though, it gets waaaay crowded. It will get 10 degrees hotter when you get to the back were everyone is dancing. Drinks are well priced. It's a fun place to go to hang out with friends and let loose.

The bathroom is gross. Don't go there unless you absolutely have to! There's only one female stall and it gets really disgusting.

There can be some shady, creepy guys there too. I was with a bunch of friends and this random guy kept taking pictures of us, with FLASH! Then we came up to us and asked if he could take a picture of us. After we said no and mentioned how inappropriate that was he says "It's okay. No one will see these." REALLY?! And he still wouldn't stop until we told him no multiple times. But things like these, you can't really avoid... it's going to happen somewhere!
author: Jessica Y.

description: So we went on Thursday night and it wasn't super busy but it was definitely pretty gross, I wanted to take a picture of the bathroom to post on here but I couldn't stay in there long enough to do it. There was water and Piss all over the floor there's no toilet seat covers or mirror and it was obvious that it hadn't been cleaned in a long time. The music was okay except anytime the DJ intervened and then he would put on a horrible like horn sound and it was just like I was back at a junior high dance. The drinks were okay but definitely overpriced, if you're already in the mission I would say I guess it's fine to go to since there's no cover charge, But Don't make it your destination for the night!
author: Genevieve R.

description: I thought this place was going to be a little bit bitter for some reason. I came her a couple months ago, the wall of boom boxes were pretty cool. Other than that meh...dance floor was super small and crowded.
author: Rosallie B.

description:
My friend brought me here on a Saturday night and I found it to be primo people watching property. The mix is something to behold. The best were the hipsters "dancing" to rap music. We had a few good laughs at their expense with some other patrons.

People were friendly and pretty good about stepping aside as you tried to navigate through the crowded area. We chit chatted with some handsome guys and joked around with some really nice girls.

We dug the blacklight dancefloor, the sneakers hanging from the ceiling and the boomboxes lining the walls. That's kind of where the charm ended though. We were brought back to reality when we had to hand over $8 plus tip for two Coronas.
author: Ericka A.

description: This is an amazing bar! I loved that I could enjoy Hip Hop music while I had my drinks. I also loved the bartenders here they were all very nice and very helpful in helping me choose great drinks! i absolutely fell in love with this bar! :)
author: Paulina E.

description:
I came to Double Dutch when the city was away at Burning Man. 

Double Dutch is fun. Deco is hip & cool. People are friendly there are ready to have a good time. Dance floor is small.  

No cover. Unless you're a man. $5.
author: Rosa L.

description:
If you like it when bouncers yell at you to "Shut the fuck up" when asking a question...this is your spot!

I've head a lot of great things about this place so when a group of friends decided to go out for a night of dancing at Double Dutch I was excited however, I didn't even make it past the doorway before deciding to leave ASAP!!

After some friends and I got into the club, we noticed that our non-US friend  was having a difficult time getting in. We are aware that sometimes this happens at certain clubs so instead of spending more time trying to convince the guy checking IDs to let her in, I suggested to my friends that we leave and find someplace else to  dance since it was getting late. Well this didn't sit too well with ID guy who first proceeded to enter our private conversation and then tell my friend that it was MY FAULT that we weren't getting in. I was confused by his absurd statement because first off I don't work there - I don't make decisions about who gets in, he does and secondly, he had already let me and few other friends in minutes earlier so I'm pretty sure I wasn't the reason for my friend getting denied. 

But it gets worst because he then proceeded to yell at me as I was walking away that I had a "big mouth." I was baffled.  My friends were completely baffled as well. I almost have to wonder if he was intoxicated because I've heard an employee say anything like that to me. I also have to wonder if he would have still said that to me if we were with guys (my guess is probably not). He was trying to intimate me which unfortunately for him, did not work.  As we started to walk away, he called my friend back and said he'd let us in. I think it's because people in line started to talk about what was going on....bad business 101.  

I could  really care less about going in at that point however my friends really wanted to dance so I approached the ID guy to ask what the situation was. I proceeded to ask if were cool but before I could finish my sentence he literally yelled at me to "shut the fuck up." Once again, he was trying to intimidate me and more thank likely feel like a big man since he had already made a huge fool of himself throughout this whole ordeal. I was baffled for the last time and walked away immediately. So in the end, 7 people who were willing to spend a decent amount of money on a good night out just left. 

The owner or hiring manager of this place should be made aware that they are losing businesses because of this guy (small black guy checking IDs on the night of July 19th). I won't return and I won't  recommend this place to others because of the poor and dare I say it shitty service I received before stepping foot inside. 

Dance elsewhere.
author: Emily F.

description:
The Saturday of a 3 day weekend at the club should mean, party people dressed to the T's drinking top shelf in VIP lounges and getting crazy on the dance floor either listening to club bangers or the illest of legit hip hop by regionally or nationally known DJ's that tour with artists. Somehow this concept is lost here. People were dressed to the OG's, drinking their usuals, but there is no lounge, no booths, no bottle service and the bathroom is completely blocked by the dance floor. The bartenders were dressed the way I'd expect, but white T's and white sole's had me on edge and hand on my edc pocket knife. There were some women that got the point of going out and danced into the morning with me without a care in the world, doing what I want Vegas style on the dance floor

The bar is nicely decorated and perfectly crowded, stocked with 5-6 deep of the most popular bottles that were going quick. It reminds me of Analog Bar in San Diego from the boom boxes on the wall except in that Analog uses vinyl sleeves. Space is the issue in that groups cannot post up, but rather sit just stand around and block everyone else from roaming and having a good time, but at the same time it's not packed. 

Prices were a bit more than  I expected as 6 Jaeger bombs were $48, 7 Irish Car bombs were $59.50. if it wasn't for the saving grace of the few ladies I met with that have partied the way I'm used to this was a 3 star bar, but not a club despite the fact that a DJ, top shelf drinks, well dressed bar tenders are more indicative of clubs I rate it a 4 star bar or 3 star club.
author: Walter M.

description: I went there a couple of Saturdays ago for a quick drink with friends after dinner. I had some moderately fond memories of this bar from when I was in my twenties. That all changed when a hipster bartender in a camo shirt with a Sideshow Bob haircut embarked on a rude and incoherent diatribe about how he "keeps it real" by not making cocktails. I get it guy, I was dumb to think, even if just for a moment, that Double Dutch is anything other than a divey novelty bar. I bit my tongue and restrained myself from jumping over the bar. I won't be back.
author: Bobby N.

description:
It's been a while (queue Britney music).

LHEEET ME BREAK THE ICE!

Okay, there is a very low possibility of a Brit-Brit song popping up on the INCREDIBLY DANCEABLE playlists on the turntables at this sweet little "dive-bar-that-could," but you'll definitely be fighting for some space while everyone busts a move in this feel-good place. 

Wall full of 80's stereos? CHECK. 

sick beats? CH-CHECK.

Nostalgia? You know it! 

I didn't pay for my drink here, but it was pretty good. Henderson + Ginger. 

Space is limited, so get there early and bring your down-to-Earth, nitty-gritty, lets-have-some-fun friends and shred the dance floor!

'Mmurica!
author: Shanika H.

description: the only reason i like this place is because they play some good hip hop. I like the wall of boombox's too. sometimes it can get crazy crowded in there and hella hot. overall its a good spot if you like to dance and dontmind the crowdedness!
author: Christian D.

description: I'm from Miami where I thought we had an attitude problem, but that fat bouncer takes the cake. My friend was smoking a cigarette OUTSIDE far from him and he already singled him out telling him he doesn't want him smoking "near him". Yeah, but he sure can eat. He should probably worry more about his clogged arteries. Also, this is a hip hop club. Why was there even a problem with my friend wearing a hat?! I've never heard of that being against the dress code. Anyway my friend took it off and put out his cigarette but it shouldn't have been such a big deal. When I went to find my other friend who got her phone stolen he wouldn't let me back inside... he was shoving everyone off because some douche got into a fight OUTSIDE the bar. How is that my problem?! I never leave a bad review you all can check, but this was the worst service ever and he's just the bouncer. The music was good, but not worth it to have someone make you go through so much just to get inside. He's clearly on a power trip for no reason whatsoever. I get that people generally drunk and annoying trying to get in but we were sober and pretty respectful if you ask me considering the stank attitude we got from him. Looking at the other reviews it doesn't look like this is his first time people had a bad experience from this place BECAUSE of the bouncer.
author: Ariza G.

description:
Filthy in the greatest way.  One those nights where I don't wanna get too dressed up and just have some cheap drinks and dance with my friends, this is the go-to spot. 

Old and new school hip hop. Ahh, the music here. If you're sick of house music or songs about Mick Jagger, this is the oasis in the middle of the desert.  Yes, the dance floor is small and the bathroom is grimey.  But its a damn good time and if you're not feeling it, the location is perfect for bar hopping!
author: Siobhan T.

description: The drinks here are SUPER strong and the music is great. This place gets pretty packed, so come early. Also, pee before you leave your house because the bathrooms are hidden on the dance floor, it makes going to pee a journey.
author: Cathy S.

description: Crowed but alot of chicks lol. One of the few bars in the mission you don't have to worrie about people trying to fight you at.
author: Alonzo T.

description:
This place has a great low-key vibe. 

No cover? Check.

The ability to order a drink without pushing and shoving? Check.

Ample seating with a view of the crowd? Check.

The downside is that I came on a Friday night, and the DJ was playing an old school hip-hop set that was uninspired and erratic. The song sequence was something like this: current Top 40. Late 90's Top 40. 80's Top 40. One-hit wonder. Hella old. Random underground rap that no one has ever heard of. Repeat.

One star off for all the posers and lames crowding the dance floor who are NOT there to dance. If you just want to hold your drink all night and talk with your friends, move to the front of the bar or stay on the wall. Leave the small dance area to those of us who came to jump around!
author: Maurice R.

description:
If you want to drop it low on the floor, bend over and shake it all night. Hit up Double Dutch!!!
 Go ready to have a good time and dance. If you're in 'complaining' mode and expect to have the whole dance floor to yourself and couple friends. If you are gonna complain all night about how its so crowded and hot and sweaty. Do not even bother going- this joint would rather not have you. In conclusion I would recommend it for dancing and having fun. I had a blast, didnt even notice twas a wrap at 1:45ish.
author: DeesQue N.

description:
I might be a little biased b/c DD is among my first dance joints in SF, but I dig it! 

First of all it's free entry. What do you expect? Well I'll tell you. Definitely not the amazing wall composed of ghetto blasters, the crazy pair of lighted shoes descended above the dance floor, the hot bartenders and of course the music!! Although the music is best characterized by rap mixed with hip hop, they played some 80s and 90s remixes on Saturday night that "It got me going" like I was in Paris. However, I'd say it's more of pit stop rather than a night to spend the entire night. If you haven't been, definitely stop by. The wall of ghetto blasters is worth the experience. Felt like I was in Step up 3. One thing is for sure. The club couldn't handle me.
author: Bobby N.

description:
"And when they do the double dutch, that's them dancing..."  --Liz Phair

Yes. I just quoted Liz Phair. Why? I have no fucking idea. What does it have to do with this bar? Nothing at all. 

So what has me skipping double-high for the Double Dutch down in the Mission? Let me see:

1. Nice and mellow crowd (on a Sunday night)
2. DJ perched in a booth surrounded by vintage boom boxes dropping cut after cut from deep in the crates of any self-respecting hip-hop connoisseur. 
3. Pint of Trumer and a shot of Jameson for $5 (on a Sunday night)
4. Wallpaper featuring classic scenes of poppin', lockin', and other variations of the Electric Boogaloo (fer realz)
5. Utter lack of hipster pretension in a neighborhood ensconced in... well.. hipster pretension (remember, I visited on a Sunday night, it could very well be overly-hipster-infested on other nights)
6. Did I mention the DJ?

So yeah. A groovin' soundtrack to reasonably priced drinks in a dirty atmosphere and the crowd doesn't suck? 

Will you open a location in Portland, please?
author: Don B.

description:
I've been to Double Dutch a few times, and have never paid a cover.  Every time i've been here it's been really crowded which means it's also very hot.  I usually don't have enough room to dance and end up really sweaty.  I wish there was more cooling near the dance floor.

Drinks are well made, I feel like they're either perfect or on the heavy side with the liquor.  I haven't come on a night that I really liked the DJ, I prefer the music at Blondie's Bar and No Grill which is 16th and Valencia.  I normally hit up both clubs in the same night when I am out in this area.

Whenever I come to Double Dutch I end up making new friends for the night, and I don't consider myself that talkative a person.  

I give the place 3 stars because it can be fun, but it's hard to walk around, especially if you're trying to get back to the bar for another drink.
author: Dawn H.

description: I'm a huge fan of the design of this bar! The wall of boom boxes glued on the wall, the tasteful graffiti near the dance floor and well just the whole place is so clean and well put together....it's really nice! On Wednesday night, it wasn't very crowded at all. The music was alright, but they weren't rockin any 80s music on their supposed "Wednesdays 80s night." This was a no-go for us-- we had to keep on moving... the dj wasn't playing music to dance to, just more like background noise for their lounge... ;-( But I still like the place.. I would go back again, maybe on a different night of the week.
author: Cassandra E.

description: Really cool spot. They always play old school hip hop and their walls are decorated with stereos and records. It has a very chill club-like atmosphere and there's a dance floor!
author: Gladys M.

description:
I understand that the Double-D is a pretty well known dance spot in the Mission, but I've yet to saunter in on a weekend to shake my tail feather. I did, however, swing by earlier this afternoon... and I had a fabulous time.

First off, like most of the bars in the Mission, it's dog friendly. I think it's so cool that a majority of the dives in the 'hood let your dog hang with you while you get your swerve on. My pup is seemingly always the worst behaved animal in bars like these, but it's a new world for him and we're hoping he learns to summmmmmmma donnnnnnnn-NA sooner than later... but I digress.

I'm going go out on a limb and say that Sunday and Monday are the two best nights to experience the 'Dutch. All day, they offer a pint of Trumer Pilsner and a shot of Jameson for $5. Really breathe that in and let it resonate for a moment, as $5 is a complete steal for two high quality products like Trumer and Jameson. Insane! 

They also do Wii bowling tournaments on Sunday/Monday, and everyone who sits down at the bar gets a complimentary glass of crunchy Cheetos. What's not to love?

The bathrooms are pretty gross if you're a girl looking to reliever herself, but I'm assuming it's got something do with the NY, graffiti, hip-hop scene they have going on. I might be completely wrong, but I have a feeling the tagging was intentional to give it a gritty feel, so maybe it's not as bad as it might seem. Speaking of the hip-hop, break dancing vibe, you gotta scope out the walls and check out the old school boom boxes that line the interior. Either these guys scored big time on EBAY, or they raided Grandmaster Flash's storage facility, because these vintage stereos are dope! So jealous!

I'd love to see what happens to this place on a busy Friday or Saturday night. From other reviews I've read, it looks as though the weekend warriors spoil any chance of a good time, but that's yet to be experienced. Wish me luck!
author: Ruggy J.

description: Ok spot but the bouncers were jerks. Friend left her credit card but they don't answer their phone so you have to go there and hope it's there. Also the bathrooms are disgusting so ladies beware.
author: Michelle G.

description:
I use to like this spot, been here many times, but last time I was here the bar tender was an asshole to a friend. She was meddling with a pourer and the dude snatched it from her hand and gave her lip. All he had to do was ask her to put it down she would have. 

The wait made it worse. We had been waiting for a drink for more than twenty minutes. When I tried to make her feel better I muttered ''a-hole'' but not loud and given he had ignored us for over 20 minutes I didn't think he'd heard. Another 15 mins went by he finally approached another friend who was going to order for me when I was about to tell her what I wanted he said ''you called me an asshole I'm not serving you'' needless to say we left and went over to Kilowatt where the bartenders are not assholes, but granted the music is sometimes better at DD.

BTW, I don't often give 1 star reviews. The experience has to be really bad to get a 1 star from me.
author: M R.

description:
I very rarely write a review but felt this was important to me. So me and a group of friends arrive at this place on a Saturday night sometime between 1 am and 1:15.  There was a 5 dollar cover to get in.  Half the group was split on going in because of the cover (not because of the 5 but because of how little time we would have actually spent in there).  I was willing to pay it however my ride home wasn't. Fine OK at that point in the night a ride home is more important then going to another bar especially when you have to wake up early the next morning (which I didn't anyways).  So I step out of line to leave with a couple other people and next thing I know the bouncer is yelling at me where am I going why am I leaving.  Excuse me Mr bouncer who looked like he was actually just pocketing the cover himself that is none of your business and not professional at all.  Because of that I'm never going to actually come to this place and actually check out the inside of it.

Only reason I gave two instead of one is that from the outside I did enjoy hearing the music that was actually being played.
author: Ricky K.

description:
I like to shake my booty. 
Went to Double Dutch on a Saturday night and danced my pants off to old school hip hop. The wall o boom boxes is awesome. 
I generally don't encourage public urination, however, Double Dutch's bathroom may convince the germaphobic that a nearby ally is a good option. Luckily, there's plenty of good times to be had outside the loo, and a seemingly fun crowd.
author: Rae S.

description:
My mood has to be very specific to hit up Double Dutch, and by mood I mean hammered and wanting to get my dance on. Actually I'm in that "mood" a lot which is probably why this is a spot of mine when I'm out to play in the Mission. 

The DD pulls me in when the clock draws near 1AM. Likely a moderate amount of Fernet is in my system and I can hear faint hip hop in the recesses of my mind, like a siren's song saying "Jusssttiiiiinnnn, come shake your asssssss... drink more tooooooo...." 

Sure, it is smaller and packed every damn weekend, but the vibe reminds me of house parties from back in the day so maybe it's nostalgia. 100 degrees, music thumping, and wall to wall people letting loose and dancing until the lights pop on. I know I dig this spot because every time those obnoxious lights do come on I'm genuinely bummed that it's over.

I can't comment on the booze selection because frankly I'm toasted and focusing 100% of my remaining brain power on dancing with some fine ladies. If you're in the Mission and want to shake it, come on down. Be prepared for a line after midnight though, evidently I'm not the only one trying to bust a move at Double Dutch.
author: Justin N.

description:
This place is AWESOME!!! Especially to be in San Francisco, sorry I'm from Oakland and I may be hating since I don't need to leave my city to have FUN ;).. Anyways I was surprised that the music was hella good, they played straight old skool hip hop. And some sh*t I hadn't heard in a while. So kudos for that. The decor is super hip hop, b-boy style. The walls have boom box and cassette deck wallpaper. I felt as if I was partying in Brooklyn because of the ambiance. 

Well, why not five-stars ok the bathroom's are located inconveniently by the dance floor.. Bummer! Also, the drinks are a bit pricey. But hands down whenever I'm back in the city I'll make my way to the Double Dutch.
author: Danielle B.

description: Probably you should avoid going here. Two murders, one in June 2012, another in July 2013.
author: C. H.

description:
Went here on a Friday night went with a couple of my friends. The place is really tiny and gets pretty jam packed, but the music they play is great! Especially If you love to dance to hip hop music. It's amazing how small the dance floor is and yet people can manage to crowd the spot and have a good time! Regardless of the tiny size, this place just  has a great atmosphere...  minus a couple of creepers that come around like vultures O_o. 

A couple of things that prevent me from giving this place 5 stars is the $20 minimum for credit card use, so bring cash if you're not planning to get more than one drink!
author: Clementine D.

description:
If you're into that SOUTHERNPLAYALISTICCADILLACMUZIK you must FIND A WAY to STEP INTO A WORLD like dub d's because THIS IS HOW  WE CHILL FROM 93 TIL. 

It's SUMMERTIME IN THE SFC so IT AIN'T HARD TO TELL this place does get crowded with MS FAT BOOTY's, BONITA APPLEBUM's and the occasional KNUCKLEHEADZ on Fri/Sat nights. If you end up going on those nights you may have to REGULATE and THROW THEM BOWS.

I usually prefer the Thursday SCENARIO to LAY LOW for some of that ELECTRIC RELAXATION. It's ok if you LEFT YOUR WALLET IN EL SEGUNDO because they take other forms of C.R.E.A.M. 

If you have no idea what I'm talking about then you might as well stay at home. I like double d's.
author: Earl G.

description:
I love my friends. I love them even more if they laugh at my jokes. It was my friend Erin's birthday, and to be honest I'll follow that girl anywhere, she is that awesome. I even texted her, "I've never done coke but I totally will tonight because it's your birthday". And for those of you who know how adamant I am against doing coke, she is that cool. (Thank God she said I didn't have to)

So when she wanted to go to Double Dutch, I said, BRING IT. It's a relatively small place with an even smaller dance floor, but the bathroom line moves quickly, you can get your drink in a pretty short amount of time (either that or the tequila I pregamed with makes time speed up), and the crowd is a hit or miss in the looks department. 

Of course, only I could get into a situation where half the time I had to make sure I didn't wake up the next morning with "Ship To Dubai" stamped on my ass on my way to a harem. All I have to say about that is a) you won't get my number if you don't recognize the state of Israel and b) THANK GOD for the ring my mother gave me.
author: Jaime L.

description:
Occasion: Night out with friends for Weekender (Oct 2011) 

What I Had: Nothing 

Food Review: We were bar hopping and I didn't get a drink here, but they do have a bar that stretches across most of the length of the venue. 

Service Review: N/A

Venue Review: They have one entire wall on the right-hand side made of old stereos. IT'S AMAZING, and the first songs that popped into my head were naturally "Stereo Hearts" and "Stereo Love." There's a little dance floor in the back but the entire place was completely packed with people everywhere we went, but kind of in a good way because everyone we bumped into was a lot of fun. The hipster crowd here is so much fun, and what us girls loved about this place was everyone was super friendly (like, "OMG, I'm soo sorry I bumped into you, I'm __ btw, where you from?) and there weren't any creepers. The DJ was great as well. He played a lot of throwbacks from like the 90s, and we had a blast screaming the lyrics.  

Overall Impression: This place is legit. Great place to just let your hair down and have a blast with friends.
author: Rachael K.

description:
I've had a good time every time I've been here. I think that's about 3 or four times. It's usually the second or third place I go to when rolling through the Mission. It's got a good, chill vibe. Got Js & stereos decorating the wall, with a little bit of Lite Brite thrown up there. 

Drinks are OK, nothing special. Coronas are $4 each. Like most spots in the Mission, cash is preferred and their $20 minimum for credit cards policy displays that preference. 

Music is my favorite part about this place. You'll hear everything from Drake to Stevie Wonder to "Murder She Wrote" to Jackson 5. The space itself is pretty crowded, so be prepared to swap sweat with other Double Dutchers.
author: Emerald M.

description: Uh-oh getting down @ Double Dutch. It was my first time out in the Mission District. It was a suggestion to go here from a friend of a friend. No cover charge, easy bouncer, potentially short line if you come early enough. Drinks were not too pricey in my book. It's pretty close to a lot of other places on the street, so great location. We got here kind of early, it wasn't dead, but the DJ was playing good music and a good amount of people were dancing. We left after 1 hour and thought we'd try somewhere else because we're bar hoppers (or we think we are). It turns out almost all the places on this street were charging cover. So we actually ended up coming back here, and there was a long line! Luckily we had stamps so we walked right in. The place was even more packed, the music got better, drinks kept coming, and my feet wouldn't stop dancing. Great time at Double Dutch!
author: Darlene B.

description:
My girls and I were looking for a cool night out, we went bar hopping. We came in on a Sunday night 07/26/15 and the music was really good we were really originally having a pretty good time and were planning on coming back. We all started with one drink and during our time there we tried to grab the bartenders attention and he continued to blow us off, a friend of mine finally grabbed his attention and asked the bartender (mid 30's and bald)  for some ice. He said "I don't give out ice by itself", it was unusual to us, so we made our way out the bar when the bartender yelled at us "maybe you should have thought about that before you decided not to tip!" Regardless you get a tip or not you should always treat customers with respect. My friends came back to confirm what he said and he called them both out their names, calling them bitches and just being upright disrespectful. I would NEVER go back to this bar.. EVER.

LEARN TO TREAT PEOPLE WITH RESPECT FOOL!!!
author: Alexandra C.

description:
Although Double Dutch is one of the better bars in the Mission, particularly on 16th St., my thoughts are exactly, "Meh, I've experienced better." 

You'll never be disappointed by the music if you're into hip hop, R&B and Bay slaps, but the times I've been here, I've been turned off by the wait and the lack of space to move around. On some nights, you'll have to wait up to 20 minutes to walk into the door, and once you do, you'll be standing there the whole night due to the crowding issue. I refrain from venturing in any deeper than I have to, just  because I enjoy some breathing room. The "dance floor" is located in the back, but really, on busy nights, you'll only have enough space to stand and maybe sway back and forth or wiggle your arms a little -- not much dancing though. And whoever decided to put the bathrooms in the back..not very smart engineering. The time you can spend dancing is instead spent moving out of people's way as they walk to and from the very small and dirty restrooms. Word to the wise..get stamped and use the bathroom across the street at Elixir. 

Generally speaking, their drinks are between $6-10 for mixed drinks or shots. Dress code is casual and there is no cover. Double Dutch is cool for groups of up to 8 people and not recommended for birthdays if you're planning on inviting a ton of friends. Your guests will end up standing in line for 30 minutes as you watch them from inside.
author: Camille B.

description: It was too crowded so we were forced to stand near the door. And then the cops shut the place down for a reason unknown to us... and they wouldn't even let me use the bathroom before kicking us out. ROARRRRR!!
author: Vivian H.

description:
I had a really fun night here, granted my review of this place will be a bit skewed because I was hella drunk.

First off, no cover, whoo!!! The dance floor is pretty small, it's a bit crowded, and it's reallyyy hard to find a place to sit.  That being said, it just had a nice feel.  I docked off one star because they over-charged us on drinks.  It was 10 dollars per drink!  My friends thought that it was because it was a white male bartender and my Asian boyfriend ordered--and they don't' like Asians.  I hope that's not the case.  I didn't' really think that much of it, and I quite happily enjoyed my drink.  I can't remember what I got, but it was sweet and tasted like a jolly rancher.  I can't remember what everybody else got.  I can't remember what else I drank that night either...

There wasn't too many people dancing at first, but as the night wore on, and as everybody got drunker, there were enough people just having fun/dancing kind of everywhere-since the dance floor is really small.

I made a bet with my boyfriend that he couldn't pick up a white girl at the bar.  He had to get her number or dance with her.  So that was the entertainment of the night, for me at least.  He won :P and his friend bought everybody another round of drinks.  

So yes,  pretty fun bar.  I like bars with dance floors.
author: Aly A.

description:
Love the boombox decor in this place but I hate the crowd issue. Every time I come here, it feels like I'm in a sardine can. 

The crowd is usually chill. The drinks are moderately priced and the music is usually pretty good. 

I also hate the fact that I never have reception in this place but I blame AT&T for that little issue. 

I have never experienced a cover charge here, so I don't know that they have any. 

The seating is limited, so arrive early and expect people or VULTURES to be circling your seat as you get up to grab a drink. It's best to have someone cover your seat or leave a jacket if you trust people, personally I trust no one. 

Prices: Fair
Crowd Control: Bad
Music: Good
Environment: OK
author: Augusto L.

description:
So crowded its infuriating.  Certain pockets of the dance floor get so smelly its almost debilitating.  

$20 min for card. 

Bouncer's nice though.
author: Christine B.

description:
had friends meet us here for my bachelorette party.  it's a great venue in that it's in the heart of the mission, plays great hip-hop and is close to late night eats. Only downsize is that it gets packed rather quickly and the bathroom is all the way at the bar of the venue -- so you have to squeeze yourself through the dancefloor to use the bathroom.

I like the side benches and tables and the bartender poured great drinks. Not ideal if you want to have a conversation you can hear with your friends -- or if you don't like people brushing against you all night.  But if you're into that, then this is your place!
author: Carmel U.

description: Drinks okay, bartender with a kangol had a chip on his shoulder and was throwing hella shade. Music is great though.
author: Orlando D.

description:
A whole lotta booty shakin' goes down here, ninedeez hip hop style.  =) 

Maybe this wasn't the best place to catch up with a friend since it was super loud and busy, but I'm glad we went anyway.  "Double Dutch" in Lite Brite, vintage hip-hop items, and beer selection together brought a smile to my face.
author: David O.

description: Hip hop crowd. they played some good 90s hiphop last time i was there, which is one of my favorites, so it was a good time. Started getting full towards later and people were dancing and having a good time. Drinks are super cheap. Not bad.
author: C A.

description:
Chill spot.

Enjoyed the music and the drinks were priced well.
I've only been here twice and both times were pretty fun.

The first time I came here it was super crowded and they played good hip-hop music and the second time, it wasn't as crowded but they played a mix of different kinds of music.

This place is small but pretty typical for a SF bar.

No cover = a happy Criselle.
author: Criselle O.

description:
Chill place to come hang with friends. Although, I must say the crowd is kinda ehh... It ranges from super ghetto to a much much older crowd. Even though everyone was completely different from whom I would usually surround myself with, if you go with the right people it is still fun. 

Some friends were visiting from SoCal so my girls and I took them here. We came here because we didn't have time to go home and get glammed up. This place doesn't require super dressy attire, it is really casual. The music is mainly hip hop with a mix of old school and today's songs. The dance floor is pretty small, but everyone is dancing throughout this little bar anyway. The drinks are pretty strong! Decently priced. 

For guys it's $5 cover and girls FREE (yay we're lucky). There are booths around so you could sit and chill and chit chat it up! I like how they have a bunch of stereos hanging around their walls. Makes the place look really urban-y.
author: Katrina T.

description: I dig the music and the painting of the shoes on the wall because i own like 3 pairs of them.
author: Misha T.

description:
Decor is filled with  boom boxes, sneakers, and retro style photography.  Definitely an ode to old-school hip hop!  A crew of 20 girls rolled through after having dinner at Andalu on a Saturday night. Casual setting with a few booths and a long lengthy bar. Drinks were made right.  By 11:30pm, it started to get crowded.

It's a place to chill and appreciate GOOD beats filled with unpretentious people. Don't hate the DJ - he was a little sloppy that night.  At least he played "OLD-SKOOL."

If you're into the "urban-esque" feel, hang out in the Mission.
author: Diana M.

description: Another of my go-to theme bars. This place has an amazing collection of boom boxes that line the walls, and they frequently have breakdancing playing on their TVs. I especially love the back room with tons of graffiti on the walls.
author: Amber K.

description: Found this lil spot on yelp while on vacation.  Really good oldschool hip hop and r&b, good drinks, and bartenders were very quick to refill drinks!
author: Amanda G.

description:
Been here several times and the music on Friday nights is the best. The after work/happy hour crowd leave around 9ish and it seems empty until about 11ish when the DJ is spinning and the crowd arrives. Crazy busy after that. Barely any room to walk. Small dance floor, modestly priced drinks, no fancy drinks, nice staff, 2 unisex restrooms, hip hop decor, mixed crowd, $20 minimum on credit card purchases.

Fun place with a group, ratio of men to women feels like 5 to 1. Not a hen party!!! Hooray!
author: Amelia M.

description:
I'm a lovin the double D's! Another bar a long 16th street to stop at and it's definitely worth your time if you're into hip-hop. I think this place is a little cooler than Skylark, it's a little bigger, a little "cleaner", also has good music, but I love double dutch for it's boom boxes a long the side wall and the kicks hanging from up top. Got that old school vibe when you're inside!!

Average prices for drinks, can get really crowded, usually a line to get in (no cover charge).
author: Arnold N.

description: Although the drinks and music is good, this place has a serious theft problem. My wife's wallet and phone were snatched out of her purse while she was dancing. The thieves were deliberate and precise in what they took and the bar was unable to help us in any way. Keep a tight grip on your valuables if you're planning on partying here.
author: C P.

description: Awesome service and fun environment. It got pretty crowded, but it was seriously such a fun time. My group of friends ended up leaving to go to blondes (worst decision since it was a horrible place to be at) but now I know for the future that I will be staying here if I am back in this area. Thank you for the awesome time.
author: Juliet M.

description:
Let's rate this place on 3 things, which is how many stars it gets:

1) The music - Awesome. Great hip-hop mixed with new hits. The DJ was talented and passionate about what he spun/.

2) The layout - standard college bar except with one little issue. The bathrooms are literally on the dance floor and there is no clear pathway. It's tough to dance here because of all the interruptions and the complete lack of order to the flow of traffic.

3) Drinks - I get it, we're in SF and drinks are expensive. But well shots shouldn't be seven bucks in a place this small and dirty.
