Overall, I love this place to go dancing - if I could actually get some room to dance.
author: Z K.

description:
One star for the bouncer that was working the night of 5/13. 

We entered the bar, realized it was way too full of USF students, and promptly decided to exit.  Upon leaving, he stopped us and accused us of "leaving with bottles."  Lets think about this.  In a club that is packed like a box of sewer rats, how would three girls run up, steal bottles from the bar, and leave without getting caught.  Oh please.  He literally was looking for any excuse to harass us, staring at us, and trying to go through our purses again (once was enough jerk).  

The cake topper was this: as we turned to leave, he grabbed my friend by her purse strap and yanked her back.  

This is where I say "ohhhh HELLLLL NO."

Don't you ever touch a woman, let alone someone that frequents your work establishment that way, ever.  We will NEVER come back, and hope that your dumb ass is fired.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
I love this place for the fact that Mimi, a dog, is a regular here. How cool is that!!!  (only a dog lover would understand)

Plus, Chris, the bartender there is awesome. My gf left her heart in SF because of you: hi Chris.
author: Chanel V.

description:
Are you a hipster? Do you love to dance? Do you love unique throwback and hip music? If so, this place is for you!

The place is very hip and you'll rarely find tourists here. The crowd is young, underground, and looks like SF locals here. 

The only thing is, the place is TINY. You'll get sweaty fast and you'll be thrown around if you're on the dance floor. 

Other than that, if you're looking for hip place to drop by, hear some good beats, this is it.

What kind of music do they play? The good kind.
author: Erin M.

description:
Awwww don't hate. Short line, no cover, cheap beer, dance floor, coat/bag pegs so you can get your groove on unencumbered.

Good place to make bad decisions.
author: Amanda F.

description:
Four stars for being one of the fun, reliable places in the Mission to go dancing and hear some music you've, you know, heard before.

One star for the fact that the bouncers seem to take into no account how many hundreds of people are already inside milling about and letting in the huge line outside. Last saturday I almost had a panic attack. it was disgusting and you couldn't even move, and I've been to these types of places before. I wish there was a little more crowd control and PLEASE PAY FOR SOME AIR IN THERE. I was sweating for like two hours afterwards because my body couldn't cool itself off after sitting in that sauna with 4,595,201 of my closest friends.

Still three stars because it's much more tolerable than some of the other mission spots.

Actually, it's like 2.5 stars. 20 dollar credit card minimum? Come on people.
author: Courtney A.

description:
Can pass as a boom box 80s 90s rap hip hop museum. The best part is that, it is dance ready!

You know how there are those songs that just bring you back to certain places in your memories - this is what you can get here.
author: Kali F.

description:
First time coming here, I'd expect this place to be like any other bar in the mission/valencia area: full of hippy-ish fixie riders coming here for a drink (not that i have anything against them except for those who ride under the influence afterwards - def BUI status).

the line was about 10 deep aroudn 1130pm, looked VERY crowded inside, which it was. and no cover charge = hellurrrr (madea)

went inside, sweating hotness, a very diverse crowd, and suprising to see some cute girls there, way suprised.

Music - def poppin. DJ's were slappin some good stuff from top 40 to old school hip hop, etc. 

way in the back is a "dance floor" where you just see people grindin while you see people chillin in these "booths" with tables sippin on some drinks, and then theres the stupid group of girls that like to hang out in front of the bar even after they have gotten their drinks. ok so ... you got your drink, now GTFO  so other people can get drunk. (btw, i'm glad i elbowed you, you wouldnt move when i was grabbin my round of drinks) GOT HEEEM.


$8 for a kamikaze shot at a bar? I've paid half that amount at other bars and they were even bigger shots. 

I'll consider coming here again, but damn it can be ghetto.
author: Kenny L.

description:
Yo, homey, it's a hip hop ho down at Double Dutch!

It's also 90 degrees outside, and a temperature that rivals the temperature on the sun inside.  I had heard that it gets HOT up in there, so I dressed like a hooker.  

Great peeps, decent moves.  The drinks were strong, but for a margarita I expected it to be in a taller glass.  As I was also sampling other people's drinks (sorry about the cooties, kids), I noticed that theirs were strong as well.

I'll probably come back, just because I can.  Wouldn't be a bad place for a birthday party, as there is plenty of seating AND a dance floor.

AND they have Simon.
author: Pam S.

description:
This place is absolutely awful, don't even consider it. First off, they selectively enforce their no hats dress code. I was grabbed by the doorman and yelled at to remove my hat.  I looked around and there was a bunch of people wearing hats.  I asked why they were able to wear it and the only response I got was take off your hat or leave.

The place is filthy and smells.  The glasses I got my drink in was dirty and the bar was sopping wet.  I don't think they wiped it down the entire night.

The crowd was even worse.  I witnessed 2 fights and the bouncer just watched for a few minutes before getting involved.  Very rude and angry people.
author: J E.

description:
Dance. Drink. Someone bumps into you. Spill a little of your drink. Guys wink at you. Repeat.

*Takes CC, w/ $20 min.*
author: Shira O.

description: Came here on a Friday night. $5 cover? You're joking me right? Was it to see the collection of old boom boxes on the wall? Must be, because I don't see any other real reason to be charging so much for entry. The place was almost completely empty with just a few people dancing. I'm hoping I came here on a bad night, but a popular place doesn't have bad nights. I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt though, because I can see the potential for a happening spot.
author: Phan H.

description: Left my card in the bar, they lost it and took no responsibility whatsoever. Mega-FAIL.
author: Athanasios E.

description:
Our server was super attentive.  I told her I thought the old-fashioned I ordered was too strong and gave it to my BF instead and had his drink.  She came back and gave me another one on the house that had more fruit.  how sweet!

Apparently she said there was some mix up with the beers, and gave us one on the house as well.

She took care of us.  Wish I asked her for her name so everyone can look out for her.
author: Z C.

description: The old black fat bouncer outside was a fucking asshole. My friends and I came in with a smile on our face and a positive attitude and he was immediately confrontational and wanting to argue and belittle us . Dj was fine but the bouncer fucked up the night.
author: Max H.

description:
So there I was, half asleep because of a long day, hoody on, when I was stirred by an ice cube tumbling down my chest after being chucked at me? 

No, it didn't hurt (totally harmless, please don't admonish them), and when I took my hood off to see who had perpetrated such an action, I was pleasantly surprised by a gorgeous bartender smiling back at me. A few drinks later, and I actually had enough courage/energy from my "nap" and booze to try my c-walk on the dance floor until the place closed.
author: Jason C.

description: Came here as our last bar hopping stop on a Friday night. I absolutely loved it, pretty crowded but in a good way. Good hip hop music too! One wall was covered in old school radios which was really cool. BUT! Huge issue - the bathroom was the most ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING bar bathroom I have ever been in. Had the bathroom not been such a disaster this place would've got 5/5 stars.
author: Nikki K.

description:
This place has a retro 80's type theme but with a modern touch. There are OG boomboxes stacked all around the dj booth and retro toys and gadgets neatly decorated above the bottles section. Very nostalgic to see some of those things like the lite-brite and the old school nikes.

Best thing about this place is the music if you grew up in the 80's or 90's or just love old school music. The dj knows how to get the crowd up on their feet and the place moving. 

Drinks are mediocre but you go here more for the atmosphere than anything.
author: Patrick L.

description:
This bar is a nice place. 

I came here with no expectations. It was Sunday night and I with two out-of-towners. Considering it was a Sunday night, it wasn't empty. What ruined it for me was my friends getting yelled at by the bartender. I admit they shouldn't have stood on the couches to take pictures however thats not enough grounds to be yelling at our tourist.

Other than that, nice place, good vibe and good music!
author: Noel R.

description: Music slappppps!!! Nice location and the bartenders are hella cool.
author: Chris W.

description:
I used to DJ here every first Friday for about a year. I REEEAALLLY miss this place.

Bartenders here have always been pretty attentive, nice, and fast (even when I'm not DJ'ing). Drinks are cheap.

No cover, and the music is always solid. One of the few spots on 16th where you can hear some good throwback party music and maybe some current tunes - but this place really sticks to its 'old school hip hop' aesthetic. Probably the best place for dancing.

I've heard many people say, "Double Dutch... isn't it kinda ghetto over there?" Get-over yourself. Double Dutch is always double fun.

I do think the 'renovations' they've done are kinda cheesy. Batman style cheesy - "Wham!", "Pow", "Coolbeans!". It was more classy (for lack of a better word) when everything wasn't tagged with ugly neon spray paint. -.5

The bathrooms are your standard San Francisco Mission District grossness; I've been more sensitive to it because the DJ booth is right next to them. -.5
author: Harold C.

description:
I've been to Double Dutch a handful of times now and I've had a blast each time.

The last time I was here was for the Yelp DJ Night and it was going off! After working late that night, my partner in crime and I came in and had a few drinks, danced, mingled with the ladies, and even came close to getting into a brawl! Yeah, lots of mixing it up that night!

They often play 80s hip-hop which is quite fine with me. When they threw in the Digital Underground the last time, I got to bust out some old moves of my own!

Granted, I've never come here on the weekend so I can't say much about that crowd. But like I said, after a half dozen visits or so, I've always had a great time here. Hence, the 5 stars.
author: Art O.

description:
Went on a random Thursday night before grabbing dinner at Andalu.  Not sure if it was "happy hour" but all drinks were $5 I think.  I was stoked that they  had Wydner's pear cider... got a good buzz on before having dinner.

It was pretty empty when we went there, I'd agree with "diverse crowd" but the bartender was friendly and I was a fan of the fact that they had cups of potato chips and pretzels to munch on.
author: Melody T.

description:
Drunken nights always have slightly skewed ratings, because we always choose to remember the best parts of a wild night, rather than dirty bathrooms, sweaty guys (and girls), and tooth-chipping vodka and red-bull induced falls; but I still feel pretty good about giving Double Dutch four stars. 

The sparkling wine from Hidden Vine and the Yelp fizzes from Rye were starting to kick in - when we stumbled, danced, and ran into Double Dutch; hurrying to secure our place at the bar. There weren't a ton of people at Double Dutch when we we BROUGHT IT; but that was probably a good thing; as dancing was what everyone was longing to do anyways. And everyone knows that a real artist needs room to create true work.  And we did.  At least from what I remember.  

All those years spent practicing Synchronized swimming routines in  friend's backyard pools (I'm hoping others can relate on this one), to mirror faced bedroom dance numbers - payed off, as the crazy  Yelp  dance revolution that  booty-shook itself on Double Dutch's dance-floor began to take dazzling form. At least from what I remember. White dressed shimmies, pink striped worms, and top hatted belly moves. We turned that room up to HOT. I'm talking John Krasinski  -Office HOT.

What made the rest of the night so hazy was Double Dutch's great bartender. I waited only seconds MANY a time; before having a vodka and redbull drink in hand . Perfectly balanced too. At least from what I remember.  He was friendly and relaxed, and made it easy to multi-task  - the whole drinking and dancing thing - arduous work. 

I can't say thatf Double Dutch's interior blew me away, but I did enjoy the music, the sultry lighting, and the memories - at least those that I remember.
author: Jessica T.

description: They spun pretty legitimate hip hop.  I"d love to come back and get my dance on but it was a bit of a sausage fest.  Also, the bathroom leaks so the floor was wet.  My buddy was wearing sandals... SUCKER hahahaha
author: Theodore Y.

description:
First, I should admit it: I've had fun at Double Dutch. Kind of in the same way I've had fun watching Hulk Hogan in the little-known flick Santa with Muscles. Occasionally, we used to cap off nights in the Mission with a visit to Double Dutch just for the hilarity of it. There was almost always some sort of disaster to witness. I'm not sure if words can do the place justice. All I can really say is I wouldn't be surprised if a dance-off broke out here. 

You know how some things can be so bad they're good? That was how I originally felt about Double Dutch, but after a few visits, the pendulum has swung back to bad. I had enough of Santa with Muscles after 20 minutes, too.
author: Susan S.

description:
The first thing my friend said to me, when I eventually found him, after squeezing my way through the dense wad of moist and clammy skin between the door and the dance floor was: "I know. But they have two dollar beers." And I looked around, and then I looked back at him, wordlessly, and he said, "Yes, but two dollar beers." I raised an eyebrow, and he said: "Two dollar beers." 

Later on he said, "I am so uncomfortable. It is so hot in here, and ugly people keep touching me."

This is the place you go to when you're already drunk. For emphasis: it is not the place you go to get drunk. Rather, this place is the DMZ between drunk and blackout, and should be visited when strange and tiny men in fedoras seem manly and rugged, like Indiana Jones outpacing a giant rolling ball, and awkward women in too much melty make-up and too little clothing take on a sultry and mysterious mien. Otherwise--and I tell you this from experience--you will pass the bulk of your time sweating, and counting the sneaker-doodles on the walls, and waiting stoically at the bar in order to acquire as many shots as possible, to take the edge off being poked and prodded and stared up at by the improbable number of dudes shorter than me who are just sort of milling around and/or doing the sneaky backdoor grind-up on the five or six women churning viscously on the dancefloor. 

My standard scotch ran me $10 and Don Julio tequila shots were $9 a pop. As I said, unless you are willing to drink endless cans of obscure two dollar beer--which, admittedly, many people were--this is not somewhere you go to get drunk. 

I'm sure Double Dutch can effectively facilitate dancing wildly to old school hip hop, while giggling, and intimately acquainting your buttocks with a stranger's groin or vice versa, but you have to have the right mindset for all of this, and that mindset is "close to complete loss of brain function," which is not something that appeals to the all-new Laura Who Has Shit to Do Tomorrow Morning anymore.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Two dollar beers.
author: Laura T.

description:
Whoa!

What was up with all the wannabe-hipster yuppies there last night? From the snippet of conversation I caught as I walked by a few, it was planned. When anyone suggests coming here, I always make that cringe face because it's usually disgustingly packed. It's a place where you can dance without having to pay a cover. Part of what makes it disgusting is the waves of poo-smell that hit you because the bathrooms are right next to the DJ. Poor guy. The DJs here are pretty good usually. It just sucks to have to leave all the time because of how hot and uncomfortable it gets.

The good thing about last night though is that the majority of yuppies don't dance so the dance floor wasn't jam-packed.
author: May C.

description:
Went here for a CLASH scavenger hunt event on a Friday night. Fridays are probably the best night to go because of the music and atmosphere. Only downfall is that the dance floor gets really cramped after 9pm and also the restroom is located right at the dance floor and lines form which makes it more cramped. Other than that, the drinks are reasonably priced around the time of happy hour and beware of using a credit card because there is a $20 minimum.

A fun, divy, and high energy place to party on a Friday night if your in the mission.
author: Jonas E.

description:
The dance party at Double Dutch is unique in the Mission and the tunes are always bumpin', but lately every time I have ventured it has been too crowded to move.  However, I have had some awesome nights here that were directly correlated with excessive levels of alcohol consumption.  

The drinks are way more expensive than you'd expect, but there isn't any cover.  The staff is super friendly but there usually aren't enough bartenders to efficiently serve the sea of humanity that packs into this place on the weekends.  

Double Dutch definitely has a lot to offer if you are with just a couple of friends, in the mood for a crazy dance party and prepared to get drenched in sweat and beer.  But, if you are with a larger group and have a blood alcohol level of less than .15, Double Dutch probably isn't the best fit.
author: Lauren R.

description:
my friends and i went bar hopping in SF Mission District and this was the first bar we went to.

really small like most of the bars in SF but i liked the old school hip hop look of the place. only downside is the bathroom was almost impossible to find, it looks like a closet.

no cover and well drinks were $6. played good music to dance to, pretty crackin on a saturday night!
author: Christine C.

description:
This was a fun spot!  No cover--the Music was good--played new stuff and old school hip hop--so that was on point!  We even requested some Dancehall Reggae and the DJ played it!!  Loved all the old school boomboxes on the wall !!

Minuses-- Drinks are a bit weak, Very small so be prepared to be pushed and shoved a bit--but it's all good it was still fun!
author: T J.

description: Despite it being a Wednesday, pretty dead and me being birthday inebriated I had a great time. Only because the DJ was off the hook. Im sorry but I get crazy when Im taken back to the 90's. Best years off my life when I didnt have a care in the world. Suddenly I was busting a kid n play on the dance floor. So what if I was the only one dancing. I was transported to a land of old school hip hop, Im lil Kim now, thought you knew. Cant wait to come back, perhaps on a different night when there are more people.
author: Lauren N.

description:
Ok...warning this place gets soooo jammed packed but why the high score? Well, the music of course.  If I came here a little earlier or if there's ever a "dead" day..it'd be perfect.  It's a mixed group of people which is always nice.  Yes a few questionable random folks but it makes for an "interesting" night.  But majority speaking the people here are harmless and frriendly and did I say the music is awesome?! 

DJ was great the whole night flipping from old school to top 40 beats without any awkward transitions.  It was a good time...but we had to leave when I felt like a sardine in the venue. Oy...
author: Kim D.

description:
It's not that I have anything against this place.  I've even had a good time here several times.  But it is way too small.  I mean way way too small.  Walking from the front to the back on a weekend night it what I assume being groped by 30 different people at once is like.  Their drinks are small and over priced. And their bathrooms look like people didn't want to use the toilet, so they just peed on the walls, which really sucks since it is a 3 foot by 3 foot box of inclosed grossness.

This place is fine. Nothing special, crowded, but sometimes when the night is right you can meet a nice pretty lady, or you can have your ass grabbed by a foreign guy as your walking into the bathroom.
author: Meara G.

description:
Love the boom boxes on the wall. Unfortunately, that is about it with Double Dutch.

Too crowded to: order a drink, get from the door to the dance floor, actually dance on the dance floor, use the bathroom or even sit down anywhere. Not to mention the DJ was pretty weak. No talent whatsoever.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Too crowded on weekends to be fun.  Getting to the dance floor in back takes 20 minutes.  10 minutes of squeezing through a stagnant crowd and 10 minutes of waiting to buy a drink to replace the one you spilled.  The bathroom is hard to find and has way too long of a line.
author: M S.

description:
Whoa, this place is steamier than a South American rain forest! As we walked in I looked to my right to find a pair of glasses completely fogged up in a matter of seconds. It's hard to talk to someone when you can't make eye contact :)

We arrived around 11ish and it seemed that with the end of the free beer the masses had an exodus. I guess you know that party is winding down when you see Jessica T haulin' ass outta there. However I was still able to run into a few Yelpers I knew and decided to catch a final drink before calling it a night. 

Holy cow, the drinks are heavy here. I got one loaded ass Rob Roy while the Lemon Drop was declared just as potent. We actually had to dig into the Roxie movie candy supply of Starburts to take the edge off. The place is quite narrow and I could only assume that it was wall to wall post Freeway but since my stomach couldn't hold out any longer I had to go get some food beforehand and took the Fongz's advice to hit up Range since we would have a chance to sneak in on a Wed night. Looked like most that were left were ready to go and Nish had the aura of what the height of the night must have been. Otherwise the place seems pretty mellow and I guess I'll just have to be back the next  time there's a good shindig to see the true potential.
author: Kim N.

description:
The place is chill. I'd rather come here than go to any clubs in San Fran. Great selection of hip hop. Reminds me of NY. Very chill and artistic environment. More minorities which is my shit. Drinks are well-priced. 

My only advice: If you're going to smoke bud on the dance floor, the 4'3 mexican guy with the blue light will grab u and kick you out jazz-from-fresh-prince status. Lol shit happened to me last time. Smh
author: Joe P.

description: Your typical divey bar, but...they play OLD TOP 40 HIP HOP songs and have a dance floor! It's so refreshing, since the clubs nowadays mostly only play EDM, which is harder for me to dance to. $20 minimum to use a credit card and the bathroom is a little sketchy looking in the back. (There are two stalls, but lining up is tough since there is no separation between the dance floor and the doors to the bathroom)
author: Melody L.

description:
I've been here a few times and each time they never disappoint.

The music is always awesome and the dance floor is always fun. I love the decor inside and the feel of the whole place. All my friends have their birthday get togethers here and it's always a good time.

No cover charge is always a plus too.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
WOAH!

The was one of the hottest clusterf*cks I've ever stepped into. Up there with Las Vegas clubs, Amnesia in Ibiza or any rave/concert stands/moshpit I've been in. As soon as I walked in, layers had to come off. Everyone looked like they were having the time of their life though. WILD! What's even weirder, my cranky-ass didn't leave from this bar entirely annoyed or pissed off that I've been elbowed and pushed in a sea of sweaty people for the past 20 minutes, rad. Ladies, this is not the bar you want to bring a big purse too, just bring a wristlet.

A friend and I came to check Double Dutch out on a Friday night and this place was packed. We needed to use the restroom and it seriously took us 10 minutes to traverse through the crowd. We spent more time walking to the line than we did in the line itself. The coed restrooms are way in the back by the dj booth, so good luck. The music was loud and crowd-pleaser songs included Bel Biv Devoe and Michael Jackson.

After deciding our restroom trip was a little too strenuous, as was the line at the bar, we decided to head over to Delirium before last call. Double Dutch, I'll pay you a visit soon, just not at the plateau of occupancy.
author: Chelsea P.

description: My favorite me go-to! Great music! Throwbacks, twerking, and throwbacks! Great GNO spot!
author: Dominique F.

description:
Double Dutch is(was) one of my favorite bars for the past couple years, but I've only been twice this year.  I attested my lack of Double Dutch visits to my disinterest in going out, but after giving Double Dutch one more try last night,  I decided, It's not me, it's you. I loved going to Double Dutch, because of the great music, and the great decor, but now that can't even persuade me to give the rest of the 3 stars that this place deserved 2 years ago.

I took a break from Double Dutch, because of the recent murder that occurred in front of it, but decided last night to give it another try.  First of all, $5 cover for guys??? I was half ok with this because I thought it would weed out the bad seeds.  But I quickly realized that $5 isn't a big enough border between a fun night and violence.  My friends and I went out on the dance floor, and what do you know a fight broke out.  There was fighting then it stopped, fighting again, then stop, fight stop...where was security?  Barely making their way.  As we saw security arriving, my friend screamed that someone just took her wallet.  So my friends and I (boys and girls), tried to chase after the guy. But the security guards ended up stopping us.  They tried to kick out one of my friends who they believed was in the fight, but really was one of the few actually trying to stop it.  Then they got in a really heated argument with another one of my friends who was trying to pass by them to chase after the guy.  When we tried to explain to him that my friends wallet had just got stolen (over his arguing with us), he walked us over to a sign that said "Beware of Pick Pocketers".  We are in the Mission no shit, we gotta watch out.  But when there is a brawl of about 5 people happening in front of you, it's kind of hard to "beware of pick pocketers" when you are trying to make sure you don't get a foot in your face. 

We finally break away/kicked out because the security guard seemed to put their focus on us rather than the massive fight that was happening behind us.  Within 2 minutes of being outside another fight shoots out from the Double Dutch doors.  This time a girl got a bottle to the head.  I'm assuming jealous girlfriends shit.

My one time guaranteed good time bar is now polluted with violence and misdemeanor.  I am officially retiring Double Dutch from my bar repertoire.  It sincerely breaks my heart.  But Double Dutch, it's time for you to get shut down....
author: Jaena S.

description: A friend once told me that Double Dutch was Hipsterville. No idea what that meant until one night when I stumbled in one night. It was on our list of bars to visit for our Mission Pub Crawl. He was right. Double Dutch was filled with Mission hipsters and those who you could tell, did not live in the area (aka me). If you get here early enough you can score a table along the side or grab a seat at the bar. The place got packed fairly quickly, music was loud and bumping awesome hits and the drinks were strong and creative. Place gets packed by 11-midnight. I'd come again but not on a weekend night since the place gets super crowded. No need to shove people!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
A hip hop bar with a really cool wall of old boom boxes along the side that make it perfect for the hip hop décor they're going for. Place was pretty empty, but the DJ had a nice mix of new and old school hip hop, as well as some dance and techno mixed in as the evening got later.

We went on a Wednesday night, and knocked back a few $7 Fernets on the rocks. If the place was a bit more popular, could be a really fun little hangout. But it's always hard to get a vibe in a bar/club when there aren't too many people in there.
author: Collin S.

description:
A couple words to describe this place on a Friday night....

-hot
-sweaty
-lots of people

Needless to say that these may seem like negative words.....they all have one describing word in common:  "CRACKIN"

They play all the old school jams that remind me of middle school and high school.......always a good thing!!!!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
This is another dope spot out on 16th. The thing that immediately catches you is the awesome decor they got going on inside. A lot of throwback stuff that makes you feel like you're walkin on beat street. They come correct with the music at this joint for sure. 

Super crackin on fridays and saturdays. You can't even walk from the bar to the dance floor without gettin felt up on, which may not be a bad thing. haha but it is quite busy at times. The bartenders are super dope. I even got hooked up with a free shot. Actually, that being said, I'm changing this to a 5 star. BOOOOOM!
author: Alvin P.

description: Double Dutch is my JAM!  Every time I party in the Mission I end up here one way or the other.  The DJ is consistently on point and seemingly always playing my favorite hip hop jams.  I'm talkin' Biggie, Tupac, early Jay-z etc.  In a city that is slowly loosing its color, it's refreshing to be in a place where you forget that harsh reality.  The only negative is the small dance floor.  This place gets wayyy too crowded, to the point where you can't bust a move.   Please Double Dutch, buy the place next door so you can have the most bangin' bar in the bay!
author: Meli M.

description:
I left my favorite black cashmere scarf here. 

Must have been a good enough time to sacrifice my favorite one. I never leave anything behind at bars, so I'm kinda sad. 

If you found my black ribbed, soft cashmere scarf....I would very much like it back.
author: Alita M.

description: This place is very cool on the inside. There are "boom  boxes" that are hung up on the wall and its a really cool, funky, and eclectic little atmosphere! You can sit, stand, and even dance! They play great music and have fairly priced drinks as well!
author: Aditi G.

description:
The Mission is a great place to go around bar hopping but don't plan to stay at Double Dutch for too long (especially on a Friday night) because it gets packed to the MAXIMUM. 

The dance floor is even smaller than the size of San Francisco (comparatively) and you'll end up being squished in there like a pack of sardines. The only thing you'll probably end up doing is fist pumping as the air on the top is the only area that has free space.

All in all, this place is great (music is good) other than the crowd issue. Come here for a few drinks and chill for a bit and then be on your merry way out...
author: David W.

description:
I must have gone on an "off" night..it was a Saturday, whatever that tells you.
I did not hear much old school hip-hop, it was typical top 40 being played, which was disappointing to say the least.
I live in Scottsdale, AZ, I had greater expectations visiting Northern Cali, but the music was comparable to the crap I hear down here.

Drinks took forever to get, only because it was SO crowded, with that being said, I ordered once, and when I came back the bartender started making my drink right away.  I applaud that, especially considering how busy it was.  We didn't stick around long, and headed to skylark instead.
author: Ashley B.

description:
Oh Double Dutch...

You are so crowded on the weekend, but we managed to get a table. Your dance floor is tiny and packed, but very, very fun. Your DJs listen to pretty girls who make requests, and your strong drinks helped to improve my sweet dancing skills. 

You make me dance dance dance and drink drink drink. 

You make me squeeze between sweaty bodies and shake my butt.
author: Christy D.

description:
The funnest place to dance, ever. Not too crowded if you go early. no cover. GREAT GREAT music. super casual atmosphere. next to 16th street bart.

My favorite place to dance, bar none.
author: Grilled O.

description: Throwback boombox art. Decent hiphop music some nights.
author: Inigo M.

description: Terrible experience last night! Overcrowded as fuhhhh, first of all. Shoulder to shoulder. My friends phone got stolen. And the fat f*** piece of shit bouncer wouldn't let us back inside to look for it. On top of everything, he told my husband outside to take off his hat and put out his cigarette. No problem. My husband put it out and took off his hat. Inside the bar, we were dancing and he put it back on. (Mind you, it's a raggedy ass hip hop club? You can't wear hats? Y'all too fancy?) One of the bouncers (not the fat one cause he obviously can barely move) came in and PHYSICALLY hit him over the head with a flashlight to take it off. Over a HAT? Are you kidding me? I should sue you. It was just terrible. We went back outside to look for a friend and he yelled at us to get the fuck out of here. Go the fuck home. Do you own the sidewalk? We weren't doing anything. Just WAITING. We weren't even drunk. It was just terrible. Never going back again.
author: Gema O.

description: Wow this place gets packed! Fun atmosphere and decor, would go here again when in the city.
author: Kyra S.

description: Came here a couple times, but this time around (Sunday), I really got to see the bar in its whole entirety.  Typically packed during the weekend.  I love the set up, the boom boxes (old school!!) ahahaha The tennis shoes on the wall.. do not be deceived!! It's just a drawing so don't think you are going to be able to wear it and walk out of the bar with them. LOL. Good touch to the space.. lighting was cool, music was fun to dance to.  2 bathroom stalls, TV, full bar, small dance floor, I think the dj set up is bigger than the dance floor! =X  JK.  To use a card its $20 max.  Again, another little joint to just grab a few drinks and hang out
author: Becky U.

description:
"Hip Hop and you don't stop 
to rock it to the bang bang boogie 
say up jump the boogie, 
to the rhythm of the boogie, the beat 
Let's rock, you don't stop 
Rock the rhythm that'll make your body rock" 

-The Sugar Hill Gang (For those of you who don't know, now you know) 

DOUBLE DUTCH! 

The Vintage 415 guys bring a slice of the old school to the Mission!!!Graffiti, Old School Hip Hop, Bboy summits on the flat screens, old school high tops hanging from the bar! I love this place. I wanted to throw my birthday here one year and buy out the place, bring my own DJ and give every guest gold brass knuckle rings, "LOVE" "HATE" "FIGHT THE POWER!" "FIGHT THE POWERS THAT BE!" 

Old school 80's photos that are back lite adorn the graffiti walls that make Double Dutch. Truly a patronage to the 80's BBoy era!  As Ali G would say, "RESPEKT!"   The DJ booth is made of authentic Old School Boom boxes.  I WISH they would play more 80's hip hop; The music they play doesn't really match the concept. We want to hear Public Enemy, Run DMC, Grand Master Flash, Kurtis Blow, the Fat Boys, Geto Boys.....Bring it BACK! 

The crowd on the weekends are usually a Marina crowd transported into the Mission (tourists), the music is hip hop, but I don't care. This place is an homage to Bboy and the roots of modern day hip hop. 

Brilliant concept bar. 

AND you can scratch on their website! It plays, "Straight Outta Compton" Try it yourself at home, kiddies! 

Wiki wiki wiki wiki!!!! 

http://www.thedoubledutch.com/

"Ain't Nothing Like the Old School"
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PdQHls7hlds
author: Sandy C.

description:
While in the city galavanting around I was able to catch my good ol fellow yelper/buddy Harry aka Facemelter 

(http://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=oTpmi6DjCotg0htLaETemg)
 spinning at double dutch. The decor was super sweet. I loved the dj booth with all the old school boom boxes AND I also loved the "nike show display" on the wall haha. So realistic. The drinks here were made to perfection and it was JAMMED packed. I was very glad I made it out to double dutch, although it was often hard to make your way through the small bar  you were welcomed with sweaty arms and groovin bods. If your ever in the mission you should check this spot out.
author: Valerie G.

description:
I'm so torn about this place.  While it has the best music and feel in the Mission, the bartenders couldn't mix a drink to save their lives.  

Oh well, it's still a cool place to hang out, but I'd get a drink at one of the many other bars before stopping here though.
author: Joe N.

description:
Sometimes when you're already fucked up a $2 can of Olympia can be the best and the worst decision of your life. And as you make that decision, "Mo' Money, Mo' Problems" is playing in the background. 

I can deal with that.

It also smells kinda off here. Like a bar.

Not sure if I can deal with that.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Whenever I come here, the letters H & M come to mind for 3 reasons. One, its in the middle of Hipster Mission. Two, when its cracking in here, everyone is a Hot Mess because its too damn crowded. And three, there's usually one person I see wearing something I bought or at least considered buying from H&M at some point in my life.  

Being a former sneakerhead, Double Dutch immediately brought back a feeling of nostalgia and how much of a hypebeast I was not too long ago. Whenever I look at my black and red lowtop Jordan 1s, I think of the ones hanging over the bear next to the picture of two people in daisy dukes jumping rope. I also look at the very well painted mini mural of a collection of sneakers I wish I owned, from the Jordan 11s to the infrared air max 90s. Any sneakerhead would greatly appreciate this place for its novelty. 

As for the place itself, it gets too crowded in here on a weekend. One minute you're outside taking in the cold San Francisco air with your hoody, and the next minute you walk into the bar and you're sweating like crazy. Hello sickness. The huge crowd is good for the bar, but there's hardly any room to move around. Having no cover and a casual dress code is a huge plus though. 

I can usually count on this place being a go to spot in the Mission when I feel like chillin in the area and not having to pay cover to a venue where some douchebag and a wannabe Asian thug fight over a spilled drink, thus closing the club down early. Then again the diverse crowd in the Mission could call for that too, but like I said, no cover. I also like this place because they make black velvet drafts (champagne on bottom, Guinness on the top) perfectly. 

Cool concept for a bar. No wonder I've been here at least 3 times already.
author: Loren John B.

description: Great music. Cool decor. Good drink. Only downside is it is a bit small.
author: John K.

description: I like this place.  They play great hip-hop and there's no cover.  The crowd is diverse and the bartenders are nice.  The only thing I don't like is that it is so small.  By 11pm it's pretty crowded and hot, so it's difficult to really dance.  Also, the bathrooms are right next to the dance floor, so a long line is usually forming right in the middle, taking up the little space that they have.  I'd still come back though!
author: Jade F.

description:
Gotta love the Mission.
This spot is perfectly placed- no cover, great music, laid back crowd and cheap drinks. 
For NYE, I spent the evening here and brought in 2010 like it should be. Danced till my feet hurt. That's the way it should be.
The Dutch is what us 30 sumins raised on HipHop need to keep us young. Love to the creators!
author: Deliah R.

description:
We decided to hit up the Double Dutch Saturday night after leaving a club in North Beach.  A fav of one of the girls I was with.

There was  a line to get in and the place was shoulder to shoulder with people.  The floors were sticky and the restroom floors were flooded with urine, and it was not from the towels overflowing.  The guy had the most cheesy pick up lines and the girls were dancing with their elbows out!!! 

The place was okay - but not worth getting ready for.  I will not be going back.

Music was good otherwise I would have given it two stars!
author: Sissy T.

description:
[EDITED 2/19/07]

I don't know what happened to this place, but it sure went downhill fast. I went a few weeks ago, and it was just packed to the gills with what I can only describe as B&T folks--and I'm from Berkeley. Anyway, the vibe was far from the chill, hip place I'd been to a few times previously. OK, I know, what should I expect at a Mission bar close to 16th St. But still, it was a pretty cool place just a few months ago. The point is, my girlfriend and I were in and out the door within 20 minutes.

One key problem: NO DJ!! On a Saturday night!! This problem is further compounded by the fact that this place still has one of the most amazing DJ booths in town. Note to the owners: having a DJ, not just a cool DJ booth, is really important for setting a party vibe, even if it's just for background music. Also, you should invest in a better sound system, because what you've got isn't hacking it at all.

The punch line is that I have to downgrade this place severely. Back to searching for a no-cover bar in the Mission to go to before the clubs heat up...

****************************************************

I've been here a couple times now, and I'd say it makes for a nice pre-game spot. As people have mentioned, it has an old-school hip hop theme to it, although you'd be hard-pressed to know that from the clientele. Cool layout, with a nice patio in the back. It is a bit strange that the bathrooms are right off the dance floor, so you have a queue set up right where people are trying to get their groove on.

It has the absolute coolest DJ booth of all time, with the wall of ghetto blasters behind it. Too bad they don't always have a DJ there, like the last time I went there. When the DJ was there, I was totally down with the music, but mostly because I was spotting all the tunes I had on my iPod (cool, I know this one...I know that one too...and that one...and that one!!). I think I was getting on my friends' nerves after a while of that. But I digress...

Drinks were good and reasonably priced (relatively speaking, of course). I liked the crowd, although I wish more people danced (oh well, it's a bar, not a club). Overall, like I said, it's a good stop in your hop around the Mission.
author: Barry E.

description:
So they replaced one trendy bar with another. I like this much better than Cama -- maybe because they've drilled into my demographic. Music I partied to in middle school. But is it filled with people who listen to this with no irony...for whom this is the first time they've heard the music?

Troubling.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Disclaimer: this review may or may not have been done in a buzzed state.

I like this place, where there is no cover, the crowd is mixed (it's like every neighborhood in the City represented!), the drinks were strong, tonight's=Wed's music by DJ Ritoes(sp?) was awesome (brought back memories from the '80s...Young MC, BBD, MJ, Vanilla Ice, etc.). She will be back on Friday night, yo.

The place itself feels intimate but not cramped. There is a large bar and tables & leather sofas, yes plural. The DJ booth is in the back (with at least two dozen old school boomboxes decorating the wall). The dance floor was next to it, and was decent-sized for the venue and there's always people busting a move. The two unisex restrooms are back there too.

Bonus review: the "Not For Tourists 2010 San Francisco Edition & iPhone App Launch Party" (http://www.yelp.com/events/san-francisco-not-for-tourists-2010-san-francisco-edition-and-iphone-app-launch-party) event was awesome. The writer of this booklet/manual greeted every single person at the door, and provided free kegs of beers, and when those ran out - and for people who showed up late - free absinthe cocktails tickets! How cool is that mang? Had the "Transamerica" (Le Tourment Vert absinthe, lemon-lime soda) first and that ish is the ish. Halfway through and was feelin' it. Then, went to get a burrito at Taqueria La Cumbre (http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?q=la+cumbre&userid=09T1oyi6c-9lvyt7gQCD2w) before returning for the raffle drawing. Got a "Cable Car" (absinthe, club soda, cranberry juice) and that ish was really good and seemed easier to drink. Could have had two, no problemo.
author: Peter L.

description:
I am a fan of any place that plays old school hip-hop, sells decently priced drinks, has a good vibe and room to DANCE without being a "night club".

The atmosphere here is very chill and people seem to be just having a good time, not caught up in pretentious bullcrap.  Great place to meet friends for a happy hour or to knock back a few while waiting to get a table at Andalu.
author: Marissa C.

description:
The Web site for this place has a loop of "Straight Outta Compton" playing. Nevermind the out-of-date calendar - I say best Web site ever!

Plenty of bars and clubs have hip hop-themed nights, but Double Dutch is the only one I know of that is dedicated to playing a mix of old and new rap every day. It has an array of boom boxes decorating the wall behind the DJ booth, which thankfully sits just high enough so they can ignore your lame request to play Journey.

The beer and drinks are reasonably priced, and the bartenders have always been friendly. It can get a little hot inside, as there is a narrow path between booths and the bar that gets super packed even when there aren't a ton of people here. Somehow, though, the place never seems to smell too bad. I dunno how they do it. Is someone paid to sit near the vents and spray Fabreeze into the room every 20 seconds? DID THEY REPURPOSE TERMINATOR MACHINES TO SIT IN THE VENT AND SPRAY THE FABREEZE?

I'll ask an employee if I can stop rapping along to "Award Tour" for a couple minutes.
author: Trey C.

description:
This place is okay.  The crowd is sketchy and it smells awful, but if you're messed up enough you won't even notice.  

My favorite bars all have cheap drinks and a dance floor with a live DJ.  Check, check, check.
author: Timothy J.

description:
So I went here for the 1st time for a girls night out. Had a blast! They played hip-hop all night. Great music all night long! 
I had a margarita with a side shot of Patron, 1st one was $17 
2nd was $22, but, i had to say something b/c the other bartender charged me 17, so she changed it back to $17 (weird) and the 3rd was $22. They all need to get their prices straight! 
Met some really cool peeps in there and we are now friends on FB. All in all a good night out with the ladies and dance all night to the best hip-hop beats!
author: Carmen C.

description:
Everytime I come here, it's always crackin'. It gets so crowded in here though that it's hard to maneuver around people. Kinda like being stuck in traffic in the middle of rush hour. It's stop n' go, son. And it's a small, narrow space so it gets very stuffy. So for all you hipsters, don't even think about wearing your cardigans. 

Drinks aren't bad. The beer selection is decent. Music is always good here. Hip hop, top 40...you name it, they'll bump it. Though the crowd can get a bit...uneven? By that, I mean more guys than girls. UH OH! 

And I hate that the dancefloor interferes with the path to the bathroom. It's hard to tell who's dancing to the jams and who's itching to take care of business (if you know what I mean). Bathrooms are really grimey too. Not the cleanest but sad to say, I've seen worse. 

Double Dutch is nice because there's no cover. It draws a good crowd that knows how to party. And the atmosphere is youthful and vibrant. Despite some minor setbacks, it's definitely what I look for when I visit the Mission. See for yourself.
author: Will S.

description:
This is a strange little bar in a very bad way. It apparently wants to be some retro hip-hop club mashed together with a dive bar or something. The way they designed the place is cheap and just a strange mix of styles that look like this was the best they could pull together from a couple yard sales.

The crowd was along those same lines. A strange mix of people who apparently had no idea that this place was strange or that the music was lame pop and hip-hop that you would hear 10 times that day on the radio.

AND, as we walked in the bartender waved us over with the worst attitude I have ever seen from a bartender - "HEY! ID'S!" and waved us over like we were trying to sneak in.  It's not our fault the door guy was on break. Showing ID's is no problem but he acted like we were stealing something. Then charged us for their over priced, porrly made drinks.

Lame. All around lame. If you have any taste at all, avoid this place.
author: Marty T.

description:
The paradox of Double Dutch is that while I feel too old to deal with the hyper drunk crowd and the stuffy space, it's the only spot where I can get down to the DJ playing "Everything She Wants" by Wham!.

Yes, I said "get down." 

Jeeze, I'm old.
author: Vandana M.

description:
Best.Bar.Ever. 

This place is an experience. The place was perfectly decorated -- the painted Jordan's on the wall, the boom-box DJ booth. I'm a sucker for 90's hip-hop/rap -- and that's just what I got here! I didn't stop singing/dancing the whole night. Not too mention there was A LOT to watch in the human aquarium (i.e. some hilarious booty dancing, dry humping and just plain inappropriateness)! I felt like I stepped back into middle/high school. LOVES IT! 

Watch out San Francisco I'm coming back!!!
author: J M.

description:
Headed over to Double Dutch on its second night open (Thursday), but the night before its official opening, apparently, and again last night (Tuesday).  Half of San Francisco was crammed in there on Thursday, having a fabulous time.

Double Dutch is great!  The crowd is relaxed and happy - not too much drama-rama going on there, which is good.  Some of the owners are also bartenders, so there's no question about quality.  Don't worry about which bartender you get, though, because they are all fabulous.

Check it out today - and pretty soon, those chandeliers are going to be uber-popular, so be glad you were one of the first to see them.  Personally, I'm calling first dibs on the t-shirts with the chandelier image, boys. (hint, hint)
author: Danielle F.

description:
The Double Dutch gets the Vibe poppin'. 
DJ's are always on point, drinks are decently priced. Only complaint is this place gets packed. What do you expect though in the mission on a thurs, friday, 
saturday night.
author: Felipe Giovanni I.

description:
Drinks are decently priced ($7 James/Ging), it's the right amount of dive-y and the DJ spins old school hip hop. The dance floor is tiny, but that just means it takes a smaller critical mass to get the dancing started. Super fun!

(Also, I see a lot of people complaining about the presence of hipsters at this place...I didn't experience that, but *DUH* it's in the gentrified part of the Mission. I'm sure that's bound to happen from time to time.)

My friends and I went up to the city for a girls night out and after a pre-game in the hotel room, dinner at Limon around the corner, we started our evening here. When it got too crowded, we bounced. A good spot to start your night out.
author: Tori W.

description:
Went here with my roommates on a Saturday night.

Now I am a 24-year-old white boy living in SF, but damn did I feel like I was straight up thuggin' it California-Love-music-video style! You can tell when you're there you're at a place where the DJs actually have talent. No cheesy Lil' Jon remixes where it fades to played-out Journey songs here... Clever and head-bangin' mixes left me on all corners of the dance floor with my double vodka in hand.

The atmosphere was also awesome. Old school 90s boom boxes cover a part of the wall where the DJ spins and silky smooth graffiti is by the lounge section of the bar.

"I'll be back" like Arnold! (not for governor, action movies please, and don't give me this cameo crap in sly stone movies)
author: Lee L.

description:
We swooped in here on the promise of some sort of Trumer and shot deal, and when you're rearranging your face with buddies you don't see particularly often, the sight of the Double Dutch can really hit the spot. One of our group is a resounding hip hop nut, and the soundtrack here sent him to the stratosphere. 

It's a slender reed of a bar, dominated on one side by the bar and stools themselves; decent brew selection and a no-frills approach to a cool and casual stepping out. And it's dim, which, when you're bound and determined to bark at the moon, might be just what the moment calls for.
author: Kevin N.

description:
We stumbled into this place looking for Cama...then quickly realized it had been replaced by DD. We must have gone in during a night when they had hosted a party earlier...lots of young, drunk peeps and a sea of empty Sophia Cans and 40's bottles. 
Needless to say, we stayed only for a quick drink..just long enough to be entertained by the drunken young"ins dressed in double-dutch themed costumes...(does sports bra with track pants count?)  and we bailed.
To their credit...for such a busy night..the bartenders were fairly quick with serving drinks...I may go back during a week night to check out the scene.
author: Mimi T.

description: Have been coming here on business since 2005.  Will never go nor recommend again.  Was embarrassingly accosted by an insolent a staff member for under-tipping despite tipping 17%on top of tax for less than stellar service.   Apparently math is not a strong suit.  Will never go back nor recommend again.  There are plenty of fantastic/polite establishments in the area, don't waste your time nor money for poor service cherry topped with bad attitude.
author: Vanessa G.

description:
Narrow bar with lots of old school appeal. Boom boxes, painting of jordan's shoe collection and air max's (which I could proudly say I own a few), small dance floor, and GUH-REAT old school beats...the kind that makes you put your hand in a fist to your mouth as you say HO-Oohh.
Weird- at 9 it was even crowded and just got busier as the night drew on. Weirder- the crowd.
Good place to chill. It's a 3-1/2 er but I bumped it to 4 because they played Notorious B.I.G. (it was all a dream!)
author: Janice S.

description:
BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS!!!! 
Double dutch USED to be my favorite spot to go dance in the mission on a Friday or Saturday night until last Saturday (10/15/2011) when I had my wallet stolen on my way out. The place is soo crowded that in the 5 minute span o pushing and shoving through the  from the dance area to outside someone unzipped my purse (that was on my body) and grabbed my wallet. I have lived in SF all my life, and traveled all over the world and never been pick pocketed so it felt especially awful for it to happen on a normal night out in SF, especially becasue then I could not get into any other bars! I talked to a really nice bartender and she said that people get items stolen every weekend there. She said it was becasue they don't charge a cover so people will come in take some wallets, phones, etc then leave. I used to really like this place but after this experience and realizing what a joke their security is I don't think I will ever go back
author: Sophie C.

description:
Super nice bartenders. Great interior photos and theme. A bar that celebrates hip hop culture and yet there are no people of color to be found. While Double Dutch has the best intentions and a great location, it firmly reminds us that SF is primarily a white town where hip hop culture and Afro-American flavor remains in the margins and out of the mix.

All in all, a good place to grab a drink and hang out with friends, but not a tru-school DJ bar (like the Top in the mid-late '90's).
author: Be N.

description:
Let me summarize this place in a few sentences because to be honest you don't need any paragraphs to describe this place.

- Super Crowded
- Good music of old school mix with some current main stream
- Young crowd with pretty chicks drunk and yelling
- Super Crowded
- A bouncer that stamps your palm rather than wrist or back hand
- Super Crowded
author: Sonlay V.

description:
Once about a year ago I was dragged here by a crazy girl I met at a bar in the Richmond. I was so drunk I actually danced, I knew it was where Dr. Bombay's used to be but couldn't ever remember the name of it.

Sunday (memorial day weekend) I was with a cash poor friend looking for places that take credit cards. 

I love how the doorman carded me, gray hair and all.

This isn't a dance club, no cover and cheap drinks, but it isn't a dive bar either. This is a divey hole in the wall bar where young good looking people dance to vintage hip hop. 

I think it might be owned by Sammy Hagar because at one point I think he came in there and all the employees kissed his ass. They all looked too young to remember his music and too hip to have enjoyed it.
author: Manny F.

description:
July 5th, 2009

"It's going to be a damned long time before I drink again.  This past weekend almost killed me."

                                                  --Archie

July 6th, 2009

"One more Guinness *hiccup* please."

                                                  --Archie

I am so weak willed.

Hops.
author: Archie R.

description:
So you would like to go to Double Dutch?  Let's see if you fit the bill. Please check all that apply and we will get back to you in 20-968 minutes:
__ Sweaty
__ Grope-y
__ Sardine
__ Dislike personal space
__ REALLY like other people's personal space
__ Willing to fight up to bar
__ Willing to fight for attention from bartender
__ Willing to pay a lot for mediocre well drinks
__ Coked out Russian gangster, half covered in tattoos (literally), and probably run your own counterfeiting ring.
__ Sidekick to said gangster, wink at girls suggestively while they talk to their boyfriend

Though we don't [perfectly] fit the profiles, the bf and I were here with some friends and were lucky enough to meet some people who fit the last two descriptions remarkably well.  

For some reason, the Russian gangster took a strong liking to us:

Russian Gangster: What are two handsome, nice kids like you doing here?  With scum like us?
The BF: Oh, you're not scum.
RG: Yeah, we are.  I'm in the mafia, see? (lifts shirt to show tattoos)
Me: You missed the nipple...
RG: You two should go to this great place, in Pacifica.  You belong somewhere better than this.
Sidekick: *wink* *smile* *lick lips suggestively*
Me: um, ok mister...

He insisted on giving us a crisp $200 in what I suspect was counterfeit bills in exchange for the promise that we eat here: 

http://www.yelp.com/biz/moss-beach-distillery-moss-beach#hrid:NMTogcOE1S89zjM9U4ZNOw

Like, soon.  Because he just had a good feeling about us... 

Pays to buy a stranger a drink every so often.
author: Mari C.

description:
"It's Tricky...Tr-tr-tr-tricky (Tricky) Trrrrrrrrrrricky .... It's Tricky to rock a rhyme, to rock a rhyme that's right on time...it's Tricky"

My Saturday late night infatuation for old school hip hop took me to Double Dutch bar, one of my favorite bars in SF. I remember when I first discovered this place...my mouth dropped from the surrounding hip-hop (music & décor) at this funky spot. It's nice to go back to the "real" hip hop that I miss. This launching of hip hop culture into the San Francisco nightlife is awesome and something that I'd probably have to go to NYC for

You've gotta love the awesome décor including old hip-hop paraphernalia such as double tape deck boom boxes hanging up the wall; portraits, pictures of Run DMC, Kool Moe Dee, Sugar Hill gang, etc., vinyl records, 8 track tapes, a flashy collection of adidas high tops in a glass display and cool graffiti art splashed all over the walls.

Though after a couple visits to Double Dutch...the classic hip hop vibe I once felt for this bar has strayed. I don't know if this was an attempt to draw more crowds (ie. Tourists) who are non hip-hop aficionados but it was weird to hear 80s british mod music that night. But, other than that...it's a fine place to reminisce for all you homeboys & homegirls
author: Charmian D.

description: Super crowded but fun place to dance and get some drinks. They mainly played today's top R&B and rap.
author: Simon W.

description: I love this place. Always super packed and hot .  been here a few times and the crowd is always very diverse.. the ambiance is great with cool vibes all around... I love the old school theme in this place, they have old school nikes n boom boxes displayed on the walls .... the bartenders are cool, got one on each end and they work hard, if ur nice to them, they willhook ur tab up...!. I do have to say, the bathroom is pretty tiny n can get yucky and theres always so many people wtg to get in there.. casual attire (but u can get sexy if that's ur preference) and no cover!!! Can't wait to visit this place again...
author: Melissa M.

description:
- love the music (majority 90s hip hop) Makes me feel 20 years younger!
- music not too loud
- my first drink was weak, second was stronger I wonder if it's consistent
- overall a good experience
- street parking is a pain
- no cover
- no cell phone reception (ATT sucks)
- love the ambiance
- wish it had a view
author: Shine S.

description: Always a cool place to drink, dance, and listen to some good ole hip hop. Love the decor of this place!  Love the radio wall and the black light art on the the dance floor wall.  Its great when its not extremely crowded because the dance floor isn't very big and people have to walk through the dancers to get to the bathroom in the back. And the bathrooms aren't marked so you dont know whether its male or female or if its even a bathroom!  I like that its a dive but hip and cool aura that makes me wanna shake it like a salt shaker in my pumped up kicks!
author: Gina S.

description: The Mission nightlife isn't really my scene, but I like Double Dutch because they play hippity hip hop and the penis status is less douchey than Vertigo. However, I have to deduct major points for the disgusting bathroom. I'd never had to use it until recently, and all I saw was pee pee, poo poo and damp toilet paper all over the place. Barf!
author: Suany W.

description:
Great for tall people who can smell the fresh air from above and don't have to worry about the BO from everyone else.. no seriously! 

Way too crowded, the tables take up so much of the space and most of the time no one is really using them, everyone just sits against the couch! 

Both times I went it was a Saturday. The first time I went, great music... a lot of old school jams and such. The second time not so great, newer stuff which was fine, but mixed in with some houseish/hard to dance to music. 

Little tip - go to the back between the last booth and the DJ area. There is a small step there that is big enough for two people to stand and dance on. This way you can actually dance instead of just being knocked into.
author: Rona Y.

description: Great nostalgia place - awesome throwback music from the golden age of rap and hip hop!
author: Glenn M.

description:
1. No cover
2. Decent priced drinks ($7 for a Black Label! Unheard of)
3. Good hip hop
4. Room to dance
5. No need to dress up! 

All the factors of a very good night. Mission accomplished!
author: Melissa T.

description:
laid back atmosphere with some hip hop flair.
80/90s type of joint, has a divey feel and cool decor. drinks and cheap and the vibe is mellow.
good spot to dance or to people watch
author: Saran N.

description:
I like sausage, but preferably when it comes with/on pizza.  This was more like Atkins Sausagefest Thanksgiving--just meat, meat, and more meat....

No cover + quick bartenders + fun music + close quarters = hot + sweaty+ grabby, which can be tons of fun w/the right crowd, but can also mean a lotta laying down the DontMakeMeKickYouInTheBalls law.  Overall fun vibe, but just be prepared to feel/witness some serious gropage & lip lockage.
author: Amy K.

description: The actions of the door man on the evening of October first 2011 have caused the loss of business of several patrons. The doorman aggressively grabbed my girlfriend who was entering the building and shoved her out of the way to allow a delivery of plastic cups? I immediately confronted him and he backpedaled to tell me that he thought she was "falling down". He is lucky nothing worse happened by our group walking away from the situation.
author: Ryan M.

description:
If you're broke and you like the usual Top 40's, then this is the place for you. You can get cheap drinks and cheap girls all under one roof! I'm surprised they decided to open up in this neighborhood. 

The bouncer had no sense of humor. I forgot what I said, but I made a joke about my ID. Because of this, he told me to step aside and show him several forms of identification. Geez, Louise! Get that stick outta your ass. Whatever, I'm not complaining. There's no cover and I got in regardless. 

This place is tiny and cramped and there is no lighting. There are d-bags left and right and sloppy drunk females hanging on to those aforementioned d-bags. If you're lucky, there may be some cougars on the prowl. There are booths on the right side against the wall, with pretty much no lighting (sugar boogers?). The dance floor is smaller than my bedroom, and to make things worse, the bathroom is right next to it. I guess it's not that stupid. You can do your peepee dance on the dance floor! How appropriate.
author: Kristy H.

description: Double... no. Apparently there is a frequent issue with pick-pocketers, which the bouncers shrug their shoulders over. It's a very proactive way to take accountability for the safety and financial return of their patrons. But, you win some and you lose some. Other times experiencing Double Dutch... other people having their wallets stolen and a bottle-smashing / bar-clearing fight. If you think I'm joking... I wish, but certainly am not. Highly DO NOT recommend?
author: Stef E.

description:
I've been here couple of times and I had a nice time. For these reasons:

Bouncers: Sweet and actually ASK "How you doin' tonight?" instead of thinking they're getting paid to be meanies!

Drinks: Decent 

DJ: I really enjoyed the music

Crowd: Diverse. 

Now if they only taught classes on HOW to Double Dutch so I can remember from elementary :(
author: Sarina I.

description:
As I sit here at my desk on this painfully slow Monday with an achy back and an admirable bruise/scrape the size of a grapefruit on my arm, I cant help but look back positively on my night at Double Dutch. It is not Double Dutch's fault that I consumed one too many vodka sodas and got crazy on the dance floor. Nor is it their fault that I so happened to notice a park bench on the dance floor and proceeded to shimmy on top of it. Alas, I can blame no one but myself for sitting on top of the bench and leaning against a door that to my dismay swung open and took the bench with a 5'5 Irish girl down with it. 

I cant wait to go back!
author: Heather S.

description:
One of my favorite lounges in San Francisco.  Great old school music any day of the week and no cover.  Hip hop heads and hipsters in a funky Mission mix.  Baron Davis used to roll through occasionally too when he played for the Warriors.

Get there early to grab couch seating across from the bar.  

Dancing is definitely encouraged.  

Lastly, take the DUI challenge, have a friend pick u up, or take the 22 bus because catching a cab down there takes forever.

Keep up the solid work, Darin & Mike.
author: Dave C.

description: It's small and sweaty but the bartenders friendly and quick. The music was okay. Wouldn't go there again though. Unless it is someone's birthday.
author: Sylvia V.

description:
hip hop heads rejoice, you've got a chill spot to dance and have a good time here in double dutch. no cover, cheap drinks, and great music.  the wall art is well done and captures the essence of the 80s-90s hiphop breaker vibe that we all miss.  $20 min on cards but no reason why that cant be easily achieved with a few drinks

oh and one more thing....ATT users, you will get NO reception here. go to the front by the entrance or right outside if you're expecting a text/call or to check in on yelp!
author: omid a.

description: Happened upon this place by chance..We went on a Saturday evening.. maybe around 5 or 6 and it was pretty dead. That isn't necessarily a bad thing as we got a chance to check out the unique decor with all the ghetto blasters and old basketball shoes...Having grown up in the 80s I'm a big fan of that kind of stuff (breakdancing and old hip hop) so I thought this place was pretty cool. seems like it may be more of a dance club than a bar as it gets later..Check, Check it out.,.,
author: Morris D.

description:
I really liked the layout and decor of this bar. There's plenty of space in the entryway, the aisle down the bar is wide enough to not create a bottleneck, and a moderately sized open space near the back would be a great dancefloor. Comfortable couches line the wall opposite the bar, making a great place to chat with friends. Walls are black, light is low, and the standout are the neon "chandeliers" in red and yellow. They break up the blackness nicely and provide some character. The biggest drawback was the excessively loud music, particularly given the modest number of people there.

TRIVIA: Jump-rope originated in ancient times, the "double dutch" style started in New York City (then "New Amsterdam") in the 1600s among Dutch immigrants. With its inclusion in the growing hip-hop culture, the game spawned the popular song "Double Dutch Bus". In 2009, Double Dutch will be a varsity sport in NYC high schools!
author: Bill B.

description:
I loved the wall of  boomboxes aka ghetto blasters in this bar. The photos of old school Hip Hop photos cracked me up. The wood decor and booths are polished.

 I was there for Heist. I did not really dance even though the music was good. The dance floor is kinda small. I need room to break out. I also did not drink much as I did not want to depend on the bathroom situation. Great booze selection. My friends told me it is a great bar to come to when it is not so crowded.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
This is a two part review. Any faithful DYLer will tell you that too much sauce will ,on occasion, bring out their "evil twin". This is also the case for Double Dutch. On the weekends, Double Douche rears his ugly head. 

Double Dutch: 4 stars 

1. Great decor and ambiance: Think of New York in 1984, when the b-boys and hip hop ruled. Classic Adidas and ghetto blasters adorn the walls, while neon chandeliers give the place a red/yellow hue. Makes you just want to lay down the cardboard and get down wit your bad selves Mr. Rogers style. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xatZgEZ62fU 

2. Bartenders are fast and attentive. Huge plus is that they will accept credit cards, which is great considering lots of places in the area are cash only. From what I remember, there was no minimum tab. One bartender has a nice dog that he often brings to the bar (yellow lab I think). 

3. Two coed bathrooms makes the one line go much faster. One thing though, is that the bathroom is right next to the dance floor, so you gotta be careful opening the door; you don't want to bump someone shaking their bon bon. Likewise, you don't want to be working it on the floor and bump someone in line for the bathroom. Generally this isn't a problem on weekdays. 

Double Douche: 1 star 

1. Ugh...this place gets fucking packed on the weekends. Absolutely sweaty shoulder to sweaty shoulder. Either Double Douche is a spa/sauna, or they really need to install a ventilation system up in that piece. I don't like being turned away at a bar, but after Sat night, I know why a bar has to do it sometimes. Sometimes turning you away is a good thing. 

2. Not only does it get packed, but it gets packed w/ douche bag Marina boys wanting to go somewhere "edgy". I'm here for Ali's b-day and Andrew T asks where she went. I look around for her and some midget taps me, wanting to start beef. Seriously? Sorry your eyes fell in my line of sight as I look for my friend, get over it asshole. Anyway, his friend calms him down (for what, I have no clue) and the sweaty night continues. 

Finally, I can't stand the heat any more and wish Ali one last happy b-day as I step into the cool crisp air on 16th St.
author: Angelo F.

description: Yay..finally stumbled across a bar in SF that I really liked. Loved the hip hop theme and the vibe was cool.  Good music playing and my drinks were made perfectly!
author: Erica R.

description: Went here two years ago and had an amazing time- good music, cheap drinks, good crowd. Went here last Saturday and can safely say I wouldn't go back. Nothing major happened to report on, the vibe had just changed (though it could be the saturday night crowd?) and it was way too crowded playing the top 40s jams. Oh well!
author: Catherine A.

description: This funky fresh dive is A-OK.  No menu to be seen, which has become a standard feature of top SF bars and certainly a requirement for genuine fandom.  A lack of a menu goes a long way to crushing the confidence of bar goers who maybe tempted to order a drink with more than two ingredients.  They could add to their cool decor and great beats by stepping it up in the bar department.
author: Luke M.

description:
I loved the old school photos on the walls with kids break dancing or jump-roping.. Great touch! I can't double dutch for the life of me. The layout reminds me of Rosewood, but like a Mission version. Booths on the side, and a dance floor in the back. Fake florescent light chandelier.. awesome! The bartenders are attentive and let us basically take over the place. Outside food is allowed, and they have Guinness on tap. 5 stars for that.

However, after a long day of baking in the sun and starving, I was extremely irritable. It also didn't help that I got felt up 3 times. Creepy green shirt man touched me twice, and was finally escorted out.. Then angry short man grabbed my ass.. WTF??!! I was soooo pissed and really felt the urge to sock these creeps in the face.. For the remainder of the time I was there, I tried my best to look chipper, since there were all these scavenger hunt ppls. I was going to subtract more stars, but it's not fair to the bar. UGH.. Talking about it again makes me feel violent.. seriously.. ima sock them in face if i see them..

Other than that, a good bar I wouldn't mind going to again if the effing creeps don't go there..
author: Donna H.

description:
Dear Double Dutch,

I am writing to request two extra-long jump ropes.

From these jump ropes, I will fashion a hangman's noose and give myself the execution your bar so sorely lacks.

Yours 'til the end,
Omid

P.S. - Mild kudos for having hanger hooks under the bar. One of the most underappreciated features of any drinking establishment. Too bad you fucked that up and they're too low for me to hang myself from 'em.
author: Omid T.

description:
Satan fanning the flames of hell - it was hot in there last night.  It was warm out on the street, but one step inside the doors of Double Dutch and it was like standing in front of a blast furnace.  

Still I was compelled by the great beats, and the packed room full of folks I know.  It's nice to hang out with friends.

Double Dutch has Trumer on tap (Think Globally - Drink Locally!) - and that alone is almost good enough for a 4 star review from me.  Double Dutch gets 5 stars because when some other Yelper stole the beer that belongs to the Yelper whom we all know as The President of Cool, the bartender replaced it for free.  And free is my favorite 4-letter word.  Oh wait, know, there's that other f-word . . .
author: Joe C.

description:
DOUBLE DUTCH IS MY NEW STEEZE!!

Like a brand new pair of Puma Suede Clydes (Holiday '07s!), this spot is both classic cool and new hotness all at the same time!!

E & I headed up to the City (Saturday) for a good friend's birthday (HAPPY BIRTHDAY, Jerome!) and Abby [http://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=EpJMKlxPPs63wiavBHELXw] picked out this awesome lil spot to help celebrate!

An end-to-end graffiti'd piece ["Double Dutch"] on the wall?  Tight!
Restrooms (co-ed) dressed-up/tagged from floor to ceiling?  Dope!
Old school boom-boxes adorning the deejay booth?  Coo'!
A show case displaying Pumas in fresh colorways? Sick!

The dancefloor is a tiny little affair at the back of the bar, and making space for the more dramatic and sweeping repertoire of moves can be dicey.  Plus, it gets hot to heck back there; dancing close up with that sugar-honey makes for some combustible, sultry moments!  

Towards the end of the night, a breaker's/battle circle erupted with cheers, oohs, and ahhs... uprocks, flares, freezes!!  The underground will never die!!

The DJ (she's a cutie!) spun an awesome set, mixing together all sorts of music, from the timeless classics to the latest club anthems.  Most def, its the deejay's penchant for old school beats that makes the night here a fun (rather than clubby-hype) experience...  [Michael Jackson's "Rock With You", Groove Theory's "Tell Me", Jeru the Damaja's "Ya Playing Ya'self", The Gap Band's "Outstanding"]

The crowd that mingles about here (oh... and they mingle!) is a good mix of young and still-young (*holding onto my youth*), the type that perk up and respond to the cheesiness of BellBivDevoe's Poison, reciting lyrics and mimic'ing choreography, but will also press up on you to Lil' Mama/Chris Brown "Shawty Get Loose"...  Its a fun group.  Secksy too.  And flirty... bad naughty oomph flirty!

Oh, and they have Franziskaner hefe-weisse on tap... mmmm!

We'll be back to this little gem of a spot, no question!!
_________________________
BONUS!!  
I saw and said "hi" to Jen, one of my very very very very first bartender crushes ever.  
Haven't seen her in YEARS!  And she's still cute as all-get-out... =)  I *heart* my bartenders.
author: Mikey U.

description:
===diver bar meets 80's hip hop culture===
