(boom) boxes above the dj booth. heavily tagged up bathrooms that looked like it would smell like a trash can but didn't. scattered framed pictures of 80's era hip hop (b.boy poses, dd jumpers, etc.). graff piece done like back in the 80's. locked display case of some rare old school pumas. bartenders are cool and friendly. guinness on tap.

seriously, one of the dopest bars i've ever been to. it's clean but gritty. small but full of character. lot's of old school with a splash of new school.
author: watani f.

description:
Whoa?! This is the place where we all danced like a bunch of booty ho's and hood rat hoochie mamas back in '06?! Who knew!

I didn't because clearly if I was doing pop and lock routines with my booty, alcohol was involved. I really wish I could tell you more about this place, but from my hazy recollection, I know we danced and worked up a sweat, pounded shots, danced some more and well...I think this picture pretty much sums it all up: http://static.px.yelp.com/photo/LtAN_ob9WVvQ9UqFPVtiRg/l
author: Stephy S.

description: Been going here for a few years now and always have a pretty good time here. They have pretty good music to dance to in my opinion - play a lot of 90s hip-hop, mix in some current hits - and there is always a decent crowd.
author: Raina B.

description:
The history of this location, in three parts............

Chapter 1. Doc Bombay's - a bar with seating for drinking, catering to a clientele of punk rock throwbacks, sort of divey, sort of loud, sort of crowded on the weekends, good music, average drink prices, good bartenders and generally a good time to be had.

Chapter 2. Cama - a bar with beds, catering to a clientele better suited for other areas of town, sort of upscale looking, sort of loud, never crowded on the weekends, okay music, pricey drinks for the area, good bartenders and the experience was what you made it since there was never a crowd to really dictate how your night would go.

Chapter 3. Double Dutch - A bar with a small dance floor near the back, loud, catering to a clientele of hipsters, not upscale nor divey, sort of loud, strange music mixes, average drink prices, great bartenders and a reasonable time if you can get past the strange music mixes and huge crowds on the weekends. 

I miss Doctor Bombay's!!
author: Drue C.

description: Officially renamed to Double Douche. Thanks bridge and tunnel!
author: Simon S.

description:
I said a hip hop a hippie to the hippie
to the hip hip hop, you don't stop
a rockin to the bang bang boogy say upchuck the boogy,
to the rhythm of the boogity beat!

See I am Bucky K. and I'd like to say hello
to the black, to the white, the red, and the brown, the purple and yellow.

I'm really not sure why I slept on this place so long. I love old school hip hop. I love drinking. Combine the two and you have Double Dutch. If you don't like either, you should probably drink elsewhere.The bar itself was designed incredibly well. I can't decide which I like more... the mural of the b-boy on the back wall or the collection of boom boxes on the other wall. Both are bad ass. I heard the ceiling had chandeliers hanging and thought this was kinda weird til I saw them and discovered they were made from neon. Cool touch. Really nothing else to say excepts parking sucks, but it is the Mission....
author: Bucky K.

description:
The Outfield playing "Your Love" 

in the mix........

Josie's on a vacation far away
Come around and talk it over
So many things that I'd like to say
You know I like my girls a little bit older
I just wanna use your love tonight
I don't wanna lose your love tonight

I ain't got many friends left to talk to
No-one's around when I'm in trouble
You know I'd do anything for you
Stay the night - we'll keep it under cover
I just wanna use your love tonight
I don't wanna lose your love tonight

Try to stop my hands from shakin'
Somethin' in my mind's not makin' sense
It's been awhile since we've been all alone
I can't hide the way I'm feelin' 


Conversation remembered:

Stan: Yo Jamal, you alright bro! 

Jamal: yeah man, I'm feeling the music.

Stan: Are you sure, you haven't broke it on the dance floor yet? 
Why you SWEATING?

Jamal wipes sweat from forehead. 

Steph spills drink on floor: Are you? Stanley? 

Jamal: that's Stanley Steamer, don't cha know?

Stan: Apparently not, Jamal is soaking wet. 

Always had a good time here, just wish they could do something about their ventilation system, bathrooms, and dance floor. It's always slippery when wet. I also wish they open up their back room area for smokers.
author: Stanley K.

description:
Love the layout, the decor, the fact that there is an area that screams "DANCE FLOOR" in the back AND that they serve Blue Moon! Yay! 

I came here last night with the always affable Bill B. for a quick beer. It was practically empty but that isn't surprising for a Tuesday night. I would be surprised if this place isn't packed on a Friday or Saturday. And maybe that's why the music was so loud. Maybe they just don't turn it down from the volume it is at on the weekends.

At any rate, I am totally stoked to realize that there are bars in the Mission that actually have a dance floor. I'm so sick and tired of the crap holes that my friends tend to take me to. I'm not a big fan of dive bars and I am a very LARGE fan of places that have space & danceable music. Now at least I have a counter suggestion when no one knows where to go and everyone is leaning towards Zeitgeist. 

Zeitgeist? It's 50F out. Eff that, let's go to Double Dutch!

I'm trademarking that.
author: Alexis B.

description:
It's 5 til 8 - WHAT?! Shit shit shit! Calm down, calm down....you got this, you GOT this!

Yo! Mr. Bartender man, can I get three vodka tonics with lime? Thanks bud!

Uhhh - whaddya have there on your clock Mr. Man?

What 1 to 8? Okay, wait so how much do you charge for drinks after happy hour? 

WHAT?! Double the price? Okay, um, do you  mind making it FIVE vodka tonics extra lime, and can you do that before 8?

YEAH! You rock dude! Thanks much!

WHEeeeeee!!
author: Aim E.

description:
Theme concepts can be trite and hard to execute, so I always feel nervous for places that go the theme route. But lately I've been more pleasantly surprised with some of the places with themes I've been to, like famerbrown (Southern US/Soul/Funk?) and Lola in Seattle (Greek) and I've noticed that the key to making a theme palatable is to be suggestive with it, infusing it lightly into most aspects of the experience, rather than trying to beat people over the head with it. 

So I appreciated the relative sparseness of the theme at Double Dutch. I thought the Simon, Lite Brite and backlit period photos were suggestive, but that the bar retains enough generality that it's attractive to people who aren't necessarily looking to walk into a Brooklyn block party circa 1980. Which is probably a wise business decision in this neighborhood, where most of the bar crowd were in diapers in 1980, somewhere east of Oakland and west of the Hudson. 

Also, I think the decor is quite crisp, and the physical aspects of the bar are incredibly well-designed.

There are many fantastic things about Double Dutch that will keep me coming back regularly (on uncrowded afternoons when the Daily Candy crowd is at the gym - Friday and Saturday nights are the same Amateur Night you'd find at any other halfway clean bar in the Mission.)

Firstly (and I think it's been mentioned), the bar belongs to Mike, owner of Magnet in North Beach. Not only is he quite the young bar impresario, he's also easy to look at, and has an extremely fresh dog.

Which brings me to the second fantastic thing: the bar is very dog friendly (again, on uncrowded afternoons) and on my recent visit, there were many adorable canines enjoying the social hour.

And thirdly, the bathrooms are new and clean and ideally suited to washing hands. Bar bathrooms that facilitate handwashing are princely, in my book.

Anyway, I dug it. I'll be back on some uncrowded afternoons.
author: Megan W.

description:
The bouncer made me pour my canteen of water out*.  Not only did he make me pour it out, but he smelled it first.  That's just kinda kinky and unnecessary. He was nice enough, but this is not a damn concert venue with $5 bottled water.  This is not the airport and my water does not threaten the bar's security.  The radio hits you pay some poor hipster to spin here proves this place is nothing special.  But it's crowded nonetheless.

Next time someone suggests this place I am going to put more effort into convincing the crowd to hit up Makeout Room, Amnesia, or Elbo Room instead.  Better music, more diverse crowd, less meat-markety, no facist doorman.

*I have a little known insecurity about being anywhere without water; being thirsty makes me uncharacteristically bitchy and unhappy.  PS, some people call it a water bottle, but when it's made of metal, "canteen" is just cooler.  In a boyscout-hipster sort of way.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Ok, Double Dutch is 5 stars on the weekdays ONLY. I almost wish they start charging a cover for the weekends to try to weed people out of there. 

WAY too crowded. We got there at 9:30 thinking we'd be there in time to snag a table, FAIL. 

They also play what I call "crowd pleasers" on the weekends, so you get to dance all night to the newest hits with some classic 'rock' songs and old school beats thrown in. Which is fine, but not really how I'd define Double Dutch on the weekdays. 

So high five to Angelo for pointing out this bar's evil twin...

Double Dutch: Sunday-Thursday, 5 Stars
Double Douche: Friday and Saturday, 2 Stars
author: Ali R.

description:
I finally made it to Double Dutch last week after watching "Freeway" at the Roxie (thanks Yelp!)  Free beer was flowing (thanks again Yelp!) but  even that couldn't convince me to stay more than an hour because it was so friggin' hot inside.
Yelper babes in tank tops = hot.
Sweaty Phil = not hot.
Three stars for the fast, friendly bartenders and the great old school music.
author: phil h.

description:
Here ye, Here ye!!!

I love whiskey.  On the rocks or in other stuff....it's gooooood.

I get to Double Dutch, exhausted from work, and thinkin' sure, I'll have a cocktail.  I start with on the rocks, because I'm only going to have one.  Yummy...I'm laughing with some yelpers and enjoying my drink and I look down and it is gone.   

WTF?  Who stole my damn whiskey!!?  Oh....I drank it.

So, I mosey over to the bar to get another when a nice boy says, what are you drinkin'?  I say whiskey.  The nice boy buys me another drink...and a place in my heart, I won't lie.

I go back to my spot before and sit down enjoying this lovely libation...fun socialization happens.  I meet this very rad chicky who is talking to me, and alas!!! My whiskey again is gone.  Now, I am no alcoholic, so I know I am done.  I am buzzed and happy...

My new lady friend says, no f*** it!!!  Get another with me.  Me, being such a good new friend says...sure...okay, another.

SO, we talked and danced and watched the yelp booty action happen...which is ALWAYS fun.  And what do you know, I have another glass o whiskey in my hand.  CRAZY.

After all of this "fun" I have to pee really bad, and I find the hidden bathrooms.  For reals, the people who own this joint must know that drunkies like me cannot see bathrooms that blend in low light and cocktails...illuminate the damn sign...and leave extra tp.

So, I decide it is time to go...some scandolous goodbyes are said and I am off on my merry way.  I take the 21 home, really easy...right?  Yes, with the help of a yelper to point me in the right direction.

I notice at the end there are two other, more sober, yelpers on the 21...but I am drunk so I stay in the corner.

I meet a friend and we eat.  I feel less drunk after a garden burger...but am fearfull of the DYL HH hang over.  Thanks to Todd E for getting us to a bar by 6, I am drunk by 830 and NOT hungover.  YES!

I love yelp...and yelpers!
author: Jess S.

description:
It's a theme bar, but one with cans of Oly for two bucks and grandmaster flash. Double Dutch looks good on paper.

And for the most part it works, though there are other things you need to know about. Six bucks for a vodka soda is steep, even with stoli as a well vodka. The noise, and lots of pushing and shoving; being on 16th next to dozens of other bars there are lots of people just passing through.

Also, that guy over there with the popped collar and the miami vice dye job, doing that weird chicken dance in the middle of all those drunk girls? I think he's a regular here.

And I have seen with my own eyes that this place is wheelchair accessible, but even when you're in a wheelchair you should still say 'excuse me' when you run over someone's feet, you bastard.
author: matthew r.

description:
I'm a sucker for Kangol.  I like kangaroos and fuzzy things, there's nothing I can do about it.  I also wish I could break dance.  I mean, I've seen "Breakin" about 10 times, how awesome would it be to be able to do that?!  Completely awesome.

With that said, Double Dutch is like a really awesome dream come true for me.  I mean, with the Lite-Brite's and a wall full of boom-boxes, you cant go wrong!

The drinks are pricey, but the well vodka isn't crap, its Stoli, so you pay for what you get.  It also gets crowded fast, so snag a table if you can, just try not to accidentally sit on someones dog (I did it once, I was drunk and THERE WAS A DOG ON THE SEAT, it could happen to anyone).

All in all, its one of my favorite destinations in the Mission.  I'll be the girl *attempting* to breakdance in the back.  Laugh all you want, I still say I do a mean robot.
author: Erika C.

description:
I have to say that I loved all the old school boom boxes on the wall at Double Dutch, and was down to get my dance on with my girls but I thought the drinks were a little pricey and the crowd turned super shady. 

Beware of your purses ladies! My iPhone got stolen out of my purse while it was on my arm. Similarly my friends iPhone and camera got stolen out of her purse too. There are some shady people that go to this place so just be cautious.
author: Kelli P.

description:
Friendly bartenders and cool vibe make it hard to not like this place. Having a dance floor just makes it straight fun. 

Even without us Yelpers taking it over, it still got busy on a Thursday night. This is quite the hotspot on 16th Street! Speaking of hot, it did get quite warm inside. And there was no cell phone reception, which gave a good excuse to cool myself in the 1000 degree weather outside.

Like most dive bars, their bathroom nearly gave this germophobe a heart attack, but they were stocked with soap and armed with auto-on blow dryers. So good play, DD, good play.
author: Ryan V.

description:
Automatic five stars since I can bring in Baxter, my little Spanish speaking gentleman.  Granted, after he darted out the door last night and hauled balls up 16th with me screaming in tow like a wee little girl, I must reconsider letting him have his way with the other patrons off leash.  He was in some SERIOUS time out after that nonsense.  

Double Dutch is an ill bar to chill at during the week.  I have been on several occasions and the bartenders are friendly and prompt.  Good selection of beer on tap (I recently learned that Guinness has very low calories, Guinness is my new favorite beer,) and they have Hangar One Vodka, which is my favorite.  It does get absolutely packed on weekends, but that won't detract me from going, I just leave my little gentleman at home.

Atmosphere inside is great, too.  Old boomboxes and sneakers on the wall, INSANE amounts of graffiti in the shitters and classic hip hop blaring creates an awesome mood.  The crowds during the week are super diverse, I found myself chatting with a salty drunken one legged sailor last night, and last week I made friends with a long-faced down in the dumps Dutch girl named Darcie.  It really is a mixed bag.  

If you want a quiet spot to relax, hit this joint up Sun-Wed.  Otherwise, for a poppin, packed good time, head out on Thur-Sat.  

My mustache brings all the girls to the yard.
author: Sean O.

description:
Ok if this was strictly based on the Yelp event... 4 stars... however

I do not think I'd be back anytime soon.  

Jessica T said it best, "sweaty guys (and girls)," yes I was one of them there sweaty guys!  Not dirty sweaty but DAMN this place needs air conditioning sweaty.  I can't judge the drinks since I only had beer paid for by Yelp.  Though I don't believe my DJC would have been a DJC... more like a 1n a/JC... I'd go back again but I'm not sure my kind is welcome in that there area hint: Delirium

This one event showed the difference between a Yelp event and you stumbling across a bar.
author: Jamal G.

description:
I suck at meeting women. I mean reallly realllly suck. It's a mother thing, I think. But we lonely hearts have to keep on truckin. What other options do we have???

Anyhooo, went to a birthday party here for some random hot chick whose name I forget. Heather, Brittney, Ashley...something like that. Impressions: this place is hot (not hawt), for an 80's themed bar you'd think they'd have 80's themed decor huh, if you're going to play shitty music why play it so freaking loud, does every bridge and tunnel chick think she's living in a Sex and the City rerun, I haate tall whitey jerks who drip entitlement out of their bungholes!!! I can't work under these conditions. But I ain't bitter...really. Zero stars- if I could do it.

I walked home and watched Comedy Central til 4AM. Jeff Foxworthy is funnier than he gets credit for.
author: John T.

description:
I'm picky I guess. 

If your idea of fun is hanging around buttplugs on a Friday night, this is your kinda place.
author: chandra g.

description: Great atmosphere but it is way too small and it takes forever to order drinks.
author: Gilbert L.

description: I feel like this place has so much potential. It looks cool inside with the old skool boomboxes lining the wall, graffiti, good music for dancing, and super cheap drinks. It also should be cooler than it is because it sticks out from the normal divey Mission bars, in a good way! But unfortunately, it simply is not living up to it's potential. Oddly enough, when other bars are packed on weeknights, Duble Dutch can be totally dead- like 2 people sitting at the bar gazing down at their drinks. Maybe it should be in a different part of town? Would it be more hoppin' then? Anyways, I like that they have $2 cans of Olympia, because it makes consumption easy and cheap. Like I said, they can have good tunes to dance to, but when it is packed it gets so hot near the dance floor that you're practically dripping with sweat. So NOT hot.
author: Sonya D.

description:
The old school was cool 
the beats were poppin'
What I really want to know is why was there no hoppin'

Your names Double Dutch but cha got no rope
I got my turners and I got some hope.

How my sposed to get my jump on to the tunes goin bump!
Your namessake and beats make me wanna jump jump jump.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Update in response to my friends' wtf? inquiries I  should add that I like the old school playing here so much that it inspired me to write a rap ala Run DMC and the like.  

As you may tell by my verse, I am indeed half white.
author: R M.

description:
Attention drinkers! There is a tear in the space time continuum. It is located on 16th St near Valencia. If you accidently fall into this tear you will find yourself in the Marina. 
Avoid tear at all costs. 

Sorry people who work here, you are nice.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Cute place - we were here for an event last night and got a kick out of the old school decorations and vibe.  Loved the Double Dutch logo displayed via Light Brites circa 1986 and the case of vintage sneaks.   

The 1980's neighborhood photos took me back to my youth, sitting on the stoop as older kids with boomboxes walked by in the summertime, playing mixed tapes with LL Cool J in heavy rotation.  Bonus points for the neon chandeliers - retro yet modern.

There was ample seating (on a weeknight) and we tucked into a comfortable booth featuring a lovely sleek coffee table.  Bartenders were very nice and surprisingly quick, considering the volume of free draft beers they were slinging.  Bathrooms were a bit sketch but nothing horrifying and of course you don't come out to spend time in the restroom.

Now I've just got to go dig up my old school adidas and knee socks...
author: Jaimie M.

description:
Allegedly I had a good time here.  The following events may or may not have happened in our group.....

-package checking
-tequila drinking
-dancing on areas that are not the dance floor
-foot rubs
-mini make out session
-recruiting for a three some
-political discussion
-phone number exchange
-re-enactment of 90's videos
author: Nikki c.

description: The looks of the place rule.  Wall of boom boxes, glowing sneakers, 80s wild.  The customer service from the bartender was a lil lackluster.  It was pretty dead inside(midday) and he was basically turning way customers by not putting on the giants game over the basketball game that only HE was watching...
author: Sophia F.

description:
I like the lighting; it's pretty trippy.  From back-lit pictures to neon chandeliers to good ol' Lite-Brites, it's a pretty cool setting.
Relatively decent crowd, awesome bartenders and good location.
author: Christine M.

description:
Okay, I pretty much absolutely love this place...

The music is great (I can't get enough of Hip-Hop) and the DJ did a great job of mixing...

It had a nice full sized bar, lots of seating, and a small dance floor in the back...

The crowd seemed really chill and laid back...

I can totally see myself coming back here again...
author: Mike V.

description:
I'm glad they're trying again with Fritz on Valencia, because when those guys tried Cama it was weak. Having said that, Double Dutch is no prize.  Yes the area is a magnet for people descending like Vikings on a quiet village, but still, you can't just open any old bar and expect to be printing money. 
Now Double Dutch. The inside is a homage to the early days of hip-hop by way of Disney and Vegas. The walls are filled with the appropriate pictures of 'old-skool' breakdancing crews, classic hi-tops, and the DJ booth has an era-perfect stack of ghetto-blasters. But the feeling leaving there is a lot like what I imagine it must have felt like to leave a Paul Simon concert in his world music days. The beats are tight, but when you look around you have to wonder how many of these people would have lasted a hot minute in the South Bronx in the 80s. 

I mean, yeah it's nice to listen to old-school rap, but don't you have to lived through it to consider it retro? So don't expect authentic. This is San Francisco in 2007, but its not a bad cultural safari.
author: Olu J.

description:
I will NEVER return to this bar again.

Last night I went to see a favorite DJ of mine play at the Double Dutch. He was amazing (of course) and was drawing a bigger crowd by the second. Everyone was dancing and having a great time when suddenly he stopped playing. Everyone was confused, someone from the bar was talking to the DJ, and soon he got on the mic to say that he was being kicked out! apparently the staff wasn't vibing on his music and decided to pull the plug MID SET! The crowd couldn't believe it!
   I've come to this bar before- and despite the crowd, i've had a good time. I like a good throw back sampling every once in a while- and frankly, that's all i've heard here, and they get some talented DJ'S - but to stop an artist mid way- especially one who is more original and slammin than any other DJ i've heard in  long time at this place- is F*@king ridiculous! Not to mention rude as shit. ( I later heard that they kept the "more well known" DJ that my dj brought in as a bonus AND still had him pay for him!). Talk about conniving. IF YOU ARE A DJ LOOKING TO BOOK THIS PLACE- FORGET IT! apparently they like to cheat artists out of money and close them down early.
  Before he left the booth, The DJ said to the crowd "never come back here again". I know I will NEVER recommend or return to this bar again. I suggest you do the same.
author: Kristin S.

description:
Interesting theme, but I've never seen a more lackluster, half-assed dedication to a concept before in my life (with the possible exception of Cama). 

The theme is supposed to be Bronx-Brooklyn Hip Hop in the late 70s-early 80s. Hearing this, I immediately thought, "Cool, they've probably tagged all the walls up with graffiti and the place will look like a Queensbridge house party with Afrikka Bambatta behind the decks.

What do we get instead? Several framed pictures of breakdancers and $7 drinks. If they spent more than $200 decorating this place, they got ripped off.

In short, we were only there for about five minutes before wondering what the next theme is that this bar will attempt. Perhaps they can turn it into a military themed breakfast place called 'Take Orders'. Oh wait, that was done already.

What depresses me most about this place is that, knowing it will fail, the chances of the next incarnation of it having a better starting theme is probably about 5%, so the fact that they got this one wrong is all the more saddening knowing that in six months this place will probably be some jizz-bucket infested snobbitorium where the only theme is 'our drinks are ten bucks and up'.

Pass....the dutchie on this place.
author: Andrew L.

description:
If bar music is what sets your impression on a place, then you will find this place to be a hit or miss on any given night... found myself liking the music in here at one time, then liking it less the next...

But then it seems that perhaps most of the patrons here don't really give an F about what is playing overhead, or the fact that it can get REALLY LOUD THAT ONE HAS TO START TALKING IN A HIGHER PITCHED VOICE... WHAT, WHAT, WHAT DID YOU SAY? 

I appreciate the light box fixtures illuminating scenes of the 80's street kids, break-dancing in their DC or Etnies sneakers and with getto-blaster in hand. And of course, you can't call this place Double Dutch without a picture of two young black girls playing double dutch, of all things!

The neon chandeliers gives this joint an eclectic feel.

Despite the theme going on here, this ain't a hip hop joint, THAT'S FOR SURE.

+ one star for serving Chimay.
author: NirvAnna M.

description:
Surprisingly, I prefer this place on weeknights, rather than weekends (wednesday being my top choice). On the weekends it just isn't my type of crowd, a lot of older, and rude people. Plus its sooo crowded especially in the back where it's so small! During the week it's a real cool, chill bar, that has fantastic music! I'm not sure all the days that theres a dj, but wednesday night there is. Even when there isn't a dj the music thats playing is still really good. Thats my favorite thing about Double Dutch- the music (older hip hop, stuff you don't hear anywhere that often). Drinks are both average for how they are made and price. The bartender was great, kept giving me free champagne, yay! :)

You can also play Wii & hop scotch! 

I'm surprised how easy it is to find parking in this area. Plus there's about 3-4 alright/good bars within walking distance.
author: Ashley Marie L.

description:
I always end up at Double Dutch for events of some sort, so my opinions are a little biased. It's a small bar space, but big enough to have one main bar area and another dance floor. 

I thought Doc Bombay's was lame and belonged in the Haight and Cama was just one long pregnant pause of a bad time, so just having the Double Dutch is an improvement just by being there.

Ask for Mike the next time you're in, actually all the staff know what's up.
author: Nish N.

description:
Want to drink your night away with artists such as A Tribe Called Quest, Digital Underground, Naughty By Nature, Dr. Dre, and other hip hop favorites through time?  Then this is the place to go.  Get nostalgic with some old skool hip hop tunes and groove to newer hip hop songs.

Okay - I totally sound like an ad for this place - but seriously - it's a pretty dope joint.  It's fun all around. People are having a good time.  It DOES get crowded, though!

But this place, I would have to say, is (say it with me now) - FRESH!!!
author: Anne M.

description:
Um tote empty on a Tuesday night..WTF?  I feel so betrayed by Daily Candy.  I though this was supposed to be happening?  So NOT.

80's Brooklyn?  NOPE!

Try again....such a waste of time.

Headed over to Dalva....
author: A P.

description:
UPDATE: Originally a 4 star is now upgraded to a 5 star. Bambi is in love with Double Dutch. I have been here 3 times in the last 2 weeks and each time the service was wonderful and the bartenders were quite friendly. The Beats are great too... 

Bambi sneaked out of the Pink party for a quick trip cause Dunzo said ..."Bambi...there is a new bar opening and I was just invited .. would you like to accompany me". With that said the Coco babes were off to Double Dutch... ditching the guests at PINK. (a party I was co hosting with Miriam, Connie and Raoul. Sorry  guys I had to take a break from the door).

ZIP TO DOUBLE DUTCH

Walk in place is packed, music is pumping, drinks are flowing, everyone is hot..(or WAS IT ME?)... Bambi is drunk, Dunzo is social, We meet a friend,I get introduced and become immediately attracted ( my G-Dar was out of service at this point) 
, We invite the friend for a drink. He invites more friends for a drink, We get shots, Bambi is slurring...

Bambi: DUNZO RUN RUN... back to pink quick quick.

Zip Back to PINK no one notices we were MIA. 

So peeps unfortunately... I will have to go back to Double Dutch a bit more composed to give a good assessment.Until then I will say it is going to be a great space to jump back and forth between here and PINK.
author: Teddy d.

description:
I was at this place earlier October on a Sunday night, which was totally dead, with a group of 40+ people. Everything was going great (maybe except for how hot it got; it was like a frickin' sauna at this bar!), we were all getting our drinks on & shaking our (_|_)s, when all of the sudden the music stopped & it was only 11:20pm!!! The DJ came on the mike and said that the music has to be turned off so that the other patrons in the bar can watch some show on Food Network. WTF!!! Apparently, some jack(_|_) at the bar has a friend that was being featured on Food Network that night and decided to shut the DJ down so that the show can be heard. I guess these pecker heads' never heard of DVR or TiVo!!! & NO ONE that ran this place bothered to tell my group about this crap or else we would have never came here in the 1st place. 

Needless to say, this place lost our business that night (& FOREVER) as we all went to another bar. 

I would suggest that next time you have a group gathering call ahead and check to see if the Food Network interruption sh*t will happen again! (I was told by the DJ that this is a common occurrence at this place) Shoo, just Double Dutch yourself to another bar & skip this place entirely!!!
author: Tiffa S.

description:
Wednesday: 12/272006 
- 1:01a Arrival
- 1:15a Departure

Score!  Parking right in front.  

My Date: "Celeste, do you really want to go in here?"
Celeste: "Yeah, sure, why not?"
My Date: "Everyone just seen so pretentious, but let's go check it out anyway."

The bartender who was wearing a shirt printed with this type: "my evil twin did it," was very nice and attentive.  Considering how crowded the bar was, she was quick and precise -- we got our Stella Artois pints in no time.  As soon as we got our beers, a booth opened up so we sat for a bit to people watch.  

Music was off the hook -- really enjoyed listening to 2Pac' s "California Love" and Too Short's "Gettin' It."  Great vibe, everyone seen to be having a good time :-)!  

My Date: "Do you want to stay, or can we go?"
Celeste: "Why, what's wrong?"
My Date: "You fit right in, but I feel uncomfortable being here.  I'm probably the ugliest person here."
Celeste:  *looking around* "There are a lot of good looking people here."
My Date: "Maybe the second ugliest."
Celeste: *looking around*  "No."
My Date: "I think this is the bar where beautiful people hang out."
Celeste: "Okay, we can go -- not because I think you are not good looking, but because I can't stand the Rottweiler running around here."

Off course the night could not be complete without a drink or two at Delirium (currently one of my favorite bars), so we ditched Double Dutch and crossed the street :-)!

THE END.
author: Celeste M.

description:
**This review is for the Yelp party on 4/11/07.**

Even with a zillion Yelpers packed in here like thirsty sardines, DD was fun.  The music was good, Graceypoo's dancing was off the hook, and there was free beer.  My two favorite things:  the fantastic bar staff who were dazzlingly efficient non-stop smilers, and the boom box shrine on the wall by the bathrooms.
author: Andi T.

description:
No cover charge!

The bar was realllllllllllly crowded when we got in. I had to hold onto Juliane's hand most of the time so she wouldn't lose me. There was barely a 2 inch gap btw each person. When we were trying to order our drink this lady kept booty shaking, I guess to entertain her friends but damn her ass was all up on mine! That was pretty annoying. Once we got our drinks we walked to the back where all the dancing were SUPPOSE to be done. They play old school music but with a mix of what we hear on the radio too. 

It was really stuffy inside so plus the dancing it was a sweat fest in there. Good place if you want to feel up on someone and make it not noticeable or just want an ass all up against you. Other than that I don't think I be in here unless I have somewhere to sit.
author: Tracy A.

description: Super fun.  I am reading mixed reviews....so maybe I came here on a good night (Friday).  Not super crowded but was getting there when we left.  I like the relaxed environment....with definitely a Hip Hop feel to it with the wall decor of boomboxes.  The bathrooms were yes all the way back of the dance floor (and I think there are only 2 unisex stalls)..but they are pretty spacious and enough to pack a few friends in there to keep you company.  Fun place..will probably add this to my list of bars to stop by when we do our Mission Bar Crawl.  I don't know if I can hang out here the entire night...but definitely a cool place.  The bar wasn't too crowded and service was fast.
author: Helen C.

description:
Double Dutch Double Sucks! 

Please Please leave leave the the 'hood 'hood.
author: Zoe s.

description:
This is all I have to say:
Yes it was crowded, yes it was bloody hot, yes the line for the bathroom was looooonnnnggg.

HOWEVER:
In a crowd of 250+ Yelpers vs. three bartenders do you know how long I had to wait for a drink?

30 seconds.

Seriously.  30 FUCKING SECONDS.

And, not even the free beer... a mixed drink that I had to tell the bartender once and every subsequent time I came to the bar that drink was practically slapped in my hand.  It was brilliant.

You might think this was due to me being a girl with bodacious ta-tas and it was a guy bartender (something I've taken advantage of before and something I will, honestly, take advantage of again I am sure) -- NO SUCH THING!  Girl bartender.  And, I declare:  GOOD SERVICE!

Not to mention that the drinks were cheap and strong (just how I like my men) -- so strong, in fact, that my eyes were crossed... and, I am still kinda feelin' them this evening.  Ugh.  Who let me drink that much on a school nite?  Seriously you guys!
author: Kate R.

description:
The fact that I've lived across the street from this place for months and never noticed it should attest to the fact that it's probably not awesome. Although I did pull that same move for months when I lived across from the Lone Palm and that place rocks hard.

I'm afraid I can't pull samesies for Double Dutch. It was alright. The bartender was very nice and quick - even though it was busy we didn't have to wait forever for drinks. They were good drinks too. 

I don't know... it might have been the vibe of the bar that put me off. I don't mean to be a snoot but it was not at all a typical Mission crowd - there were some T & B, Marina and older business types. Normally I don't hate on that. At least I don't hate on it when I'm expecting it. And I was expecting a local crowd which was mos def not the case. I was also told that the music was great but the dj played A LOT of old school hip hop. I prefer old school for a novelty mix-up rather than the entire mix.
author: C P.

description: Oh HELL yeah.  What I remember of this place was rather rockin' - shots of Brooklyn on the wall, and shots of alcohol in my belly.  Some other choice moments include me freaking with the fabulous Erica C, some serious booty shaking happening from Jessica T, and a CM shot with Geoff D (albeit a wimpy one).  See pics for further evidence.  But just for the record, I did actually take a few moments from the drunken raving to notice the place and remark "yeah, I would definitely come back here."  Sleek, but warm atmosphere and very friendly staff.  Great Mission bar (I love how I say that like I know so many different bars in the Mission...).
author: Sam P.

description:
probably a 4.5 but i like it enough to push it on over to a 5.

Came here on a Friday night for a birthday shindig, so many of 'us' populated the place, but looking around the crowd was good, no sleezeballs or biotches, everyone is casually dressed and no one cares, no one is all glammed out, thank goodness. The drinks are fair and reasonably priced, and you are usually able to get something to drink within reasonable time (when it gets crowded that is). Theres a small small dancefloor in the way back, but I didn't go anywhere near there. So damn hot. 

My favorite parts about this place are:
(1) they have a good amount of tables and sitting area in addition to the bar stools
(2) the music is OFF THE HOOK. They were playing stuff like TLC and the fugees. LOVE IT.
(3) the decorations, the neon light chandelier, the box that Simon comes in (the game, if you remember it) that's sitting on the bar shelf, the old school nikes, the graffiti, etc. 
(4) close to late good eats after you're done drinking, and jonesing for some tacos.


Bad points:
(1) coming here on a hot day isn't a good idea unless you like wiping other people's sweat on your body
(2) bathroom is heinous. But like most bars/clubs I guess it depends what time in the night you go in??? 
(3) no parking, if you can, it's RIDICULOUSLY easy to take bart.

I went when there was that crazy heat wave, so it was like 5489385940534 degress in there and no sign of air conditioning, they had their feeble attempts of keeping the door open, but who are they kidding. 

Would I come here again? hell to the yes.
author: Irene C.

description:
AKA Drinkin' 2: Electric Beergaloo.

Big props on the urban-street-life-circa-1980 theme.  But why is there no correspondingly clever drink menu (I'm thinking Hi-C, I'm thinking TaB...)?  Why is the DJ playing too-loud, decidedly non-Golden Age hip-hop?  And why do the patrons seem like the overflow from Bruno's?  (Actually, like Bruno's, I have a feeling that this place may improve on the off nights.  But there's still a 1-star penalty for being off-limits on Saturday...it's a convenient night, after all).  Anyway, enjoy elbowing your way to the bar for another drink--I'll see you at Elixir.
author: Wes M.

description:
Came here on New Years Eve and we were just glad to get in before 12. Before New Years hit, we were already armed with complimentary glasses of champagne, which they kept refilling for 20 minutes after. YAY for free alcohol! 

Love the diverse crowd it draws. Love the cute little busser guy who's always there. Love the owner who bartends as well. Love the wall of boom boxes. Love the hot girl DJ. LOVE THE DECOR. All I feel is LOVE for this place.
author: Julia K.

description:
You would think with a name like "Double Dutch" and with the photos on the walls AND with the piece on the back wall with the b-boy lockin', that this place would be "the spot" for good hip hop 7 days a week? Not at all brothas and sistas. De La said it best..."Say No Go"!  All marina cats and B&T people.  
"Yo Stop Frontin'"
author: Lou Z.

description:
*Best Men on Film Voice*
HATED IT! 

Ey for real if yer gonna call a joint Double Dutch and decorate  the fuckin spot with  b-boys break dancin and double dutchin laydees in Nike Cortez, live up to the image, right!  

I was expecting old skool, nu school Hip Hop....I was expecting fun, and what I got was Billy Ocean's "Caribbean Queen". 4REALZ

I like this spot when it was Cama, the drinks were great and the music was on point.  
Dude I moved from Boston mostly because of the WHACK scene, so please Mission District, I know gentrification is hard to stop, don't give in by cartering to the music interest of the nu gente.
author: Roxane P.

description: A crowded bar with rude bartenders.  I understand she is busy but when she rolls her eyes at because you have a large order that's an entirely different story.  In addition, she got upset at my friend for complaining about the quality of a drink.  To make a long story short she blamed him for a poorly mixed drink.  There are too many other good spots in the city to waste your time here.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Great little Mission dive-esque sort of bar!  My friend told me that Double Dutch is owned by the same crew that own The Ambassador and Mamacita (there was a 4th establishment that I can't recall at the moment) - what a great eclectic grouping of restaurants and bars!

We jetted over after the showing at The Roxie ended and were some of the first to walk in, which was perfect as were able to walk right up to the bar and order a few of the complimentary Pils.  We settled next to a few tables along the right side of the bar and started chatting up a few other Elite'rs.  The bar quickly filled up - it doesn't take much as the bar is rather narrow and long.  I wonder if those few people sitting at the bar before the Yelp crew took over the joint had any idea what await them into the night.  At one moment it was a quiet 80s rockin' dive bar, the next it was a packed crowd of chattering Yelpers.

I have to give a major shout-out to DD as they were spinning some great old school tunes... When on earth was the last time I heard "Candy" - especially in a bar...  I dig it!  I would only recommend turning it up just a bit - at times you could hardly hear the great tunes... And yah yah yah - you are suppose to be paying attention to what everyone is talking about - surprisingly, I CAN multi-task and do it best with some great tunes... ;)

The bartenders were rockin'!  Mike, your Hangar One martinis were the bomb - and as we mentioned, the DD price-tag is much more agreeable than the same drink at Ambassador.  There is so much to be said for the ambiance and staff at these local divey bars - and the less expensive price of drinks is like the cherry on top of the cake...
author: Nicole Rynee B.

description:
I met some good friends here a couple years ago!  

But anytime I've gone back, I didn't stay long.  The old school hip hop brings me back every once in a while but I don't go out of my way to go there.
author: Lauren C.

description:
I woulda thought this was the Marina if I hadn't checked the address.

Too bad, this place has a TON of potential for being a great true throwback club, instead I found it comparable to a really bad 80s frat party.

And you know what they say about 80s night...
http://stuffwhitepeoplelike.wordpress.com/2008/01/27/29-80s-night/
author: Andrea U.

description:
I want to come back during the week when the college frat party has left the building.  There's a sprinking of 70s and early 80s decor, but it's a far cry from the edgy, break dancing infested, Brooklyn artwork that I was envisioning.  

The music is about as all over the place as the people that venture in.  It was obvious from listening to conversations that it was a Marina and North Beach crowd.  Not necessarily bad, but just something to note if you plan on going Friday or Saturday. 

The one thing I did enjoy were the stiff and decently priced drinks.  Don't do fruity, stick to simple drinks and you'll be pleased.  It is a nice change for the neighborhood, replacing the old Cama, which wasn't more than a random bar that folks stumbled out of with no recollection.
author: Kimmie N.

description:
When i first ventured into this spot, the sounds was thumpin, and a hard LA tale was beating
by way of NWA's Dope Man. First impression, I felt this spot was ill as its decor. Justified 
to say the least. Im thinkin this is the place you can roll in with a pair blue ballys and 
some clean gold Kazals. I look at the crowd and see none of that...Thanks for the beer but 
crowd killed it. Second attempt always good to give a place a second shot why not right?..
This book had a good cover. In short I stayed for 10 minutes with a tear running down my cheek
like that PSA commercial with the Native American. All i remember is looking at the picture of
the BBOY doing a 1 handed freeze in front a Graffitti piece, and blasting in the background was 
Kelly Clarkson's Since you've been gone. Got Damn Shame...Too bad So Sad, PEACE Double DOUCHE
author: Joe J.

description:
Meh...this bar has looked exactly the same in its past 3 incarnations.  You'd think they would try and mix it up a bit.  I liked the DJ the night I was there.

I really should knock them off a star becuase their bathrooms could give Tiajuana bathrooms a run for their money in terms of disgustingness.
author: b s.

description:
Props to Mike for opening up a bar that serves hard alcohol!!  During the week this place is dope.  Not so much on the weekend.

The crowd on a Friday was monochromatic to a fault. No medley of folks at all.   The bar was packed and no one was dancing.  WTF mate?  Each person in the crowd unfortunately must have left their manners in their OTHER designer jeans because they were sorta kinda rude.  Drunk fools barged right past me shoving me aside while holding three full drinks.  Nice one boys.  And some chick clogged the toilet and not one girl who was in line before me went to tell the bartender.  Lame... 

A plague on all your houses/apartments/condos/lofts lame ass biznatches...
author: Jay H.

description:
not a whole lot to add to what's already here (i guess this is yelp doing it's job).

yes, it gets very crowded on fridays and saturdays (and eerily empty on other days).

yes, there's no cover.

yes, it plays great old-school hip-hop (a great change of pace from the hip-hop at skylark).

yes, drinks aren't cheap, but aren't outrageous.

it's just another great place in the mission (along w/ skylark, beauty bar) for when you decide at the last-minute you want to go dancing that night but don't want to do the full-on club experience.
author: Mark A.

description:
Nice little bar.  The music was so-so, we thought we were going for 80's rap, but they had a lot of r&b crap mixed in also.  It was pretty cramped but people were friendly.  

I'd stop by again.
author: Tom K.

description:
Biased as I may be...The Double "D" is one of my favorite places to venture to when I am in the city. 
As if by some strange gravitational force...(Delicious drinks and a considerably delicious staff! Yeah I said it!) 
I can not help but shake my rather considerable something on that particular dance floor!
My sweat and tears of joy are a testament to the Double"D" effect! 
And what a fabulous effect it doth' have on me.
Guilty as charged... The Double "D" can get rather crowded on the Fri and Satz- so squeeze on in and drop large amounts of cash on these well deserving tenders of da' bar- and shake a lil' something! 
Your ass, (or donkey, if you nasty)  will thank you.
author: Andie F.

description:
Double Dutch is that unique dope spot that seemingly inspires hip hop heads like Jeff Chang to memorialize the art form's power to build communities and inspire creative expression. With vintage ghetto blasters bumping from the dj booth and still shots straight out of Wild Style or Beat Street this is THE place to go to pop n lock to old school hip hop. Urban Diversion brought a group of 40 Santa's here on Saturday night and we were very much accommodated. Strong, affordable drinks and attentive service with a smile made this the perfect start to our evening. Thanks DD.  

HIT UP THIS SPOT!
author: Jessica M.

description: Truly awful place. I will never go back. I barely even went in the first place, except I had said I was going to meet some people here. The bouncer was EXTREMELY rude and condescending. I had a water bottle in my backpack with a little bit of water left, and I asked to finish it before I went inside and he took it from me and refused to believe it was water and not "special water". Dude, you could open the fucking thing and smell it for yourself to see that it's water, except that you probably can't because the smell of deep personal shame that must come from treating people like this has overpowered your senses. In conclusion, fuck this place.
author: Tony P.

description:
I have been here twice and both times the bartender poured very stiff vodka tonics.  The decor is interesting with some cool old school photos and a couple of nice booths.  The location and music are also good.  This is a very solid three stars.  Everything is GOOD, but nothing really grabs me about this place.  There is nothing that  is GREAT.  

i would defintely go back but not if I were the one planning the night.
author: Spencer G.

description:
I approve of: stocking of all varieties of Hangar One vodka, the boom-boxes and old school kids on the walls, the Lite Brite sign, and the so-bad-it's-good mashups.

I do not approve of opening a refreshingly fun bar in the Mission in a space way too small to accommodate the number of people you let in.  Saturday night Double Dutch was packed.  The bathroom line (for the one  bathroom) took up about half of the tiny, tiny dance floor.  I don't mind a crowded bar, but it was ridiculous.
author: Katie S.

description:
I had a rad time here with a bunch if not all of my fellow coworkers.

The bar staff was really friendly and accomodating. We didn't like the music and they changed it for us! Well, I mean, we were the only ones in there cause it was kinda early. but still, shows they care :)

I found a really cute puppy roaming around, but I couldn't find any jump ropes though :(
author: Richard T.

description:
A nice touch to a great hood!  Made it in here one night out of curiosity of what became of the old Cama space.  Loved the music...  all old school hip-hop!  It was quite entertaining to see the young skinny-jeaned hipsters getting down to Humpty Dumpty!  The decor was pretty perfect... classic break-dancing photos and full bar stocked with booze and boom-boxes.  I could see this place getting pretty rowdy in the a.m. when all the too-cool inhibitions get washed away.  Comfy crowd-watching seats available if you're afraid of the dance floor... definitely worth a visit!  At least for the Simon game!

UPDATE:  Stormed this place with some Yelpers and they handled it pretty well.  It was by far our first drink of the night and they were just getting rolling.  We needed hip hop so the bartender just handed over his ipod and let us have our fun.  Now that's customer service!
author: Tara G.

description:
I HAD SO MUCH FUN...I think.  I mean, I'm like 98% sure I did.  They were pouring Absolute Vodka cocktails for 2 bucks...your memory would be fuzzy too!

The music was kick ass...the chick DJ was apparently a last minute fill in and she ROCKED it.

The drinks were strong and cheap.  Though without those lovely coupons they would have been kinda pricey.  But still totes worth it.

We got there early and were able to get comfy seats which eventually were overrun with people we didn't know once we opted to boogie.  I would def go back.  My friend Max lives LITERALLY around the corner so I'm sure it'll be soon.
author: Jennifer A.

description:
I always get a feeling most of the times I come here is that most of the clientele is just here because they think it's divey and hip to be at Double Dutch and how much better it is here than to be at a lame ass club.  I don't know how hip hop you are just because you like Lords of the Underground records or wear Adidas shelltoes.  I guess they feel they maintain some kind of street cred coming here.

With all that said, I do enjoy coming here and yes I do enjoy Lords of the Underground records. It's a pretty laid back atmosphere and I do enjoy the music they play here. It's fun to hear some of the older stuff that you may have forgotten about.  Prices for drinks are about average  but most of the times, service is pretty swift in getting your drinks.

The negatives here is that the space is pretty small and there are only 2 bathrooms which you may have to lineup for if the toilet is occupied.  Having to wait in line after a few beers isn't very fun as  most of you know.  The bathroom is also near the dance floor so you might have to dodge some people when waiting in line.  The place gets pretty packed on the weekend but I wouldn't say overpacked where it's just uncomfortable to be there.

The crowd here is pretty diverse and I haven't seen a fight here yet so I guess it's full of positive people.  The bouncers seem pretty friendly and don't really trip on what you're wearing.  I haven't had a problem getting in here.

Overall check it out and make up your own mind.  I enjoy it enough to come back....
author: Jason Y.

description: Double Dutch was fun! Love the wall 'o' boom boxes. Drinks were decent. Music was great! My only gripe with this place is the ladies' closet-of-a-bathroom...the floor was a swampy piss puddle. Blegh! Don't forget to hover ladies.
author: Carol R.

description:
So far I think this is my fav bar in the Mission. Surprisingly great hip hop was played on a Friday night and I love those neon chandeliers they have. 

Good music, good drinks, good decor--good enough for me.
author: kate r.

description: Enjoyed how this place pays homage to old school hip hop.  The sneakers hanging from the cieling are classic..along with the boomboxes lining the wall.  I liked it!  Drinks were good, reasonably priced.  And the music overall was good, but not as old school as it looks.  Still enjoyable and walking distance from a lot of restaurants.
author: Rissa R.

description:
Place was packed by the time we rolled in at 10:30PM. 

I was already with a good crowd so the evening started out rizz-O!

Music is tiiiiiight: DeeJay on the 1's and 2's intermixing ol' school beats with catchy new rap. 

Crowd was heterogenous (enjoy people watching and appreciate different styles) with urban peeps, preppy folks, and unique individuals chit-chatting away. 

There's also dancing in the back where people actually dance, YES! 

Partying in the Mission? Be sure to stop by DD's for a bit o' fun!
author: Chuck N.

description:
I'm not too experienced with themed bars, but they do it well here in my opinion. The music is good--not too loud, and there was a decent crowd on a Thursday, though I'm biased toward places that aren't too crazy. The decor is very attractive and the background touches are well placed. You can play a game of trying to find the themed aspects. 

The service was very good, and the bartenders were patient, which I really liked. They also seemed to be enjoying themselves and weren't blase at all. Definitely a place to stop by on a tour of the mission bar scene.
author: Jesse E.

description:
After about a minute and a half in this place last night my friend and I dubbed this god awful place the 'Double Douche' and vowed to never return. 

I don't know what  the rest of the week is like, but Fridays at the 'Douche bring a taste of the Marina out to the Mission. Like it's predecessors in this space, the 'Douche probably won't be around for long!
author: Jared K.

description: Nothing really dazzled me after being to the double dutch.  My friends who took me here swear by it.  It's basically like any other average bar venue in San Francisco.  Walk in there's a bar to your side and dance floor in the back with a whole bunch of sweaty belligerent party goers.  Call me old fashioned but I to like to have fun, just not getting trampled and pushed around in the act.  I felt like the place was way to packed (shoulder to shoulder) and the temperature inside was through the roof.  I was trying to talk to someone but it was way to loud.  I did notice that the walls were lined with old boom boxes which made for a cool look.  Prices for booze were average.  If your in the area be sure to give this place a gander but have a back up if its not your scene.
author: john d.

description:
I probably wouldn't have gone here on my own, but because two of my co-workers at Mezzanine decided to combine their respective B-day bashes in one, I went willingly and happily.

As it turned out, it was a good time. Everyone got pretty snockered, but all in good fun. B-day boy Brian (one of the clubs bookers) is also a DJ, so he actually spun some tunes with other DJ's, which was mostly old-school disco, as I recall. I already have lived through what seems like 3 revivals of the form, but no matter. There was good company. It was nice to hang with most my co-workers in a social setting.

The decor was like an 80's time capsule, with a particularly cool collection of Air Jordans. I liked the intimate feel of the place, and I thought the bartenders did a great job of  slinging the drinks in a timely fashion.

I wouldn't mind coming here to DJ, either. Except I'd whip out my old-school Funk and drop in some Motown for good measure. That'd be a blast, and I'd get to indulge one of my other passions, besides the hard stuff...

We shall see.
author: ACE A.

description:
This place is really meh. whatever

I give the bartenders props for working quick, considerig there is only two of them, but the drinks arent poured heavy enough like other spots.

Place gets turns into a sauna real fast.  Too many people, but i dont remember it even getting as hot in the Elbo Room.

Music gets recycled a lot.

I really did enjoy the decor though.  Maybe the spot is better at different times.
author: Mark L.

description: Not much going on at the Double Door on Thursday night, which just meant more room for our crowd on the dance floor! I was looking forward to spending some time at this 80's bar, but it didn't quite have the 80's feel when we arrived.  Of course that didn't stop me from joining everyone on the dance floor and having a fabulous time.
author: Andrea R.

description:
Double Dutch has a great ambiance. One of the smaller bars in the Mission, it has a graffiti/90's hip-hop thing going on, which is right up my alley.  The clientele is cool, laid back people that like to dance.  The dance floor is small but that is not always a bad thing.  I have never been disappointed by the music.  Damien is my favorite bouncer.  Friendly & funny.  I'm pretty sure they don't ever charge a cover.  

The ONLY reason they don't get five stars is because of the bar.  It takes a little too long to get a drink & when you do, it seems to cost a bit more than any other bar in the mission.  But, really, what is a couple bucks on a Saturday night?
author: Nicole S.

description:
Maybe I'm being a bit harsh, but there seemed to be an inordinate number of d-bags populating this place Friday night. A tightly-packed dance floor (sardines, anyone?) & a lot of dudes standing around in freshly ironed collared shirts scoping out girls they were trying to work up the courage to hit on.

I don't want to assume it's like that EVERY Friday night, but it definitely seems to be the kind of place where more upscale Mission kids would hang out (I suspect you wouldn't find many of these folks in Kilowatt).

I didn't hang out in here enough to hate on it entirely (& they get cool points for having one wall entirely covered in boom boxes), but it wasn't a very good first impression.
author: Pete J.

description: This place is more of a lounge than a dive bar. They mainly play hip hop and rap music. The bathrooms alway have long lines everytime I come to this place, and the bathroom floor is alway flooded with piss. So flooded that piss escape from the bathroom and onto the dance floor. (Cleveland Brown's voice): That's naaasty
author: Richard C.

description:
3 1/2 Stars.

For all you hip hop heads out there, Double Dutch is where it's at. Mainly just in terms of music though.

Everytime I come here, I'm in hip hop heaven. The DJ spins the best selection that can keep me on the dance floor all night. The Double Dutch Brite Lite display above the bar takes me waaay back. All the diff boomboxes set-up by the DJ is a cool work of art and the breakdancing documentary they have running on the flat screen had me sneaking peeks during convos. 

However, Double Dutch has many departments they can improve on. Ventilation is horrible, so you work up a sweat just by standing there- especially in the back. I know they have a tough space to work w/, but still. Having a bathroom line that is right on the dance floor in front of the DJ is pretty ridiculous/awkward. The bar doesn't offer up anything special as well, just your standard drinks. W/ the theme that they have going on, just think how creative they can get w/ their drink menu!

Though Double Dutch may have some negatives, at least they have the most important element down: quality beats.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I was 8 when the 80s ended, so I don't remember much from that period in time.  Might as well be Shakespearean England.  So when people tell me the decor is 80s themed, I'll just take their word for it.

The neon light chandeliers are awesome.

The pear cider I had here was probably the best pear cider I've had, even though I've had it a thousand times before.  Don't know why.  Magic?
author: Fen Z.

description:
There are so many things I like about Double Dutch. 

a. The neon light "chandeliers".
b. The wall-o-boom boxes above the DJ booth.
c. The fact that I played Simon for the first time since '89. 

But my fave dawg thing about this place (by far) is the Lite Brite that spells out "Double Dutch" that is rested on a shelf behind the bar. One day I want to either steal that Lite Brite or get the bartender to give it to me. I love, love, love it. It takes me back to my childhood and is right there with Rainbow Bright, My Little Pony and Transformers. 

Only downfall: I sweat like a mutha every time I'm here. Too small and too hot.
author: Jenny S.

description:
ZOMG a bar in the mission that actually takes credit cards? NO WAI!!!

it was strange, but true. this place fuels social activity, as there are barely any tables or seats to speak of, so you need to actually move around and, well, TALK to people around you. 

the music is good, the decor is odd but minimalist [giant mirrors a-la rouge, a wall of boomboxes stapled to the wall behind the dj, and a display of puma shoes that looks more like an eastbay catalog than art], and the bathrooms are dirty, but you can't expect much fro a bar. in the mission.

so, if you don't feel like putting on the banana republic gear or scooting by the ATM on any given night out with the homies, come on by double dutch. just be prepared to stand around, because, well, you're supposed to.
author: Charles C.

description:
So now on to the next bar...

Row and I separated from the group and we stumbled in after being given the wrong directions.  But the directions were oh so right in leading us to the ever wonderful bacon wrapped hot dog cart at the 16th & Mission Bart station.  Yummers!

So back to stumbling in after inhaling the delicious dog.  Went straight to the back to meet up with friends.  Bypassed the crowd, the bar and the big black dog hanging out front.  Wait, but there was no crowd because EVERYONE's out at the Irish pubs tonight.  It's kinda nice not having to yell into Row's ear.  I'm diggin' this. Very chill.  Just don't ask me about the decor or atmospere...I don't remember. 

Oh it's on now! Got my drink on!  Best Very Dirty Grey Goose Martini (3 olives please) in town!   This is my second ever, so don't take my word for it.  
I'm in a happy place.  Good mood, good drinks, good friends and just to top that off, we were groovin' to 90's hiphop. Mya, MA$E? Montel J?aww just like our college days!   How appropriate!

Must check out again.
author: Yvonne C.

description: Love this place! Went here for a friend's birthday...no cover...people were great...music was great! they even played songs from the 90's which i absolutely loved!
author: Addison K.

description:
Cool music, even in the earlier hours before the DJs start spinning. It's narrow in here and tends to get elbow-to-elbow packed on weekends. While good for business, I don't necessarily like being sardined in a bar. If that were the case, I'd just go to a club instead.

The Jordan 1s hanging above the bar are cool. I'ma get stupid drunk one of these days and steal em.
author: O'Shea J.

description:
I went there with a group of friends, and we were in an experimental mood. We weren't sure if we were gonna like this place, but the night turned out to be a blast. I skipped my usual fru-fru drinks for the Corona with lime, as it just seemed to suit the feel of the place better.  Very reasonable pricing on the drinks too.

They had a female DJ playing (hip hop mixed with other random stuff) in front of walls covered by colorful ghetto-blasters and a section of retro hip-hop shoes. There was graffiti everywhere, but it was done very well. I loved the look of the place, it had a "lightly-ghettoed" feel to it. I danced all night and had a great time.

I give it 4/5 stars and will try to go back soon for more Double Dutchy goodness!
author: Eh W.

description:
What the hell happened to this place.  It really used to be cool and I loved the music and decor but the crowd sucked arse.  

Yes the place is narrow and you have to squeeze by to get from one end to the the other but learn some manners people - all you have to do is say excuse me and people will let you pass.
author: Mabelle A.

description:
Step into Double Dutch, and you will think you were transported to a Brooklyn dive bar in 1984, back when music was raw, graffiti was art, and kids carried ghetto blasters on their shoulders instead of whimpy iPods in their pockets. Everyone was a bboy and shell toes were king. Double Dutch preserves that era with its funky decor and dope beats. 

I'll say it right now, if you think graffitti is vandalism or don't know what a ghetto blaster is, you should probably just stop reading and not bother going to Double Dutch, and head to the Marina instead. 

Usually I don't care about bathrooms, being a guy and all. All we need is a designated place to urinate, and sometimes we don't even need that, what with being able to whip it out anywhere oh so conveniently. But if you do need one, there are two and both are small, and would usually be classified as filthy. Not by my standards! Graffiti lines every single inch of the bathroom walls, mostly tags with a spattering of quick throwups. It reminds me of the days I used to carry paint pens and a couple cans of Krylon in my backpack everywhere I went.

It's a bar. There's booze and music, what more do you need? 

Check out my in-depth feature with photos on my blog, link is on my profile.
author: Gene M.

description: No cover. Great music. Good drinks. I had a great time here last Saturday.  I liked the crowd here A LOT better than Casanova's. Although as mentioned by others... it's a pretty hilarious sight watching hipsters dance to hip hop.
author: Hoa T.

description:
went there for the first time lastnight...LOVED IT!

$6 mixed drinks that were pretty damn strong

great crowd and a cool hip hop atmosphere

friendly bartenders

booths and dance floor were a plus

great location....plenty of other bars in the area (delirium and dalva just to name two) 

you gotta check this place out.  

right as we walked in they were playing return of the mack....DOESNT GET MUCH BETTER THAN THAT!!
author: Jamaica B.

description:
Originally a 3 star review, but I'm updating to a 3.5...and being nice with the 4 stars.

Came here last Friday on our tour-de-Mission with the mission of getting our dance and drink on.
+ drinks are still strong
+ music is *solid*.  The DJ mixed up older hip hop with more recent stuff (finding anything past 2005 that doesn't blow is a challenge, and he did it!)
+- the dancing was fun but #$%(!@ it's SO EFFING SMALL!!! gahhhh!
+- the people here are pretty chill, but chick with the turtleneck and kangol hat, calm down killer and hand ll cool j his outfit back.  
+ decor is still kick ass.  I mean c'mon there's an entire wall made up of boomboxes
- the bathroom is in the worst place ever! (did Madrone Art Bar and Double Dutch think it would be funny to put the bathroom in a cubby hole off of the dance floor so you can stand in line to pee yet still be on the dance floor? not a fan)  Avoid the bathroom on the right because it's *tiny*, like a bit bigger than airplane size, stand in line for the bathroom on the left!

My recommendation is to get there around 9:30 to drink and dance and take in the cool surroundings and then get out before it gets slammed around 10:30.
author: Kat P.

description:
I am sure this could be a great place if you don't go in at 10PM on a Saturday night. The music was great, the people were a mixed bag. 
The place was so packed no one in my group was unable to get a drink. The line for the bathroom was very long. As I was waiting for my friend in the bathroom line, two guys go into the bathroom at the same time. Great! we wait in line and some one decides they need a blow job. However, my rant was interrupted by a fellow patron who said, " they are probably in there just doing blow" 
I suppose the 80's are back.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Love the old school 80s hip hop motif and the photos on the wall.  I'm happy this bar moved into the neighborhood!  It's definitely a welcome change from Cama and has much warmer feel.

Thurs nights are the best.  A good group of ppl get onto the dancefloor and the DJ spins some nice beats.  The music gets cheesier on Fri and Sat...

Update:  Marina takeover warning. On weekends, this bar has lost its sense of diversity and I saw maybe two people of color a few Saturdays ago -- that's really egregious for a Mission establishment!
author: Sid D.

description:
One odd aspect to this bar is that the DJ Booth/Dance Floor is right next to the two unisex bathrooms (though the seat is missing on one, so only adventurous women use it).   So as you are waiting in line to tap a kidney you are pretty much in the middle of the dance floor standing still.  Who really wants to dance with a full bladder?

Not that I dance in any event.

As a 'hipster bar', I felt pretty comfortable watching October baseball here as I would in any sports bar.   Maybe I'm missing something, though watching the game got a little difficult when the cute blonde sat down next to me.
author: Beau G.

description:
"Double, double toil and trouble
Fire burn and cauldron bubble.."

Thus begins the Witches scene in Macbeth.  From double- crossing spouses to double meanings of predators, paranoia of anything double is embedded in our collective unconsciousness. Hence with a lot of caution, I treaded into the Double Dutch last night.

I look into my drink and I can almost see the hemlock in the Corona's disguise. I look into her beautiful eyes and I imagine apathy and contempt(unfortunately no lust). I steal a glance over the side and I see him sharpening his imaginary knives. After gulping some quick alcohol, my double vision makes me see enemies all around me and for a fleeting moment I thought of elbowing out of the maze towards the Elbo Room. Suddenly out of the darkness emerges the yellow light of a Yellow Cab and I jump into it. Epiphany strikes me in the form of POGO's words "We have found the enemy and he is within us"
author: Kaustav C.

description:
SO much potential, but has a ways to go. We stopped in here after sushi at Tokyo Go Go, and being my first time, I wasn't sure what to expect. You have to give them serious points for the beat box pics/art, but the music they were playing didn't coincide. If they stick with the stuff they were playing on our visit, they'll be following Medjool's path to Purgatory. 

This is one of my favorite neighborhoods and I just don't want to see another Blondie's or Medjool, so let's step it up DD.  You're in the heart of the Mission.
author: k. w.

description: Yes, the "dance floor" is crowded on weekends, but I haven't figured out why one would need to go back there to begin with.  The music sounds equally good in all areas of the lounge, and the flooring is the same throughout, so just do what I do: find a not-so-crowded spot, cordon it off by assembling a wall of your non-dancing friends, and just get your groove on.
author: Zain K.

description: Good music, good crowd, no cover (at least every time I've been here), almost non-existent dress code, decent drinks. Cool spot if your crawling that part of the Mission. Grew up down the block so it's nice to visit the old stomping grounds while having a blast.
author: Alvin T.

description:
I liked it better when it was Cama.

but the bartender was chill. even gave me a free shot. though it helped that the girl I was with flirted with him to get it. and he probably didn't know he was giving a shot to a guy also.
author: Derek Alistair J.

description:
This place is sweet! Sick old school boom boxes on the wall, some sweet art and nicely furnished.  Drinks are normal priced for mission bars.
Had an asshole bartender, but didn't destroy the night. 4 stars
author: Tom C.

description: Come here to dance, be in a tight bar crowd, have your sweat glands activated and to see a bunch of hipsters.
author: Jessica A.

description:
Perfect if you are looking for a small place with great music, good drinks and a little bit of dancing. 
Perfect if you want to do something in the Mission but aren't up for the Blondie's type places (who is at this point anyway?!?) 
Perfect if you aren't going to hang out for the entire night bec it can get busy and ppl from the Blondie's type places walk on over... 

....so thennnn not so perfect anymore.. come early and leave when the crowd resembles Blondie's
author: Doro P.

description:
I like small bars with small dance floors.  The mission has a bunch of these, even though I rarely venture onto the dance floor.  I just like to be near the scene, baby :)  

The Double Dutch usually has friendly bartenders and no cover, but it can get crowded.  Oh, and they take credit cards!  I shouldn't even have to rave about that, but I can't believe how many places (Casanova Lounge, Kilowatt, etc) don't.  What business doesn't take credit?  What is this... pre-Diners Club America?
author: Akshay S.

description:
First, my rum + coke =  water. 

But I came here for a friend's birthday thing and had fun! 
Get ready to sweat your pants off because there is virtually no AC and it is hot hot hot inside, especially in the back where the "dance floor" is.
The DJ that night played some good stuff though. There really isn't much to the tiny place besides the art decor on the walls and the crowd was okay. Your typical mission-scene for a Friday or Saturday night. Oh and the bartenders were nice and helped me right away.
author: Pet O.

description:
Being born in 1980 I was a mere child when the hip-hop scene first emerged and too young to have worn the Adidas suits and pumas with phat laces that were  around at that time - but that doesn't mean I didn't idolize my older cousins and that I don't L-O-V-E the music. So when I read about Double Dutch, I was intrigued, anxious and EXCITED to go.

When a group of us finally decided to go (including the toughest critic...my husband!) we had high hopes (which were were quickly dashed) Here are my thoughts:

The Pros:
-Cool Awning
-No Cover
-Nice Interior ( love the Lite Brite, and super imposed picture of '80s breakdancer on the back wall)
-Inexpensive drinks

CONS
-Small space
-Crowded
-People STANDING on the dance floor
-Weird crowd

I know that  some people come into bars just come to drink and not necessarily because they are into the scene but this time it disappointed me. These people did not love hip-hop nor  did they feel nostalgic about the  early days of b-boys and b-girls breakin' in 1980s Brooklyn. They were just looking for a watering hole.  With all the reviews saying people came here to practice break dancing I expected ( read:hoped) I'd see someone doing as much, but I didn't. The highlight of my night was singing along to Positive K's 'I got a Man'

I like Megan W. will go back...I always believe in second chances, maybe I will go in the afternoon like she  suggests.
author: Stephany M.

description:
Chrissy Bartends on Wed shes the coolest!. 

Along with King Most spinning the dopest shit on this earth!
author: jeremy D.

description: I went her on a Friday night in December and it was pretty cool. There were way to many people though. The place gets packed like a sardine can and of course half of those sardines are creepy guys who use the packed-ness to their advantage, rubbing themselves on young women...eehh...disgusting. Anyway that is a normal bar thing though. The bartenders were nice, I bought a girl a drink and the bartender helped me pick it out and i got the girls number. It was a good mix of Mission folk. Definitely not a hipster hang zone. The music they were playing was high school dance style so it brought me back, but it being so packed I couldn't really take advantage. Good bar, Good people, good music, just way to small.
author: Danny S.

description:
Very cool place! Dig the 80's vibe and the awesome break dancing videos on the tv.

I didn't have any drinks here but thought it was awesome they offer Olympia, in cans...for $2.

DJ was great but he turned it up a tad too loud just after we got here and made it impossible to talk to people next to you unless you shouted.

There was a dude here wearing an awesome Michael Bolton t-shirt, +1 star.
author: Christine K.

description:
Yous about to get in something you will never regret, and it's gonna be the BOMB this is what I bet...YEP! 

double dutch makes me wanna do double dutch! I had a blast here when I last went (which was several months back). I have heard the scene has changed up a bit since then, so I can't really speak for it currently..but from my experience I loved it! 

Bar: DD is sort of small. So it gets pretty squishy and warm in there (only thing I  didn't like). It gets crowded on weekend nights! There is a small dance floor in the back, which is cool, but again it's not that huge. 
Service wasn't bad...can't expect super fast service on a busy night at a bar, so patience is key. But I have no complaints about it. Decent amount of beer and drink selections.
