Music: The night I went the music was GREAT. I love a bar that doesn't straight up play the current hits...A lot of old school hiphop which I really dug. So I give a thumbs up to the DJ. Best music i've heard in awhile at a bar. 

I think I will jump rope my way here again soon! :)
author: Catherine O.

description:
Probably the only bar within a bit of walking distance in the Mission that has a semi-dance floor and a fairly decent DJ, it's worth hitting up if you're in the mood for something aligned with the club scene, but somehow you're stuck in the Mission and you'll have to go with a Mission-flare "club", i.e. local, funky and... undoubtedly, small.
I like this place but it is just far too cramped, especially the thing they call the dance floor, and given any night with its number of female trend setters looking for a place to shake that thang, it can get pretty claustrophobic with multi-hip action going on simultaneously. It will take much skill to have a drink here without spilling, but I'd be willing to come back, especially since there is no cover, the drink prices are not extraordinarily expensive (but a bit higher) and the music flows with my style.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Small place with pretty good music. Lots of people crammed into a small space. Looked like one washroom. When it gets hot it begins to rain. You know what I mean. It's kind of gross when drops start falling on your the first few times, but then you get used to it. 

The decor is pretty neat. One wall has a bunch of boom boxes pasted up. There are also some pictures of people doing double dutch. 

As for the prices, $4 pint of beer and $7 mixed I think. Pretty typical.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Love it, it's like a little slice of 80's Brooklyn!  I say go to this place when there's hardly anyone there and enjoy Darin's chili, like on a Monday night.  (Darin, next time I come I expect to see High Life and Frito Boats, and we're doing another Fernet shot!)  Not sure I'd like the place on a weekend when the Marina & B&T types infect the joint, but dug it tonight.  I PROMISE to get a Double Dutch tournament in there soon!!!

Oh, my 4 stars is because I'm sure this place has a much different vibe on weekends, and the one owner I talked to was drunk and a dick, so I have to dock a point for that.  If I lived closer I'd be in every day after work for sure though.
author: kerry l.

description:
You mean DOUBLE DOUCHE?!?

So I had been coming here for a couple of years starting in 2008 and the vibe was so cool and chill. I LOVED the 80's urban theme. The boom boxes and the wall paintings are hella cool. The crowd was once chill and slightly more ature (mid 20s to early 30s) which was perfect! 
But alas as with many spots in the mission this place has fallen victim to the general doucheiness that is infecting the area. The crowd now consist of wannabes, hipsters and dumb young kids out to get wasted and pass out. The bar (not club, but bar) is always packed to capacity and beyond, the people re difficult to bare, the drinks are okay at best, the music (which used to be good lots of throwbacks) now consist of more top 40. Its an utter disappointment! I never come to thins place unless its out of desperation and even then I think twice. Its not so bad on the weekdays but I dont go there anymore on the weekends!

Only perks now a days is no cover and they accept credit cards... thats the only good things I have to say. :(
author: Vero V.

description: I came here for some drinks, as part of a barhopping stop and ended up staying there because of the dope Hip Hop being played. I would say that this place is more of a lounge/bar. The dance floor is about a 15x15ft area with part of the floor being consumed by the DJ booth. The area has a real old school hip hop feel to it. There's old boomboxes that line the wall of one side of the bar/club and there are some really nice detail touches like the painted shelf of retro Jordan's by the dance floor. This was my kind of place. I think though if you're looking for something more upscale you'd be down on this, but COME ON this is the Mission, what do you expect. The beer's/mixed well drinks are reasonable and of course the ladies working the bar are Nice. What more can you ask from a chill time out.
author: Michael C.

description:
Great concept and excellent execution.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  They even smile a lot and seem to have a good time while they are there.  
Interesting decor that brings back a lot of memories.  The vintage boob box (pre CD) is a cool twist on the art.  The music was great and not deafening.  

I had a great time, will be back soon too.  

I see a lot of haters posting reviews on this place, what do you expect?  should they owners shell out $400,000 on decor?  It's the mission for Pete's sake!  Go back to the marina already.  as for the hater sisters... get real... you BOTH had to log in to slam the bartenders because of a simple billing error?  get over yourselves already.
author: Daten S.

description:
Way too crowded with people who are definitely NOT part of the hip hop-Misison scene.  But I don't blame Double Dutch for attracting the crowd.  

It still has cool style and good music.  We had a much better experience when we went in December and it wasn't as crowded.  It was a great place to go and dance with friends without having to pay cover or getting dressed up.  Can we do crowd control here? :)
author: Annie C.

description:
Wandering down 16th is like a candy shop for mission dwelling alcoholics... or people that just really like to go out and drink.  There are so many bars it is hard to make a choice.  Double Dutch is always one of my standards.  Reliably good music (often old school hip hop) and people watching.  Not only do they sneakers displayed in glass cases, but the clientle are often sporting great shoes as well.  I enjoy some quality, innovative sneakers.

Tuesdays are good.  Not too crowded.  Great music.  Live painting. $2 Budweisers and some shot special I can't remember.  I also like it on a Thursday but it tends to get super packed.  The bartenders are nice.  The people tend to be nice too.  The only downside is that the bathrooms suck... but, hey it is a dive bar on 16th.  Can't be too glamorous.
author: Zoe H.

description:
I've only been here once, but that Friday night we went, my friends and I had a blast.  It took about 5 minutes for this place to become a favorite of mine.

The first thing I noticed was the graffiti on the wall, which I thought was pretty neat.  I loved how they didn't play much mainstream hip-hop (Definitely not a big fan of the radio).  This place gave me a pretty good vibe too.  The crowd was mixed, and I didn't encounter any creepy guys.  The drinks were inexpensive, loved the wall covered with boom boxes, and  the fact that the bathroom walls were completely tagged up with paint markers, added to the joint's personality.

Never have I seen so many good looking guys in one place, in one night.  Points for that, for sure!
author: Sabrina G.

description: The bartenders here are assholes and don't know how to count their money. Both the male and the female. Came here on Saturday 11/10 and they were rude as hell. I don't remember what the female looked like but the dude was wearing a beret (unstylish as fuck). I'm never coming here again.
author: Andrew H.

description:
came here on a Friday (I think) and had a total blast. the dj KILLED it and the dancing was fantastic. only reason I'm not going for 5 stars is because it got so incredibly crowded at one point I thought I was gonna be crushed by the crowd. 

pretty good location because if you're not feeling it theres plenty of other places in the mission to check out. didn't pay much attention to the decor but theres a really awesome wall of boom boxes. come ready to get down on the dance floor or you probably won't be feelin it.
author: Georgia W.

description:
Uh let's see.  I stopped in for a bit of the Yelp event and the joint reeked like a men's locker room after a well played game.  Not that I have ever been in a mens locker room, but I imagine this is what one smells like.

I was impressed with the bar staff's level of service considering that they were mostly serving beer to a bunch of lushes.  They really kept it cool and the alcohol flowing.
author: Amy Z.

description:
I didnt get the "marina hipster" feel in this bar when I entered, so i was already happy about that.
The bartenders alone get 5 stars. They're young, hardworking, non-hating, easy going and great pourers.
When I came here it was planned to meet here with some folks from my work . So many co-workers of mine showed up and we had a blast till last call. It was pretty crowded for a thursday night and having to move from the front to back wasnt hard at all. What I mean is sometimes at bar or clubs people see that you are trying to pass through them or pass by them and they will look at you like"im not gonna move" or "you want me to move for you?" All it takes is for a person to take one step closer towards their friends and let you by.

I'll be back for sure and hopefully again the with my co-workers
The DJ Brian even kick some ass with his late 70's beats
Yes the bathroom is a little messy, with a whole lotta piss on the
floor. Im sure chics dont even sit on the seats of bars/clubs
that sucks and must be a whole lotta cleaning b4 you even do your thing, lmao
author: Andrew Z.

description:
:( I just wrote a super awesome review for you, Double Dutch, and it didn't get saved when I hit the Post It button. Ok, I will try my best to recreate my review...

RAD!
Where else could you...see a display case of Puma's, old school beatbox radios, lite brites, posters from the really really early 80's of kids playing double dutch and iconic oldschool rappers, not to mention play double dutch outside of the joint? PLEASE PM me if you know of another place, cuz I don't believe it for a second!

YOU DONE GOOD DOUBLE DUTCH, YOU DONE GOOD!
author: Jewel N.

description:
After reading reviews of this place on Yelp, not gonna lie, I was pretty excited to check it out.  It really seemed like it would be mind kind of bar.  So I got my dancing shoes on and prepped for a saturday night out on the town.  Unfortunately, it didn't fully live up to my expectations.

First and foremost, the place was simply way too overcrowded.  I'm all for a poppin' bar/lounge but when everyone and their mother violates you by simply walking by it's too much.  Secondly, the drinks weren't strong enough for my liking.  If I'm going to put up with the crowds and lines then I want a stiff drink, don't expect that here.

For its part, the music was pretty great.  The jams come one after another and lend themselves to spontaneous dance-offs (if you can find the space).  I'm not ruling this place out but the first time wasn't a charm.  Maybe better on a different night of the week?
author: Justin B.

description:
I went here last Friday and it was sooo much fun! It was my first time really going out in the Mission and I loved it! The music brought back old memories of middle school dances. The drinks were fairly priced and the crowd was really friendly.

I gave it 4 stars only because the bathrooms were creepy :/

Overall: Love the Dub Dutch
author: Anna F.

description:
Went here on my birthday celebration night and expected it to be waaay cooler than it was.  Although I was pretty drunk, I remember MC Hammer playing in the background.  Yeah, he's kinda cool but I guess I just wasn't feelin' it.  The bathroom sitch is pretty bad-it's in the middle of the dance floor and their both coed, tiny little things.   I ended up running into some friends there, which made the experience better, but in all, I'm expecting more from a place that tries to embody a social scene dedicated to the old school hip hop days.  
Of course I'm still going to give it another try...
author: lehua h.

description:
Some friends and I were looking for somewhere new to grab a beer, so we checked out Double Dutch last night around 10:30pm or so. There were a lot of people, but I've seen much more crowded places.

They checked IDs at the door, but there was no cover charge.  I was actually surprised that there was no cover because the place is like a miniature dance club, complete with leather seating hugging the wall with little tables that make you feel like you're in the VIP seating.
The neon chandeliers add to the quirky pseudo-dance club vibe.

$5 for a Blue Moon draft. I've suppose I've paid more for a beer in the city before, but that's still not a "welcoming" price for a draft.

I found the spot to be a cool compromise between people like me who prefer more laid-back pub settings and people like my roommate who like crowded bars with loud dance music. 

I'm never surprised when places are cash only in San Francisco, only when they don't have ATMs. Fortunately, Double Dutch has an ATM ($2.50 fee).

Worth checking out.
author: Ramsey D.

description:
This place is great for either hipsters or men from the marina who want to go to the Mission and get hand jobs from women they barely know.  

Otherwise, it is also a fairly average Mission bar that occasionally has some pretty awesome music.  I do kinda dig the 80's hip hop theme though.
author: Matthew H.

description:
It's kind of funny when a place makes an effort to achieve this old-school look, and you look around and realize, hey.  I'm OLD-SCHOOL.

Double Dutch is a Mission bar with a cool vibe (possibly cooler than their clientele, I think), good bartenders, and bumping grooves.  I can't say that it's really that different than other Mission bars, but it does what it does well.  

I enjoyed the walk down memory lane looking at the boom-boxes, original Air Jordans, and SIMON, the game.  I enjoyed my cognac, neat.  I enjoyed having room to stand and breathe, but I am not sure that is representative of this bar on a typical night.  I didn't enjoy being around 15 years older than everyone else, but that's my issue, not theirs.

The space is very narrow and gets crowded quickly, but there is room to dance at the back.  Except I doubt I would dance here, as I am more old-school 80's new wave than old-school hip-hop, but I can do a righteous head-bob with the best of them.  Preferably while sitting my ass down on one of the padded couches against the wall.

Overall, I liked the place and would go back when I am in the neighborhood.
author: Liz S.

description:
Me & mah crew find ourselves frequenting this place often, dunno why, maybe it's because we are constantly next door at Tokyo Go Go...
Because one of my boys know the folks in both places, we tend to go balls out when it comes to this combo and the only thing that is a sure thing EVERY time is that it's bound to get Scandalous!
Watch out!
We're the drunken crew doin' shots and taking mad pics..
author: Rose C R.

description:
I go out. A lot. Mostly in the SoMa scene.

Double Dutch will have me going to the Mission more often on weekends, however - at least for the start of a night.

Here's why:

1) Bartender was awesome. Remembered my groups' drinks and my tab.  Alwasy nice to be able to just give a motion indicating another round would be in order.
2) There are a large number of attractive women here. And they aren't bitches.  I can't remember the last time so many random girls just looked over and smiled during the course of one night.  And no, I'm not saying that b/c i'm some kind of "super-fly" guy...I just think the crowd was very friendly. It was a nice change from my SoMa based routine.
3) Very few dickhead guys.
4) Decent beats and a place to dance.
5) When you are twisted, those neon lights look so pretty...
author: Matthew R.

description:
Always have fun when I come here. Great mix of people. It's a mission crowd without being overly mission. If you're from SF you should understand that compliment.

Interesting mix of people, good music, and a lot of cool bars around it to bounce to.
author: Adam L.

description:
Came on a Tuesday night, just the right crowd, fun, chill, a little crazy and tipsy, but we could still converse and had a blast. 

The dance floor is not particularly big, and I could see it get crowded on weekends, comeon it's a good place on 16th St.! The restroom is all the way at the end of the place, you have to go through the dance floor, so it might be a little problematic when crowded...that's why we were there on a Tuesday night!

Drinks are nice and strong, the bartender is super cool. Love the benches! Oh the owner has a super sweet puppy that just decided to jump up the couch and nap next to me with her head on my lap. Loved it!
author: Yuchi C.

description:
For some odd reasons, I love this place.

The past few times I've been here with a group of friends including the bf, someone has tried to pick a fight with the bf and I'm the one who ended up with a black eye, but that's ok.

Good music, Chimay on tap, Jordans hangin from the ceiling.  And I love to jump rope.  No that you jump rope, but it's a total throw back to my playground show downs.
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Came here after Morac. The crowd was more of a hipster/yuppy mix. The music on point though fitting their hip hop decor. The dance floor was small, but we were still able to move with some room around us. Drinks were on point don't know how much they were because they were free. Probably would want to come back on a different night to see if the crowd would be the same, but overall "AIGHT" for a first time at this dive bar in the mission.
author: J B.

description:
Heading here tonight for a birthday party.  The birthday girl loves this place and you can usually find her, as well as her work crew, here on a Thursday or Friday.  I've only been to the spot once, and was not impressed.  It was a bit early on a Friday and the DJ had not yet arrived.  My "red" was too dry and there were a bit too many "hipsters" in the house.  We shall see what comes of this evening.

To be continued....

I wasn't too impressed with this bar.  I mean, the folks I ventured with were, of course, fun, but the drinks never quite "took me there," and the DJ was a bit off.  Needless to say, one of the best things about the night was the bartenders pooch.  I don't remember her name, but she was sweet and very well-mannered and trained.  Will I go back?  I'm not certain.
author: Felicia P.

description: I love the 90s throwback hits here.  They consistently have great music.  The dance floor is small though and it can get really crowded.  But the music always makes up for it.  It's a great place to go dancing without paying a cover.  I actually would prefer coming here to go dancing than paying a $10 cover for a swanky club with crappy music.  The crowd here is pretty fun and the bartenders are really nice.  Also, the interior is sick.  I love the neon kicks hanging from the ceiling and the boom boxes lined against the wall.  Reminds me of my childhood for sure.
author: Kimba V.

description:
Great, unpretentious little bar with lots of character!  The bartenders are super nice and the music rocks.  Don't make it here often, but always have a blast when I do.  Try to get one of the few tables against the wall, sit back and enjoy...

Minus 1 star because they have a minimum charge for credit card tabs.
author: Vicente G.

description:
Hmm... I was there on a recent weeknight and found the bartender very cool and amiable. Overall I liked it, but some of the clientele was just plain odd/obnoxious. I'll definitely give it another chance and I hope it finds its stride. It's on a great corner--far enough to feel I've left my neighborhood but close enough to get home in 20 minutes or so. Maybe offer pitchers of beer and/or no fruity cocktails? I don't know, but, I do wish them the best.

Okay, was there again last night. The bartender is really nice--went so far as to look up a drink I was talking about on the Internet and made me a damn fine one at that. Now, the clientele is a little more yuppie than most of the places I go, but I will say that they were all very cool and it was a live and let live kind of feeling. So, overall the place has gone up a star for me and I'd give it a 4.5 if I could.
author: Josh K.

description:
Obnoxiously, annoyingly crowded with weak drinks.

I sort of appreciated the decor, even if it looked like Spencer Pratt designed the wall art.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Double Dutch is a great spot. I love the vibe in this place. I went on a Tuesday night, and it was far from empty. The dance floor is fairly small, but the music was great. The DJ was playing mostly late 80s and 90s hip hop, I felt like I stepped into a different time period. 

The ambiance is the place is really cool, they have great art work of break dancers, and behind the DJ booth they have old school stereos plastered on the wall. The place definitely can get crowded, and its tough to make your way through the crowd. But the great music and atmosphere makes up for it. 

I really enjoyed my night at Double Dutch and I defiantly plan on checking this place out again.
author: Kenny C.

description:
Thursdays are what's up at Double Dutch.  This is the night when fellow Mission festival whores (like myself) get an early start to their weekend by getting absolutely shitfaced and dancing their asses off.  Double Dutch is a great place to do this.

I go because the DJs on Thursdays are my homies, and they spin disco.    

Last night, the disco brought out a trio of rather aggressive Italian male tourists wearing clothing from Hollister (obviously ignorant of the fact that you SHOULD NEVER WEAR HOLLISTER BECAUSE IT'S COMPLETELY TASTELESS CLOTHING.  DUH!).  I always carry a pair of obnoxious coke whore shades with me.  These guys would not leave me alone.  Every two minutes they demanded that I let them try on my sunglasses.  In addition, one fellow kept grabbing me around the waist, and i resorted to dancing quite dirtily with some boy i had just met so as to have protection from these creeps.

So aside from these obnoxious sons-of-bitches, I highly reccommend Double Dutch on a Thursday night.  I generally have a damn good time.
author: Crystal T.

description:
Is it hella crowded on the weekends? YES. Do you have to worry about getting shanked one street up? YES. Are the bathrooms coed and hella dirty? YES. Is Double Dutch still dope? YES! 

I love this place. Its got a cool, chill vibe even though its really packed. The bartenders take care of you. They use Dole Pineapple Juice, which is a big plus for my Crown and Pineapple (Don't knock it). The decor is awesome. Makes me wish I still had some of my old Puma's. I don't think I have ever paid cover either. Do they even charge cover? 

The music is hit or miss. I once went on an old school hip hop night and they were playing T Pain... weak. 

Another time, for a friends birthday, the ladies we were with met the bay's youngest creeper. It was actually pretty funny. Give him points for trying tho right?
author: Nick B.

description:
I like the bar keep's big black labrador that was there one time.  It was adorable, and it followed me to the bathroom after I gave it an awesome booty scratchin'.  I didn't know until my friends told me the dog wanted more until I got back, which I subsequently continued.

Anyways, I came here both as a starter to my mission/valencia bar travels, and also ended up here as the last stop in a bar hop. The bar gets super crowded but if you come at the right time, you should be able to justify the stop.  I like the 80's momentos of double dutchin' memorabilia that adorn the walls, and it brings me back to the days of the Breakfast Club and hightops.
author: Alfred Y.

description:
The first time I came here, I tooooore up the dance floor (as I do).  The next time they were playing SOLELY old school and also the time after.  I appreciate old school, but I like to mix in some booty shaking songs also. 

Logistics:
Crowd: Pretty diverse
Music: Hip-Hop, old school
Drinks: Thrifty in the alcohol
Also, I have the best luck with parking whenever I come here.
author: Josie A.

description: I liked the atmosphere here, but the drinks suck so much. I asked the bartender what he suggested and he said a gimlet. The gimlet he gave me was the worst gimlet I have ever tasted. It tasted like a crappy lemon drop. I would be skeptical of coming here, but maybe I'll give it a second chance
author: Stephanie L.

description:
The dynamic at Double Dutch last night was odd - there were obviously two groups of people in the bar... the further away you were from the front door, the less 'look at me' it felt.

Agree with all previous reviewers that the decor's funky, music pretty good and the bartenders were super friendly & efficient. But the crowd... I just cannot pinpoint it other than feeling like the cardigan wearing set wanting to be naughty this Friday night and chose to hang out at the Mission bar.

Definitely a good venue to boogie on down (dance floor placed as far away from front door as you can get) - met some pretty cool people and had a good time. Drinks were reasonable ($4 for a wheat beer) in comparison to city prices.

To be fair this bar was marked down largely due to things they cannot control. But what they COULD'VE controlled is the cleanliness of the restrooms... someone puked in the sink and that person's 'dinner' was left in the sink all night. Come on guys, surely that's against OH&S?

Verdict - not one to rave about, not one to rule out either.
author: Joyce L.

description:
Cool atmosphere, and music reminiscent of a hip hop party from the 80s to the early 90s???????  Hip hop sorta environment.  My preppy Midwestern boyfriend stood out, but it was fun regardless.  

Bathroom is gross though. Don't go, I almost threw up walking in there.  

Everything else though was fine.
author: Denise B.

description:
Hmm. I give two stars if it is really suppose to be a late 80s/early 90s hip-hop themed bar. The decor certainly suggested that this was the case, but the music told a different story. The mix of Guns N Roses, Lynard Skynard and Ciara while interesting, was not hip-hop.  But maybe I'm just tragically old skool...

If ,however it is suppose to be chill bar where you can go to have a good time like you used to at dimly lit college frat parties, I increase my star rating to 4!
author: Gray S.

description:
One of the better spots in the Mish in the sense that it doesn't smell like a mixture of cat piss and armpit. The dance area in the back is cramped and the music is run of the mill. The only distinguishing feature is the decor which is pretty cool with its neon chandelier. 

Its dark and has alcohol. If these are your only two requirements - and for that is often the case, then this is the place for you. 
P.S. Gyros down the street within stumbling distance is an added plus
author: Stacy T.

description:
Heard about the opening through my DailyCandy emails. Nice vibe, good music, with a mixed crowd of casual and trendy folks (and a handful of younger just-turned-21 folks too). When we got there around 11, people were already drunk as hell dancing their asses off to some fresh old school hip-hop beats. In the back, a well-ventilated patio serves as a hangout for the smokers (or people who don't want to dance and deal with the crowded bar). The lounge has white walls decorated with bboy photos and ceiling with tacky neon chandeliers. Service at the bar was quick, though they didn't have any more of my beer of choice. Boo.

It's pretty well-lit for a bar/lounge (I'm not too used to seeing people's faces so clearly) and the bar area gets really packed, and all you have is a narrow walkway with a couple couches on the side. People just end up standing around and you can't really move anywhere, until you suddenly realize it's actually a line for the restrooms (not good placement of the banos).

I don't really know what I thought of this place. I have no strong feelings for it (therefore, it gets a neutral 3-stars). It's supposed to be a hip-hop inspired bar, so I'll have to hit it up in a couple of weeks to see how it's turned out and maybe change my review, if need be.
author: Zell C.

description:
I have only been to double dutch once and I really was not impressed.   

Granted, the music is pretty nostalgic, but the place is so over crowded that you can barely move and then it begins smelling like sweaty people. So if you like the smell of other peoples' sweat...
author: E-dough R.

description:
Meh. A Marina crowd coming to immerse themselves in the "oooh FAKE retro-ness suppose to pass as hip" atmosphere. 
Their music was bad too-- where can I find a real good hip hop joint in the city??? The dance floor was also tiny as this is really a long bar with a tiny room that pretends to be a dance floor which is also right next to the stinky bathrooms. Only thing I liked was the neon chandeliers.
author: Empress C.

description:
Great bar....and definite plus that they had breakdancing on the TV!  OMG - the breakdancers are awesome!!!!  By the way, I came here on a Tuesday so the bar wasn't as packed as it would be on a weekend.

There was also a girl painting in the corner - you could buy raffles tickets to win the painting.  I didn't partake, but thought it was a cool idea.
author: Megan H.

description: Holy Crap! This place rocks! Girls dancing everywhere, dope DJ's. This is what I wan't when I come to a hip hop club. We came out on a Wednesday night and I was blown away by the music and just the atmosphere in general.
author: James P.

description:
Jump, jump. Jump, jump...to another bar.

Very nice staff. Layout is definitely for a standing crowd. Great for grabbing an early drink but as Phil M mentioned, it gets too packed on peak nights. Not particularly memorable as a venue, however...some friends and I realized we had been there previous times with it being Double Dutch. Have to agree with the college party feel.
author: Tanya P.

description:
I'm pretty sure Double Dutch is the embodiment of the Mission in a certain way.  The theme seems to be of the urban/hip-hop variety.  The walls are covered in faux graffiti, hip hop videos and break dance competitions play on the flat screens, big pictures of what look like mid-90's rappers and the like are plastered on the walls.  The only thing is, this place is so far from gritty urban scene it isn't even funny.

Much like how the Mission is full of hipsters wishing to be surrounded by urban grittiness but not really wanting to ACTUALLY participate in any of it (I think the big, fancy apartments, the pressed shirts and $200 jeans make you anything but gritty urban), Double Dutch an urban paradise, minus the grittiness and all the negative things that make 'urban' what it really is.

It's basically a bunch of people milling about in their 'I didn't think about this outfit at all' (but spent hours assembling it and a fortune buying it) kind of way, trying to talk to each other but not hearing anything over the blaring music (which, by the way, wasn't rap, ironically).  It's dark and cramped, so nobody is dancing, just milling.  This place falls squarely into my 'doesn't know whether to be a dance club or a bar' kind of place that I really don't like.

Even still, it was worth two stars since the bar tender was nice, fast, and responded quickly (I didn't have to wait long at all, he took people in the order they came, not based on the amount of cleavage they have).  That and the pint of Guinness I ordered was poured just right.  Besides the drink though, largely unimpressed.
author: Eric M.

description: One of my favorite places to dance in SF! Great music...the DJ usually spins throwback R&B/Hip-Hop. I've been here twice for girl's nights (both Saturdays) and we always have a ball. I'd say it deserves 4.5 stars since it gets so hot and sweaty in here. Get here early to get a table and enjoy drinks because after 11, this place is packed from wall to wall. It's a pretty small venue, but it typically hosts a pretty good crowd. I'm not a huge fan of the bars in the Mission, but I LOVE Double Dutch. The doorman is always friendly and I believe there are in-and-out privileges. Writing this review has me thinking I'm due for a trip out to the Mission soon!
author: Seanté B.

description: So I heard they play some decent hip-hop here... But it sounded more like top40 with just a hint of  some underground hip-hop last weekend. I'll give it one more try though sometime. I was disappointed, to say the least, with the music though.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Used to like this place now its really crowded and hot inside and don't have enough room to dance. Seriously, $5 cover charge!!!! I still like inside decor with old school radios drinks prices are reasonable
author: Ryan R.

description:
Out with the old loungey / dirty / creepy ass Cama, in with the new /hip-hop / breaker boy / New York style / boom box decor that is the new Double Dutch!

Co-owner's Mike G., who also owns Magnet in North Beach, and Darrin really have it, what a great idea for an SF local bar!  The bar is not the type of place you walk into and are immediately filled with any strong impression, I don't think they wanted it like that, but it is the kind of place that gets more exciting the further back you go.  The dance floor is a good size, good enough for my toe-touch headspins at least, and last Thursday the DJ was serving up some real nice old school beats that would've made Bea Arthur boogie down to the beat.  

Along with the DJ booth being laden with boom boxes, the rest of the place has some really cool pictures of old school break dancers.  There is even two light-brights, a couple of rubics cubes, and a Simon game strategically placed on the liqour shelf.  The place is just waiting for Mike D from the beastie boys to roll up in there and be like "Damn, this place is DOPE!" 

I think it's safe to say you'll find me at Double Dutch a lot from now on.  I've been waiting for a bar besides 500 Club that I can call home.  500 Club comes close, but alas, I'm not as punk rock as I thought.  Double Dutch has a very chill feeling without being too dirty (Casanova) or Mission-y (Kilowatt) - which both places I still like (3 stars-ish) for the record. 

I'm giving it four stars, they could've earned five had they not offered us homemade Chili last night and made me vomit in my mouth a little at possibly eating Chili at a bar. Chili is a whole other review, I have issues with the fact that there are just too many ways for Chili to suck.

five exclusive, dictatorship my reviews, stars for rocking my world every day of the week even when there's a greasy hipster serving drinks. thanks, will do. i'm on it.
author: Kelly H.

description:
On a recent visit to San Francisco, I was staying with a friend in the Mission and she took me here.

Not knowing the whole theme beforehand, I walked in and thought, um, am I back in Brooklyn? The music was sooo Williamsburg hipster, in a good way (never thought I'd say that, LOL). But maybe it was just this particular bartender's iPod on a random Monday night that made it seem that way.

I took a look at the photos on the wall -- scenes of old school hip hop, kinda like Ricky Powell but less portraiture. Hmm, looks like New York... yep, that's definitely a picture of a New York subway car.

Asked the bartender who the photographer was. Some dude from Brooklyn, he said. A-ha.

I was digging the place. Not because it reminded me of Williamsburg, but for the same reason I like certain Williamsburg bars -- good music and cheap drinks (for what I'm used to) and enough style to give the place some character without being stylized. So, maybe it's not Brooklyn from the 80's, but it is kinda Brooklyn now. Total neighborhood hipster bar.
author: Edwin C.

description:
A little less than a year ago, I was really feelin' this place.  The crowd was great, the music was fun and it wasn't as packed as it gets now.  For some reason now it's either dead or packed solid.  I love the decor with the "double dutch" photos, the Lite-Brite, and the florescent chandeliers.  Did I mention they make mojitos...sometimes....when they feel like it?  

Look for an updated review, I haven't been in a while.
author: Kerry D.

description:
I've been here a few times now and I think it's really grown on me! I love the music (Ini Kamoze and Dr. Dre all in one night?) and the Lite Brites on display. The dance floor is a little cramped, but it's less sketchy than the Skylark one. 

Bottom line: The drinks are strong and the ghetto blasters are in full force
author: lindsay w.

description:
I went here the Wednesday before Thanksgiving.  Why, I don't know.  My drinking partner suggested it.  Well, I'll tell you one thing.  I lurrrve the decor.  It is very good looking.

However, the clientele has GOT. TO. GO.  Goddamn.  The drunker I got, the more confused I got about whether or not I was in the Marina.  Seriously, sometimes I think bars should have doorguys just to keep the douches out.  It was a douche spectacular up in there.  

That said....I'd like to give it another chance.  The bartender was sweet and cute, even though I wasn't that enamored with my martinis.  Maybe on a different night the Marina contingent would stay where they belong.  Maybe.
author: Coco D.

description:
Double Dutch was jammed to the rafters with friendly people enjoying each other's company. The first thing I noticed as I walked in were five or six beautiful women walking out.  Fortunately, there were still plenty left inside. The second thing I noticed was the wonderfully unified and colorful decor and the blasting hip hop and mash-ups. Vibrant tags on the wall? Sweet! Photos of bombers and ghetto blasters? Love it!

The crowd was definitely less Mission than I expected given its across the street neighbor Gestalt, however that's not to say the crowd wasn't diverse.  Marina transplant in designer jeans and ubiquitous striped button-down? Check. Indie hipster in skinny jeans and obscure band's shirt? Check. People from everywhere in between having a phenomenal time? Check, Check, and Check! 

The only downside to the wide range and variety of interesting, fun people was the total lack of elbow room and personal space of any kind.  Double Dutch is small! Some sort of ventilation would be lovely too. That place gets HOT!

The barstaff were attentive and efficient. Despite a packed house and a pretty crowded bar, I didn't wait more than a minute or two for someone to take my order.

The drinks were rather disappointing.  General thought seems to hold that a gin and tonic is relatively easy to make, yet Double Dutch isn't quite on board yet.  

Despite less than stellar beverages, I had a blast at Double Dutch and will be back for sure, though perhaps on a less crowded night!
author: Zachary S.

description:
When you hear Living on a Prayer as you're getting your ID checked at the door, you know you're in for a good time.  Overall, a fun crowd and good pop music, though it would be nice if the DJ played a song for more than 30 seconds before switching it up.  What's up with that?  I was just getting my groove on.  I do like the boombox wallpaper though, awesome.

Plus an extra star for having a selection of Hangar One, my new boyfriend.
author: Yasmine G.

description:
Double Dutch is grimy, packed and hot. On the flip side, it's a fantastic place to come to dance and the DJs always mix some great tunes. On the nights the DJs aren't spinning, old school hip hop abounds.

If you can put up with the negative things, Double Dutch is a great place to let loose on the weekend. I guarantee you'll leave happy.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Like this place.

Good atmosphere. Seemed like a watered-down nostalgic hole when I first came here.

This is the only 80's bar I've been to with actual toys on the wall, like Lite-Brite and S.I.M.O.N. Awesome set-up. Not too busy, but still lively.

The bartender was real friendly too. Highly recommended.
author: Alexander D.

description:
On the weekends this place CAN be Marinaesqe (NO OFFENSE) but just not my first choice UNLESS I've just broke up with my girlfriend, and I'm with my obnoxious high-school buddies, and all I can think about is getting ASS with my collared shirt on.

Like I said, not my first choice but I'll admit it happens from time to time!

$2 dollar OLYMPIA'S, stiff drinks, and the occasional perfect mix of crowd, crowdedness, and music...........  HIGH RISK = HIGH REWARDS!
author: Justin C.

description: Too crowded on weekends! The music is ok. I just hope that this place was a little bit bigger but still not bad if u love dancing and sweating at the same time.
author: E-lie P.

description:
Music = B- (club hop pop) I was hoping for mixes of local artists or bay area hyphy. Not hur

Establishment = Durrty but fun with a decent dance space but no room for anything else. Good luck making it to and from the bar to the dance floor

Location = PERFECT! Taquerias, liquor stores, semi-fine dining, more bars, lounges near valencia and guerrero. Freakin sweet!
author: Jedi H.

description: Double Dutch is pretty awesome. The atmosphere is great, it has graffiti on the walls of the dance floor, and the wall near the bar is made of old boom boxes. The dance floor is small, but they play great music. It definitely gets packed here, but worth it.
author: lottie t.

description:
The bartenders are good. They're actually pretty efficient for the amount of people that are there. 

The music is all old-school hip hop, which will attract people in their late 20's to early 30's. 

I'm 27 years old right now. And I HATE young people. They're fuckin annoying. Especially people who wear long tee's. "Hey retard! You look like you're wearing a dress!"

Very glad that the "hyphy movement" is dead now. It was annoying as fuck.

I would come back to this place. There were a lot of cute girls there.
author: Chris K.

description: Standard (decent) Mission bar. Really deserves 2.5 stars, but I'll round up since I *think* the walls surrounding their tiny dance floor are covered in some kind of glow-in-the-dark paint that always makes me feel like I'm tripping balls.
author: Leo K.

description:
Went on Friday night.  It was a schizophrenic experience.  Nice place up until about 10-11pm when droves of obnoxious ppl begin to swarm in.  The music is also fantastic up until this point, it turns from \ old school hip-hop and R&B to top 40 trash unfortunately.

The decor is cool, the wall opposite of the bar is lined with old ghetto blasters, decent selection of beers and strong gin and tonics.

Overall an OK experience, two more stars if the early evening vibe was carried through the whole night.  Good to hop out of by 10p at the latest.
author: Ryan F.

description:
Went to Double Dutch on Friday, really tried to like the place.  I like the decor, but I thought that it was weird that a bar with an early 80s old school theme would play very little music from that era (the DJ, while decent in the mash up department, could have been playing at any generic bar in the city).

I like the separation of the dance floor from the bar (seems obvious, but a lot of places don't do this, and it's fucking annoying when you're trying to get a drink and some drunken uncoordinated posse keeps flailing into your personal space).  I don't like the aforementioned bathroom next to the dance floor, which is a gigantic flaw in bar design.

Service is erratic.  Sometimes the drinks would roll out in two minutes, sometimes in twenty.  I know, it's Friday, but I wanna drink, and California's closing time means I need to drink fast.

The place is packed.  There were a ton of people standing on the sideline of the dance floor (I hate this, either dance or get out of the way, stop leering and doing nothing), the area behind the bar was not much better.  A surprising number of older persons here (fortyish and fiftyish).  A fairly attractive crowd.  Seems mostly like non-Mission folks.

All in all: the place has potential, but the weekend hassle is a drag.  This could be a solid Wednesday night spot.
author: David C.

description:
This isn't cama anymore?  Guess I missed the boat on that one.  This place will always be somewhat special, as I had my first date with my girlfriend here.  Looks sort of different on the inside now , but not a whole lot.  Some pics of break dancing on the walls, but other than that, I didn't really get a hip hop or old school vibe.  

I did like the fact that a friend and I could walk in here at 10 pm on a Saturday night, get a drink fairly quickly, and actually have a conversation.  Though that might not bode well for business.
author: James M.

description:
I heart this bar. Why don't we have places like this on the east coast?!
The decor was totally rad (old school boom boxes, sneakers, graffitti) and the Dj was killing it. We danced the night away here...love it!
author: molly f.

description:
The dvd of guys breaking against each other kept my attention for at least half an hour.  

Minus a star for the bathroom line being in the dance floor.
author: Don B.

description:
I love the atmosphere of Double Dutch.  It has a great decor, good music, and the drinks are always strong.
Sometimes it gets a little crowded on the weekend, but that's what elbows are for!
author: Jordan D.

description:
I can only vouch for this place when it comes to private parties.  We had a company holiday party here last year and it was really fun!  Good DJ, amazing bartenders, loved the old school vibe, we brought tons of Little Star Pizza and cupcakes (does life get any better?!?)...it was a great time.  A tad on the small side, but do-able for a crowd of 100 or so...otherwise me gets claustrophobic.

I guess the only reason it doesn't get 4 stars is that I just don't feel like outside of a private party, this is a place I'd want to hang out at on a regular basis.  
Bummer, because the location is brilliant!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I've only come here on a Friday or Saturday night, so I can't say much about the other days.  Parking is almost non-existent.  You just gotta be aggressive and swoop in on the first space you see.  

 Around 10ish or 11, this place gets packed to the gills with a mixture of people who are ready to bust a move.  It gets so crowded, that its ridiculous.  Its because of this place, I've managed the art of the shoulder-pat where I've had to get people's attention to move out of my way.  I did this to some guy, while he was talking to this woman.  He looked pretty pissed.  Dude, if I ruined your game I'm sorry.  

Their price of alcohol is no different from most other establishments around the Mission area, but they sure are strong.   And they have a make-shift dance area which is pretty small due to the crowds.  That's not cool when you're someone waiting in front of the bathroom, in the middle of the dance floor.  But they also play some good music that I hadn't heard in years.
author: Chan L.

description:
double dutch = :\

-the music here is not bad, they play alot of old school hip hop, and mash up some top 40s for a couple of seconds. but definitely danceable music.

-the crowd.. once you walk in, everyone is in their own little circles, and there's nothing wrong with that except they all block the freaking way to the dance floor. its gets really crowded and really hard to move around..

-drinks are strong. A+

-the whole set up of the place is pretty odd IMO, it congests feet traffic to the dance floor or the bar and that's what i hate about double dutch, the interior is sooo skinnnny.

definitely not a place you wanna spent your whole night in, but a great place to start and once it gets crowded.. stumble your drunk self to skylark for some serious hip hop.
author: Alex C.

description:
Hot as hell inside (you can barely breathe when you first step in), but love it for what it is. Its a small space with plenty of seating both up and down the bar and along the walls. Booths are comfortable, music is bangin' and crowd is friendly. Bathrooms scared us a bit though because they were labeled unisex and there were only two of them. 

I would have given it 4 stars until I saw the bartender wipe vomit off the table, not knowing it was vomit at first, but still wiping after she realized what it was and set the towel back down behind the counter. Ewwww
author: Candy C.

description:
This was probably the best bar around the Mission scene. I went to a few others, and felt a lil out of place. 
   The bar was a little small, but adorned in a hip-hop theme, with posters of breakdancers from the 80's, glass cases with 80's basketball shoes, and a wall of OG boomboxes. I thought this place was pretty cool just by looking around. The people were a diverse crowd of 20-40 somethings of all walks of life. The music was raw hip-hop from the 80's to the present. The drinks were cheap, and the bartenders were prompt. 
   If you are in the Mission, and want to get a drink at a bar, and like hip hop, this would be your place. Only downside about this place, is how puny it is.
author: rich s.

description:
Drinks are reasonable, lines for the bathroom weren't too long, plenty of places to put your stuff down, good music, fun dance floor, cute bartenders...the only thing negative, is that when it gets crowded with sweaty bodies...it's like a sauna in there!  

Fun place to go on New Year's Eve - dj played "We are the Champions" after midnight and the whole bar sang along - the place had a good vibe, overall.
author: Tabatha Y.

description:
See, here's the thing...

I really liked Cama. A lot of people hated it, but I loved it. They served this drink called "the insolent" that just rocked my whole freakin world...and I am a picky drinker, so it was like a big deal that I found a drink I loved at Cama...but then Cama closed, and Double Dutch opened...

So, naturally, I went to Double Dutch in a pathetic effort to like try to relive my memories of Cama...and needless to say, it didn't work. I WANTED to like it, you know, I thought that going there might help ease and sooth the pain and hurt...but it didn't...

I'm telling you...It was like a mercy fuck gone wrong...so sad.

Yeah...but on the real tip, I actually had a halfway decent time the night I went because we ran into my boyfriend's old co-worker, and she was really cool, and she also gave me mad props for wearing white leather, which I thought was nice.
author: Shannon R.

description:
I have been tryin to hit this place up on Tuesday nights for sometime now, finally decided to make my way over there..last night!
I am glad i did. Mixed crowd, from hip-hop heads to rockers, and everyone seemed to be having a good time. People were chatting, dancing and there was live painting going on as well.
The beats were fresh, i heard everything from "back that ass up" to old schoooool hip-hop, can we say "that girl is poison?" :]
i was impressed by the decor of the place though, old school boom boxes on the walls, limited edition nikes and vans mounted on the walls!!! i mean, come on...if that ain't fresh...i don't know what is. right?
photos of people break-dancing from back in the day..good stuff!
;]
Mad graffiti pieces on the wall as well, oh and get this-
CRUSH GROOVE playing on the TV!! WHAAATT!! old school!!!

Good times had by all..see you there Tuesday nights for their drink specials and free cover!
author: Yasmin R.

description:
Yet another chill lounge to hit up in the mission. Pretty on-par with Skylark, Medjool, and Elbo if not one-up. Maybe I like it here better because it's new to me, I've only heard of it recently. After it being suggested by friends, went for the first time this past Saturday for a birthday.

Relative to its size, there's lots of room to sit at the bar and booths. The drink prices are standard. Small dancefloor, and it can get crowded- I was a little irritated at people who pushed through us to get a space. 

The restrooms are NASTY (not in the cool way). Probably the worst I've seen in the mission. Swampy. Let's just say I was thankful to be wearing heels. Yuck. 

If you  can avoid that, then the one thing I really, really, really like is the decor suited to its double dutch bus-ey theme. Very retro and funky! Of course, great old school hip hop, dance hall and new tunes to groove to. Graph art on the walls, a case with vintage sneakers (I wanted to steal the pair of blacknpurple cheetah pumas danget), and a collection of nice looking old school cassette boom boxes above the dj booth. Hot.

Check it out if you want something different than the usual hit-ups on 16th. 

Dirty dogs after on me!
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
Wow, who knew there was a place in the Universe that sold Olympia? For two dollars!? Totally awesome. I used to go here when I drank hard alcohol (those days are long gone), now I will go back for the Olympia deliciousness. I will be back, indeed.
They have super fast service (even when it is way crowded). The bartenders are friendly, the clientele is mostly legit. The doorman is super funny.
Dance floor is a bit small but, if you're crafty, you can bust moves wherever your little heart desires.
go!
author: Meghan B.

description:
Love the Vibe of this place. 

Very young and hip crowd.  

Affordable drinks.  The bartenders are nice

The DJ is tight, she mixed a lot of old school hip hop classics which is a lot different from other Top 40 crap other bars play.

My only knock is its a little too small to dance for my taste
author: Christopher L.

description:
hottness: lite brite and simon says 

I had an okay time, but overall, it was just an average bar, hence, the neutral rating. drinks were average, music was good, but could have been better...

I'm not totes impressed, but I'll probably give it another shot, they do have a lite brite and all..
author: Natalie C.

description:
I went here this past Saturday with a bunch of my female friends, and one guy, and we all had a blast. It is a tiny place, but the music is great, the boom box wall behind the DJ booth is awesome, and there is a great mix of people here. 

The place was packed, but it never took me more than 5 minutes to get a drink. Bartenders are fast and attentive. 

I definitely will come here again! Granted, I was a little drunk while here, but I don't think that would change my review =)
author: Nicole K.

description:
Went to this place after Delirium, and for me it was a nice little break from the hipster, scenester, shit that's going down all over the place. 

It was kinda marina esque... well, i guess the people were kinda marina esque, which to me was okay. The girls were cute (way cuter than those dirty hipster girls at delirium). and the guys weren't douche-ish, so that was a plus. 

The music was definitely the highlight for me. They had a female DJ which was a plus. She played alot of cool shit, mostly  hip hop, but she threw in some jackson 5, some Prince, and some older Biggie. Like I said, it was a nice break from delirium and the 80s shit that's going down over there. By the way, if I hear "come on eileen" one more fucking time at delirium, I'm gonna shoot somebody. I like 80s music, but fuck, mix some other shit in too. 

Drinks were cool. they had $2 beer special, which is cool with me. Olympia, I think. It definitely got the job done. 

Definitely a place to go AFTER you go somewhere shittier. I wouldn't start the night here though. 

oh. and the chandeliers were cool.
author: Lawrence A.

description:
I like this place. 80's hip hop. I own the dance floor when Kid n' Play comes on. Oh la Oh La Ehh!

Good smokers patio. Decent eye candy, although I hate hipsters so being on Valencia and 16th is a good way for me to enter the hipster twighlights zone. Hipsters aside, this is a fun place and you can party with friends and enjoy the 80's hip hop i nonomous theme. 

Also good tapas place next door that I am forgetting them name of. And at 1am on Saturday night there is a mexicano "cat dog" vendor serving up mean cat dogs across the street. I call these cat dogs because of my concern for the origin of the meat, although when I am 8 jack rocks deep, I will pound a cat dog.Meow. Gato.
author: D M.

description:
This bar has gone through many owners, and if finally seems that they've got it right.

I went there on a  Friday night and had a great time!

My friend and I sat at the bar and ordered drinks, before we knew it,  the bartender striked up a conversation with us.  He seemed genuinely interested in getting to know his clientele.  He was also very excited about the bar since he is part owner. There was great customer service here, something that is truly lacking in a lot of restaurants, bars etc.

Now to the drinks, my whiskey sour was good, stiff but not too stiff and the best part is the bartender gave both my friend and I a free lemon drop shot... can't go wrong with that!!

The decor is really cool, an 80's theme and the crowd is fun but not  the 20's crowd of other bars.

This place is great to hang out and have some drink with friends and let the good times roll.
author: Michi R.

description:
Fuck you double dutch! Ive been a loyal customer for a couple weeks now, dropping hundreds of dollars on liquor and the one night i get a little too wasted you cut me off in front of all my friends!
You must've mistaken me for some rookie who would know no better than to just come whimpering back with my tail between my legs! Ill be taking my business to Bruno's where i can enjoy jumping jazz and southern-style cuisine inside a romantic lounge.  FUCK OFF DOUBLE DUTCH..
author: Kyle B.

description:
on the day i went, this place would have been super awesome if they told 1/2 of the people to GET OUT.

bathroom by the dance floor? what up with that?

great decor, great location, and super cool hipster loving font/neon sign.



thanks to double dutch i know what it's like to be a cattle in those non-neiman ranches.
author: Ameer N.

description:
All you Yelpers have it right. This place is what a bar SHOULD be. Totally chill, great music (old/new school hip-hop), decent drinks, no cover, diverse crowd. I ended up there last night after being forced to go to Medjool's first and am happy to report that DD saved my night from being another one of those lame nights. Yeah, the bathrooms are pretty nasty, but I've seen worse. 

And the only reason I'm writing a review is so I remember to go back!
author: Veronica S.

description:
When you don't have plans and your near by this place is off the chain! This is the spot where we wound up on my birthday and New years eve 07. The tunes were Old skool circa the late 80's & all about the 90's! 
My girl Lynne & I danced and partied like it was 1999!  The house was packed, and we were up by the front because the dance floor was mad crowded so we made our own right where we were. As people walked by and saw us jammin they came in to check it out!  The drinks were on point, but with crowds you always have to wait. I might check this place out one more'gain!
author: Aisha M.

description:
I went here this past Tuesday for an Art Now Hosted event....
Double Dutch hosts a live painter every tuesday night, and they post it up in the front next to the huge mirror, and whilst you sip away at your beer or cocktail or whatev, you get to see the creative process of different San Francisco artisians.   nice combo i'd say!!!
author: sarah f.

description:
Took a friend visiting from the east coast here to meet up with some artsy fartsy friends from the east bay who like to paint and such. We all had fun. The music is very urban. and they had some kind of art projects going on that night. Not sure what that was all about. The place is small so when you hit the "dance floor" you are pretty much grinding up on everyone in the bar. But hey, who doesn't like to make new friends?

The drinks are reasonably priced, from examining the credit card bill the next morning. They had this one specialty shot thing that was an eerie green color, like coolant green. Can't think of the name as we had hit a few of the dive bars around the area beforehand so we were all slightly inebriated by the time we got to meet the bartender at this particular establishment, but it was strong and tasty.

Also, we bumped into some people we haven't seen since middle school, which was strange, and we witnessed a gang fight out on the street. Actually, it could have just been some people drunk-wrestling but gang fight sounds so much more exciting so let's go with that.

In conclusion, this is the place to be if you like art so much you'd enjoy people actually painting as a backdrop to your drinking strangely colored things as you rub elbows with strangers and bump into old acquaintances while gangs quarrel over territory boundaries outside. Good times.
author: Erk R.

description:
I went on a Saturday night and apparently it was hip-hop night. The DJ was horrible. Its as if he had just learned how to spin earlier that day. After he felt like one song had been playing long enough (10 seconds) he stopped the song (and I mean dead stop) and played another one. Not really the best way to get people in the mood to dance...and that's if you can find somewhere to dance. This place is small to say the least and the only way to go to the bathroom is through the dance floor- thus alot of pushing and shoving.

Drinks are ok and the crowd was a nice mix.
author: Manny V.

description: Came out on saturday.....still waaay too weird smelling, sweaty, and crowded...luckily we only stayed for 5 minutes.
author: Kelley N.

description: This place was bumpin. Great dj playing all around hip hop jams from the 90's to current hits. Def had a bomb time. Plus there was no cover. Had a real cool wall made of boom boxes to boot. Def coming here again next time I'm in SF
author: Pol S.

description:
This was my first visit to Double Dutch.  I had been here when it was Doctor Bombay's and wasn't crazy about it - but DD is cool.

The music made me, an "I don't dance" type, actually dance.  A litttle.  I think.  Anyway....

The bartender was incredibly cool, and, despite the massive work overload for him, kept the drinks coming quickly.  He was clearly not prepared for the crowd and worked his ass off.

We'll be back.
author: Annie C.

description:
My god this place has gotten packed since it first opened. I was spilled on by a rude Asian guy and his sidekick, who was trying to play smooth operator to every XY chromosome present. Jager no less. Jager is brown! They should keep these obnoxious people out.

My first two experiences of double dutch when it was casual cool and plenty o' room to romp around were fantastic. great service. great music. crowds and obnoxious people who should have been kept home were at bay.

I don't think i will be going back. sorry.
author: Kat C.

description:
UPDATE (12/6/07)
this place is definitely my new fave.  definitely your "once a week let's meet and grab drinks" spot.  since my last review, they've put up a full wall graffiti mural and added DJs 7 days a week.  have since been on the weekends (it's crowded and the music is not as good), but it's still reliable.  have met more of the bartenders, and each one of them is great.  the standout though is owner darin.  the guy is great...remembers your name, your drink, always says wassup...honestly...he makes you feel like this is YOUR bar.  shit...that's exactly what he said to us last night.  you get a bit of that "marina in the mission" crowd, but go with friends...you'll always get a spot at the bar, bob your head and have a good time

ORIGINAL REVIEW (12/5/06)
loving it.  another place to hear some great music and chill.  i'd never been to cama, so i can't comment if this place is an up or downgrade, but i really like i.  i've only been during the week (tues, thurs), but it's never been too crowded, nor felt empty.  bartenders have been super attentive, and the crowd has seemed down to earth.

the real kicker is the music though.  when i heard the place had an 80's hip hop theme, i had to check it out.  from the montage of boomboxes behind the DJ, to the old Jordan's hanging over the bar, to murals of breakers, this place definitely sets that stage.  the music is classic throwback hip hop with little clearchannel bullshit.  i have no idea what this place is like on the weekend, but if you want to bob your head, hang with friends, and get a drink or two, this place is not a bad option at all...
author: Terence M.

description:
Ok, this place gets two stars for two reasons.

The wall behind the DJ booth is completely covered with old school boom boxes. +1

A person I met here told me that I was going to lose my job, become homeless, contract a horrible disease and jump of the Golden Gate to end it all.  What a pickup line....  - 4

If you like to dance in a really small, crazy packed, poorly lit space... or if you want your fortune told by some crazy chick, go for it!
author: Kyle R.

description:
Weirdo #1:   So what's your last name?
My friend:   Aronowitz.
Weirdo #1:   So is that like Italian?
My friend:   Indeed.
Weirdo #1:   So, does that mean you drive a Camaro and shit?

Fun recount over brunch the next morning A.


Me:   So what do you do?
Weirdo #2:    I play the sax in some bands.
Me:   That's cool.  Like what kind of bands?
Weirdo #2:    I actually play backup for a lot of famous pop singers.
Me:   Hm, like which ones?
Weirdo #2:   [Blank stare.  See wheels turning. Roll "Man this girl is not nearly drunk enough" in head.]

Fun recount over brunch the next morning B.


So yeah - the bar is random, can be hit or miss, but when it comes down to it, aren't dialogues like this a cornerstone of eclectic Mission bars? In my experience it's why I keep going back.  That and the bar fights.
author: Nicole C.

description:
mixed drinks here are totally weak and watery,but they have all night beer specials for like 2 bucks .if i drank beer that would be super but i don't often , but my friends do so that works it out.

I like this place for the decor and music/vibe. I miss it being Doc Bombays that place was the ill na, but those days are over. Now it's a old skool hip hop throwback with bboys playing on the televisions.Thats ok by me.


the seating is kinda not conducive to good conversation, but they have that big backyard so whatever.

this place is down the street from me, so I will deal with it weak drinks and all
author: Lauren V.

description:
I like this place. Music is fun, the beer is cheap (mix drinks were pricier though), just a fun Mission place.

Some people were way too overdressed for a place like this. I'm not expecting people to come in 80's attire (B-boys, Madonna with the fishnet glove things, Miami Vice), but man I thought people were coming from the prom (or most likely the Marina.... booo). This is the Mission! You're supposed to be grungy-ish and rough around the edges! Get your pop collars and Ugg boots outta here!
author: Rocky K.

description:
Good old school hip hop music that's way too loud. They got to turn it down!!! SIM-SIM-SIM-SIMMMMAAAAH DOWN NUH!!!!!

That is all.
author: Jay W.

description:
The DJ was off the hook, the bar is perfect, except soo much dancing in such a small place made for hot hot heat.  Drinks are good, old-school boomboxes on the wall make for awesome with a capital RAD, and the bench with tables on the back wall allow for a place to put a coat, along with everyone elses and not feeling shady about it.
Shake it.
author: kerry a.

description:
I truly love this bar!  The drinks are responsibly price and the theme is by far one of the most creative in the city, I love the decor.  One of the best bars to go to if you are planning to just chill with a bunch of good friends and people watch.  Honestly though, on a good night, you get the most random people.  You can normally find me sitting on the bench, listening to the good beats, drinking a corona and people watching with my friends.  Normally we would just laugh at the random individuals that get into the music and had way too many shots.  (only because we've all experienced it ourselves)  Hmm...what other "people watching" games would we play?

*Celebrity comparison.  For example, "psss...omg it's Mr. Boston.  Tell me he looks like Mr. Boston?"
*1-100.  Basically we pick out who in the room we would consider hooking up with.  

Eh, I'm sure there's more...I just can't recall.  But yes, -1 because sometimes the place gets way too packed.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: Horribly rude and slow bartenders who serve others even though you've been waiting longer. This is the marina wash up of the Mission District.
author: Bowser J.

description: OMG it is so freaking packed here! I love the crowd. It's a mixture of hipsters, gangstas, business folk, and geeks.  The music is typical. Drinks are a little watered down.
author: Val B.

description: I've been here twice... If you go earlier in the night, you can get seats but the trade off is the music isn't as good.... Later at night, the music is pretty poppin!  They also have good amfs. The drinks are little pricier than some of the other bars in the area but they take credit cards ($20 minimum). Only giving it 3 stars because someone tried to pickpocket my boyfriend's cousin one time, not cool.
author: Jess H.

description:
Music is cool
drinks can get expensive
The door guy with the pony = jack ass
author: Justin L.

description:
So stumbled into Double Dutch (less stumbled more than was lost, as there was no signage) looking for the free beer from the onion, only to find like many others who came it, it was next week.  I was waiting for some friends, and didn't feel like going home, so I stayed, had a drink in which Darren the bartender, who is also one of the owners, was nice enough to give me and the other lost onion souls happy hour prices on the beer.  

Ended up staying for a few hours, smoking out back and making friends with some of the regulars and their dogs, the whole 80's concept wasn't exactly what I was expecting (I do like the faux concrete patio thing outback), but I'll defintely be back, especially if the bartenders will keep their promise of letting me work for my booze on busy nights.
author: Jasmine B.

description:
I am not a late night at the bars, clubbing until the wee hours of the morning kind of guy. Clubbing is for baby seals... [just kidding on the seals people, no need to write hate mail]....but I broke from the norm because college friends were in town.  I was the designated driver to the double dutch.  D-lightful! 

Well, no so much on the delight. The Double-D is inferno hot. I mean, armpit of a 600lbs man who's wearing wool while doing yoga in the humidity of the tropics hot. Now, toss in as many gyrating drunk people into that pit as you can. Then close the one window to fresh-air because you're trying to drive your customers into a hot-pit driven, need-for-thirst-quenching frenzy, as a tool drive up drink sales at the bar, and you have found the mission statement for the management of the Double Dutch. 

What ends up happening is that patrons are forced to spill out onto the street for fresh-air and a break from the Bikram Bar. This wouldn't be so bad if it wasn't for the forced interaction with the street panhandlers who pounce on the inebriated and dehydrated customers with their specialized solicitation hustles. 

Fun can be had here, it was by me, but the DD conspires against your good-time more than it contributes.
author: Aaron M.

description: Double Dutch is not really my scene, but I gotta hand it to them. They definitely have a unique thing going. It's a full blown hip-hop/break dance bar. I went there on a Tuesday, and not only did they have a DJ but they also had live painting as well as rappers and spoken word artists. The screwdriver I bought was pretty terrible, and the bathroom was soaking wet before it got very packed. Nevertheless, they do offer a unique bar experience, and I did like how the booths were set up. They had good prices, and you can't go wrong if you stick to beer.
author: Katie S.

description:
Just gonna shoot this one out there..

Experienced DD on a Thursday night. 
Non dysfunctional crowd. Bouncer was freakishly nice (will consider going back  just because of him!). Bartenders wore smiles and made my drink with a quickness. DJ did have some technical difficulties but got back into the groove. They played old school hip hop and I actually wanted to dance without being belligerent! Kudos to that guy. To top it off there was entertainment for me and my posse as a few dancers showed off their professional moves... it was seriously a great experience. And those are so few and far between these days!
author: Roya s.

description:
Checked out this spot after dinner at Tokyo Gogo the other night. I was slightly buzzed, so my review may be a little off,  but seemed a little marina-ish for the location. Little annoying...

The 'old school' photos on the wall were pretty cool. Looked like Ricky Powell's stuff, but when we asked the bartender, he wasn't sure who the photographer was.
author: Allison H.

description:
This place was pretty bomb diggity. I was really feeling the old school hip hopness of the joint. They had beat boxes mounted on the wall, graffiti art, a b-boy break dance video playing on the flat screen and the DJ was spinning some old school jams. Double Dutch inspired a friend of mine to throw a early '90s rap and hip hop party which should be off the hook.

It was a fun night. After a few drinks I was happily pop locking my ass home.
author: Rodney V.

description:
Great bar.  Diverse selection from some cheap PBR knockoff cans to Chimay white ale ON TAP!  Real cool and attentive bartenders.  ALWAYS awesome music - i think i've heard Common's "The Light" EVERYTIME I've been there, and it's been mixed with a very different joint EVERYTIME.  Old school, but still trendy decor.  Break Dance videos on the TV are SICK and could be your entire night.

My only beef with Double Dutch is the crowd.  Not the fact that it's 'crowded' (which it almost always is), but the wanna-bees with  button-down dress shirts, spiked up hair, and lots of too-cool-for-school attitude.  Reminds me of NYC bars i went to in highschool.  They mostly hang around on the weekends...
author: Glenn G.

description: I came to Double Dutch at midnight for my 21st birthday and let me tell you, i couldn't have asked for a better bar to get drunk at. Although it was super crowded i really didn't mind. My friends and i were lucky enough to get a booth so we drank and chilled the entire time. Music was on point, didn't bump into any rude peeps, and the tokyo tea was crackin'.
author: Suzan L.

description: We came here for a pre-dinner drink at about 7pm on a Friday night.  I had seen the sign for "hot cider" on my walk back from BART and it left my mouth-watering in the cold.  The hot cider was really delicious and surprisingly strong - definitely worth a trip across the next few cold months.  As for the scene it was basically empty.  There were about 4 other people sitting at the bar and I think the bouncer was one of them.  The walls are lined with old stereo facades which are kind of cool and they've got some great old school pictures on the wall.  The music was awesome - which seems to be their high point after reading the other reviews.  I definitely left wanting to come back when it was a bit more crowded and there would be people dancing.  It is a pretty small and sort of grimy place, but I have no doubt it gets pretty fun at night.  If anything, I appreciated the hot whiskey cider and good music for an early Friday evening drink.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
so i've been here on weekdays: almost empty no dj and gud old skool hip hop on rotation.
and on weekends: super crowded and suky ass dj who started off alrite and then got lamer and lamer untill he wuz playing daddy yankee. seriously wtf

ur call ppl.
author: Renee S.

description:
My first review!  Yay!!  First, I'd like to express my discontent with the rating system.  No half-stars!?!  Bogus!

Double Dutch, the once swanky, retro bar known as Cama.  Overall, the venue is good-sized and well-lit.  I like that it has a dance floor area but have yet to test its grooviness.  I hear the place packs a pretty big crowd on weekends.  Now that I've had a taste, I'm going to have to head back for some dancing!!  U should join me. =)
author: J R.

description:
My feelings are mixed on Double Dutch. I used to love Cama....then wehn Double Dutch opened I gave it a whirl and didnt like it b.c the crowd was a bit frat boy and college for me. But I gave it a few more chances and sometimes it sucks,  sometimes its good. Friday nights with the Magnificent 7 are pretty good though...good music and it made the bar a little more frat-tastic and fun.

I do end up always getting anialated drunk and dancing my ass off here though, so in my drunken xanadu moments, i like this place.
author: kelly M.

description: I love this bar! The drinks are cheap, the music is good and there is no cover charge. They do accept credit cards, but there is a $10 minimum and there isn't a coat check.  The people range from girls overdressed for the club to people in flip flops.  The bartenders are good, especially the tall guy with the buzzed head, his drinks are the best. During the week it isn't that crowded and on some weeknights they have local artist there. The weekends gets crowed and sweaty, but if you get drunk, it wont bother you that much.  The downside of this place, there isn't any room to dance, so if you're planning on showing off your b- boy or b-girl moves, go to a club, there isn't enough room for you at this bar.  If you're one of those people that like to sit most of the time, I would suggest getting there before 10 to get a seat. Overall, one of the best bars in the Mission.
author: Shamiya M.

description: Good times had here. Good looking people good music/dj dancing. The place is a little small and a line forms later in the night but defiantly a good time.
author: Christopher F.

description: Holy Moly!!!  This place is wwwaaaaaaaaayyyyyyy toooo crowded!!!  It's like sauna on the dance floor, you can feel it hit you before you ever get to it...It takes forever to get a drink here too.  This would MAYBE be a good place for very early in the night to catch a drink or two, maybe.
author: Ashley J.

description: The area is really nice because the dress code is pretty lenient and the crowd is generally younger.  The negative was that the crowd is younger and more aggressive and the potential for fights is higher.  I think there are better places in the area to go to and other places in SF in general.
author: Min P.

description: been here 2-3 times and cant say i ever had a bad time...t shirt n jeans type of spot..perect for beers n keeping it casual..
author: Ivan C.

description:
Ah, the nightlife of the Mission neighborhood. Culturally diversified, latin influences, different languages being spoken on each corner. And then, through the grapevine you hear of a small place on 16th, right by Kilowatt where I used to party when I was underage (yes, you read that correctly), Double Dutch. Supposedly an "underground" style hip hop club bumpin' beats from back in the day that make you move unconsciously from the passionate undertone that busts through the speakers around you. Of course, if and when anyone says that type of description to me I become immediately taken back to younger days in NYC and LA where we'd go into unmarked unspoken clubs spittin' the illest rhymes imaginable.
