Some of the only white people in those clubs we were, and it was a great way to grow up. These experiences definitely spurned my deep love and appreciation for the underbelly of hip hop and my love of the music and it's history.

But no, this was all frontin' hype about this place. Some quickly pasted up graf on the walls and some kitchy placed talk boxes in the back behind the D.J. Full bar, that's good, cause I NEEDED to a drink just in order to hang out there for the full forty-five minutes that I could take. My girl and I were stuck against the back wall, sitting on the bench in total and complete aghast of the uncoordinated hipster white people in their H & M outfits and too tight pants with their poser hightops. They probably didn't even know what those 200 dollar AF one's are all about, or why they're so coveted. There were only a few of us were gettin' down to the beats on the small dance floor at the back next to the urine infested reaking unisex bathrooms. The music wasn't bad, but it wasn't all old school, some pretty top 40 pop-ish hip hop came on, but I guess what are all those hipsters going to dance to if they haven't heard it on the radio yet right? If they hadn't played some fly beats I would have given this place no stars at all which I don't even know you can do. Anyways, us two were really the only ones who knew ANY of the words of the music comin' out of that place. Disappointing, just disappointing. 

But the two best parts of the night (I'm being sarcastic if you haven't grasped that yet ya'll) were that:

1. There were only white people there and you know how much I love a uniform ethic crowd. Nothing like having no diversity and no cultures up in the house. I love monochromatic anything!!!!

2. I looked at my girl and we mutually agreed to bounce with no words exchanged when the guy behind me, doing some crazy (not even funny) version of the "sprinkler" said, "Wow guys! Look how white I really am!!!!"

Oh to be stuck in the back corner of a converse infected club posing as a hip hop inspired house of music. If you ask me, it was just like being in the marina, same mentality, same checkbook, just with more PBR and less good wine. Hey, at least they've got good wine and the view of the water over there.
author: Danielle S.

description: Out of many great bars in the Mission Double Dutch is the place to be on Saturday nights. Great Music and great location. The only reason why i give this bar 4 stars is because the dumb ass bouncer thought my ID was fake and it took me 10min of talking to let me in because i am 23. My girl had to convince him. Good going dumb ass.
author: Juan T.

description:
See my review for Skylark, as they are a block apart and very similar.  They differ thusly on Friday/Saturday nite:
Double Dutch has:
* smaller dance floor
* slightly better ambiance
* slightly better location
* "safer" music, but still very similar and GREAT.
* more humidity
author: Dimitry Y.

description:
i love this small little spot!

the bf and i decided to keep it chill and grab a drink there after our amazing valentines day dinner! good music, mainly hiphop, sick ass artwork and chill vibes! 

this probably doesnt matter but the bouncer noticed the detail i had done on my nails, i had music notes painted on them! the staff is uber friendly, felt like the coner spot to go to where everbody will learn your name!
author: Bernie P.

description: Before I wrote this I had to check twice to make sure the reviews I was reading were about the bar I was thinking of.I read one person mention it was a dive.Wa?This place is like a neighborhood warp to the Marina.I walked in there, and remarked to my friend, "How the fuck did we end up in the Marina?" Popped collars, backwards baseball caps, starched white shirts, 500 dollar watches, and enough hair gel to stock a SuperCuts.This place is like where douchebags go when they die, with enough skanks to make South Beach jealous.The music isn't innovative or interesting. It's just the same fucking top 40 hip hop, you could hear if you turn on your radio in Anywhere, USA.What is so special about this place? I think I may have to be careful from now on, when reading reviews of places I have never been.......
author: Joshua T.

description: Had a fun time here dancing to 90's hip-hop. Went on a Saturday night and it got a little too crowded at some points, making it a little difficult to order a drink. Other then that I had a great time here.
author: Tony S.

description: Fun, popular bar/club in the heart of the mission.  It's a narrow place, so it gets very very packed.  Drinks are OK, music is good.  Like the vintage decorations.  If I were in the neighborhood and it wasn't too packed, I would venture it.
author: Ka C.

description: I would really, really, really like to make out with someone on the fake street bench in the back (which is pretty much an exact replica of the set in Blondie's Rapture video). If you get a random PM from me asking you to do this, just humor me and do it okay? We'll never have to discuss it again.
author: Maria D.

description: GREAT bar, GREAT event. The bartenders were awesome, the drinks were strong(from what i sampled cause i stuck to beer) and decently priced, and the crowd was hot. props for having 2 co-ed bathrooms so i dont get that awkward look when i come out of the women's room(hey when you gotta go, you gotta go). it was hot as hell in there, but cant really blame the place cause it was 90 degrees outside and it was packed inside. plus, being the idiot i am, i decided to wear a long sleeve thermal undershirt. i was sweating in a non-sexy way. i knock it 1 star for having no reception inside. made it awkward when i would get text messages that no longer made sense...
author: Andrew T.

description:
What an unpleasant surprise. Despite the welcoming exterior, yr. corres. was sickened by weak drinks, terrible music and unbelievably obnoxious patrons. 
In fact, the sight of 70's black culture shamelessly trotted out for jeering frat-boys and pushy BBW blonds may be too intense for some. 

Discretion is advised.
author: Veljko S.

description: My first time at a bar in the Mission and Double Dutch didn't really disappoint. The bouncer was extremely nice and friendly and even said happy birthday! It was a little early so there wasn't much going on besides people standing/sitting around and getting some drinks. The place is pretty damn small though. The music was more of a old school music so I wasn't really into the music but a lot of people were going crazy dancing to it and just having fun. I'm not sure if the drinks were expensive or not (I hope not!) cuz my co-workers and their BF/friend bought me my shots. But all I know is that they fill they shot glass up!
author: Juliane N.

description: This is my go to spot for making a fool of myself or getting attacked by drunk douche bags.  (Thanks a lot JASON!)  It get's way too crowded and smelly on the dance floor, but they do play hip hop.  The bathrooms are disgusting!
author: Justine D.

description: This place is NOT worth checking out.  Good up until I had to close out my tab where I found they had charged my card twice and on top of that, they slapped all my drinks onto my sisters tab.  The fact that they actually argued with us about this and the way they went about it was inexcusable.  How is it that my sister and I would have had a $120 bar tab amongst the two of us?  Well, considering our bartender was completely hammered, and completely rude that's how....Just stick with Mamacitas.....Just a tip: Learn how to accomodate your customers cause at the end of the day, we're all hooking you guys up!  Something to consider!
author: Danielle V.

description: Showed up for a little Iron Chef premier, loved the feel of this bar.  We left early for dinner round 3 but I can imagine that this place gets rowdy and you can party the night away.
author: Shiho F.

description: It was certain very fabulous Yelper's Super Sweet 32nd birthday and this was the very appropriate location.  The music was a mix of old school and new.  Yes, I got teased for knowing Prince but not New Edition, but whatever.  The bartenders were efficient and my recent switch from vodka tonics to vodka sodas led to me not realizing how strong they were.  Definitely get there early enough to snag a couch.  But don't dance on it.
author: Gracie B.

description: We came here on a wednesday night and the place was pretty packed. The drinks are super strong, which would be a plus in almost everyone else's book but mine. The music and the crowd made this place for me-- everyone was chill and down to have a good time. I would definitely come back.
author: Grace C.

description: Double dutch is fun but putting the bathrooms next to the DJ booth and dance floor? PEEE YOU!
author: Shooter M.

description:
The top 5 Things I always do at Double Dutch (in no particular order):
1. Arrive before 10, this way you actually get to get in without a line, order a drink and dance a little before you get disgustingly sweaty
2. Make an order of 8 $2 Olympias, works out perfectly to pay with a $20 plus tip (don't judge, there's no way I'd tip $1 a drink for someone to pop open $2 cans)
3. Dance it up to some normally awesome mixes (I think they have improved their DJs as of late but it can be a little hit or miss at times)
4. Get in a near fight. Double Dutch is good for getting some dancing aggression out and just cool enough that a fight never actually breaks out, I think everyone there is just having too good a time.
5. Gawk at the girls that will inevitably dress up like they are either a. headed to a club (which this is not), b. attending a bachelorette party, or c. just got back from prom. Its weird, I still don't get it
author: sholeh m.

description: You rock for taking all of us idiots into your tiny area. Sorta scared some patrons away but that's all right because we made up for their lost beer with our own binge drinking. Signature Yelp fashion, or so I'm told. Still need to get my diabetic ass to a DYL one day and shock my liver like I used to. Scavenger hunts make us thirsty and especially on a hot day like it was today, a tall cold one is just what the doctor ordered...If your doctor happens to write out prescriptions for beer...Mmmmmmmm...
author: Anthony L.

description: I seem to only remember Double Dutch when I'm out of my mind drunk after visiting Beauty Bar or Delirium.  When Beauty Bar gets too crowded or Delirium gets too boring, I head over to Double Dutch for some dancing.  However, I usually end up in that space between the DJ and the bathroom.  This is actually a good location if you a) need to use the bathroom; or b) think it's funny to hold the door closed when drunken frat boys are trying to leave the bathroom.  Trust me - it's pretty entertaining.
author: Annie G.

description: We came here for New Years Eve. To be fair we were so drunk that it didnt really matter that the music sucked, and that it was wicked crowded, they exceled in what mattered and that was serving us drinks. It was a great time.  They also have a pretty funky-neat back room with seating and an area everyone dances in.
author: Camille A.

description:
douche #1: dude! you shouldn't drive right now, youre too wasted!
douche #2: fuck you dude!  that bitch was a fuckin slut!
douche #1: DUDE! you are NOT driving right now!
slut #1: omg, stop yelling you guys!
author: Skeptical Spee ..

description: A bar that plays the proper music for me to bust out my old breakdancing moves and has a dance floor big enough to do the worm?   Awesome.  Minus one star for not providing a wax floor or cardboard - you can't do a headspin on the concrete floor.
author: Erica G.

description:
a mission residing hottie i know despises this place, citing "it's where the marina crowd goes to claim they are 'in the mission'.  the other place being medjool."

me doth protest profusely (esp being a former marina-ite), defending double dutch coolness factor by way of blue moon beer on tap.

until we get there.   and out walks a 6 ft tall frat boy clad in an artic white ralph lauren long sleeved polo, collar turned up.  followed by older cougary blonde.

hottie wins.   but  i still dig it.  old school music and blue moon on tap is the way to groove.
author: Josie M.

description: Hipster Central.  Every hipster cliche is worshipped here.  The shoes, the retro coolness, the population hanging out here. Everything.  I'm not a big fan of the hipster movement though I do like to laugh at it.  Cool tunes and great bathrooms.  Other than that I'm not feeling it.  Especially since that one dude was wearing suspenders AND a belt.  If it takes that much to hold up your pants then you might want to consider buying a smaller size.  Just sayin'.
author: Jill D.

description:
pretty fresh. 

i mean, it's the reason why i'm hungover today spending the day in bed and watching chelsea lately!
author: kristin e.

description: I know I'm a light-skinned sista from around the way so I need my tunes to match my door knocker earrings.  Double Dutch is perfect for those who love old skool beats or actually were around when they first dropped.  I won't disclose which category I fall under.
author: Monica L.

description: This place was jam-packed the only time I've come by, but to its credit, a smoothly run door, bouncy DJ'ing, cheap drinks, and a fun crowd. It's definitely of its milieu.
author: Jon F.

description:
No cover. Good music. Efficient bartenders. 

Depending on the night, this place can get packed fast! "Rumpshaker Thursdays" are usually one of those nights. Although on a Saturday, I've actually seen a line out the door.
author: Ro F.

description:
The only reason I'd dare set foot in this place -- chump-infested by weekends -- it was quiet and we wanted to talk. E was having a crappy work day and needed to vent. Earlier J and I had blown off our film class to get Goat Hill Pizza. Luckily, it was not their all-you-can-eat night, otherwise, my waistline would have been in big trouble. As we're talking, E looks over and suddenly rises to her feet. 

I gaze over at the focus of her attention, and see a guy has passed out on the floor. He's out cold. E and J rush over to him, taking his pulse, and attempting to revive him. I get him some water from the bar and ask the bartender to call 911. This guy next to him, who appears to be with him, yells "don't, he doesn't have insurance." The bartender terminates his call. We revive him and with the help of others, attempt to help him off the floor. At this time, his legs buckle and the eyes in his head are rolling backwards and he starts foaming at the mouth. This time I'm like, "Look buddy, insurance or not, he needs to go to a hospital." We gently rest him on the floor, against the wall, and he's conscious again. I get him to talk, asking his name and where he lives. He has no home, but couch surfs. I ask him what happened, and he says he'd performing some skate stunt, falls, and it feels as if his hip has removed from his socket. He continued to walk over here, but then felt woozy and passed out. So it must be the shock. Meanwhile, his "friend" and some other bar patron go at it due to the latter's comment about how this guy must be drunk and high. I'm not really sure what the real deal is, but he needs help. He is sweating like a pig, and I wiped the sweat from his brow, like Mary Magdalene. J looks at me frowning and whispers I'd better wash my hands after. She works in a hospital and knows the danger of body fluids. The most frustrating part is the lack of concern from other patrons. The three of us are the only ones helping. Even his friend doesn't seem to be concerned, but is more interested in starting sh*t with other people. The guy vehemently refuses an ambulance, stating he doesn't have insurance and can't afford $1000. I tell him he can't afford to be dead either and if he fails to seek treatment he may just expose himself to further injury that will cost him more later on. He doesn't want that. He wants to make a book of skate sculptures. He's 39 years old, homeless, and no insurance. I feel really bad for him. We convince him to accept the ambulance, which has now arrived, and wish him luck. His friend doesn't even accompany him. The bartender thanks us profusely and offers us a round of free drinks. We refuse, just wanting to get the hell out and pretend the night never existed. 

Two stars for the bartender who a) let me sample a kick-ass rioja before purchasing it and b) his amazing ability to multi-task during a crisis.
author: Suzanne R.

description: This is the best place to meet your friends and drown your sorrows in a nice vodka tonic or seven. (lime twist, OTR)   The art, the wall of ghetto blasters and the boys who frequent this bar are sexy  ; )
author: Clementine D.

description: Why why why don't I go out in the Mission more often?  The bartenders at Double Dutch were psychic.  I walked to up to the bar and they read my mind immediately.  $1 beer!  It was some sort of special, but still...As a chick I could have just as easily ordered a foo foo flowery drink.  He even held up two fingers to indicate he had once again peered into my brain (or noticed my friend and his empty cup) and wanted to double dutch check that I needed two beers.  The efficiency was baffling.  Crowd - friendly and outgoing.  My favorite part?  The neon chandeliers.
author: ellyk E.

description: This is my kind of bar.  Gotta love the old school shoes and radios they have on display.  I remember the first time I went here I glanced up and said "Oh shit, are those the first Jordans I see hanging on the ceiling?  Word!  Takes me back to my double tape boombox and the old school hip hop that would play from it.  They also play great hip hop on Fridays.  We went here to celebrate my wife's bday, and we really enjoyed the night out.
author: Brian A.

description: I am sure the outrageously fabulous company had a lot to do with me loving this place...but any establishment that caters to my obsession with early 90's dancing is ok in my book:)
author: erica c.

description: The coolest thing about this place is the decor.  If you could move it to LA or NY it would be a really cool bar/lounge.  DJ was good, drinks were ok, my biggest complaint is the small space (it gets really hot and crowded) and the ridiculous people... who wears pigtails and birkenstocks out?  It was a cool venue, with an "interesting" crowd.
author: Lisa D.

description: Really enjoyed it.  Great mix of people.  Chill bartenders.  Artists making art right there, to be auctioned off at the end of the night.  Lite-Brite sign above the bar.  Great photos of old-school hiphop madness. MUSIC WAS AWFUL.  For an old-school hiphop themed bar, they played current bad pop rap songs.. didn't jive at all. We were talking a lot, so making it able to ignore for the most part. Still totally worth the journey.
author: Mary Kate B.

description:
i've only been here once so prolly not the fairest review... but don't think i'll be going back again. went on a saturday night for a friend's bday party. don't get me wrong, the place is cool and it has some popping music, but....

the bouncer was HORRIBLE. yes, it was crowded, i get it. but he needs to have better memory if he's going to not let people who were already in (and came out for a ciggie) back in because he couldn't remember (even when um, you were right in front of him the entire time). he let me in, but wouldn't let two of my friends back in because he said they weren't already in there. and when i tried to explain things to him in a calm manner, he thought i was giving him an attitude and threatened to kick all of us out - really?! 

also, it only has two bathroom stalls and it's right by the dance floor so it's difficult to get to and the line gets insanely long. it was also hot as hell... overall, wasn't a very pleasant experience (mostly because of the bouncer though)
author: Lucy C.

description: i love bars on the mission.. double dutch has got to be one of my all time faves.  we always end up here for the dancing, music, and fun crowds.  if you're looking for some special drinks or some yuppie SF scene..this is probably not your cup of tea.  if you just wanna hear some good tunes and see some unique old school hip hop decor then this is yo place!
author: Joanna M.

description: A cool, old school, small bar with good drink prices that makes me miss the 80s - I'll be back Double Dutch, I'll be back.
author: Jessica L.

description: I'm giving it 4, because of the people.  I'm not sure of the personality.  The theme maybe, 80's cassette? The walls and it seemed even the ceilings were covered with people.  That is not to say these people were wall paper...there was a lot of dancing going on.  -Good looking people  The music was good, but kinda disjointed.  Club, bruce springsting, micheal jackson, back to club...it wasn't very even.  The drinks were average bar expensive.  I had fun; I danced till I dripped.
author: Jake H.

description: Oh no! The Marina crowd infiltrated this Mission joint. Downgrade.
author: Christine N.

description:
this bar is great on the weekdays or early on the weekends.  it does get packed with members of the junior varsity drinking team on the weekends.  expect it to be crowded and loud, with a wait for the bathroom (always a fun way to spend the night, right?).  oh, and expect groping and sloppiness, because those drinkers, they're only JV, remember?

on the plus side, DD plays great hip hop, and all the break dancing photos on the wall make me want to bust a few moves out after a couple drinks. the bartenders are super friendly, they seem to let dogs in, they have bulliet bourbon.  i mean, that's pretty much enough for me.
author: Veronica Y.

description: Cute bartendar, great throwback music and decor and a hodge podge of different crowds.  The music really helps you take things up a notch when the sipping might  otherwise stall.  Bell, Biv, Devoe?  2 more Patron shots please!  See....it works like a charm :)
author: Greg R.

description: This place is Awesome!  I go there just about every Tuesday from nine to ten for free beer. Thats right, free beer!  Other than this amazing idea for a Tuesday. The atmosphere is pretty sick. Reminds me of 80's electro pop.  The crowd is a mix of gay and straight. The one thing that sticks out in my head every time I think of this place is there collage of 80's boom boxes on the wall behind the DJ. Theres this really big red one. I luvs it.  And you probably would to!
author: Michael B.

description: You could have put a petting zoo in here and it would have been an improvement over Cama, but instead they plopped Double Dutch in here. Not bad, I guess. Good selection on tap, nice bartenders and a definite improvement on the decor. There just really isn't a whole lot that appeals to me personally in here, however. Whoever owns this place did something right with the enormous dance floor in the back. All the girls in the Mission at midnight with an itch to go dancing are going to flock here. That's the first thing the girls in our group did. Damn. What a great idea.
author: Michael E.

description: I'll admit, i'm more of a marina girl.  But I did enjoy double dutch - and SIMON!!! Super nice bartenders and it was pretty busy for a monday night (monday is the new tuesday, don't look at me like that...)
author: Sloane R.

description: This place has such a nice vibe - small neighbourhood bar with a funky decor.  I am really a fan of their happy hour specials and their liquor selection is quite impressive for such a small bar.  The bartender we met was really friendly and definitely poured a heavy drink.  And apparently one of the owners is from Washington so they sell cans of Olympia beer for $2.  If I lived in the Mission, this would be my favourite neighbourhood joint.
author: Mahogany G.

description: It's time to go back, way back, back to the days of Flashy Adidas high tops, vinyl records, graffiti art and the Sugar Hill Gang. This is a bar with a great concept. With no cover, a full bar and great tunes spinning all night, Double Dutch is  "on n on n on on n on, [where] the beat dont stop until the break of dawn."
author: Alex H.

description:
maybe i've just been on all the wrong nights...but i've been 3 times and all three times were pretty ghost town. 

the dance floor is in the worst possible location - right in front of the bathrooms...you can't get to the bathrooms without playing human pinball with the dancing drunkies.

called double dutch...but they don't have a double dutch night? i used to double dutch when i lived in cincinnati...i would wait for the bus to go to work and these little girls who were waiting for the same bus to take them downtown to school would let me in on their homemade jumprope songs. i was never any good at jumping in...but i was good at holding one end of the ropes so they could ha. this bar should look into it...i think it would attract more people slow night.

couple good things - the owner is really nice...he makes really good drinks. and the dj plays alrights jams.
author: Jennifer Z.

description: Not worth the hype.... but i took home the bartender so really i can't complain
author: o. c.

description: This place is great as one of the stops in a night on the town in the Mission.  Music is fun and the people are cool.  My only complaint is how damn hot it was every time I've been.  When the windows are sweating...yeah...that's not good.  I can usually only stand this place for an hour or so but it's definitely worth a peek.
author: Erin H.

description:
My God - who designed this shit hole?  A pathetic effort.

It completely misses early-80s hip hop style.  It's much more late-eighties NYC yuppie...silly light fixtures, uncomfortable booths and skate-boarding art?!  Please...

Entirely vapid and appropriately full of the usual twat-haired, braying fucktards in stripey shirts.

Why do 'cool, new' San Francisco bars always try sooooo hard?  Incidentally, check out the 'about section' from the guys who run this bar...www.vintage415.com...'their impact was like cultural acupuncture!'
author: Ben M.

description:
first of all, i LOVE the lite brite signs over the bar!  i want one for my house to put up little signs every day.  i am kind of obsessed with it.  5 stars for the lite brite!
ok now that i got that out of my system, the bar... cool place.  of course the music was great, which is why i wanted to go check it out.  i was a little disappointed that the dance floor didnt have more going on, but maybe we were there too early.  i think that the music in that part of the bar could have been louder too, maybe that was the issue.  drinks were good - the bartender made a spot-on vodka collins (my go-to drink) which i appreciated.  i would check this place out again when out in the mission.
author: Carolyn B.

description: I like having an excuse to put on my eighties gear, but something is just not quite on.   The staff is great, the owners are super cool, but the bar itself isn't enough for me to head to the Mission.  Somehow I just can't seem to catch the beat with the music there.
author: Amme P.

description: Good 90's hiphop (though interspersed with not my favorite 2006 pop/hip hop music). Strong and tasty drinks, and a medium-crowded atmosphere. I was able to snag a barstool for my weary dogs... I guess if hearing Tag Team singing isn't a stroll down memory lane for you, you may not be that into what the sound system is blaring out.
author: Liz K.

description: I heard about this place a looong time ago and finally made it last weekend. It's a pretty cool place, I love the whole 80s hip-hop theme to it. They played some great music, the drinks were awesome, and I have to say, I had a good time (or so I heard I had a good time). From what i know, there was no dress code and no cover charge, so that just made it even better.  My only complaint is that  it's pretty small, so it gets really crowded after 11pm. Be prepared to be neck in neck with certain people. No pun intended. All in all, it's a good place to go to.
author: Caroline L.

description:
you mean theres a place where i can wear a t-shirt and jeans...on a friday night...pay no cover...and listen to hip hop all night?!?

nice find...a little small...quite crowded...but all in all a good vibe.

But please...a note to miss DJ...you got great a song selection hun...and i give you props for being one of the very few lady DJs these days...but seriously...you'll have to work on your song transitions or else...in this economic climate...you can be replaced by an ipod.
author: Gladys D.

description:
yes. i love double dutch!!!!!
they played all the right hits. return of the mack!!! creep!!! this is how we do it!!! only problem was they didnt have escapade. i asked and she said she didnt have it. gah! thats ok. THEY PLAYED CREEP! wow, havent heard TLC in a few for sure!

anyways. great bar. my type of place. totally chill. no one was super dressed up. all types of people there. ALL types. beezies were dressed up and dressed down.

lets see pros...
-music AMAZING
-lounge area nice.
-bartenders quick.
-strong kamikazes.

cons...
-ok so the bathrooms are small and dirty...WHATEVER ITS A BAR!!!
-the dancefloor is small...WHATEVER, you dont HAVE to dance ON the dance floor. theres plenty of space by the door you can dance over there.

i got there around 9:30pm on a Friday night and stayed there until midnight. i had a great time the ENTIRE time i was there. it did start to get packed around 10:30pm but thats a good thing. means the place is hella fresh.
go here.
author: A. V.

description: I feel like I have love - hate relationship with Double Dutch. Sometimes I love the following: cool shoes, jamming dance videos on the big screens, crazy lights, fun DJ, stellar dancers sweeping the floor, cocktails I never order anywhere else, fun and plentiful seating, hip bartenders (the list goes on). The problem is I find this place to constantly be a hit and miss...sometimes the crowd just sucks, the bartenders are cranky, the dancers annoy me, I hate paying that much to get drunk (this list also goes on). Never the less, I am sure I will continue to come here.
author: Alicia J.

description:
This place is a Beastie Boy's wet dream.  I like the Lite Brite sign, I swear I had one of the boomboxes on the wall by the DJ stand when I was like 8, and I love being able to play Simon Says over my vodka & soda.  But the music was just okay.  The feel is more like someone's parents are being cool enough to let all us kids hang out in the garage with no supervision.  
It was very quiet there last night, which was fine by me.  Our most entertaining moment came when a sweet little pitbull hanging out inside started barking her alarm at the passing homeless men and watching the crazy guy outside try to drag the homeless guy inside so the dog could attack him.  And then watching some random passerby slam the crazy guy into the glass door some minutes later.  
And I stand by my earlier assertion, the neon chandeliers do look like they were purchased at Hot Topic.
**04.30.08 Update **
I give major kudos to this spot for maintaining it's appeal for longer than five minutes (which I feared for them on my first visit), and for hosting the 2nd Annual Scavenger Hunt after party, and for not strangling me even though we started way later than I told them, and probably had fewer paying customers than they hoped.  Thanks so much guys!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Love it love it love it.  Perfect and ugly with no real ambiance and no scene and big tables where I actually feel like there is a neighborhood dive bar in San Francisco.  Oh and it reminds me of all the smelly ass bars in New Orleans that make me feel so happy.  Just sitting in there I wanted to light up a cigarette and start jamming out to WWOZ.  Ahhh...Double Dutch, you fulfill my need for stanky.
author: Dana M.

description:
"lemonade was a popular drink and it still is,
i get more props and stunts than bruce willis..."



'nuff said, sucka.
author: ed h.

description: Its cool not great. Its Always packed ALWAYS. The people are all either ghetto or dorky. The shoe wall is cool and going in and out is not so bad. The bathroom is horrendous. Worst ever and the line goes right through middle of the dance-floor that is already hella small. I actually disappeared from my friends for half an hour cause i went down to the pork store cafe to pee and I had to buy a drink.
author: Chris L.

description: Cool bar. It definitely has that old school hip hop feel when you walk through the door with the boomboxes and kicks chilling on the wall. The music here is pretty good, with the exception of a few mashups thrown in there, but I'd have to say 2nd best hip hop played behind Skylark on the 16th and Valencia strip. $2 Prohibitions on Wednesday nights, so it's a good place to get a beer at before heading over to Skylark for Mixtape Wednesdays.
author: Rod M.

description: If you love Becky, you'll love Double Dutch. . . If you don't know what I mean by that, then nevermind. . . Moving on: I have been to Double Dutch quite a few times, and honestly, it's hit or miss, depending on the DJ. . . I came here one night, and this chick was spinnin'. . . Jesus, I almost threw her over my shoulder, took her down to city hall, and married her. . . she was AMAZIN'. . . Other times, the music has been just 'eh'. . . This is a cool kick it spot if you are doing a bar crawl in the Mission, but it's not really some place you would post up at all night. . . I'm just sayin'. . .
author: Francesca L.

description: Great music.  Cheap drinks.  Old school boom boxes on the wall.  This place definitely has the potential to garner 5 stars from me.  So where did they lose points?  Well, if you're going to be playing danceable music, perhaps it would be a good idea to have a dance floor that's larger than my closet and is not in the direct path of people going to and coming from the bathroom.  I had to throw a few elbows, but still couldn't get enough space to myself to properly shake my ass.  Oh well, if I ever go back, guess I'll have to be content avoiding the dance floor.  Who am I kidding?  I could never avoid a dance floor; guess I'll just have to get better at throwing elbows.
author: Danielle B.

description: My favorite bar in the Mission!  Best music and best bartenders.
author: Jimmy V.

description: great spot...where else can you find a place that features lite brites and graffiti on walls!  It can get crowded but the music is well worth it...good 80's/early 90's old skool hip hop classics.
author: Abby E.

description:
This has to be the dopest dive I've been to in some time. With the collection of hip hop goodies to a nice splash of BBoy status. Double Dutch is sure to keep your eyes wondering and looking for new items. I dig the wall of ghetto blasters, how freaking dope! The Beat Street pictures were off the chain. The old school shoes to the constant BBoy summits being played on the flat screens; way too cool!

Yeah I must say I had a blast here. I finally felt like I was in a bar that represents true bboy and hip hop. They did an awesome job with setting this decor up. 

Other than the looks, the bar was and is normal. Drinks are about as strong as the next bar. Music, well I DJ'd and played mostly Hip Hop (old school/underground) and seems to be what most DJ's would be expected to play. We aint talking top 40's watered down KMEL bullshit here, so walk else where if thats what you need or simply stay in your car and dial that in.

Overall I was impressed and had a great time. Be ready to sweat though, can get very hot up in there!

I HEART U DD!
author: Jay D.

description: Awesome awesome, albeit somewhat blurry times. Of course, it rocks when 50 or so people show up at a bar together with the intent of teaching their livers a painful lesson. Poor bartender did a great job. The drinks were stiff, and cheap. Kudos for sure. Also, easy to stumble to Ti Couz for a sweet sweet crepe (or savory, if you prefer!).
author: Irene F.

description: I love this bar (awesome decor, fun people) but why do they have to cut off their songs at 30 seconds everytime?  It makes for a very schizophrenic dance experience.
author: Kayla B.

description:
So close to Man Candy's place-stumbling distance-that it got an early visit.  Despite DC's best efforts, the place was relatively empty on a Thursday night at 8:30, save for what appeared to be a birthday party at the bar, with a dog (minus one star.  A barking dog with no leash.-this will become important later in the review)

We got our drinks easily, and eased into the couches along the wall.  It was right about then that a fight started outside the bar.  The bartenders quickly shut the outside doors, and the evening continued-for about five minutes.  This was when one of the guys involved in the first fight started banging the face of someone else into the glass door, eye and cheek first. Gruesome.  The dog is barking its head off, and now appears to be a pit bull.  The bartenders are calling 911 on their cell phones, which is good because the rest of the patrons are frozen in place, as we are.  At this moment, my friend whispers to me, 
"Perhaps we should leave" and I point out the obvious, "We can't.  So we might as well get another drink."  Sure enough, we did, it was good, this could have happened anywhere(ok, anywhere in the Mission)-but much like getting punched in the face by a stranger this summer, I won't be rushing back to the scene of the crime, even though I liked the dance floor and 80's decor.
author: Beth V.

description: I like this place...very chill people and scene.  Love seeing a girl DJ so big ups to her.  Drinks and service are good.  The decor is random, but I dig it.
author: E M.

description: Really small place, reminded me of Gravity a little bit, except for the fact that you can actually walk around in there (maybe just an off night). The people were cool, music was below average, drinks OK. I'll probably go back just because I don't remember seeing the art work or the lite brite or the old school boombox (maybe it just wasn't memorable?). Oh well, double dutch gets a double star.
author: Sumant C.

description: Mission bars don't take credit cards because they don't want the Double Dutch mainstream crowd to venture into our neck of the woods. But with that aside, I like the Dutch! The Drinks are TOP Notch, they don't skimp their well is smirnoff. They use fresh juices and you can always ask for something new, except if you insist on going on an amateur night.
author: Jetsetgirl B.

description: The music was fun! non-existent dancefloor cuz it gets so packed. everybody there looked like the typical mission hipster.  Drinks were strong because they didn't know how to make em.  Had a vodka tonic that tasted the same as my friend's lemon drop.  Naasty.  That is one thing I can't stand; bartenders that can't make a drink.  but 3 stars for the music because from all the bars that I went to around mission/valencia that saturday night, this place was the one that played the best music.
author: ShayShay G.

description: Old school hip hop? I didn't hear too much of that, mostly mashes of semi-congruent pop-dance music. And maybe it wouldn't hurt to turn down the volume just a bit--it's not exactly a club and it's too loud for a bar. There's a decent selection of beers on tap and even some display cases showing off some cool, old school hoop shoes. Skylark across the street seems to play more of the indie & old skool hip hop, though.
author: Chris C.

description:
this bar was pretty cool but nothing special. the theme is 80's hip hop and they did have some really cool sold-school photos on the walls of kids break dancing. but that's pretty much as far as it went. they had some old nikes hanging from the bar, a simon game, some boomboxes, but other than that, the place was practically the same as it was when it was Cama. plus, the drinks were pretty expensive. i dont think i'd mind going again, but i doubt i'd make any special effort to go... especially since the mission has so many other better bars nearby.

(my resolution this year is to visit 50 new bars in SF.  read about it at: http://fiftybars.thisisvlad.com)
author: vlad k.

description:
light brite signage, vintage photos, pretty hot late 20's crowd, a competent bar staff.

total lack of air circulation, extremely crowded on the weekends.

four stars.
author: Darrell L.

description: If St. Francis Fountain and Blondie's had a baby, it would be called Double Dutch. You have the retro thing going on with the lite brites and glow worms and the jam-packed tiny dance floor in the back of a long narrow bar. Another solid spot in the Mish.
author: Susan L.

description: YAY. Double Dutch is rad.  I wish it was closer to my place/hood.  My friend DJs here on monday nights and I know for a fact she plays old school hip-hop for the most part.  She also plays some new stuff too.  The drinks are decently priced and Darren that works there is a really cool dude.  This is a place to go hang out barstyle.
author: Rachel P.

description: Great bar, even when you're sober. I like the music, and I love the old fashioned stereos on the walls.
author: Michelle G.

description: Boombox' s x Graffiti x BBoy's = Drunk Hip Hop Night
author: Abraham E.

description: We came here after sushi for my friends birthday. We came rather early (10ish) and the place was not that crowded. Most of the people were gathering near the bar, leaving the dance floor empty (typical), except for this one couple, whom I remembered where getting it on in the corner. The drinks are relatively cheap, a little over 20 bucks for 3 cocktails. Music is great, they had a lot of old school music, especially from the 80s and 90s. That explains the wall of boom box by the DJ. Restroom, well what can I say, it's claustrophobic in there. It's literally 4 walls and a toilet. Oh, did I mention the graffiti all over the walls. Anyway, I think someone was smoking the chronic before I went in, so I got a little fish bowl action going on.
author: Jun W.

description: Love the decor and the hip hop music ... But 2 stars are missing for the lag time on drinks, maybe it was just me but the bar wasn't too busy ... Who knows?
author: Mack M.

description: Is there no more room in the Marina?  I think they've spilled over into the mish...at double dutch!  So many dorky looking guys with no cajones to walk up to a girl.  The night I went it was a total dickfarm.  The DJ booth, GASP, had no DJ.  Everyone was dancing to a mixed CD.  Oh the horror.  The drinks were OK, but nothing to write home about.  The decor, eh, it's unique with it's retro 70's 80's feel.  But, if you're trapped in the mish and wish you were in the Marina, stop by Double Dutch.  I think this place has bad feng shui.  First Cama is gone and HOPEFULLY double dutch too.
author: Christopher C.

description:
talk about wild hip hop dance party.

at least for me it was.  I was already housed by the time I got here, so I can't say anything about their drinks, but the music kept me dancing till the end of the night.  I came on a thursday with a big group of friends.  it's a pretty simple, moderately sized bar, with a small dance floor in the back.  not pretentious, you can wear whatever the f you want, and seems to attract an overall FUN crowd of people.  very good times.
author: Jen P.

description: Double Dutch is always a good time if only for the music! You never know what old school R&B jam from high school they are going to play. The drinks can be a bit pricey though and its always soooooooo hot inside! Dress as if you were going to the beach! They have maybe one single ceiling fan ventilating the entire bar so its always very stuff inside. But all and all its a great bar.
author: Joey H.

description: Double Dutch..... no cover to get in, small, very very small dance floor, bathroom is HIDEOUS (tagging all over the walls, small, stanky, the sink is super mini, mirror --- i dont recall, only fits 1 person in here, so for all the females that enjoy group bathroom moments, not a good choice).  Music is pretty decent --- hip hop, rnb, old schools, madonna, u name it.  Parking is a biznatch around this neighborhood.  Seating is limited.  So if you are planning on going as a group, i suggest arrive early and hog ur against the wall leather seating with a mini table.
author: Mimi S.

description: Hit this place up on a Friday night and really enjoyed the groups that made their way in and out and the overall vibe of the place. I can't remember a time when I said, "I haven't heard this song in forever!" more often. If you're in the mood for some good music but have maxed out on the songs overplayed on the radio, I would recommend this place. The decor was totally fun (boom boxes, brite lites, etc) and people were friendly and just interested in dancing. Will definitely go back. FYI... Cash only, so come prepared.
author: jess c.

description:
This is a small dance club in the Mission.
nothing special but there aren't many other options if you want to dance.

My biggest complaint is that it's hard to breath when it gets packed, which is all the time since this place is so small.

It's also surely a fire hazard.
author: Henry C.

description:
i was only here for about half an hour after the roxie last night.  i was glad my friend and i headed straight there after the movie because within a few minutes of our arrival, the place was packed.  we were able to grab a couple of beers and a table but it was in the front so i think we looked like yelp volunteers.  i had to tell people where the name tags were a couple of times but that was cool.

the music i heard was good, mostly old school hip hop and i liked the '80's run dmc-ish feel of the place but considering how hot it got in there when crowded, and i was right by the door, i probably wouldn't rush to go back on a weekend.
author: Seong P.

description:
Still a spot that makes me uncomfortable. Could be my total loathing of anything remotely associated with the 80's, fuck - I lived them and they were pretty vapid. But, hey, if that's what the kids are into...whatever. 
There is a sweet and totally doable bartender there, I have sworn off Mission bartenders, so I hope he has sex with one of my slutty friends so she can tell me all about how terrific it was with the free drinks and the long, dirty nights - until he starts fucking someone else, kicks her out of the bar and she has to start going to another neighborhood so she doesn't feel like such a whore.
Oh, the place is a lot less bright than it's last incarnation and the back area is pretty nice if yr into smoky treats. I had a nice huge shot of Jameson on the rocks, the price was good at free (thanks Mimi's dad.) I bet if you have to pay the prices are pretty good if you are wearing leggings and something Lycra.
author: Colleen B.

description: Great place to start off an evening. There's a teeny tiny dance floor, but people are still getting down with their bad selves. The drinks were not as expensive as I am used to, so I appreciated that. It got a bit crowded, but I figured it was a testament to how fun/awesome this place is. Overall, a great time!
author: Angela L.

description: Thank god there is actually good hip hop in the mission!  I had a blast dancing to Paperboy's Ditty and all the other great tunes being played at the Double Dutch.  I loved the old skool vibe, boomboxes, and my painted b-boy dance partner.  My 5 star question: where was the dj?  I was shocked to see an empty dj booth on a Saturday night.  Thankfully the mixtapes/ipod playlists were money.
author: shilpa s.

description: Cool ass bar!  I'm diggin the girls double dutching on the wall and the "Lite Brite" decor.  More diversity and dancing and the 5th star is yours!
author: One Black Mans POV.. ..

description:
After having a not so pleasant experience up the street we wandered into this bar and were pleasantly surprised.  It was still relatively early on a Saturday afternoon so we were again able to find seating easily.  The decor brought you back to the days of old school, rap and break dancing.  The name was made with a couple lite bright machines.  They also had high top nike shoes hanging by the bar.  A plus for me was being asked for my ID, great way to guarantee a nice tip.  The bartendar was nice and he had that Benicio del Torro voice.  A plus was the Bob Marley music playing when we first came in.  
Then all hell broke loose, we noticed a bunch of folks coming in and they had papers and books that said literary quake on them.  We had no idea what they were doing but soon we found out.   They stopped the music and started reading poetry, literature, what have you.  We where told to be quiet while this stuff was going on.  It was fun while it lasted but we decided to leave because it would be an hour of readings and we couldn't handle another 45 plus mins.  I would definately like to go back without the lit club of course.
author: La C.

description: From the girl who co-hosted a Solid Gold New Year's Eve party- (see pix) - this place was fun and had good tunes cranking. I wasn't really prepared to be there and dancing it up but that's not the bar's fault...now is it? I'm definitely going to go back dressed to dance and burn it up to Tone Loc!
author: Diane S.

description: First time coming here tonight, and the music was fabulous.  They played 80s-90s hiphop most of the night we were there.  We came for a bday bash, and ordered drinks.  The alcohol wasn't watered down either.  The best part was the wall couch.  There was lots of room and places to put your drink if you didn't want to hold it all night long.  I'd definitely come back again. :)
author: Amy A.

description: Cool place for happy hour drinks in minimal decor in the heart of the Mission. Great tunes and a well stocked bar with a fantastic Spanish white on offer and I think they do a lovely Cosmo (I know, SO Sex and the City, but still good!).
author: Suepattra M.

description: Love the music here at Double Dutch. They mainly play 90s hip hop (Hypnotize, This Is How We Do It and Ain't No Fun), but I heard some music from the 00s (Lean Back and We Fly High) and a few newer songs as well. Drinks are decently priced ($10 AMFs) for their size, but they can be inconsistent. Got an AMF for our friend at the start of the night, and it tasted like pure alcohol. An hour and a different bartender later, I had probably one of the better AMFs I've had in awhile and a good buzz going on afterwards. There's no cover, which is always a great thing. The dance floor is tiny and it is CROWDED, so be prepared to get a drink spilled on you or drunk people flailing around you at times. I didn't see a coat check, but if you're dancing along the edge of the dance floor, there's a counter where you can pile your jackets and/or bags. Under the counter, there's also some hooks you can use as well. Definitely, definitely would come back here.
author: Amanda K.

description: Double Dutch is okay... but i kinda like Cama more. Nothing really seems to stand out about Double Dutch. It's basically like any bar in North Beach or... gasp... the Marina.
author: Bernie L.

description: I know the 80's are cool again, but I had enough of them the first time round. The hair, the clothes, the makeup (for both sexes) was terrible. Double Dutch just brings it right back in it's freakish glory... I know somebody out there probably loves this place, but I'm not one of them.
author: Kevin R.

description: I went on a weeknight. I can see how this place could get cramped, crowded and body-to-body dripping with sweat. However, it is just so darling cute with the light up signs....the beer selection is pretty right on the money and the bartenders are very attentive...they are starting to win me over. On another good point, the management is pretty relaxed, so they let me bring food into the joint and eat - I like that, it means they understand that they survive by making their customers comfortable and that reflects highly on them. I'll go back if I'm invited, and enjoy it :-).
author: Laura G.

description:
fantastic bar. i dont really judge bars too much on decor because honestly, you only really notice it when you walk in. but this bar has that breakdance/jump rope 80s theme goin on and the collection of old school boom boxes on the wall behind the DJ booth is awesome. 

what i do judge a bar on is the crowd and the music. the crowd is low key, approachable and not too styled out and there are some cute girls around.

my favorite music at bars is rap from 1996 up to and including eminem. most of the stuff after that sucks. anyways, before the dj even got there, some of 2pacs greatest hits was on, which was fantastic. then, when the dj arrived, he spun some old school snoop, a lil jay z, some notorious. this is all that needs to be said. oh yeah, drinks are reasonably priced
author: Evan M.

description: Very crowded this past Saturday night. Strong drinks that weren't too too pricey, I think it was $6 for a Chambord and 7. We had a lot of fun dancing in our little corner in the back where there were benches to sit down on when we wanted. The decor was pretty cool with pictures of kids doing double dutch in the 80s and these neon red chandeliers. Music selection was weird, at one point they actually played a Kelly Clarkson song and then a Jackson Five song. I can't really complain though because there was no cover which definitely lifted this review up a star.
author: Jenny C.

description: This is a cool spot in the mission.  They play great hip-hop and drink prices arent all that bad.  Good location and it's like two doors down from Pakwan!
author: Amul A.

description: A whole mob of us went to DD on Saturday for my cousin's b-day.  We rolled up in style in an old 1974 school bus converted into Lola the Mexican party bus.  First stop was the bathroom.  Kind of dirty, but to be expected in a bar/club.  I was in the larger of the two bathrooms, and it had a huge mirror.  Kind of felt like someone was on the other side watching.  Next we made our way to the bar for a drink.  I am deducting one star for being forced to pay with cash, since my bill was $14 (under $20).  I'm not use to that.  After catching a buzz, we headed to the dance floor.  I was totally feel'n the music.  Brought me back to my high schools days.  So fun to reminisce.  I would definitely go back.
author: Jessica C.

description: Seem to find myself in here quite often. It's the Music and dancing! Love the hip/hop and DJ has a good selection! Place gets busy around 10:30pm esp. Friday/Saturday, Women are a variety, beautiful and plenty to choose from. It gets crowded but since it's one of the stops of the whole bar hopping scene - people are in/out . Drinks are fair priced and Strong (not meaured). To the Fine Brunette Barternder- Thank you time after time (and if u read this... I am going to take you up on your offer)! Tables may be reserved also with no problems as long as you give them a couple days heads up! Only bad thing about this place is that it does get crowded and good luck making your way to the restroom.
author: Edward B.

description: I must say I really like Double Dutch. In fact, I wish I was there right now. This is kind of a break dancing bar, in that they show break dancing videos, play music you could break dance to, and some people show up as though they are about to break dance. There's not usually a lot of actual break dancing going on, though, which is partly a good thing because it would make it hard to move around and/or have more than 3 people on the dance floor at a time. The bartenders are friendly and they have cheap drink specials on weekdays. Oh yeah and in addition to being breakdanceable, the music is totally awesome. Love their DJ's!
author: Teo W.

description:
it greats very crowded here during the weekend, but it comes to no surprise.  any place that does not charge cover to listen to music and shake it will definitely be packed.

decent hip hop and reggae with no stress of casual dress.
author: Sheri N.

description: Went here on a Tuesday night after I got out of work, just to check out the space. I had heard so much about it, and finally gotten off early enough to go out afterwards so I was very excited. They did a great job with the space. Love the theme, but wish they would've gone a bit further carrying it out. It kind of felt like I was walking though an art exhibit at a museum rather than a bar... but... I'd be interested to see what it feels like when there are people actually IN the bar. I was one of six people there. But like I said.. it was a TUESDAY. Definitely want to go check it out on a Thurs/friday, although I suspect that it gets packed very quickly....
author: Marina K.

description: How can you dance if you cant move? What a great concept- but this is way to small of a space for so many good ideas.
author: Melissa B.

description: At hubby's insistence I am giving 2 stars....we HAVE been to worse bars, true, and the music made the experience tolerable but 1 out of the 3 bartenders was just mean and had quite an attitude...anyway, the only pluses were the music (which I can find sooo many bars in the city that play what they were playing) and the bouncer was cute...he remembered my b-day (after seeing  my ID)...thought it was cute but then a bit stalkeresque,No..? Nah?
author: Karen B.

description: a wall of old school boomboxes.. a pair of kicks hanging above the bar..a bboy mural...great beats from the DJ....strong drinks..what else could I ask for on a Friday night? Love to go dancing here...but im warning you, stay away from the bathroom *shudders*.
author: Loe B.

description: I have mixed feelings about double dutch.  the cocktails are made with fresh juices...a definite plus.  The greyhound i ordered had grapefruit pulp, a first for me and really delicious.  also had a hangar one gimlet str8-up.  It's a great space decked out in 80's mementos, does take you back.  patio is still open, another plus.  happy hour gives you a dollar off drinks, most seem to run at $5, so 4 bucks, but when I went top shelf, I paid $8, after the dollar off.  that was a huge turn off and source of my mixed feelings.  still no sign.  i like this place, just can't afford to keep buying drinks at $8-9.
author: Adrian N.

description: Had a really fun time here, esp. because our stay was short and full of strong drinks.  Dance floor wasn't too cool, and it was WAY too loud.  But the bartenders were nice and efficient and didn't charge extra on my credit card when I accidentally left it there overnight.  Lively atmosphere...good for when you want to go out and have fun but not put in the effort of going to a real club.  I'd go back.
author: Gina K.

description: Elixir was too full on Super Bowl Sunday, so my friend and I went across the street to double dutch.  We weren't interested in watching the game, just drinking, so we wanted plenty of bar space.  There were only 2 other guys in there when we got there, but it was pretty full when we decided to leave a couple hours later.  2 beers, 2 margaritas, 3 gin and tonics, 2 slices of pizza, a plateful of chips and dips, and a bowlful of really good chili later...$25.  Are you kidding me?  What a great afternoon...man was I feeling it around 7 pm though, ugh.
author: Sarah M.

description: I hadn't been to this place since it was CAMA, and they've done much better with the space.  Drinks were good, bar staff were attentive even with the large crowd, and although some might think the dance floor was too crowded, there's always room if you can find someone willing to squeeze.  A friend of mine tried to order beefeater, which they didn't have at the bar, but i think that was the only bump in the road, and ultimately, no big deal.
author: shawn g.

description: love this place.. went there for the first time is past Friday!! it was so much fun!!! causal place jean are ok.. drinks great!! love the bartenders !!
author: Char K.

description: Had a good time. Dance floor a little too small and its right by the bathroom so people are pushing and shoving to make their way through and creating a mini line in the middle of the dance floor to use the shitter. Besides that, good crowd, music was alright, but I'd definitely give it another try.
author: S. M.

description: This place is aight, it has decent music (although the dj always seems to play the questionable remixes rather than the original persons.) It is also filled with a lot of chi chi marina types. I do like that it's not that crowded and the drinks are reasonably priced.
author: Cathy T.

description: I miss Cama.... went to DD tonight- it was unbearably hot as soon as you walked in. I also miss the cozy outdoor patio area... now there's a little bench in front of the space and you have to fight for a spot to sit down for even just 2 minutes. Very nice (flirtatious) bouncers, though! :)
author: Nenette Y.

description: Thanks to Yelp for the recent free movie night at the closeby Roxie and we ended up in Double Dutch for free beer. I didn't have any since I lost my ticket stub but it didn't matter since I'm not a big beer fan. Bf had the Trumer Pils and I had a tiny sip. We secured seats since we were one of the first few inside but later, it got somewhat crowded and as we made our way out, we passed some rather sweaty bodies! Phew, I was glad to be out of there but it was a fun bar, good music and a nice vibe but it sure gets mighty hot inside!
author: Yan M.

description: I guess this place would be enjoyable if it weren't too pack at 11:30pm and difficult to order drinks. Forget about getting to the dance floor..the further you walk in, the hotter and sweaty it gets. We walked in and walked out to Elixir's pub which was across the street.
author: Oanh N.

description: If you love 80s music, toys and sneaks, the Double Dutch is a perfect bar/club to go to. The first time I went there, I wasn't entirely too sure about the scene, since it looked just like any typical bar you would find in San Francisco, but when I came in, I literally stepped back into time. 80s galore! The music was sick, the drinks knocked me off my feet, and the people there were fantastic. Their dance floor was in the back (kinda small, but cozy) with an entire wall full of old school boom box speakers (the kind that you would see people carrying on their shoulders walking around the streets). Another wall was dedicated to old school sneaks- mainly converse of all different colors. The bartenders were attentive and gave you your monies worth of drinks (seriously). Overall, a great bar to go to if you want to listen to 80s old school hip hop
author: Krystinne M.

description: I think this is now one of my favorite mission bars. No cover, fun hip hop and really retro cool decor. I mean lite brites, can you get any more hip? Fun fun place, I'll be back!
author: Jon N.

description:
packed like sardines in a can. dancefloor was extra crowded, couldnt even lift your elbows. music was not on point. 

didnt have any drinks here (im a lightweight), but my friends drank enough for everybody else

highlight of the night, homeless guy outside selling random junk, and a pretty clean Nintendo system (NES)!!!! i was temped, but pretty sure it didnt even work. walking back to the car i looked again, and he sold it!!
author: David D.

description: I knew this place through my bf, after that it has caught my attention every time. I don't get much a chance to go out at night on the Weekend because of my work, so Tuesday or Thursday are two available days for me to go out but  it is still busy and play great music, and beers are so cheappp!!!
author: Sasitorn O.

description: Love the wacky vibe here, all faux '80s ghetto-frontin' complete with a fabulous boombox museum corner and graff. But, docked a star for a $20 min on the plastic. Lame. No b-boy types in sight here, which seemed a bit odd considering the name and theme.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Ive been to the double dutch a few times. Its always waaayyy too packed on the weekends. The DJ was good the first time i went, but totally sucked the last two times i was there. Bouncer was an a-hole every time i went (and im a girl! wtf!?)  There is too many different places to check out in the mission for me to waste my time and money here.
author: Adri C.

description: gotta add: $2 olympia's all day every day and boomboxes for wallpaper!  i like your style...
author: dan a.

description: I was surprised that I liked this bar - after having passed by it about a thousand times, it was finally time to go in.  It's a little bit more upscale than its neighbors, Kilowatt and Delirium.  And, it offers some dancing in the back -- if you're not keen on dancing at Blondie's (yuck) or the Skylark, it's a good alternative.
author: Tim G.

description: This place is a lot of fun.  Very laid back and friendly crowd.  A little tight on space but not terrible.  I also like that the music wasn't so loud that I couldn't hear the person next to me.
author: Ankur P.

description: Went there for a birthday party and no cover! Yeehaw. Otherwise, it was a little too low key for me. The DJ station was empty apart from my friend who went up there for cameo. No DJ? The only thing that saved them was playing "Pass the Dutchie". Haven't heard that in a long time. Well, probably since the 80s.
author: Nick M.

description: On a weeknight, it is fairly mellow, lowkey, Jackson Five playing on the hi-fis.  Someone had bought their nice pitbull who wanted to snuggle and get petted, which was sweet.
author: Marina F.

description: Fun little place with excellent music.  They play a variety of music from different genres and decades.  I had a blast with my friends.  The best part was that there was no cover charge.
author: Anna S.

description: So it was Cama!  I was trying to remember what this place used to be called - thanks Yelpers!  I was never a fan of Cama - the concept was interesting but the execution was incomplete.  But Double Dutch certainly know what it is and it works well enough...  it always seems to "work" when a small dive-ish bar is packed full of hipsters undulating to catchy beats.  I don't know.  After a while, all these types of bars start to blend into one another for me.  Perhaps if I lived in the neighborhood and went more often, I would have a better feel for subtle differences.  I leave you with one not-so-subtle detail:  it was steaming hot in there.
author: Yen P.

description: I came here one Friday night and enjoyed myself. The Magnificent Seven were stirring up a nice mix of old school jams, freestyle classics and other assorted goodies. I quite like the decor, especially the booxboxes around the DJ booth. People seemed pretty friendly. The cocktails could have been a wee bit stronger.
author: Joel A.

description: This place is small and it get's really hot.  But if you find space under the fan, then it's almost bearable.  Music is cool. Drinks were average.  It can get really crowded.  But still had a fun time here.
author: Robert G.

description:
marina fest all up in this!!! the bathroom floors are ALWAYS wet and full of fancy ass dressed people, which makes me feel like a hoodrat getting dirty looks. drinks are priced alright, i'll give it that and i puked vodka into a beer glass one night at closing. good times. 

but still, double dutch, i hate thee and the douchery.
author: Melanie C.

description:
I went here for the first time over the weekend. I was pretty sober when I arrived but diffinitly did not leave the same way....drinks are strong and must be cheap cuz I woke up with a pocket full of money which doesnt happen very often.

This place is pretty small but it is dope as hell. Like all the others have said....ghetto blasters on the wall, graffitti everywhere...cool scene. I have only two complaints.....the bathroom situation sucks; its small, gross, and the line is a pain in the ass once this place gets crowded. My other complaint...this place can get crowded....at one point I was trying to walk to the other side of the bar and said excuse me to some guy who in turn tried to start a fight with me....o well i guess, this type of thing could happen anywhere.

On another note the staff here is really friendly....we went as a group of 20 or so and the bartenders were attentive. The guy at the front door was cool too....great staff.

This place is legit and I would recommend it to anyone else.
author: nick s.

description: Tonight was the first night that I went to Double Dutch.  I must say tha the atmosphere isn't all that bad.  Most places I've gone to when people bump into you or vice versa, they give you dirty looks.  Not this place.  People just smile and say excuse me or sorry.  The crowd is pretty friendly.  The music is pretty good.  There is a good mixture of hip hop, hip hop and hip hop.  The DJ did sneak in one INXS song, but it was a good one.  Some of the music brought me back to my younger days with "Back to the Hotel" by N2DEEP, and "Diddy" by Paperboy.
author: Philip L.

description: I always seemed to go too early or on off nights, but I will say that Darin makes a fantastic martini.
author: Lorelei D.

description: this place is super fun. What i like most about this place is the music. Good place to hang out w/friends and drink
author: Erica Z.

description: This bar definitely gets loud. I give it 4 stars for good old school (and bearable current) hip hop music, the hot bartender (she's smokin' hot), and decent drinks. I'm definitely going back.
author: Kelly G.

description: We went out to this place on a saturday night and it was packed.  You'll find tons of "cool" kids as well as annoying assholes here.  All of the songs that were played were definitely considered older.  Think early 90s club hits, LL Cool J, and Bell Biv Devoe.  For a calmer outing, this is a place you and friends can enjoy.  Cheap drinks too.
author: jen k.

description: The one time I actually made it to the dance floor past the seething masses and crush of people I really enjoyed dancing at Double Dutch. The music was good, a mix of classic hip hop, common pop, and random techno. However, this place is so flooded with people that whenever I stop by, the fun is limited and dancing is difficult.
author: Abigail R.

description: The yelp event was fun and the drinks were good.  I would probably go back here for a birthday or something.  Some of the photos were cool but I do not agree with other yelpers who say this bar has an oldsk00l hip hop feel.
author: angela k.

description: This place is probably more of a 3.5 -- nothing extraordinary -- although the music is really good.  Of the two bartenders working when I went  one poured uber strong the other poured a little weak.  If you aren't happy with the way you first drink turned out, just order your next drink from a different bartender, think Goldilocks and the The Bears.
author: Katie P.

description:
Sooo happy to just see this place no longer as Dr. Bombay's.  Don't even get me started on the crazy owners stories.  So it was nice to see it as not so filthy, grungy and dank with despair.  Ohh maybe that was the bartenders.  Anyway, I digress.

I liked the decor and service was fine.  Not so keen on the tunes but that's no reason to not go.
author: Misti L.

description: I came here for night one of a three night going away party for friends.  We had dinner in the Mission so we got to Double Dutch pretty early and were able to get two tables.  As the night went on, it got super crowded and difficult to get drinks.  The music was pretty good and I had a really good time, but I think most of it had to do with the people I was with and the fact that we had tables...I probably wouldn't have liked it as much if I'd had to stand up the whole night.
author: Shannon E.

description: Having just moved back from the land of video poker bars, the Double Dutch was one of the first bars I walked into. I gotta say I love it here. The DJs are usually spinning tight sets and i love the decor. $3 Jamisons and $2 PBRs! Nuff said.
author: Bill H.

description: Okay this is more of my kind of scene. You get the Mission grunge without the ratty t-shirts and untrimmed facial hair crowd. A little more professional.
author: Joshua G.

description: If you don't like this bar, I pretty much hate you.  No, seriously.  The bartenders are all really nice, and the boombox wall is enough of a reason to make the trip here.
author: Julie B.

description:
awesome vibe right when we walked in. cool crowd, no nasty guys or too slutty  girls (but it was only 12 on a thursday and the night was young!) got a couple tables but that kept me to the front and i never got to explore what was left of the place :( 
best part: Absolut $2 drink specials and free shots! thats my kind of bar.
better part: awesome music to chill and dance to. never a dull moment! 
ever better: rumors of a late night burrito place around the corner? 
       **sigh...so this is heaven?**
author: Sarah C.

description: Went here last night with some friends... it was a pretty standard bar for the mission.  A very diverse crowd ranging from hipsters to hippies and tourists from Marin.  The DJ wasn't that great either.  Overall. "Meh"
author: Peter W.

description: Literally it's OK. Maybe I wasn't that big of a fan because I went with some people I didn't know very well. They had skater videos. A dude painting in the corner - he auctioned off what he made. It was pretty cool. The place is long. The bathrooms co-ed. I'm not sure what the price of the drinks was, but my cocktails were all doubles randomly.
author: Kathleen D.

description: By far the best hip hop bar in the city! Great music cool crowd and bartenders of course. Awsome art work and pics. there every weekned about.
author: Pedro V.

description: For a local neighborhood bar this spot merits 3 stars.  Nothing but hip hop which is how I like it.  The bartendress was very nice and it just seemed like a chill spot.  Don't go here if you are afraid of dogs.  I would have given it 4 stars if there were more than just white people in there.  check it out...don't go if you don't like hip-hop...
author: Princess P.

description: I turned 21 on the 14th of May and I didn't make it out to the bars until two weeks after my birthday. Instead of bar hopping in Davis I went out to the city on the long weekend and found myself at Double Dutch (per the recommendation of a friend). I felt like I was in high school again because the crowd in there was like white collared 30 year olds. It got a little better towards midnight when all the bar creatures came out to shake their tail feathers. I'm giving it three stars because of the ambiance and decoration. 80s hip hopped themed bar? GENIUS! A wall covered with old ghettoblasters? RIDICULOUS! The music got a little schizo towards the end, but I rather enjoyed the hip hop music set that came on later.
author: Emily T.

description:
why all the sucka's be try'in to faze double dutch? y'all need to step off. 

fri and sat nights are mos def wack with all the newjack b&t posses in the house ... but the weeknights are ill. the place is chill and they throw down some dope tracks.

word to your mother.
author: jon w.

description: Good times had by all!  This is such a fun bar.  They serve up mighty good drinks.  The bartender there is soooo nice!  For my friend's birthday, she gave us free (yes free) shots!  I love that it's old school here.  You can dance, you can drink, you can act crazy.  Very non-pretentious, a very down to earth bar.
author: Sarah F.

description:
hipsterfest 08 up in this breezy. its ok. they have good beers on tap and sometimes play a good song. usually the meetup place for friends before we move on to some other valencia spot. the name is double dutch, but im pretty sure there are no jump rope competitions anytime soon.

too bad.
author: Paul Q.

description:
i fell in love with this place as soon as i walked in. 

good music. every time. period.
good drinks for a good price. i didn't walk out of there with a big gaping hole in my pocket.. always enough left over at the end of the night for a couple of dirty dogs.. mm.
and a decent vibe. the folks keep it chill, but my friends had a few run-ins with those damn drunk chics... so i don't know if they want to come back anytime soon. lol

oh well.
author: geneive j.

description: At least 4 people I was with commented on the amazing beats they were pumping out on a weekend night.  That hardly ever happens.  Ever.  Ryan was the DJ and she had everyone asking for more (including the long line at the door).
author: Victory V.

description: Went here on a Saturday night for the birthday celebration. The atmosphere has a great old-school feel and the music was good. But, the place was super crowded. We were able to get to the bar to get drinks, but that was all we were able to move. No elbow room and it felt like were were getting pushed at one side or another by people trying to get through. Drinks were tasty though and weren't watered down. Overall good experience and no cover charge was a plus!
author: Steph M.

description: A little different than most of the dive mission bars and it is usually packed on a friday-saturday night. Always solid music and good selection of whiskey which is hard to find in the hood. Bartenders is what makes this place. Hard to find around here but my man Mike is on it. Kind of a poor mans marina bar if you will, which can be a good thing in this case.
author: T S.

description: Cool bar with cooler staff. I held a party here, and the owner/staff were great helping me organize it. We reserved a seating area, had friend dress in 80s and party was a hit! The female DJ played awesome 80s music, too! Great bar/club!
author: jey o.

description: Great effort for the theme.  Nice try on the DJ but she didn't even know Cooky Puss by the BBoys.  The bathroom situation is dire, somethig needs to be done so there isn't a line all along the dance floor, and they were so dirty once I got in it I refused to even use it.
author: e w.

description:
great bar! stiff drinks, good crowd, feel-good music. it's all in the details and this place has left no stone unturned: old-school 80's hip hop pictures, graff on the walls, boomboxes mounted behind the dj booth, LITE BRITES?!

cannot wait to go back!
author: Cary A.

description: Double Dutch on Tuesday is RAD. Dollar beers....  The DJ was Wack but that didn't stop me from having a good time drinking
author: Robert M.

description: Double dutch has caught my attention. I was there sunday night, and i loved it. Great vibe/space, good drinks, great tunes! I'll be back!
author: Kelly M.

description:
This place is really fun. It's not the typical scene I see in the Mission, but the times I've been, the crowd has been excellent. It is definately a bit more upscale than some of the Mission places I'm used to, but it's by no means pretentious or obnoxious. 

The drinks are expensive but no more than you would expect at any other new place. But Double Dutch totally makes up for it with the funny and nice bartenders and the great music. The DJ was fabulous. 

Ah, I've had some good times here. You guys should all check it out and hopefully have some too.
author: Nicole R.

description: I like this place, but I wish they would go whole-hog on the old-school hip-hop tip.  The photography is the best part of Double Dutch, and worth checking out for its own sake.
