The too-loud music can be a lot of fun, with the tiny dance floor and all.  It's a good LCD (lowest common denominator) bar, with the ability to please the most # of persons while offending the least...in case groups are in play.  Being near BART and other places helps too.
author: Rawley V.

description:
this is a very chill spot that you can defineitely let loose at.  the door guys were cool, the vibe is urban/rap retro and the decor is SF tagger.  they dont trip about what shoes your wearing or non of that.  

my fav part was the DJ, some chic that played the right mix of old school with that good bay shit. 
 the drinks were decent and the crowd was a bunch of my friends.  
it is a cool lil hang out spot that i will def return to.  check it out for a good time.
author: the one m.

description:
** After leaving Levende, this is where we ended up**
 
Well when we first got here, the security at the door was being an asshole with my boyfriend, becuase he had accidently left his id at the bank. I told him to bring his birth certificate and school id to see if they would let him in. The security tried to not let him in, but you know being a pretty girl along with other beautiful girls made him succumb to our orders. TAH DAH my boyfriend finally gets in after some much needed yelling to the security at the door. You should try it sometime. We got in and after leaving Levende I was definitely feeling myself.  That night they were playing all kinds of music for the Biggie/Tupac era. I was jamming so hard, that I didn't even drink anything unitl they closed at 2. We had got there at 12:30am. I got a chance to dance underneath the boomboxes with my boyfriend. He was feeling this place as well. We weren't really paying any attention to anybody else as we celebrated my friends birthday. We were in a circle just dancing and dropping it low. A couple of guys tried to get in on the fun, but we politely told them to step and they did. Once again giving a shoutout to my golden girl Jasmine who turned 26 this past Saturday. if you plan on going to this place, you can't be a wallflower. You have to get down with the get down. 

*Peace*
author: Jainee L.

description: I wanna give double dutch four stars but hmmm, I won't. This place has been a few things throughout the years. Doctor Bombay's: a dive bar with a back patio to smoke in. Cama: an attempt to capitalize on the last of the dot commers with a hip foreign name and bad foreign music and Double Dutch: an ode to B-Boys, Wyld Style and Ghetto Blasters. I prefer the latter but do wish it still had the patio. The place looks FRESH and makes me wanna put on my shell toes and pop lock the night away. Now the DJ (female, tall, brunette) that was there was BEAUTIFUL. Her mixing was NOT. She did play some ILL tracks but just couldn't hang in the SKILLS department. It seems like SERATO has made everyone a DJ. Thanks SERATO!!! MY EARS HURT.
author: santiago g.

description: I love this place.  The people who go there aren't always the best, but that's kinda what happens at bars.  Either way, rad decor, great drink specials ($5 shot & beer on Mondays), awesome music that totally fits the whole thing they've got going on.  Hell yeah.
author: Aaron M.

description: I like double dutch.  good vibe and very good dj's.  Its a fun dance spot in the mission!
author: Emily d.

description: If you're looking for a place to grab a couple drinks or just chill this is your place! We've been here several times and we love it. Great atmosphere! Love the decor takes me back to when I was a kid. Very nostalgic. Usually has a really good Dj and a GREAT bartender! Just don't come dressed to warm cause its a little crowded so be prepared to sweat off a few pounds.
author: Jessica S.

description: I love this place. Very chill, great music, drinks, and amazing crowd. Some songs will take you back to the early 90s...Talk about reminiscing on the dance floor. No cover charge, casual place.
author: Pamela ..

description: what did i step in? that better have been rubber cement.
author: Jamie C.

description: Oh my god if I could only give this less than a star.  This place started out as 5 stars in my book....So we had had a great time there until I went to close out my tab.  They had apparently thrown all of my sister's drinks onto my tab PLUS charged her normally.  I politely brought this totheir attention and the tude I got was UNREAL!  Like the same tude I got at mamasitas that one time.....where you think you're in opposites land.  So after waiting to discuss my bill I got nothing from the bartenders.  I told them earlier in the night soooo many times to make sure he got the right tab as we had the same last name and I got the "I'm not retarded, I think I can handle this" look so I laid off.  They rectified the situation but the way they made us feel for questioning this made me feel like crap.  I will NEVEVER come here again and I am also DONE with the Vintage parties because of this.  I was totally going to go to the halloween one...NO WAY.  I guess the one guy/owner (he had to throw that in there) had a death in the family....yeah well, so did I and I'm not going around treating people like shazz.  Sorry for your loss but be a professional for goodness sakes and don't be all wasted behind the bar.  Get a grip!
author: Kirsten M.

description: this place has the single lowest ratio of actual black people to pictures of black people on the walls. . . . in the world. walk past it.
author: Nick S.

description: Ok so I hate starting off on a bad note... A couple of decent things about this place is the music and the boom boxes on the wall. Unfortunately that's about it. The bar is small and kinda yucky. The guys here are the worst. If you like getting hit on by random scum of the earth this is the place for you. I think I nearly threw up a little by the weirdos who came to "speak" to me and then a little more when their pathetic-ness actually worked on some other poor and possibly wasted (com'on, you have to be!) girl. We were in this bar for literally 30 minutes when we just couldn't take it anymore... THAT disgusting! The dance floor is virtually non-existent, the drinks poorly made and over-priced and I wouldn't be surprised if you're robbed or worse when this place gets super crowded. There are a zillion other places to visit on the Mission and even if you're on a bar hopping frenzy, please, please, please, skip this place, if nothing else for your self respect!
author: Michelle C.

description: Great bar! Good music, cheap drinks, awesome vibrations, cute decor.
author: Jamie M.

description: My gay husband, Brian, the one man who will never leave me, and I like to go to Double Dutch on Fatty Fatty Fat days. We go there to drink in the dark amongst people we wouldn't want to sleep with anyway. When I was broke (long story, short time ago...) and Brian was in "transition" (i.e. unemployed), we'd take our Prada and Helmut Lang-covered asses to Double Dutch for $1 beers between 5 and 8 on weekdays. Oh boy, did we run our Jil Sander Special Edition Pumas and Bottega Venetta Stilletos into the ground in any effort to get there before it was too late for the only booze we could afford to drink outside of the house for those short few months. The pain of knowing that your shoes or your Chanel wallet even, cost more than what you have in your checking account and savings account combined is enough to kill a person...But the $1 cans of Olympia (?) at DD got us through, along with the charming company of the owner/bartender (who is from Seattle, just like Brian) and the friendly crowd. We'd get loaded enough on $1 beers that we'd succumb after 8 and spring for one real drink each, which in turn got us drunk enough that we no longer minded the inevitable muni ride or LOOONG walk home (because we couldn't afford to take a cab...). The beers are $2 now, but I wouldn't drink that swill again anyway. I can once again support my vodka habit and thank goodness they make a great mixed drink at The DD. Because on a fat day, the last thing I want to be is sober.
author: Autumn K.

description: great music, good drinks, cute bartenders. people were dancing and having a lot of fun here. the crowd was totally mixed....reminds me a lot of bar 107 in LA. i think this would have been a more fun place to be if i was with a big group of friends.
author: Joanne S.

description: much of the debate seems to be on how well the wild-style theme is pulled off and there's certainly args for both. but let's get down to basics. there are lotsa places to sit. there's a dance floor. there's good beats. and there's no cover.
author: Seiji C.

description: Ok so the first time I went to this spot it was hella coo...it was kind of early on a sat night like 8ish...we rolled up to the bar and I ordered my fave drink a Lemon Drop; which homegirl bartender knew how to do very well. My friends got beers and whiskey which might I add they did have a great array of brews and different types of whiskey. We posted up for maybe an hour and the music was good...no dj I presume it was an ipod hooked up somewhere but they played hip hop oldies and kept the vibe pretty chill. Then I went back on another saturday night a bit later maybe 10ish and had to stand in lne to get in...ahahaha...that killed me...seriously and after about 5 minutes the doorman let us in...after he shoved 2 drunk ass asians out the front door...lmfao...pretty much it was a struggle for dear life to make it to the bar once I was there I had to down my drink for fear of spilling it all over myself and or someone else...saw some hott guys and this time they had a DJ spinning...but it was a damn sauna in there and sooo overcrowded...yeah not up to fire code!!! I liked you the first time Double Dutch...REALLY I  DID...I will give u a second shot...maybe.
author: Yolanda O.

description: Came here after dinner on a Wednesday night.  It was very quiet.  I liked the vibe of the place.  I'm interested in returning when it's a bit busier.  I figure the regulars must be cool - they have Chimay on tap!
author: AngelaS F.

description: came here at skylark was still slow, a lot more crowed and better vibe, but left because their dance floor is too cramped, probably the same size as a restroom.
author: Robin L.

description: first off, the chandeliers are brilliant. the bartender may have no idea what a snakebite is (she gave me two stella pints and a pint of cider), but the music is amazing, the breakdance-off on the television is amazing, the collection of boomboxes is amazing the dj wearing white glasses was amazing (not his DJ skilz necessarily, just that he was wearing white glasses).. i'll even forgive them for favoring puma over nike (a critical mistake, if you ask me). i don't have any clue why i've never been here before tonight.. my bad. i don't care if the whole urban thing is real or not. i don't go to bars to experience urban. if i wanted the real thing, i'd be down at club six instead of in the mission. if you're bitching about how "real" this place is or isn't, you're confused, my friend.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: i dunno.  i think it's more like 3.5 stars.  i've been here at diff times of the day/eve since i live nearby.  it's ok on a sunday afternoon to stop by and have a pop and watch something on the tv screen.  i've been here on a busy friday night and it's just too packed, loud, and HOT.  there's just something missing.  i feel like it should be or could a lot cooler. other than some of the amusing retro pics etc, there isn't much too place.  i feel like you could get the same hanging out in someone's garage.   the bartenders are nice enough i guess.  i looooove the lite brites.
author: Bird B.

description:
(jump rope optional)

double dutch double dutch
you opened last night
double dutch double dutch
the dj was tight

double dutch double dutch
shut up girls, you're shrill
double dutch double dutch
oops, someone got ill

double dutch double dutch
i'll be there again
double dutch double dutch
maybe not on the weekend
author: J K.

description: i haven't been here since it was Doctor Bombays. cool bar and bartenders, i like what they did to it.  the door guy was kinda of odd though, saying ID please, instead of just blocking the door with your girth works too.  this is a marina bar on the weekends, or at least from what i'd expierenced last saturday night, was in and out in 20 minutes.
author: Pickle R.

description: Perhaps I went on an off night, but I can't remember the last time I've experience so much drama, with terrible hip-hop as the icing on the cake. The crowd consisted of mainly wiggers and the UgZ type girls who drool over them. It does get points, however, for having cheap drinks and efficient bartenders.
author: Jeremy J.

description: great weekday bar... on weekends, turns into the double douche.
author: Mooni P.

description: stumbled into double dutch looking for cama and was pleasantly surprised by the new decor.  we were greeted by a smiling bartender, who let us know what was up with the new digs.  he also brought out simon (you know, the fabulous red, yellow, green and blue paneled game of 80's past).  unfortunately, simon was low on batteries but the bar was not.  can't wait to go back for another happy hour.
author: Sharlene C.

description: This place is good for party planners. And what I mean by that is, those that are smart and plan to party in the Mission district have the chance to buy a drunken hot dog or burrito meal almost anywhere nearby after partying! Double Dutch is such a place located in the heart of the Mission. A quaint long bar with a 12 by 12 foot dance floor in the back, has the bathroom tucked away behind the dancing crowd and four wire-light chandeliers above that were bright but looked cheap. The drinks were average and inconsistent: I had the same drink thrice and for some reason some were harder than others. I saw Norm from the Real World New York in there, too, so I am thinking the place has some clout among the coolest of the cool in SF. I did feel a little younger there because of a higher perceived average age, but the crowd was pretty diverse as we danced, or fell off of chairs, to the bumping hip hop beats. And by the way, I know it is cold outside, so self-check your coat UNDER the bar countrer. There are hooks to hang your scarf, jacket, and your shyness. -Matt
author: Matthew C.

description: the more I go to the mission the more I dislike it, but double dutch isn't THAT bad - mainly because the patron "shots" are more like pint glasses, and it's cheap.
author: David D.

description: big fan of arriving on the early side - can stake out the couches and enjoy the place as it fills up. not quite a russian hill/marina bar, but it's kinda close...
author: Heidi L.

description: awesome themed new bar in the mission... Just a little weary that it will become another yupster haven in my hood :(
author: Paola W.

description: This is my favorite mission bar, FAVORITE. Its always fun to see what kind of crowd is there, and what kind of throwbacks their gonna be playing,and and, well its just awesome.
author: Brendan M.

description: The main reason I'm down with Double Dutch is simple: the Wii.  A few months ago a friend and I stopped by DD on a holiday, not realizing that it would be virtually deserted.  The bartender had brought his Wii in and some of his friends were just hanging out there playing and drinking, and eventually I got sucked into Wii bowling and some involved shooting game [ok, I don't have a Wii, so ignore my ignorance of what I was actually playing].  And thus, I became down with the DD.  Granted, I probably wouldn't be able to point that bartender out in a lineup today, and I've never been back on another Wii night, but it has a special place in my heart now, if not for the cool people we met that night, then for the tunes, kicks, and boomboxes that it provides on all other nights.
author: Margie N.

description: Have to give DD the 5 star salute gotta love a place where the bartender always works his ass off to  overserve me and my friends !!! Bonus is that Brian the door guy is a sweetheart.  My friend K had her going away party here in August on a Thursday night. Great mixed crowd mostly locals.  Thursday nites are the best Friday and Saturday nite can be scary as in you drastically increase your chances of being groped, man/woman/trannie-handled ,stalked, harrassed or otherwise ass raped.   On the nite of aforementioned  party i have to say i kissed the hottest boy ever !!!!    Too bad i didnt get his contact  info just one of  the setbacks associated with being overserved is 1. elusive memory  retention and 2. diahrrea of the mouth.   I also made several  mind numbingly idiotic comments  like "I'm  married"  and then he  (apparently similarly afflicted ) made me attempt to pronounce his girfriends  unpronounceable name .  Im actually concerned about his welfare and considered calling SFGH and St Lukes for any hot male head trauma victims with  huge erections.   Lets just say at the end of the night hot boy and i were involved in a lot of  hair pulling, glass slamming (against the Pakwan storefront window) and serious ass groping  (my ass not his, please im not that kinda girl),and the next morning both my backside and my lips (the ones on my face get your minds outta the gutter) were seriously bruised.   Was the  closest I've ever been to having sex vertically, with my clothes on.   Seriously best kiss ive had so far.....Anyway now that my Porcelynne panties are wet...You get the picture, check out the DD for yourselves.  Sure their bathrooms are nasty but they pour generously and the eye candy here is normally worth the visit.
author: Ellie A.

description: alwayz good music, alwayz a fun crowd.  parking is alwayz terrible in the mission, so blah to that.  on weekends, this gets crowded, so hard to get drinks sometimes.  other than that, luv it!
author: Latef X.

description: when i walked in i was like, " im comming here every weekend." very very cool space. great crowd. drinks came quick but....way way way too crowded for me. bathroom is in the back off the dance floor...nightmare to get to.******3rd date...see if she can dance******
author: Dave L.

description: love this bar. great music to dance to once your sh*t faced. gets a little crowded on the weekends, but its a lot of fun.
author: Lauren D.

description: great bar...super nice bartenders, yummy drinks and SIMON! hours of entertainment!
author: Joy Y.

description: hot men, ghetto blasters, break murals and videos, and the best music played at any bar in the mission. tuesday is the night to be there to catch incredible artists, good deals, and a lively atmosphere
author: Julia K.

description: i have never been to double dutch on a weekend night, so my review only applies to an uncrowded monday.  when i visited the bar, there was hardly anyone there, which left plenty of room for my friends to gather, and more importantly, made it especially easy for me to take in all of the choice decorating decisions in the place.  i really can best describe it as 'yo mtv raps' as translated into a room, and i think the designers went over the top just enough to make it perfect.  the walls of the dj booth are covered in vintage boomboxes, there is a mounted shrine to colorful kicks, and the walls are dotted with lighted posters of break-dancers and other badasses proudly showing off their bling.  throw in a couple of light brights and some graffitied walls and i think you get the picture.  i'm not sure how the space holds up on a crowded weekend, but for a mellow weeknight, all i can say is: rad.
author: ali l.

description: went on a saturday nite. not bad. it is sweaty in here. the bathroom floor is soaked in urine and sweat and the mirrors get fogged up. people werent even getting that crazy on the dancefloor so i dunno what the deal is with that, open a window or somethin. cheapest brew is in a can and its 2 dollars so i liked that. the dj was kind of corny playin some jock jams but played some good jams and had people dancin so i'm not gonna h8.
author: Wats C.
